title: Dumbbells
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Incredible Value', 'author': 'Anon', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased a set of these 35lbs dumbbells, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. These dumbbells have quickly become an essential part of my workout routine, and I am thoroughly impressed with their quality, durability, and value for money.First and foremost, the quality of these dumbbells is outstanding, especially considering their affordable price. The construction is solid and feels sturdy and well-made in my hands. I have used them extensively and held up remarkably well without any signs of wear or damage.The knurled handles offer a secure and non-slip grip, which has really helped me maintain control during my workouts. They're about the size you'd expect from a 35lb dumbbell. The dumbbells are compact and easy to store, making them ideal for my home/apartment gym.The weight is accurate and consistent across both dumbbells, ensuring a balanced workout experience. The plates are securely attached and do not shift or rattle during use, which adds to the overall comfort and safety. Whether I'm performing curls, presses, or other exercises, these dumbbells have provided me with a challenging and effective workout every time.What truly stands out about this purchase is the incredible value for money. Compared to other similar products on the market, these dumbbells offer an exceptional combination of quality and affordability. It's rare to find such well-made equipment at such a reasonable price. These dumbbells have allowed me to save money without compromising on the quality or functionality I require for my fitness goals.Overall you really can't beat these dumbbells for the money. I got them for $32, which is an absolute steal in my opinion. I don't think any other dumbbells beat this value. I highly recommend this product.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Is a weight', 'author': 'Slice', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Typical smell. Protecting the weight from rusting and damage should it be dropped.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice set, well packaged, greasy', 'author': 'Adam W.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "These arrived well packaged (that's saying something for a 40# package) and in good shape. It does have an initial smell but does dissipates over time, took mine a couple weeks.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Solid dumdbells.', 'author': 'truckwork', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Excellent price for these dumbbells, should last a lifetime.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Skip the comfort grip', 'author': 'sharkbot', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I needed a couple extra lighter/more compact dumbbells to compliment my Iron Master adjustable set for certain exercises.So, I got a 12lb comfort grip and a 15 lb regular grip since those were on sale, and I do not like the comfort grip. title: Bundles
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Solid Choice for Home Workouts!', 'author': 'James Rushforth', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Cap Barbell 40-Pound Dumbbell Set, and I must say, I am thoroughly impressed! This set is perfect for anyone looking to add some weight training to their home workout routine.First off, the quality of these dumbbells is top-notch. The handles are sturdy and provide a comfortable grip, even during intense workouts. The weight plates are also well-made and fit securely onto the handles, so there's no need to worry about them coming loose.Another great thing about this set is the versatility it offers. With four 2.5-pound plates, four 5-pound plates, and two dumbbell handles, you can easily adjust the weight to suit your needs. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned lifter, this set has you covered.I also appreciate how compact this set is. It doesn't take up much space, so it's perfect for small home gyms or apartments. Plus, the plates are easy to store, so you can keep your workout area neat and organized.Overall, I highly recommend the Cap Barbell 40-Pound Dumbbell Set to anyone looking for a high-quality, versatile, and space-saving weight set for their home gym. It's a fantastic value for the price, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Don't listen to the negative reviews...", 'author': 'Mantis Toboggan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a long review, I hope I can keep your attention.First off, I want to tell you guys that Fedex Smartpost is the carrier for this item. I didn\'t have a problem with them, even though they delivered my dumbbells 2 days after the delivery estimate(can\'t complain, free shipping). Fedex Smartpost sends to the closest USPS, then USPS takes an additional 2 days to deliver. It seems like most people hate Fedex Smartpost because they take longer than usual("google fedex smartpost sucks" to see what I\'m talking about). I ordered these on 2-9-13 and they arrived at my doorstep on 2-16-13, so one week exactly, average time for free shipping. The dumbbells came packaged professionally and my case came in perfect condition, which I was very pleased about.I also ordered 60 pound db set from Lion Roar Fitness on 2-8-13, and as of 2-16, they didn\'t even start shipping so I ended up cancelling that order. They charged $20 for shipping too... I will NEVER even consider buying from LRF again. Just wanted to warn you guys about that. $20 for shipping AND they lag it? No thank you.These Dumbbell sets are a great investment, and I know they will last a long time. First of all, there is no toxic chemical smell the negative reviewers mentioned. Not even the case it came with. They clearly have gotten better with quality control. I read ALL of the negative reviews and took a chance with these, and I am glad I did. My bars are all nicely polished, smooth, and the weights and collars fit accordingly. There are 4 pieces of rubber stoppers that help keep these weights in place, 2 in the middle of the bar and 2 that are connected to the collars, which does an excellent job. When you lift weights, you should never "jerk" through your workouts, but instead keep good form with nice controlled movements. That\'s how my workouts are, and the weights have not moved, rolled, clanked, at all. The only time the collars roll out, is when I twist them to change weights. I even put all the plates on one bar(30 lbs) and the weights/collars were still in place. People say these are not the best quality, but what more do you expect from a set of dumbbells? Good finish on the plates with a clean tough metal bar, which cannot rip as some rubber grip bars tend to rip after tightening the collars too much. Carefully put the plates on, or you could scratch/chip off the paint. If you don\'t like getting callouses on your hands, I recommend investing in gloves. I don\'t feel a thing with gloves on and can enjoy lifting weights without getting blisters. If you have Fat Gripz(check my review for Fat Gripz), you don\'t even need gloves. Those rubber suckers will cover it, and give you a much better workout.I will buy additional plates for these soon but before you guys do as well, try adding Fat Gripz to the bars with your normal workouts. It will give your workouts more of a challenge, and you will see some good results in your forearm strength. I wish I knew about them when I wrestled in high school..Long story short, don\'t listen to the negative reviews. Keep yourself in shape and buy these already!Oh yeah, I forgot to mention that the bars + collars does not equal 5 pounds(unless you are weighing both bars and 4 collars together). So you get about 17.5 pounds each dumbbell. The description states that they weigh 5 pounds but it\'s half. The case it comes with is about 5 or 6 pounds so that\'s where they kind of trick you. So if you do the math, 4 x 5lbs plate + 4 x 2.5 lbs plate + 2 x 2.5 collars & bar = 35 lbs + 5 lbs case = 40 lbs db set.. I\'m not going to knock off a star for that because I bought these knowing this information. We can always buy more plates, so no big deal.Thank you for reading my long review. I hope this helped make your decision in building a better body! Train hard, train safe, and good luck :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Affordable and heavy.', 'author': 'Mike', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a great set of weights for someone looking to get started working out at home. It's not perfect, but I'm not really sure that the imperfections matter for a product like this. So let's get the negatives out of the way first:- Yeah, they smell, as others have noted. It's nothing strange -- if you've ever been to a gym before, you already know this smell. They're metallic with additional chemical odors. For a basic sniff test, you won't notice much. But the smell does begin to accumulate after a few days in cramped quarters, so maybe they're not the best choice for a bedroom or tiny apartment. I suspect the smell will dissipate in time, but I don't know how long that will be.- The carrying case is cheap molded plastic, and there's a good chance yours will arrive with one or more corners dented. It's fine -- the cases aren't meant to be display items. They're meant to store the weights, and to give you a convenient way to lug them around when needed.- It's obvious that corners were cut in some regards. The rubber cushions on the bars are cheap, and could possibly fall off and get lost if you aren't attentive. Likewise, the rubber cushions within the screw-on collars can fall out. It's not a big deal if they do -- you just stick them back in. But these are obviously not advanced equipment. They were designed to be cheap and functional.That said, I don't think any of these cons really matter. Weights have one purpose in life -- to weigh something. Your muscles can't tell if you're holding twenty pounds of expensive metal or cheap metal. This particular set is very well priced, and they feel safe and sturdy. You don't have to worry about the collars wiggling loose, and they're adjustable down to 2.5 pound increments. I snagged two sets, giving me greater versatility and the ability to put more weight on a single bar if needed. For the price, this is a perfect way to get started with a cheap, space-saving home gym.Weights don't need to be pretty and fancy to work. They just need to give gravity something to act on. You can buy fancier equipment than this, but it's not clear why you'd really want to.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Honest review addressing common concerns...', 'author': 'Bleacherbum95', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When originally considering this product I was very concerned with the number of negative reviews/comments that people were leaving about these dumbbells. After deciding to take the risk, I felt the need to write a review since I believe that the negative reviews are overblown and overly dramatic. I will hopefully address the main concerns that you as the prospective buyer are having while considering this product. If you don\'t care about the details I have a TLDR at the bottom =)1. Smell: These weights do not smells like daisies; no dumbbells do. However, the smell is NOT as bad as people are saying. I would highly recommend leaving these weights outside (and/or washing them) to let them air out and control the smell, but it is not immediately overpowering. When the package arrived I slowly opened the box waiting for a toxic stench to explode out, but it never came. It was not until I lifted a plate out of the box that I noticed the smell people mentioned (the chemical applied to prevent rust), and it was not very strong. I left mine in the garage to air out and noticed a slight change in the smell of the garage, but nothing extreme. I would certainly keep them out of the house to be safe, but for $40 a quick wash or airing out was worth it to me.2: Quality: If you are looking for professional dumbbells that are made of top quality materials then look elsewhere. But if you are looking for a solid set of starter weights, this is your product. I will say that the first time I removed a collar a small piece of metal broke off, but it did not affect the functionality of the piece. Also, I noticed someone mentioned that the collar lets the weights slide...this was incorrect in my experience. The collars seem to hold the weights snugly in place, so there should be no problems there. The quality is by no means great (unbeatable for the price though), but it is good enough that I trust it will last and serve its purpose.3. Case: I saw a few people talking about how the case broke easily. The case seems fairly sturdy if it is treated well. A case breaking or not will depend on your delivery man. The weights are packaged very well inside a few boxes (Amazon ships it out in an excessively large box), and in my experience there were no cracks. The sliders to keep the box closed seem pretty lame, but I\'m one of those people who isn\'t going to sweat it if the case breaks.I hope I covered the main concerns that most people were having. My honest review of this product is that this is unbeatable for the price. $40 with free shipping (mine came in 2 days) is great, and these are exactly what I was looking for. And NO I was not paid for this review and think Amazon should be ashamed of including paid reviews.TLDR: Does NOT smell that bad (easily fixed), decent quality, best bang for the buck for somebody looking for starter dumbbells.UPDATE 1/25/14: I now have two sets of these (it was cheaper than buying weight individually), and they are holding up great after over a year and a half of use. I\'ve noticed the collar shifts slightly when you get over 30lbs, but never enough that it\'s a problem. Be confident in purchasing these as starter weights.UPDATE 7/31/16: My original bars are still going strong. The collar shifting still happens on occasion, but not to the point where it interferes with my workout. I\'ve purchased additional plates for it and added them just fine - any 1" plate should fit just as well as the originals. So these have held up strong for 4 years...zero complaints here. One thing I forgot in the original review - you may want some lifting gloves. The metals isn\'t forgiving on your hands, so if you don\'t want big calluses, invest in a cheap pair of gloves.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Adjustible Weight Set', 'author': 'Lumbre', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First of all, let\'s get the smell part clear. Yes, it smells. It smells similar to the stuff you find in the tire/automotive aisles at Target/WalMart/other stores. Yes, it can be a bit strong. Let it air for a day and put a dryer sheet in the case when you close it. Problem solved. If you\'re picky on having your home smell like candles or something, these are not for you. If you don\'t even notice the smell of a gym when you\'re in a gym (or aren\'t the quickest to pick up on smells), then you\'re fine. Also, I think it\'s the box that smells, not any of the paint.Pros:*It is easy to add/remove weights. Just unscrew the collars, remove/add weights, screw collars back in. You can do this while resting in less than a minute.*You can add your own weights. When you outgrow these, you can add your own weights (doesn\'t have to be the same brand). Any generic 1" weight will do.*When I bought these, they were awesome for $40. Under $1/pound if you count the different combinations of weights you can do and that you can add more later.*Cheap compared to buying individually.Cons:*Slight bump in one of the corners of the case. No big deal. Contents inside are fine. Just an aesthetic issue.*Smell. As addressed above, it can be a bit overpowering, but just take the time to let them air out. Some people also do fine by rinsing them.*They\'re not neoprene.Notes & Thoughts:*A lot of people complain about the default California warning added to this set. Seriously, California is overprotective. Drinking dozens of gallons of water is known to cause death. If ingested, gasoline can destroy your organs. Too much sun can give you cancer. They have these warnings on a ton of things for sale in California. Something containing nickel, for example, automatically gets this warning. If it were more serious, more states or the entire country would place a warning or they would be getting sued for giving people cancer (it\'s not like lawyers are exactly shy).*The handles may be a bit too textured for some people, especially those with delicate hands or buying more weights. In that case, maybe you should buy weight-lifting gloves. For those who don\'t mind getting scuffed by sand or falling hands-first on pavement, you\'re fine. If anything, I shift my hands around on the bar which varies up my routine a bit.*People say it\'s a good starter set. I just started a serious workout routine and have had this for a month. I see myself having this for years.*A few have complained that the weights aren\'t exact. The bar doesn\'t seem like 5 pounds, but when I weight myself with one of my 20 lb. dumbbells, I see my weight increase by 19.8 or 20 (my scale goes in intervals of 0.2). It\'s close enough for me. I don\'t need it to be that exact.*Mine didn\'t seem to have any loose seal rings or collars. They seem good for the price. They may shift a small amount after a 30 minute workout to where you can hear a slight clunk. Just retighten them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing quality', 'author': 'John carter', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Everything came double if not even triple boxed and wrapped and had stuffing on the original box all the weights came individually wrapped there was no chemical strong smell with my set (105lb) pair they just smelled new nothing that made me gag or was to strong as far as the mechanics it seems to work perfect they hold still while I do chest dumbell flys with 35lbs on each only time will tell but as of now extremely happy don‚Äôt listen to the review also if you want to add plates to this set make sure there 1.14 or bigger 1inch plates won‚Äôt work also I personally love the diamond pattern grip but if your not used to lifting without gloves your going to have to break your hands in or get some gloves me personally gives me more grip I love it it does not feel like it‚Äôs digging in my skin like others said overall good product for the price can‚Äôt beat it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Nice dumbbell bars', 'author': 'RY', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I liked the dumbell bars. They are solid, easy to grip, and the nuts tighten down nicely. The weights that came with them would be fine except the center hole in them is a lot bigger than it needs to be causing the weights to shift,if you don't really crank down on the bar nuts.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best deals I‚Äôve ever found on Amazon', 'author': "D'Art", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This 52.5 lb single dumbbell setup is without a doubt one of the best deals I‚Äôve ever found on Amazon. While most iron free-weights sell for around $2/pound (as of the fall of 2022), this set is much more affordable,The price for it does seem to vary wildly day by day. I paid $77 in October 2022 and see that a month later, it is selling for $65. But I‚Äôm not complaining since it‚Äôs a steal at either price.I bought 2 sets so I‚Äôd have a pair of dumbbells.The dumbbell bars and threaded, star-shaped end nuts are nicely made. The chrome coating seems thick and durable. And because the threaded nuts have black rubber washers on the side that makes contact with the weight plates, they tighten securely and stay firmly in place when in use. Other sets I‚Äôve used did not have the rubber washer and as a result, would loosen up while doing reps. That‚Äôs both annoying and dangerousThe rubber washers do tend to fall off when removing the nuts from the dumbbell, but that is easily rectified by putting a few drops of superglue in the groove in the nut into which the rubber washer sits.The weight plates themselves are a little less precisely made. For instance, I weighed my 5 lb plates on a postal scale and discovered they range anywhere from 4.75 lbs to 5.25 lbs. That‚Äôs not a big deal most of the time but you can definitely notice an imbalance if you inadvertently end up with 8 of the heavier 5 lb plates on one hand and 8 of the lighter plates on the other.To avoid that from happening, I used a silver Sharpie to mark the plate that are over 5 lbs and keep them in a separate pile so I can distribute the weight more evenly into the bars.Also, while the clear-coat on the plates seems heavy duty enough, you do need to check for rough edges. That goes for the dumbbell bars too. I had to file down a couple of spots to avoid getting metal splinters in my hands.Last but not least, the dumbbells I received have a diameter of 1.18 inches (or 30mm) and the weight plates have holes that size. This means any plates you may already have with 1 inch (25mm) holes will not fit onto these bars. Likewise, while the plates from this set will easily go onto a 1 inch bar, they can flop around a bit. In practice the latter is not a problem as long as you can tighten down the bar-end clamps. I use my 30mm plates on a 25mm curl bar without issue.In short, while there may be some compromises involved, at these prices, this dumbbell set is one of the best deals out there.Follow up note written on April 11, 2023:I‚Äôve been using my weight set several times a week for about 6 months now and all parts are holding up great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really like these', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed a set to get started with. It‚Äôs hard to make it all the way to the gym...and if I‚Äôm watching tv I can just pick these up and do a few curls every now and then. Really helpful. They are easy to switch weights in and out, and if you are cool with doing one arm at a time then you could add all the weights on one and basically have a dumbbell that goes up to nearly 50 pounds (minus the 4 pound bar), without having to spend all the money of buying 2, 50 pound dumbbells, which would cost twice as much. Instead just do one arm at a time and save half the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Customer service was decent', 'author': 'Nick', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'For quality. You need to try each screw to find one that will actually screw on all the way. Paint is intact, other than that, they are weights.Be advised, you might not get everything in your shipment. Thankfully, customer service was easy to contact. After a couple of days, I recieved a reply asking for the details of my purchase, and after that I recieved my missing handle promptly.4 stars for good customer service.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Top Sellers
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Set, Great Value', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As others have mentioned, these are shipped in three boxes of weights at 50# each, and one narrow box that holds the stand. In my case, while extremely heavy duty boxes were used, and well taped, one of the boxes was sliced open and minor damage to rubber ends of DBs in that box occurred. Looks like it was slid over something which cut it through.In any event, 2x5, 2x10, 2x15, 2x20, 2x25# DBs are included, making this an excellent "base" set. Handles are knurled and as expected in diameter and abrasiveness. No gloves required, but your mileage may vary.Is there a smell? seems to be the burning question. Of course they have a smell. They were just born of chemicals. They smell like what they are: rubber. So if you have ever had a new bike tire in your house, that is the smell, multiplied by a few pairs. It doesn\'t bother me in the slightest, and I was able to start using right away. I cannot relate at all to folks who seemed like they were going to swoon after opening the boxes.NOTE: I "washed" these with dish soap and water before using because they are covered in manufacturing residual dust etc. and will make your hands filthy otherwise. Mine did *not* have any kind of oily residues, as others have mentioned; again, just new tire smell, which for me is not obnoxious. But hey- some people think cilantro tastes terrible, so there is no accounting for taste.NOTE #2: Unlike the way Amazon\'s own brand and some other DBs I have purchased are wrapped, these were just loose in the box. No Styrofoam, no placement in a baggie, nada. Just in the box. So they are not going to be 100% brand new and flawless looking when you take them out. Get over it. They\'re dumbbells. They\'ll look like that in a couple months of workouts anyway. Also, because there is no protection, be judicious in opening the boxes. Just slice around the tape so you are not gouging a chunk out of your new best friends.I got these for basically a buck a pound, which is what weights were before Covid, and what they should be anyway, and held off on buying them until I hit the sale amount. Having said that, they would still be worth it for the $200 amount too, of course, just slightly less of a bargain.As has been mentioned by other reviewers, the A-frame is easy to put together, but will take your fingers off if you are not watching what you are doing when replacing the weights onto the rack, something which was also true at many gyms I have used and is a bug and not a feature of this style of rack.Definitely recommend, and would purchase again. Plan on augmenting with additional weights and eventually using a horizontal rack for all of them, but this was a steal-- and delivered on top of it.I am keeping the boxes. These are some of the heaviest duty boxes I have had sent to me. You should keep them until your return date is over anyway, in the event something untoward happens and they need to go back.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely worth the price', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "TL;DRYou can't go wrong with this weight set for the money. I got them on a flash sale for under $180.The good: Easy to assemble, sturdy stand, nice grips on the weights. Company will send free replacements if anything is wrong in the shipment.The not-so-good: Rubber smell upon opening, will need some time to dissipate, so I'd plan on leaving them sit in a well ventilated area for a week before seriously using them. Also, the ends would appear to be dipped to rubberize them, and some of the material splashed onto the chrome handles. Absolutely no big deal and can be cleaned off, but something to be aware of. I would also suspect this material would wear off and expose the metal if abused (particularly if it got dropped on the corner of something).I have no idea how they make money on these as they came to me in 4 separate boxes via UPS. I did have one weight that had some shipping damage to the end (pictured), but it's not the end of the world.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value and easy to assemble!', 'author': 'Roberto A. Rodriguez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been considering getting a set to exercise at home. This is a great value for what you get delivered to you home. The product feels sturdy and well built. The stands holds everything together in an easy to access form with minimum space requirement. title: CAP Barbell Dumbbell Set with Rack | Multiple Options in 150lbs and 210lbs
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Set, Great Value', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As others have mentioned, these are shipped in three boxes of weights at 50# each, and one narrow box that holds the stand. In my case, while extremely heavy duty boxes were used, and well taped, one of the boxes was sliced open and minor damage to rubber ends of DBs in that box occurred. Looks like it was slid over something which cut it through.In any event, 2x5, 2x10, 2x15, 2x20, 2x25# DBs are included, making this an excellent "base" set. Handles are knurled and as expected in diameter and abrasiveness. No gloves required, but your mileage may vary.Is there a smell? seems to be the burning question. Of course they have a smell. They were just born of chemicals. They smell like what they are: rubber. So if you have ever had a new bike tire in your house, that is the smell, multiplied by a few pairs. It doesn\'t bother me in the slightest, and I was able to start using right away. I cannot relate at all to folks who seemed like they were going to swoon after opening the boxes.NOTE: I "washed" these with dish soap and water before using because they are covered in manufacturing residual dust etc. and will make your hands filthy otherwise. Mine did *not* have any kind of oily residues, as others have mentioned; again, just new tire smell, which for me is not obnoxious. But hey- some people think cilantro tastes terrible, so there is no accounting for taste.NOTE #2: Unlike the way Amazon\'s own brand and some other DBs I have purchased are wrapped, these were just loose in the box. No Styrofoam, no placement in a baggie, nada. Just in the box. So they are not going to be 100% brand new and flawless looking when you take them out. Get over it. They\'re dumbbells. They\'ll look like that in a couple months of workouts anyway. Also, because there is no protection, be judicious in opening the boxes. Just slice around the tape so you are not gouging a chunk out of your new best friends.I got these for basically a buck a pound, which is what weights were before Covid, and what they should be anyway, and held off on buying them until I hit the sale amount. Having said that, they would still be worth it for the $200 amount too, of course, just slightly less of a bargain.As has been mentioned by other reviewers, the A-frame is easy to put together, but will take your fingers off if you are not watching what you are doing when replacing the weights onto the rack, something which was also true at many gyms I have used and is a bug and not a feature of this style of rack.Definitely recommend, and would purchase again. Plan on augmenting with additional weights and eventually using a horizontal rack for all of them, but this was a steal-- and delivered on top of it.I am keeping the boxes. These are some of the heaviest duty boxes I have had sent to me. You should keep them until your return date is over anyway, in the event something untoward happens and they need to go back.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely worth the price', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "TL;DRYou can't go wrong with this weight set for the money. Company will send free replacements if anything is wrong in the shipment.The not-so-good: Rubber smell upon opening, will need some time to dissipate, so I'd plan on leaving them sit in a well ventilated area for a week before seriously using them. title: Signature Fitness Rubber Coated Hex Dumbbell Weight Set and Storage Rack, Multiple Packages
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Buy These...No BS...This is the review for you!', 'author': 'Ryan T Birkhimer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "First of all, this is probably only the 2nd or 3rd review I've ever left on Amazon but after reading other reviews and seeing multiple complaints of smell, oiliness, staining, and marking I wanted to leave my true and honest opinions for anyone who may be interested in this product.I recommend these dumbbells!!!Firstly, I bought 2x single 45lb rubber encased hex dumbbells at about $41 each with shipping included ($85ish total) (1/25/22). I was talking the price up to a buddy the next day and when I checked the price again they had already gone up to $55 for each dumbbell. So if you are in the market for this specific kind of dumbbell I would suggest you make your purchase when they are within a price range of $1 per pound. The price is likely to be based on supply and demand as I can see that many of the lighter weights (higher demand) in some cases are $2 per pound or more. Again though, my specific purchase of the 45lb singles are what we're talking about.Moving on from price, as of this time I have only opened, handled, cleaned, and inspected the dumbbells, they arrived today so this is not a review after multiple months of use but more of a first impressions, unboxing review.Pro's and Con's (you pick) - First impression, great quality, sturdy, nearly identical to what you will find in most fitness clubs/gyms. - They are made in China, says so right on the side of the packaging - Smell, oiliness, staining, and marking (This one takes a little more explaining) I purchased RUBBER encased dumbbells. Synthetic rubber is a byproduct of petroleum products (motor oil, gasoline, etc.) I expected the smell, oiliness, staining, and marking. The smell? If you've ever been near, or worked in a tire shop/center you will recognize the smell, smells like brand new tires (rubber)! If this bothers you you can always clean the dumbbells after you receive them, which is what I did using a little bit of water and Dawn Dish Soap, the exact stuff they use to clean off baby animals after an oil spill (petroleum product). Additionally, you can leave them outside for a monitored period of time in order to off gas some of the remaining petroleum elements that may be causing the smell. I say monitored because like any rubber/metal product left outside the more exposed to the elements (sun, rain, dirt/dust, etc.) the more rapidly it will break down. A clear sunny day would be most appropriate in this case but only for a few hours at a time. Oiliness, staining? Again, rubber is made from petroleum byproducts. During unpackaging of the dumbbells there was some oiliness on the bubble wrap that was protecting them. This residue from the rubber hex heads is expected, I used small amounts of Dawn Dish Soap and water to clean the dumbbells, I also used a white shop rag so I know that my cleaning was effective because of the slight change in color to the rag. It was a dingy white so to be clear it was not a massive amount of oil or staining. Marking? Have you or have you seen someone wear black soled (rubber) shoes on a light colored tile floor or a basketball court? You'll get marks! These dumbbells are really no different, they will mark if you brush a wall while carrying them, drop them aggressively, or drag them across a light colored tile floor...you've been warned! - Knurled handles for extra grip, not overly sharp or aggressive. - Weight...they each way 44.5lbs exactly, on my super-scientific bathroom scale. So either my scale has been lying to me or the dumbbells lost 1/2 lb each in the Metric (Chinese) to Imperial conversion...I'm still happy.I believe these are great quality dumbbells and I would recommend an educated purchase, taking into account my above listed items. Maybe you don't care about the above listed stuff because you know that working out can be inherently dirty, smelly, and non-flattering...great, buy them! If you do care about that stuff, take the extra 5 minutes to clean and treat them and I'm sure you'll be happy, buy them!Down the road if my opinion changes I will absolutely return and update my review...buy them!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Solid dumbell', 'author': 'ASGIRL', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just what I wanted in a dumbell, good price, comfortable handle, and fast delivery. The initial rubber/petroleum smell lasted about a week. I did wipe it down with a dawn soap sponge bath on arrival, which made it usable the next day.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Too heavy...', 'author': 'Michael Dean Ford', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just kidding...coated dumbbell just like I wanted. Delivery was on time too. Now, just need to order a little extra strength for lifting it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really great weight', 'author': 'Cyril Bassan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just got 2 of those 45lbs and they are great. The handle feels great and not cheap at all. I‚Äôm excited to finally found some great weight to go go back working out.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well priced and well constructed.', 'author': 'Spirto', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased a Sporzon! 50 lb single dumbbell. This item is great. It is solid, well finished and well constructed. The handle is perfectly sized to fit my hand and made of highly polished steel with a knurled center that prevents slippage. The rubber coating is clean and well finished and has very little odor... I have bought dumbbells in the past that stink up the workout room of my home. Not these. This item was very well priced when compared to other similar items offered. I would buy this item again and highly recommend these dumbbells.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great', 'author': 'k', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Great - got this for 15 y/o son for home gym - it's great and all the dumbells match etc. Great for home gym. There is a chemical smell that resolved after airing it out for about 1 wk. Great buy", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just as described', 'author': 'Lauren Thacher', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Quality was on point.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Smelly rubber!', 'author': 'Yogo Athletics', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Everything's fine but the odor. It will not go away. I ordered another product a while back that had this same odor, and after 6 months it has not decreased. I'm hopeful that this dumbbell will stop stinking soon. It smells toxix.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 13, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Terrible odor and uneven weights', 'author': 'Electrosoft', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I ordered a pair of 45lb dumbbells as I can scale this up to 60lbs holding a 15lb with it in each hand (same as I did before with 30lb and some 15lbs). The price was good and delivery time was within a few days so why not?As soon as I opened the first box, I was taken aback by the STRONG smell of rubber/plastic. Ever been in a tire shop or worked on cars? That was the smell that washed over me....yikes. Opening up the second just doubled the fun....I saw a few reviews that said wash them in dawn and that will take care of the smell. Nope, did not work. It was still there front and center but hey at least my weights were nice and clean.....looking. We ended up giving them prolonged outside sessions till the smell would at least dial back from a 10 to a 7.One main problem is weighing each dumbbell that were 45lbs each one registered at 44lbs 9oz and the other registered at 46lbs 2oz. If you're expecting tight tolerances be wary. I adjusted for this just by switching weights between hands each set and going from odd sets to even sets but still that is a serious variance.Pro tip: Do not let this hit your walls or drop on hard floors or you will leave black streaks everywhere.I do love the handles. Very comfortable and the price was the best I could find.3/5", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 28, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'vidcar', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The grip is a bit wider in the middle for a more comfortable grip and less likely to slide around when your hands get sweaty.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Yes4All Dumbbell Adjustable
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars More than your money's worth", 'author': 'Jarred Salyer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'To start off, don\'t base your decision on these weights off of all the negative reviews you may read. I will state the simple problems and solutions to each one. I purchased 3 total sets, 50 pound set, 105 pound set, and 200 pound set which cost about $400 total. This is the cheapest and best option to obtaining the most weight as now I have over 360 pounds in total dead weight, 135 per arm, the reason for stating this is because this is absolutely the cheapest solution for the most weight. Now most of the complaints span to roughness of the handle to as ridiculous as giving one star for weight plates being to "greasy" upon first opening. The first major issue stated is that the star twist clamp doesn\'t stay tight enough for safe heavy lifting which causes the weight to constantly have to be checked for safety. The first obvious thing is that you should always check your weight for safety no matter if your clamp is tight or not, and I will assure you that if you tighten these clamps and put actual force into it they will stay put, take out the rubber rings if you must as that helps them stick together, for those of you that cannot put so much force than simply twist the last weight plate next to each clamp right and this will tighten it with little effort. The next most complained about is how rough the handle is, and metal splinters are common upon first opening, I will make it clear that I received 3 different sets of handles through my total orders so I know the extent of how rough they may come and honestly if your used to holding a shovel or have used lighter weights than you\'ll be fine, the metal splinter shards that people have stated really are not extreme enough to give these dumbbells one star over, this goes with the greasy weight statement, just have some paper towels like I did or a rag to be prepared to wipe down each weight and handle, I expected to do this even before my first order. When it comes to scraped paint and dents and scrapes in weight plates the scraped paint is minimal and expect to see some of the paint slightly come off when first using and especially upon opening, as for dents there is none, the "dents" are just how some come and is expected to see in every type of weight plate, I will show another picture for that. The last issue stated is shipping, know that the 50 pounds ships in 1 box, the 105 ships in 2, and the 200 ships in 3. Some have stated to be missing weights and handles which is really not to be expected so I wouldn\'t worry as I received over 7 packages in my 3 back to back orders and received every part of my order with no issues and received each order in only 3 days with free shipping. These weights are heavy duty and meant to last a lifetime and also not for beginner weight lifters, which is why there are so many negative reviews. These weights are perfect for if you need heavier weight and cannot afford it, do not expect pretty smooth handled easy grip amature weights as these are great for hardcore workouts and great to push you to your limits, and sky rocket your strength, if your truly for lifting than you will be completely satisfied with these weights. I have tried my best to accommodate every question as I wish I had this review when I made my major decision on this big purchase as major insight really eases the mind. I hoped this helped.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 7, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly What I Needed at a Great Price', 'author': 'TK', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a game-changer for my fitness routine, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. This set delivers precisely what I needed at an affordable price, and it deserves a solid 5-star rating.First and foremost, the versatility of this dumbbell set is exceptional. It provides the flexibility to adjust the weight according to my workout needs, making it suitable for various exercises and fitness levels. Whether I'm targeting specific muscle groups with heavyweights or opting for lighter weights for endurance training, this set has me covered.The build quality is impressive. The cast iron plates are sturdy and durable, and the bars are robust and well-made. I've used them extensively, and they have held up flawlessly without any signs of wear or loosening.Assembly is straightforward and hassle-free, and the weight changes are quick and secure. This efficiency allows me to transition between exercises seamlessly, maximizing the efficiency of my workouts.The price point is a significant plus. Similar adjustable dumbbell sets can be quite expensive, but Yes4All offers a high-quality option at a fraction of the cost. It's a fantastic value for the quality and functionality it provides.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Almost perfect...', 'author': 'Robert Bidinotto', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'What a bargain!I just bought the 40-lb. Yes4All adjustable dumbbells with the connector bar, which allows the set to be modified into a short barbell. It just arrived this morning, within two days of my order.The set consists of four 5-lb. plates, four 3-lb. plates, two dumbbell bars, four screw-on collars, and the dumbbell connector bar. It was impressively packed. Each piece, wrapped individually in plastic, had its own secure place seated in a flat Styrofoam block. That block sat inside a thick cardboard box, taped shut and tightly wrapped with five plastic binding bands. In turn, that box was tightly enclosed within a second thick-cardboard shipping box.Nothing had shifted or come undone in transit; the set arrived in pristine condition. All the iron plates are in excellent shape, without nicks or coating flaws. The dumbbell bars and connector bar are all strong and gym-quality, as is the optional connector bar, which screws firmly onto the ends of the dumbbells. The plate collars are strong, too, and they screw onto the bars smoothly and tightly.The *only* flaw in the set is extremely minor ( hence my 4-star rather than 5-star rating). Each of the collars has a screw that can be tightened down with your fingers to further secure the collar to the bars. I found that one of those collar screws won\'t tighten in all the way, and another barely so. Because the collars themselves screw tightly onto the bars, I have no worries that the plates will ever fall off the bars during use, even without tightening down those securing screws. Still, it\'s a manufacturing flaw that should have been fixed long ago -- especially since this Chinese company has been producing these sets for years. But in too many cases, "Chinese quality control" is an oxymoron. Still, the overall quality of this set is excellent.I\'ve also ordered the Yes4All 60-lb. dumbbell set (the one without a connecting bar), which is yet to arrive. My hope is to combine its 8-lb. and 5-lb. plates with those in this 40-lb. set, then use the connector bar to create a barbell that holds up to 100 lbs. total, for additional versatility in my workouts. I\'ll have to see how many plates that combo arrangement will hold safely and securely. When the 60 lb. set arrives, I\'ll try it out and update this review and that one. However, even without that barbell option, I\'ll be able to prepare the four dumbbells with different weight combinations, so that I won\'t have to waste time to change the plates while working out.In combination with my recent purchase of the outstanding Fitness Reality 1000 Supermax weight bench, I now have a gym-quality weight set in my garage. It will allow me to perform the resistance exercises I need to get back into shape after the closure of my local gym. With a little imagination, I can even attach resistance bands to the bench for additional exercise versatility. Or buy a doorway chin-up bar for about $25.The best thing about these purchases is their low cost. As a Prime member, the entire arrangement -- the excellent Fitness Reality weight bench (which I rated 5 stars), the 40-lb. dumbbell set with connector bar, plus the 60-lb. dumbbell set -- cost me a grand total of only $218.18, including tax. (That price was as of late July 2021.) That\'s about as cheap as you can find for quality home workout equipment. By contrast, a gym membership would cost much more than that in just a few months.So for me, this dumbbell set is a bargain, and the entire combination I\'ve described is a *terrific* bargain. I doubt you\'ll be able to find better value for the price.UPDATE: The additional 60-lb. set, described above, arrived yesterday via UPS. However, both the exterior shipping box and the interior one were badly damaged through rough handling during the shipping process. The contents -- plates, collars, bars -- were all present, but no longer in their protective Styrofoam slots: They were heaped about in a jumbled mess. Most of the plates had superficial scrapes to their finishes, although there was no damage to any of the bars or collars. On the plus side, the securing pins on this set of collars screw all the way in, unimpeded.Overall, I\'m pleased with the purchase, though not the shipping. The additional dumbbell set gives me more versatility in preparing and using dumbbells of different weights during workouts, without the need to waste time changing out plates. As far as I can tell, the Yes4All dumbbells are the least expensive per pound currently available on Amazon, and they are of good quality.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 1, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent bargain, excellent product.', 'author': 'Chicagorep', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought these dumbbells specifically for doing P90X and they are fantastic. If you are considering these because you can't afford, or simply don't want to pay for Ironmasters, Powerblocks, or selecttechs than you found your answer. These dumbbells are an excellent bargain and give you a wide range of weight variety. Now, as for the ability to change weight during a workout, these are no competition compared to the major three adjustables. But do not let this discourage you! The locking screws come off quickly and it doesn't take long to switch the plates in and out once you get your routine down. Not as easy as turning a dial, or pulling a pin, but sufficiently quick. When you consider the price comparison, these are a very good buy. The chrome handles as well as the iron plates are solid as a rock. They feel very sturdy and durable. The locking screws fit tight enough to prevent any rattling what so ever. I have no qualms with these dumbbells at all. They shipped in boxes that didn't hold up well during the shipping process. So be careful picking up the boxes once you have them. But the dumbbells themselves are an excellent product. I give it a full recommendation.::UPDATE::I have been using these for a couple of weeks now and feel the review needs an update. If you are considering these dumbbells for P90X (that's what I use them for) there's a few things to note. While I stand by my comment that changing out the plates is sufficiently fast enough to use them for P90X, it's important to note that time can be a factor for some of the P90X workouts. In particular, the arms and shoulders workout. This routine is almost all dumbbell work and since you switch from shoulders, to biceps, to triceps, you often need a different weight for each one. If you like to follow along with the DVD, you will need to pause from time to time. If you know the routine like I do, it's rather irrelevant. However, I have noticed that it extends the total time for the workout a bit. Some may find this inconvenient if time is a big issue for you. There are some tricks I have developed though. Don't feel that the plates must go in order from heaviest to lightest. I often stack the 2&1/2 pound plates in between the 5 pound ones. This makes it very easy to drop the weight by as much as 10 pounds very quickly. Very useful for myself since my bicep sets tend to be ten pounds lighter than my shoulder sets. It also helps to have some kind of stand to set them on (I use a chair), and keep the plates you know you will need near by and organized. These little tricks can significantly reduce the changing time. Also the dumbbells are a little long for the Cohen curl, a little adjustment will be necessary. I keep me feet spread wider and lean on the wall to prevent unnecessary stress in places I don't want it. Keep in mind that my 5 star review takes the cost into consideration. If cost is not an issue for you, but time and space are. Do yourself a favor and spend the $500 on some Ironmasters. If cost and space are not an issue for you but time is, I recommend getting a full set of dumbbells with a proper stand as that is the absolute best option in my opinion. But if you are like me and cost and space are the biggest issue, you can't really go wrong with these. After some regular use, I would give these dumbbells 4&1/2 stars. However I cannot input a half a star so I will let my five star review stand. Great product for the budget conscious.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value', 'author': 'Greg', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These are old school dumbbells. Glad I purchased!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality purchase', 'author': 'Don S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are solid for the price. Would definitely buy again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Dumbbells for the Price!', 'author': 'B. Murphy', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Just got my pair of 52.5lb dumbbells (purchased individually) and I couldn't be happier! I have read a lot of the reviews and I am sorry to those of you who have had a bad experience, but I have not seen any of the same bad issues with the product. I ordered them on Sunday and received the packages Wednesday virtually unblemished. My biggest worry was that I would receive them in the mail already scratched or chipped. Maybe they changed the packaging from the days of people's reviews of this happening, but mine came all bundled up in Styrofoam and in pristine condition as you can see from the pictures.I purchased these as an upgrade to my Weider adjustable dumbbells of the same style. I had two identical pair of 20lb dumbbells which could be combined for a total weight of 36lbs. I felt like I would need more in the future. I'm sure at 52.5 lbs these are all I will ever need! And what's great is, they adjust in 2.5lb increments which is great for smaller weights for working the weaker muscle groups. Also perfect for gradually working your way up to higher weights.The Weiders did have a baked-on enamel finish which made them much more resistant to chipping than the powder coat paint, but with proper care I'm sure these will hold up just fine in the long run. I live in a 3rd floor apartment so I will only be setting them down gently on carpeted floor. If you have to drop them on the ground you are probably using too much weight in my opinion...My only concern is that the inside diameter of the weights might chip from sliding up and down the threaded bar. But, this is still just cosmetic. They will never be exposed to moisture to where they might rust. And as someone stated in their review, they are meant to be used not looked at. Worst casesenario: I have to touch them up with some powder coat enamel spray paint in the future?The locking nuts on these also have the rubber O-rings, and they are longer than my old ones, which gives them much more grip than my Weiders had. Those would often come loose, just enough to cause them to make noise, which I found annoying. But, these stay nice and snug, even during curls which causes the handles to want to twist loose.As for the price... Absolutely the BEST deal on the market for adjustable dumbbells! So I can't just dial in the weight, I have to take a few seconds to unscrew the caps and change out the plates... Not a big deal. Dial-a-weight dumbbells are exorbitant in price. And if you need the 200lb set then good for you but for my purposes 52.5lbs is perfect for me, and that is by far the best deal. As I said, I purchased 2x 52.5lb dumbells individually without the connected bar. I don't feel like I need or even want the connected bar. I don't have a rack to set it on, plus, I feel like having to balance the dumbbells during exercises will actually make me stronger. I highly recommend buying them in this fashion as it is the most economical. But, like I said, if you are needing the 200lb set then more power to you! Still a good deal. My total cost was $169 with tax and FREE shipping with Amazon Prime! I sold my old set for $100 on Craigslist. So I am sittin pretty for only $70 invested.I also purchased a quality door frame pull-up bar and set of resistance bands (also great deals on Amazon). Now I have all the equipment I should ever need for tackling the P90X! Laugh if you want, but it's perfect for my purposes working out at home in a COVID world. I got it used on eBay for $27, and if it was good 10-12yrs ago, it's still good today in my opinion. I just hit PLAY, follow along on the videos, and in an hour to an hour and a half, I get the best work out I feel like I can get given the time and the space and the convenience. So, if you are in a similar position, I think these dumbbells are the perfect option for you. Hope this was helpfull, Happy exercising, and stay safe!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 14, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Solid beginner dumbbell set', 'author': 'A. Franciscus', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a very sturdy, no frills starter dumbbell set. It comes well packaged, even so there was some minor chipping of the black paint on the cast iron plates but that's to be expected. The set I got comes with 4 5lb cast iron plates, 4 3lb cast iron plates, 2 steel dumbbell handles, 4 steel star collar locks and 1 connector bar (for connecting the dumbbells to each other to form a barbell). I did some weighing of my own and found that the handles (with star collar locks attached) are about 3lbs 14oz, so not quite 4 pounds each side (without any plates). Using the lower set of included weights that makes each side just shy of 10lb, which is fine for my needs but may be too much for someone just starting out. I have been using this set for about 2 months now and have not had any issues, the star collars keep the weights in place with no concern that they'll slide off. I wiped all the pieces down with an old rag as soon as I unboxed them (some reviewers said their set had sharp metal edges that could cause cuts, this was not the case with mine though). The connector bar is ok, takes a bit of getting used to setting up and it's a bit shorter than I'd prefer for bar style exercises but if you don't already have a bar and want a basic option that can save you space this will do the trick. The Nuobells are better at 70lbs and under but when you want to go above 70, these are way betterCost: these are slightly cheaper than my 20inch loadables (loaded with 10lb cap plates) and much cheaper than my $800 NuobellsCapacity: Having the ability to go up to 100lbs on these and not having the length interfere with my exercises will be awesome for me in terms of db shoulder press and bench.Cons:Durability is questionable: A few of the plates arrived with chips in them and some of the metal coating on the bar flaked off when I first put these together.
