title: Bowflex SelectTech 552 Adjustable Dumbbells
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth it', 'author': 'Garrett', 'rating': 5, 'content': "ProsThe product is easy to use and understand. The weights are well balanced. The grip is comfortable. The adjustable knob is extremely smooth and feels well designed. I really like ability to adjust the sides to different weights, it allows for more exercise variations than possible with traditional dumbbells. The wide range of weights available allow me to use this product for all types of muscle building. The total volume of this product is small, making it ideal for storing in small areas. I've had noticable gains within the first month of this product!ConsThe only thing I don't like about the product is that they are always big, even when they are light. The 5 lbs setting is just as long of a dumbbell as the the 52.5 lbs setting. So, while a large dumbbell being 52.5 lbs isn't really a problem, sometimes it is problematic to have a 5 lbs dumbbell taking up so much space. It could limit your ability to maneuver the dumbbells during certain exercises.PriceI would say it was priced exactly what it is worth. Although, considering the costs of going to the gym, or the cost of buying individual dumbbells for each weight, the cost of this product is actually pretty low.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Multiple weights in less space', 'author': 'Logain777', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been extremely impressed with their versatility and convenience. These dumbbells are perfect for anyone who wants to get a upper-body workout at home without taking up a lot of space.The adjustable weight feature is very convenient, as it allows me to quickly and easily change the weight of the dumbbells to suit my needs. The weight range of 5 to 52.5 pounds is perfect for a variety of exercises, from lighter weight lifting to heavier compound movements.The build quality of these dumbbells is also very impressive. They feel solid and well-made, with a durable construction that has held up well against regular use. The grip is comfortable and provides a good amount of traction, which is important for preventing slips and accidents during exercise. The base is plastic tho (seems pretty durable so far) and you cannot change the weight dials without them being on the base.One thing to note is that these dumbbells are quite large and may take up more space than traditional dumbbells. However, the convenience of being able to adjust the weight and save on space more than makes up for this.Overall, I highly recommend the Bowflex SelectTech 552 Adjustable Dumbbells for anyone who wants a versatile and convenient way to get a upper-body workout at home.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent solution for P90X or those that don't want a house full of weights", 'author': 'Jacopo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'After a lot of consideration, I ended up purchasing these weights to use with P90X Extreme Home Fitness Workout Program - 13 DVDs, Nutrition Guide, Exercise Planner . The program calls for a lot of different weights, and I was tired of leaving 8 different dumbbells lying around on the floor of my den. After using these for roughly three months, I am very pleased with them, and with a few exceptions, they work great for P90X.CONSTRUCTION/DESIGN- As of 2/16/10, the model being sold on Amazon is the 2009 model, which came out in September 2008 and is the most current model available. There is no 2010 model, despite what many third party sellers claim (I have confirmed this with Nautilus). I have uploaded pictures of the version Amazon is selling, which comes with a black base plate. Amazon has lumped the reviews from the 2008 model in with this 2009 model, so read the reviews carefully. The 2009 model eliminates many of the complaints of the 2008, most specifically, it uses metal tabs on the weight plates to lock them in place. Construction is solid and it is very unlikely these will break. Although unlike traditional dumbbells, you can\'t drop these on the ground after a set. They are fairly sturdy, but I would be very nervous about dropping these from any height over about 5". The handle is ergonomic to fit the palm of your hand and the grip feels good and natural during lifting. The handle is thicker than a dumbbell and I prefer it to the thinner dumbbell handles.The weights have a dial on the end of them that you turn to select the desired weight. If you select 10lbs, it will then lock in the two weight plates to make 10 lbs, and release everything else; so when you pick up the weights, you get 10 lbs and all the other weights are left in the base plate. When done, you put the weights back in the base plate. This works very well, with the exception of it "catching" occasionally if the weight plates shift a little bit. This happens maybe 1/100 times or so though and isn\'t a big problem. You just jiggle the weights a bit until it locks. The nice thing about this design, is that the two ends of the dumbbell don\'t have to be the same weight. You can set the dial to 10lbs on one end and 30 lbs on the other. This will effectively put 5lbs on one end of the bar and 15lbs on the other. I don\'t do this often, but it can lead to more variation in exercises, and I occasionally do it for tricep workouts or hammer curls. When lifting, the weights feel very sturdy. The plates are firmly locked onto the handle. There is no shaking or movement of the plates at all, and they don\'t feel much different than dumbbells.PRICE - I definitely do not think these are worth the suggested retail price, but then again, I have never seen them sold for anything close to that. While they may seem expensive, if you calculate the cost of a large range of dumbbells (which typically sell for $1 per pound), these are a very favorable comparison. Just two 35lb dumbbells are going to cost you at least $50 (closer to $70 if new).USE WITH P90X - I originally did P90X with dumbbells. I had three different dumbbells, which just isn\'t enough for the variety of exercises used in that program. If money and space is no object, I would recommend a full dumbbell set over these, as dumbbells are better for the exercises. But for most people that just isn\'t practical. I hate pulling out and storing even three sets of dumbbells every other day to workout. The SelectTechs look so good that I just leave them in my den year round.The main advantages the SelectTechs have with P90X is the ability to select smaller weight increment, and being able to make weight changes quickly. Before these I owned a set of 10s, 15s, and 25s, which isn\'t enough variety. Going up from 15 to 25 on bicep curls is a very big jump for me was too light, 25 was too heavy, and my form was terrible because I was struggling with the weight. With the SelectTechs, I could go to 17.5, then 20, then 22.5, then finally to 25. being able to go from 10lbs to 12.5 on tricep exercises, rather than 10lbs to 15 helps significantly. The other advantage is to quickly change weight increments. With P90X, you have about 15-30 seconds to set up for the next exercise. 5-10 seconds is all the time I needed to change the four dials on the SelectTechs and get a new weight.CONS - The real problem with these weights is the length. I had no real problem with the width, which is very manageable, but the dumbbells are 16" long. This can cause a problem with some of the P90X exercises. There are maybe 7-8 exercises during the entire program that are awkward to do because of the length of the dumbbells. There are about 2-3 exercises that are very awkward to do (to the point that I actually switch to my dumbbells for these). Congdon Curls and Flip Grip Twist Kickback (tricep exercise) are two that I can think of off-hand that are difficult to do. You can ultimately make it work, but it\'s going to feel a little funny as you try to hold the weights out far enough to clear each other or your chest. This isn\'t enough of an issue that it would discourage me from buying them again.I originally debated between getting these and the Bowflex SelectTech 1090 Single Dumbbell , since I was worried 52.5 pounds wouldn\'t be enough. Even though there are a few exercises where you could eventually need more than 52.5 pounds (heavy pants and lawnmowers come to mind), I really think this is enough weight for 90% of the people who will be doing P90X. And as Tony says, if you don\'t have heavy enough weight, you can always add reps. I would not buy the 1090s (which go up to 90 lbs) for P90X because I think the length of those, which is even bigger than the 552s), would just be too unwieldy for many of the exercises.The SelectTechs did come with a short DVD that shows you some workouts specifically designed for these dumbbells and how to use them. I did find this beneficial since it gave me some tips that I didn\'t know about lifting. Optionally, I bought the Bowflex SelectTech 552 / 1090 Dumbbell Stand to use with these. It looks great, but I\'m not sure I would buy it again. If you don\'t care about looks, the box the SelectTechs are shipped in makes a great stand on it\'s own and is very sturdy.UPDATE June 2012 - I\'ve put these weights through an estimated 200+ hours of heavy use since I\'ve had them and they still look brand new and work just the same as when I got them. There are times when I want heavier weights and would have liked some dumbbells that go up to 90 lbs, but I don\'t want to sacrifice the smaller profile of these for the larger model. Still very satisfied.UPDATE November 2013 - I\'m still using the SelectTechs almost daily. They are in almost identical condition to when I received them with no signs of wear or problems. I have not found a better solution for adjustable dumbbells yet and will continue to use them (although I do wish they were slightly smaller).UPDATE November 2016 - Still using the SelectTechs, albeit about bi-weekly since I have switched my fitness regimen. I would say they have close to 1000 hours of use and are still in almost brand new condition, and still working great. I have recently switched to the Selecttech 560s though and will be finally retiring the 552s.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2010', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bowflex - the best choice! (long but thorough review)', 'author': 'beam me up Scotty', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm a 48-yr old guy of average fitness, average strength, and average physique. I started lifting weights to...don't laugh...improve my golf game. I love a bargain, but I love a great value even more, and I'll pay for the most expensive choice if it's worth it. When I decided to get some adjustable dumbbells, I started digging into the details. See below for the brands I considered and the pros and cons in my opinion. I only reviewed the ones I was able to try with my own hands (mainly a used or new sporting goods store or friends' places). Bottom line: the SelectTech 'bells provide the most bang for the buck and are the best choice by a wide margin! [note after editing - my columns disappeared but you will get the idea]Brand PROS CONSCap Barbell 40-Pound - Dirt cheap! - Take a long time to adjust - Lift like traditional 'bells - Cheap chrome finish - Indestructible - drop 'em! - Useless cheap case - Add-on plates easy to findBottom line: I once owned some similar to this, and hardly ever used them except for at a single weight, because they were such a pain to adjust. If it's all you can afford, not bad for $40.PowerBlock Personal Trainer - Nice range of weights - Pricey, weird shape and form - Solid construction - HUGE, very tricky adjustment - What is that idiotic color coding?Bottom line: Tough, well made, and feel good in your hands. Not droppable but solid. I can't get past the blocky, bulky form factor of these 'bells however. They hit me in the chin on curls, rows are impossible, they touch your wrists sometimes, and don't even think about anything behind your head! The adjustments are difficult and just plain won't work unless the unit is level on a solid surface (not carpet!). A no go.Ironmaster 75 lb Quick Lock - The most weight - Big bucks - The most solidly built - Hard to adjust, pins precarious! - Good size, feel right - Lose the square corners!Bottom line: By far the most solid and traditional feeling of the adjustable 'bells; I dropped them several times and they didn't break, but the pins fell out when I did! Very expensive, but the only way to get to 100+lbs in each hand (with add on kit) in this segment. The stand is adequate. The corners are annoying and got in the way sometimes. Among the most difficult to adjust. If they were round, and had easy to adjust, secure pins, they would be a winner. But they don't. Fail.Bowflex SelectTech - BY FAR easiest to adjust - Pricey - Solid (= to powerblocks) - Seem a bit looser than others - Excellent size and form - 2.5-lb increments up to 25 lbs are superbBottom line: The smoothest, fastest to adjust, nicest feeeling of all. The grip is just the right firmness and size, the plates aren't bulky, and while they feel a bit rattl-ey, they aren't! Actually these had the most secure adjustments except the star-locks on the Cap Bells (which take so long they defeat the purpose). These also benefit from an elegant level of finish, like a Lexus among Kias. And while they aren't cheap, they are #3 on the price list of my review (out of 6). The clear winner!Lifesmart 5- to 55-Pound - Inexpensive - Junk construction! - Unique (?) - Difficult to adjustBottom line: A weird set...the handle holds the plates from the outside, making the whole 'bell unbalanced unless hanging down in your hand. So cheaply made they feel like toys. Pesky pins to adjust; this seems to be a bad solution in general! I mention them only to advise you to avoid! Terrible product.Proform Pro Quick 100-Pound - Fair price - Worthless stand - Good dumbbell feel - Feel cheapBottom line: These use an adjustment mechanism similar to the Bowflex 'bells: dials at the ends. The increments are wider, though, and I could feel how the cheap plastic bits on the insides were near breaking (I was trying a used set). Nothing like the Bowlex's solid clunk of metal parts on the inside. Don't be swayed by the included stand, it's crap and won't last 3 months. Definitely not a good value.Others: I stopped after 6. There seem to be several products similar to the Proforms, maybe even exactly the same manufacturer! I could tell at a glance that they're all equally cheap. If money is a big limiting factor, I suggest you go with the Cap Bells until you can afford the good stuff.If you read this far, thanks, and enjoy whichever one you buy!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2010', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Going on 10 years, still like new; cannot recommend enough', 'author': 'Skeegz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought these in January of 2013. Not a week has gone by that these things did not get some use, usually at least 3x per week, often a lot more. If it wasn\'t me using them, it was one of the many roommates, friends, and family members who have lived with me over the years. I used them back when me and some friends were doing the p90x; they\'ve been a part of pretty much every exercise routine I\'ve ever used in the past 10 years; I often use them in between gaming sessions or while waiting through loading screens; friends often mess around with them casually when they come over; I\'ve lent them out for brief periods for friends who wanted to try them out.Honestly, after 10 years of hard, constant use, they still look and feel brand new to me. It\'s absolutely ridiculous.When I first got them, I worried that I was making an expensive impulse purchase, and that they would gather dust in the corner or break after a few years. In the years since, I frequently look back and think to myself, "that was probably one of the best purchases I\'ve made."I\'ve never had any issues with the weights, and they\'ve never failed on me. They\'re extremely easy to use and are indispensable for workouts. Adjusting the weights is still as smooth and as simple as the day I first purchased them, and to me the clicking sound that the adjusting process makes is an oddly satisfying noise.They\'re small and don\'t take up much space. They\'re easy to move if you can lift 55 lbs (a little more than a kitty litter bucket), and the base has what feels like handholds on all four sides. Hell, you can even stack them and carry them two at a time, or store them on top of each other.The biggest con I can think of is that they\'re a bit bulky when you\'re using them, so they might be a little unwieldy for some exercises. Never bothered me that much, though. Maybe the fact that you have to adjust both sides of the dumbbell might be a little cumbersome, but honestly that\'s being very nit-picky.I\'ve recommended these to so many people over the years, and I can\'t praise them enough. If they were to break on me tomorrow, I would purchase a replacement set the first opportunity I had - though I honestly wouldn\'t be surprised if these outlast me at the rate they\'re going.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bowflex SelectTech 552 Dumbbells... are great!', 'author': 'D&CP301', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Man, I was excited to try out these Bowflex SelectTech 552 dumbbells! So let‚Äôs get down to it...-These dumbbells were packaged well. They are encased in very thick styrofoam blocks which is inside of a very thick cardboard box. The dumbbells themselves have a plastic bag around them and they are fastened to the dumbbell base with a strap. Overall, very pleased with how they are shipped. Nothing was broken so A+ to Bowflex, Amazon, and UPS.-Easy to operate right out of the box. It‚Äôs all fairly self explanatory. There are two knobs, one on each end of the dumbbell. You turn the knobs to the desired weight setting and lift straight up on the dumbbell. That‚Äôs it. You don‚Äôt need to try to figure out any weight plate combinations in your head. You just turn the knobs on each end to the desired weight. As an added bonus you can do an ‚Äúoffset‚Äù dumbbell. You simply set one knob for a specific weight (20lbs for example) and set the opposite knob for a different weight (7.5lbs for example). Using the dumbbells in ‚Äúoffset‚Äù mode can be beneficial in certain exercises. Bowflex goes into greater detail about ‚Äúoffset‚Äù in the owners manual. This is not something you can do with traditional dumbbells.-Operation is smooth. The knobs turn very easily and give a distinct/solid ‚Äúclick‚Äù when the knob is in the correct position. Lifting the dumbbells out of the base and putting them back in is easy.-The handles are great! They have a grippy section that makes them feel very secure in your hands. And there is plenty of room to grab the handle. It doesn‚Äôt feel cramped (I mention this because some of the pictures I‚Äôve seen make it look like there‚Äôs not a lot of room)-The plates are the only area where I have a couple of very, very small complaints. First, they do shift slightly as you are using them during exercises. I‚Äôve never felt like they were going to disengage from the handle but there is a slight movement of the weight plates during curls/presses/etc. I‚Äôm used to using solid, old school dumbbells so the movement of the plates is just something I will need to get used to. The second small complaint is the overall width of the dumbbells. In order to accommodate all of the weight plates the dumbbells have to be wide. I understand that. And I HAVE NOT whacked myself in the head while using these BUT it feels like they get very close to my head on certain exercises (shoulder press, shoulder flies) and on other exercises (upright rows for example) they almost... almost... get in the way of themselves. Again, this is just a small complaint and wouldn‚Äôt stop me from recommending them.-The weight range is phenomenal. I mean, come on. To be able to have the equivalent of 30 dumbbells ranging from 5-52.5 lbs and be able to tuck them neatly away in the corner somewhere?? Yeah. That‚Äôs a HUGE advantage of these dumbbells, which leads me to...-A GREAT VALUE! You are getting the equivalent of 30 dumbbells with this set. $350 divided by 30 dumbbells equals $11.67 per dumbbell. With dumbbell prices currently hovering somewhere near $2 per pound you would have to spend over $1500. Even if prices go back down to $1 per pound these are still an amazing bargain.-Extra stuff... they come with a 2 year warranty (make sure you keep your proof of purchase), a really nice, well written owners manual that explains the previously mentioned ‚Äúoffsetting‚Äù and gives you instructions on several exercises to try. They come with a nice, solid base that has hand holds at each end so they are very easy to move. They‚Äôre made by Bowflex so you know you‚Äôre going to get a quality product AND quality support should you ever need it.-Overall I‚Äôm very happy with these dumbbells. Would highly recommend. Thanks for reading this review! I hope you found it helpful!**Edit - I had a dumbbell ‚Äúfreeze‚Äù during my second workout. It wouldn‚Äôt release from the base. Panicked a bit until I looked it up on YouTube and found out how to fix it. This has only happened once and I‚Äôve removed/replaced them from the base multiple times during the two workouts in which I‚Äôve used them. At this point I‚Äôm still very pleased with them and my rating won‚Äôt change unless this freezing issue keeps recurring. Also, I added a photo of the dumbbell on a scale to show the accuracy of the weight.Edit (9-8-2021): These continue to be my go to dumbbells after several months of use. It‚Äôs just very convenient to twist a knob and have a weight range from 5-52.5 lbs. They are still a little tricky to remove from the base occasionally but it‚Äôs something I‚Äôve gotten used to. No major problems at all. I‚Äôve been using them 5 days a week for several months now and would still recommend them to anyone looking for a solid set of adjustable dumbbells.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 16, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars In love with the product, in depth review of the best dumbbells', 'author': 'Prakhar Rawat', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I recently purchased a set of Bowflex SelectTech Dumbbells and I have to say, I am thoroughly impressed with their performance and versatility. As someone who values convenience and efficiency in my workout routine, these dumbbells have been a game-changer for me.One of the standout features of the Bowflex dumbbells is their adjustable weight system. With just the turn of a dial, I can easily switch between a range of weights, from 5 pounds all the way up to 52.5 pounds. This not only saves me time and space (I no longer have to clutter my home gym with multiple sets of dumbbells), but it also allows me to progressively increase the intensity of my workouts as my strength improves.In addition to their adjustable weight system, the Bowflex dumbbells are also incredibly durable and well-made. The handles are comfortable to grip and the weights themselves feel solid and secure. I have never had any issues with them slipping or sliding during my workouts, which is a huge plus.Another advantage of the Bowflex dumbbells is their versatility. With a single set, I can perform a wide variety of exercises, from bicep curls and tricep kickbacks to shoulder presses and rows. This not only keeps my workouts interesting and varied, but it also allows me to target multiple muscle groups and achieve a more well-rounded physique.Since incorporating the Bowflex dumbbells into my workout routine, I have noticed significant improvements in my strength and endurance. I feel more energized and motivated to stick to my exercise plan, and I am seeing tangible results in terms of muscle definition and overall fitness.All in all, I am extremely satisfied with my purchase of the Bowflex SelectTech Dumbbells. title: Amazon Basics Rubber Encased Exercise & Fitness Hex Dumbbell, Single, Hand Weight For Strength Training
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding Rubber Dumbbell', 'author': 'THE-DEADLY-DOG', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Synopsis: Everything you need a rubber dumbbell to be from a dependable and reasonably priced brand.I was putting together a garage gym for my girlfriend and engaged in the process of trying to scavenge for dumbbells to supplement the free weights. If you've ever shopped for dumbbells you know they are outrageously expensive and run in a whole litany of varieties, sizes, reliability, etc. What I decided on were rubbers as they had the most durability in the setting of our garage and they would also be the most space-effective. These 10lbs and 15lbs are a bread-and-butter for warming up, doing light shoulder work, arm work, etc. so they needed to join the gym as quickly as possible.The dumbbells themselves are exactly what you would expect from any hexagonal dumbbells. They don't slide around on the floor, they sit nicely when placed down, they are sturdy, and pretty darn close to being weight accurate (see pictures). It should be expected that these dumbbells will not weight the exact weight purchased as they are not calibrated to that level. A rule of thumb I always tell her, and suggest in any gym; rotate your dumbbell each set to ensure any imbalances are evened out.My girlfriend has been using them weekly since December and has never run into any issues or complaints about the grip or the weight. I would highly advise you leave them in a place with airflow for a few days though--these will smell terrible out of the box because of the plastic, as mentioned by many of the other reviewers.Overall you simply cannot beat this value though. The dumbbells are reliable and for a fair price. No need to look anywhere else when Amazon Basics can supply exactly what you need.5 Liftin' Stars out of 5!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 40lb dumbell- High quality and easy to grip', 'author': 'Florida50', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Purchased one 40lb dumbell to use for goblet squats then went back and bought the second to make them pair. I bought two of them. He loves them! They are very sturdy, too heavy for me, but My Husband loves it. Thank you! You won‚Äôt go wrong buying these. I paid a lot for each one and I did buy two I should‚Äôve only bought one, but I didn‚Äôt feel like sending the other one back. But worth the money!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars ~1.5yr Review | Full set, still looks and works as if new', 'author': 'K', 'rating': 5, 'content': "SUMMARY- Took a year but built the whole set (10 - 50)- Nothing beats the versatility of a good set of dumbbells- Stinky and oily first few days (no big deal for me)- Look like new 1.5years later with nearly daily use- Follow gym etiquette and treat them right, they will last forever- Did not confirm their weightFULL REVIEWBACK STORYAs was the case everywhere when COVID hit, my MMA gym shut down.Previous to that closure, I had barbells and plates that I'd accumulated through the past couple of decades.But when the everything closed, I quickly found myself missing the variation and breadth of exercises that you get at the gym vs the barbell setup I had at home. Almost immediately, I ordered a cable machine but still felt like I was missing a bunch of exercises.4 months later, in July of 2020 I found these and ordered what I could -- at that time only 10 & 20 pounders were available. That order was just shy of $95. Expensive but seemed like a somewhat fair trade given that I had cancelled my gym memberships, not knowing what was going to happen or for how long places would remain closed.They trickled in as they could over the next month.I would check the site daily to see if any more had become available for sale. Most of the time they would come with a warning, stating that there were none in stock but would be shortly and charges would appear on CC until they were shipped. I'd pick up a pair as I saw them available.April of 2021 (almost a year after I purchased my first pair), I bought the elusive 50 and 35 pound pairs. The last two I needed to complete the 10 - 50 pound set (incremental by 5lbs).THE DUMBBELLSHIIT, being able to switch weights instantly to finish a set out to complete failure, flies and reverse flies, single arm lifts for core strength, etc. Nothing beats the versatility of a good dumbbell set.Yes, some were oily and had a rubbery smell when they first arrived. I would cut the box top, remove from the plastic bag and let air outside for a couple of days. I'd then wipe down with a cloth and place on dumbbell rack. These two things were never really an issue for me.After a year and a half of almost daily use, they look and feel as they did when I first got them. Please note, that I follow gym etiquette. I don't let them slam against the floor (drop), I don't bang them against each other, I re-rack when done, etc. The highest they ever dropped is from bench after doing chest press (will drop lower my arms by my side and l and these roll off -- as anyone would at any gym). They do fall on mats, or carpet. They've never dropped on concrete, brick, rock, or similar.Take care of them, and THEY WILL LAST you forever.WEIGHTThere are a few reviews that tested the weight to verify how close they were to their stated weights. I haven't checked mine. Honestly, up until I started to write this review I hadn't even thought about it. I'm no professional body builder. I need resistance and these seem to be doing a very good job at it. Maybe if I get a calibrated scale in the future I'll weigh 'em and update this review (but doubtful).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality', 'author': 'Matthew Staller', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great feel in the hand, knurling is medium light. title: CAP Barbell Adjustable Dumbbell Weight Set | Multiple Options
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Solid Choice for Home Workouts!', 'author': 'James Rushforth', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Cap Barbell 40-Pound Dumbbell Set, and I must say, I am thoroughly impressed! This set is perfect for anyone looking to add some weight training to their home workout routine.First off, the quality of these dumbbells is top-notch. The handles are sturdy and provide a comfortable grip, even during intense workouts. The weight plates are also well-made and fit securely onto the handles, so there's no need to worry about them coming loose.Another great thing about this set is the versatility it offers. With four 2.5-pound plates, four 5-pound plates, and two dumbbell handles, you can easily adjust the weight to suit your needs. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned lifter, this set has you covered.I also appreciate how compact this set is. It doesn't take up much space, so it's perfect for small home gyms or apartments. Plus, the plates are easy to store, so you can keep your workout area neat and organized.Overall, I highly recommend the Cap Barbell 40-Pound Dumbbell Set to anyone looking for a high-quality, versatile, and space-saving weight set for their home gym. It's a fantastic value for the price, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Don't listen to the negative reviews...", 'author': 'Mantis Toboggan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a long review, I hope I can keep your attention.First off, I want to tell you guys that Fedex Smartpost is the carrier for this item. I didn\'t have a problem with them, even though they delivered my dumbbells 2 days after the delivery estimate(can\'t complain, free shipping). Fedex Smartpost sends to the closest USPS, then USPS takes an additional 2 days to deliver. It seems like most people hate Fedex Smartpost because they take longer than usual("google fedex smartpost sucks" to see what I\'m talking about). I ordered these on 2-9-13 and they arrived at my doorstep on 2-16-13, so one week exactly, average time for free shipping. The dumbbells came packaged professionally and my case came in perfect condition, which I was very pleased about.I also ordered 60 pound db set from Lion Roar Fitness on 2-8-13, and as of 2-16, they didn\'t even start shipping so I ended up cancelling that order. They charged $20 for shipping too... I will NEVER even consider buying from LRF again. Just wanted to warn you guys about that. $20 for shipping AND they lag it? No thank you.These Dumbbell sets are a great investment, and I know they will last a long time. First of all, there is no toxic chemical smell the negative reviewers mentioned. Not even the case it came with. They clearly have gotten better with quality control. I read ALL of the negative reviews and took a chance with these, and I am glad I did. My bars are all nicely polished, smooth, and the weights and collars fit accordingly. There are 4 pieces of rubber stoppers that help keep these weights in place, 2 in the middle of the bar and 2 that are connected to the collars, which does an excellent job. When you lift weights, you should never "jerk" through your workouts, but instead keep good form with nice controlled movements. That\'s how my workouts are, and the weights have not moved, rolled, clanked, at all. The only time the collars roll out, is when I twist them to change weights. I even put all the plates on one bar(30 lbs) and the weights/collars were still in place. People say these are not the best quality, but what more do you expect from a set of dumbbells? Good finish on the plates with a clean tough metal bar, which cannot rip as some rubber grip bars tend to rip after tightening the collars too much. Carefully put the plates on, or you could scratch/chip off the paint. If you don\'t like getting callouses on your hands, I recommend investing in gloves. I don\'t feel a thing with gloves on and can enjoy lifting weights without getting blisters. If you have Fat Gripz(check my review for Fat Gripz), you don\'t even need gloves. Those rubber suckers will cover it, and give you a much better workout.I will buy additional plates for these soon but before you guys do as well, try adding Fat Gripz to the bars with your normal workouts. It will give your workouts more of a challenge, and you will see some good results in your forearm strength. I wish I knew about them when I wrestled in high school..Long story short, don\'t listen to the negative reviews. Keep yourself in shape and buy these already!Oh yeah, I forgot to mention that the bars + collars does not equal 5 pounds(unless you are weighing both bars and 4 collars together). So you get about 17.5 pounds each dumbbell. The description states that they weigh 5 pounds but it\'s half. The case it comes with is about 5 or 6 pounds so that\'s where they kind of trick you. So if you do the math, 4 x 5lbs plate + 4 x 2.5 lbs plate + 2 x 2.5 collars & bar = 35 lbs + 5 lbs case = 40 lbs db set.. I\'m not going to knock off a star for that because I bought these knowing this information. We can always buy more plates, so no big deal.Thank you for reading my long review. I hope this helped make your decision in building a better body! Train hard, train safe, and good luck :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Affordable and heavy.', 'author': 'Mike', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a great set of weights for someone looking to get started working out at home. It's not perfect, but I'm not really sure that the imperfections matter for a product like this. So let's get the negatives out of the way first:- Yeah, they smell, as others have noted. It's nothing strange -- if you've ever been to a gym before, you already know this smell. They're metallic with additional chemical odors. For a basic sniff test, you won't notice much. But the smell does begin to accumulate after a few days in cramped quarters, so maybe they're not the best choice for a bedroom or tiny apartment. I suspect the smell will dissipate in time, but I don't know how long that will be.- The carrying case is cheap molded plastic, and there's a good chance yours will arrive with one or more corners dented. It's fine -- the cases aren't meant to be display items. They're meant to store the weights, and to give you a convenient way to lug them around when needed.- It's obvious that corners were cut in some regards. The rubber cushions on the bars are cheap, and could possibly fall off and get lost if you aren't attentive. Likewise, the rubber cushions within the screw-on collars can fall out. It's not a big deal if they do -- you just stick them back in. But these are obviously not advanced equipment. They were designed to be cheap and functional.That said, I don't think any of these cons really matter. Weights have one purpose in life -- to weigh something. Your muscles can't tell if you're holding twenty pounds of expensive metal or cheap metal. This particular set is very well priced, and they feel safe and sturdy. You don't have to worry about the collars wiggling loose, and they're adjustable down to 2.5 pound increments. I snagged two sets, giving me greater versatility and the ability to put more weight on a single bar if needed. For the price, this is a perfect way to get started with a cheap, space-saving home gym.Weights don't need to be pretty and fancy to work. They just need to give gravity something to act on. You can buy fancier equipment than this, but it's not clear why you'd really want to.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Honest review addressing common concerns...', 'author': 'Bleacherbum95', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When originally considering this product I was very concerned with the number of negative reviews/comments that people were leaving about these dumbbells. After deciding to take the risk, I felt the need to write a review since I believe that the negative reviews are overblown and overly dramatic. I will hopefully address the main concerns that you as the prospective buyer are having while considering this product. If you don\'t care about the details I have a TLDR at the bottom =)1. Smell: These weights do not smells like daisies; no dumbbells do. However, the smell is NOT as bad as people are saying. I would highly recommend leaving these weights outside (and/or washing them) to let them air out and control the smell, but it is not immediately overpowering. When the package arrived I slowly opened the box waiting for a toxic stench to explode out, but it never came. It was not until I lifted a plate out of the box that I noticed the smell people mentioned (the chemical applied to prevent rust), and it was not very strong. I left mine in the garage to air out and noticed a slight change in the smell of the garage, but nothing extreme. I would certainly keep them out of the house to be safe, but for $40 a quick wash or airing out was worth it to me.2: Quality: If you are looking for professional dumbbells that are made of top quality materials then look elsewhere. But if you are looking for a solid set of starter weights, this is your product. I will say that the first time I removed a collar a small piece of metal broke off, but it did not affect the functionality of the piece. Also, I noticed someone mentioned that the collar lets the weights slide...this was incorrect in my experience. The collars seem to hold the weights snugly in place, so there should be no problems there. The quality is by no means great (unbeatable for the price though), but it is good enough that I trust it will last and serve its purpose.3. Case: I saw a few people talking about how the case broke easily. The case seems fairly sturdy if it is treated well. A case breaking or not will depend on your delivery man. The weights are packaged very well inside a few boxes (Amazon ships it out in an excessively large box), and in my experience there were no cracks. The sliders to keep the box closed seem pretty lame, but I\'m one of those people who isn\'t going to sweat it if the case breaks.I hope I covered the main concerns that most people were having. My honest review of this product is that this is unbeatable for the price. $40 with free shipping (mine came in 2 days) is great, and these are exactly what I was looking for. And NO I was not paid for this review and think Amazon should be ashamed of including paid reviews.TLDR: Does NOT smell that bad (easily fixed), decent quality, best bang for the buck for somebody looking for starter dumbbells.UPDATE 1/25/14: I now have two sets of these (it was cheaper than buying weight individually), and they are holding up great after over a year and a half of use. I\'ve noticed the collar shifts slightly when you get over 30lbs, but never enough that it\'s a problem. Be confident in purchasing these as starter weights.UPDATE 7/31/16: My original bars are still going strong. The collar shifting still happens on occasion, but not to the point where it interferes with my workout. I\'ve purchased additional plates for it and added them just fine - any 1" plate should fit just as well as the originals. So these have held up strong for 4 years...zero complaints here. One thing I forgot in the original review - you may want some lifting gloves. The metals isn\'t forgiving on your hands, so if you don\'t want big calluses, invest in a cheap pair of gloves.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Adjustible Weight Set', 'author': 'Lumbre', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First of all, let\'s get the smell part clear. Yes, it smells. It smells similar to the stuff you find in the tire/automotive aisles at Target/WalMart/other stores. Yes, it can be a bit strong. Let it air for a day and put a dryer sheet in the case when you close it. Problem solved. If you\'re picky on having your home smell like candles or something, these are not for you. If you don\'t even notice the smell of a gym when you\'re in a gym (or aren\'t the quickest to pick up on smells), then you\'re fine. Also, I think it\'s the box that smells, not any of the paint.Pros:*It is easy to add/remove weights. Just unscrew the collars, remove/add weights, screw collars back in. You can do this while resting in less than a minute.*You can add your own weights. When you outgrow these, you can add your own weights (doesn\'t have to be the same brand). Any generic 1" weight will do.*When I bought these, they were awesome for $40. Under $1/pound if you count the different combinations of weights you can do and that you can add more later.*Cheap compared to buying individually.Cons:*Slight bump in one of the corners of the case. No big deal. Contents inside are fine. Just an aesthetic issue.*Smell. As addressed above, it can be a bit overpowering, but just take the time to let them air out. Some people also do fine by rinsing them.*They\'re not neoprene.Notes & Thoughts:*A lot of people complain about the default California warning added to this set. Seriously, California is overprotective. Drinking dozens of gallons of water is known to cause death. If ingested, gasoline can destroy your organs. Too much sun can give you cancer. They have these warnings on a ton of things for sale in California. Something containing nickel, for example, automatically gets this warning. If it were more serious, more states or the entire country would place a warning or they would be getting sued for giving people cancer (it\'s not like lawyers are exactly shy).*The handles may be a bit too textured for some people, especially those with delicate hands or buying more weights. In that case, maybe you should buy weight-lifting gloves. For those who don\'t mind getting scuffed by sand or falling hands-first on pavement, you\'re fine. If anything, I shift my hands around on the bar which varies up my routine a bit.*People say it\'s a good starter set. I just started a serious workout routine and have had this for a month. I see myself having this for years.*A few have complained that the weights aren\'t exact. The bar doesn\'t seem like 5 pounds, but when I weight myself with one of my 20 lb. dumbbells, I see my weight increase by 19.8 or 20 (my scale goes in intervals of 0.2). It\'s close enough for me. I don\'t need it to be that exact.*Mine didn\'t seem to have any loose seal rings or collars. They seem good for the price. They may shift a small amount after a 30 minute workout to where you can hear a slight clunk. Just retighten them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing quality', 'author': 'John carter', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Everything came double if not even triple boxed and wrapped and had stuffing on the original box all the weights came individually wrapped there was no chemical strong smell with my set (105lb) pair they just smelled new nothing that made me gag or was to strong as far as the mechanics it seems to work perfect they hold still while I do chest dumbell flys with 35lbs on each only time will tell but as of now extremely happy don‚Äôt listen to the review also if you want to add plates to this set make sure there 1.14 or bigger 1inch plates won‚Äôt work also I personally love the diamond pattern grip but if your not used to lifting without gloves your going to have to break your hands in or get some gloves me personally gives me more grip I love it it does not feel like it‚Äôs digging in my skin like others said overall good product for the price can‚Äôt beat it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Nice dumbbell bars', 'author': 'RY', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I liked the dumbell bars. They are solid, easy to grip, and the nuts tighten down nicely. The weights that came with them would be fine except the center hole in them is a lot bigger than it needs to be causing the weights to shift,if you don't really crank down on the bar nuts.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best deals I‚Äôve ever found on Amazon', 'author': "D'Art", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This 52.5 lb single dumbbell setup is without a doubt one of the best deals I‚Äôve ever found on Amazon. While most iron free-weights sell for around $2/pound (as of the fall of 2022), this set is much more affordable,The price for it does seem to vary wildly day by day. I paid $77 in October 2022 and see that a month later, it is selling for $65. But I‚Äôm not complaining since it‚Äôs a steal at either price.I bought 2 sets so I‚Äôd have a pair of dumbbells.The dumbbell bars and threaded, star-shaped end nuts are nicely made. The chrome coating seems thick and durable. And because the threaded nuts have black rubber washers on the side that makes contact with the weight plates, they tighten securely and stay firmly in place when in use. Other sets I‚Äôve used did not have the rubber washer and as a result, would loosen up while doing reps. That‚Äôs both annoying and dangerousThe rubber washers do tend to fall off when removing the nuts from the dumbbell, but that is easily rectified by putting a few drops of superglue in the groove in the nut into which the rubber washer sits.The weight plates themselves are a little less precisely made. For instance, I weighed my 5 lb plates on a postal scale and discovered they range anywhere from 4.75 lbs to 5.25 lbs. That‚Äôs not a big deal most of the time but you can definitely notice an imbalance if you inadvertently end up with 8 of the heavier 5 lb plates on one hand and 8 of the lighter plates on the other.To avoid that from happening, I used a silver Sharpie to mark the plate that are over 5 lbs and keep them in a separate pile so I can distribute the weight more evenly into the bars.Also, while the clear-coat on the plates seems heavy duty enough, you do need to check for rough edges. That goes for the dumbbell bars too. I had to file down a couple of spots to avoid getting metal splinters in my hands.Last but not least, the dumbbells I received have a diameter of 1.18 inches (or 30mm) and the weight plates have holes that size. This means any plates you may already have with 1 inch (25mm) holes will not fit onto these bars. Likewise, while the plates from this set will easily go onto a 1 inch bar, they can flop around a bit. In practice the latter is not a problem as long as you can tighten down the bar-end clamps. I use my 30mm plates on a 25mm curl bar without issue.In short, while there may be some compromises involved, at these prices, this dumbbell set is one of the best deals out there.Follow up note written on April 11, 2023:I‚Äôve been using my weight set several times a week for about 6 months now and all parts are holding up great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really like these', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed a set to get started with. It‚Äôs hard to make it all the way to the gym...and if I‚Äôm watching tv I can just pick these up and do a few curls every now and then. Really helpful. They are easy to switch weights in and out, and if you are cool with doing one arm at a time then you could add all the weights on one and basically have a dumbbell that goes up to nearly 50 pounds (minus the 4 pound bar), without having to spend all the money of buying 2, 50 pound dumbbells, which would cost twice as much. Instead just do one arm at a time and save half the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Customer service was decent', 'author': 'Nick', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'For quality. You need to try each screw to find one that will actually screw on all the way. Paint is intact, other than that, they are weights.Be advised, you might not get everything in your shipment. Thankfully, customer service was easy to contact. After a couple of days, I recieved a reply asking for the details of my purchase, and after that I recieved my missing handle promptly.4 stars for good customer service.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars don't make the same mistake I made... I have the fixed 5lb, 10lb, 15lb dumbbells as well as dumbbells that you can add or remove weight plates to change the weight. However, they end up taking too much valuable space in my home gym and worst of all, my sons get lazy with changing weight plates, not to mention changing it back after using it. So they end up using the fixed dumbbells more often but they got to the point where they now need the 20lb dumbbells so I was looking for one in the market and came across this wonderful, adjustable dumbbells that can be adjusted from 5lb to 25lbs in 5 pound increment and I'm so glad I found this because they are simply amazing!First of all, I was so impressed with their packaging. It just has 2 pieces (dumbbell and plate) but both of them were well protected with thick, fitted foams so they don't move or get damaged with bumps and drops. It also came with a poster size user manual and it had pictures of various exercise you can do with the dumbbells on the back of it.I never had an adjustable dumbbell before but this is so cleverly designed. You can literally change the weight in 1 second by simply rotating the handle bar while the dumbbell is on the plate. There's clear marking of the weight from 5, 10, 15, 20, and 25 on both ends of the handle with an arrow to indicate which weight has been selected. It also makes a clicking sound when you rotate the handle so you know when the change has been set and locked in. Very clear, quick and easy way to change the weight. It really can't get any easier, simpler and faster!I was a bit worried that the dumbbell weight plates might come loose or fall off when exercising but I was again impressed that the plates stays in place and you can't even rotate the handle to change the weight once the dumbbell comes out from the plate. The handle has non-slip grip and is well shaped for comfortable and solid grip. It seems everything is made out of high quality material.Finally, I just love the space saving feature and now I can get rid of all our fixed dumbbells. No more clutter or misplacing or even adding/removing weight plates. Just turn the handle to set the dial then lift to start working out. In fact, I get grab both dumbbells and change the weights at the same time on both of them. It's that easy! Although I was looking for 20lb dumbbells for my teenager sons, I'm happy that this can be used up to 25lbs, which I'm sure they will need eventually. What's so crazy is that the price of this dumbbell is actually cheaper than all of my fixed dumbbells. This is just a no-brainer!BOTTOM LINE:Don't make the same mistake that I made when buying dumbbells. Just buy this adjustable dumbbell from the beginning and save yourself time, money, and space! title: Amazon Basics Vinyl Hexagon Workout Dumbbell Hand Weight
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable and quality!', 'author': 'Joe GoodVibes', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Amazon Basics Vinyl Hexagon Workout Dumbbell, and I've been thoroughly impressed with both the quality and value it offers. These dumbbells are well-made, with a sturdy vinyl coating that provides a comfortable grip and protects floors from scratches. The hexagon shape prevents rolling, adding an extra layer of safety during workouts. Despite their affordable price, these dumbbells feel durable and reliable, making them a fantastic investment for any home gym. Whether I'm doing strength training exercises or simply adding resistance to my workouts, these dumbbells deliver consistent performance. Overall, I highly recommend the Amazon Basics Vinyl Hexagon Workout Dumbbell for anyone looking for high-quality fitness equipment at an unbeatable value.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Useful, attractive looking, great value weights', 'author': 'Andrew Furst', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'If you buy those big heavy ugly uncoated iron weights (not these), sometimes you\'ll look at them and think "Forget it, I\'ll lift them some other time". Because that type of weight can feel cold and rough, and if you only get the heavy ones you may view them as hard to get started/motivated. The point of getting weights is to use them, not to buy and feel macho looking at them sitting in the corner, while they collect dust.These weights come in a variety of sizes and colors, they are very attractive and feel good in your hands. I bought the 8 pounds (each) red and the 12 pounds (each) blue. The reds are nice to get started in your workout, if you are a man you\'ll likely find them easy but that\'s the point - they get you started easily, they don\'t intimidate you or make you feel like they will be an ordeal. After starting with a low weight like the reds, you can move to the blues or whatever you want, however you want. I would guess that women will want to start at much lower weights than the 8 pound reds, and fortunately those are available too at great prices and attractive colors.I found the weights to be nicely finished, though there were some minor spots where I chose to sandpaper them down slightly to be even smoother. I wouldn\'t say that this is necessary but you might want to consider doing it. If they made some 16 lb dumbells I might consider buying them too, but as of now I\'m very satisfied with the 8\'s and 12\'s. They do have some nice looking 15\'s (forest green) but I\'m not sure those are enough of a bump up from the 12\'s to be worthwhile for me, and the 20\'s would be too heavy for what I want. Overall these are a tremendous value, especially when you consider the free shipping from Amazon on what will be a heavy package.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice purchase...', 'author': 'Hawaiian Punch', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice purchase. Style, size, grip, price, all good!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good feel and balance', 'author': 'Stan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This works great for that little extra weight with my stretches.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice quality for a home gym', 'author': 'Socal Viking', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Good quality product. They look good and easy to grip. I like the rubberized coating and the Grey color blends in nicely with my black gym equipment.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality', 'author': 'Jack Hill', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The rubber vinyl on the weight itself is actually quite good and durable i use these all the time i would suggest this purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly as pictured', 'author': 'jenny', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love these weights. No complaints!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good value', 'author': 'JMF', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Good value for dumbbells. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good price and works great', 'author': 'Arthur', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good price and works great. Easy to use and switch weights, and works with heavier weight plates too if you buy them separately (make sure to buy 1-inch plates).Some other reviewers complained about the grip, but I‚Äôm happy with it. Granted, I always wear gym gloves, but with gloves I find the grip strong and comfortable.The material also seems to be of good quality: I‚Äôve had it for over a year and there‚Äôs no chipping.My one complaint is that the case was a bit damaged on delivery. Which is mostly an issue with poor delivery service (rather than an issue with the product itself), but it does suggest the case is a bit flimsy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very good value for the money', 'author': 'Mike W', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I ended up buying two sets of these and may buy more in the future. The quality is amazing - I haven't found any sort of metal burrs or rough edges or anything like that. The modular design is really cool too.As others have noted, the case is VERY flimsy plastic. Mine has not broken yet - but to be honest I do not intend to use this case as I expect it will break at some point soon. For me, this isn't a big enough downside to remove a star.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well Made and Cheaper than Other Competitors', 'author': 'GeneralWAS', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are a great set of adjustable dumbbells for a good price. I purchased these when they were on sale for $45 but would be willing to pay the full price now of $55.Some background for my comparison, one of my friends purchased some adjustable dumbbells from Walmart for $60 dollars and they were significantly worse than these. The threading on these is significantly cleaner and the stop has a small rubber o ring to fit tightly against the plates. These plates are also metal which was not the case for the Walmart ones. The grip texture is aggressive enough without being too much for extended use. The case is ok, and I don't expect it to stand up to much abuse but works well for storage.Pros:-Great threading and collar-Grips are comfortable-Metal plates-Long threaded mount for expansion of weights-Has a storage case-CostCons:-Case is kind of flimsyOverall: I would recommend these if you are looking for cheaper barbells that have a good finish with the ability to expand your options if you have already have weights or if you are looking to get started with your own dumbbell set.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works great, but case arrived cracked', 'author': 'ViStep', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The weights are great. Nothing to complain about there. I look forward to using them.The case is strong enough to hold the weights, but the material is thin and brittle enough to crack. It arrived in the condition pictured here. No big deal.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars üëçüëçüëçüëç', 'author': 'Chris S', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'For the price you can not go wrong. Great for the office or small areas needing a small set of dumbbells. The quality is fantastic. You can actually fit a lot more additional weight if you have the right size weights. The ones they come with are short and chunky, normal plates fit easily and the lock grips are great quality. Great for beginners and the carrying case is so so perfect for storage. Not so much transporting back and forth', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice for price', 'author': 'Joseph', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice made. Good price. I needed something basic and pleased with this.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars a little thin for my hand, but overall a good buy', 'author': 'YC', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I like that it comes in a case, I have a small apartment and it's nice that I can store it neatly. The grip is a little thin for me, but otherwise it's fine.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great dumbells for the price point - need more plates', 'author': 'Brigitte', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought these after getting so fed up with my Sport Blocks that I wanted to throw them across the room. After using them for a few weeks, I'm happy with their function, and I'm only disappointed by the lack of extra plates to extend their weight range.The whole set is metal-- not plastic or coated or weirdly fake-feeling. So you feel like you're actually lifting metal (which you are). The shiny finish on the plates might wear off some, but I don't mind.Adding and removing plates with the screw-nut is smooth and easy and doesn't take too much time during my workout. The nut threads easily and is easy to spin on with your finger. The little rubber gaskets will probably wear out and fall off, but since everything is metal, the gaskets are nice, but not necessary.As others have noted, the grips are a little rough on the hands. I wear lifting gloves, but fingertips (and feet if you're using them for leg stuff) feel the sharp edges. I hope that will eventually wear down.The max weight you can get from the set is 17.5 per dumbell if you're using both, or 32.5 on one. I'd like to find additional 5lb plates so that I could theoretically get up to 42.5 on each. Not that I need that much now, but I have found myself wanting more than 17.5 when using both, and I would imagine that any 5lb plate with that diameter could work.Lastly, the case. Don't get these for the case. I'm sure it would work fine if I wanted to put everything away to store it, but it's much easier to keep them assembled and set them on the floor.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not much to say, just keep at it and you‚Äôll be fine.', 'author': 'R. Parisot', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The checkered handle are so sharp that you can only use them wearing gloves. Aside from that, only thing you ‚Äòll need is determination.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Solid weights', 'author': 'Cory', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These are great! I can have weights lying around my small house and they pack up nicely. There is room on the end if you want more plates.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Signature Fitness Rubber Coated Hex Dumbbell Weight Set and Storage Rack, Multiple Packages
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality, very useful!', 'author': 'Marissa Vallette', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great price and great quality. Usually when something is affordable for what it is, its trash quality.. but im thrilled to say this was not the case with this product. The weights and stand were packaged so nice; everything wrapped in bubble wrap and their own boxes so nothing was rolling around in the box. Plus it breaks down for minimal storage which is really the reason to buy a set like this. üëç', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Value for Beginner or Even Intermediate Weight Training', 'author': 'Nadine Metallo', 'rating': 4, 'content': "If you're just getting into weightlifting, or even have been casually into it for a while, this seems so far to be a nice quality set that can grow with you for a while to come, while allowing for a fair bit of convenience and versatility. Screwing the parts together can take a bit of time due to the lengths of the threads, especially if you only put the minimum number of weights, but that's the tradeoff you get for them securely combining.If you torque the wingnut holding in the weights solidly finger tight, it doesn't come loose or acquire any slack through regular use. If you use your hands to specifically try to rotate the weights while they're locked in, they can rotate in place, but again it's not something that's going to happen while you're normally using them.It came with all the advertised weight amounts. title: Powergainz Contoured Handle Cast Iron Adjustable Dumbbell Weight Set, 40-Pound Pair, 105-Pound Pair, 200-Pound Pair
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars easy to adjust', 'author': 'anonymous', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Large plastic adjusters make changing weights easy, but a little time consuming. Either barbell is adjustable to 5, 15, or 20 pounds. Not like going to a gym but these weights are functional and relatively cheap.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing dumbells!! However, they might require some cleaning and tweaking.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These dumbells are really sturdy, heavy and comfortable. Definitely one of the best and most affordable pairs of dumbells on Amazon.However, keep in mind that the locks used to keep the sand inside might have small openings around them. I recommend cleaning the dumbells with household wipes before using them. Also, I used my silicone gun to complete seal the sand locks to avoid any sand from coming out of the dumbells.Since I was satisfied with this product, I decided to order a second pair and the sand locks in the new one didn't have any openings, so I didn't have to use my silicone gun with that one.So basically, the overall quality of these dumbells is great, but they might come with some imperfections depending on the pair you get.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 16, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Hard to lift dumbbells without handles!', 'author': 'ZB', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Overall review: missing parts, , but looks like the problem was fixed via a quick Amazon chat. See below for best way to handle problems.Rationale for 3-star rating: 2 for the product (b/c of missing part) but 4 for the service, so 3 so far.Problem: All the weight plates came, but no dumbbell handles.Confirming the handles should have been in the order:I confirmed that the Amazon add mentioned handles.Also, there were four dumbbell plate locking nuts in the package, so there would be no reason for those unless they had intended to send handles.There were three options for fixing the problem: The BalanceFrom telephone number, the BalanceFrom site, and Amazon chat. The telephone number said they could not accept calls and disconnected me. The BalanceFrom site was okay, but said it might be several days before anyone replied. The Amazon chat started with a bot which didn't work out because the bot never understood that I was missing a piece of the order. When I tried again, I (think) I got a real person who handled the matter quickly and with nothing more for me to do, so that was a relief. I should get what is needed in 9-13 days, so we shall see!So I recommend the Amazon chat if you have a problem.If the matter gets resolved, I think I can update my rating.UPDATE: The replacement arrived with several large holes in the box that were big enough for the handles or locking nuts to fall out, but fortunately, they had not and all was intact. So the matter was resolved by Amazon, although my separate inquiry with the company created a series of inconclusive and repetitive exchanges , requests for information, etc. Overall, this is settled and my experience further confirms the wisdom of buying through Amazon and getting problems settled through Amazon, rather than directly via vendors on Amazon. I updated my rating to 4, as the plates seem nicer than the average cement/plastic plates. BTW, the handles are plastic but I own metal and plastic dumbbell handles at home and I actually prefer the plastic because the knurling is more comfortable, it is easier to repair the screw threads should they get knicked, they don't scratch your skin as much should they hit your leg while curling (home dumbbell kits have long handles compared to gym dumbbells, and b/c they are lighter to travel with, should I want to bring handles and resistance bands with me.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 7, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Delivered on time and nice set easy to set up.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy of set up and use. Weight combinations are ideal for my program. Would buy it again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Like!', 'author': 'ronnie jett', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This was a gift & one that's used every day, I recommend this deal!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars DO NOT BUY USED', 'author': 'Elijah', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I bought these weights used from Amazon themselves and they do the job. The bars are made of metal and are suited for the weights they come with (I wouldn't try anything heavier) and the knurling is spot on. The plates themselves are vinyl filled with what appears to be crushed gravel and sand, don't drop 'em because I am sure they will bust. Now the issue is Amazon stated they inspected and repackaged these weights and they could not have told a bolder lie. The original box was busted to bits and put inside another box. No care was put into packaging because they were loose in the box. One nut was shattered and the other was flat out missing. I was hoping to save $5 by buying used, now I have to shell out an additional $15 for the appropriate nuts. Since the weights are adjustable you can always buy more weights too for a heavier workout just unscrew the end and add more.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Popin', 'author': 'Tyler grandstrand', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Gotta admit I was skeptical about these changing my life. My court date next week should bring a lot of answers.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price if you keep your expectations in check.', 'author': 'jfmi', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'If you‚Äôre like me, I‚Äôm imagining you wanted a basic set of weights for as cheap as possible. On that front, these are a success.My set arrived in one box, and I was pleasantly surprised. I just want to tone my upper body, not looking to bulk up too much, and didn‚Äôt want to spend a lot. I was looking to extend my home gym with dumbbells without breaking the bank. I found these to be one of the cheapest adjustable dumbbells and decided to take a chance. So far I'm glad I did. Next, it is very easy to adjust your weights. Just pull the tab, go to your desired weight and lock it in. So far I have had no problems with the weights falling off or not locking into place. Very simple to use. Last, they don't feel too bulky like others I've seen when you have a lot of weight on them. The plates themselves are slim and don't get in the way.The not so good: The only real complaint that I have with these is in the instructions, your not supposed to do any 5's weight with these. For example no 15lbs 25lbs 35lbs etc. You are only supposed to do whole numbers. Technically you could still do the 15lbs, 25lbs etc. The only thing is each dumbbell would be uneven with weight. I guess the only reason they tell you not to do it is for any safety concerns.Overall, if these dumbbells hold up to the test of time, they will definitely be worth the money. Cheaper compared to other big name brands and they seem to work well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 13, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome Adjustable Dumbbells That Come In A Pair', 'author': 'Lorenzo Scott', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These dumbbells are great for a home gym. 50lbs set is more than enough to make some gains in muscle mass and strength. Can switch easy and they feel secure when lifting.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 3-month Review | Must Have for Home and Office Use', 'author': 'K', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this DB set and highly recommend this set.Summary:- Great design- Clip for changing weight works perfectly (fast, easy to use)- Not sure I would recommend dropping from bench or for push ups- My secondary set, in home office, used for quick sets throughout workday (great excuse to get up from computer)Full Review:I had been shopping for adjustable DBs for a while but hadn't committed to any because of their bulky designs. A couple of years ago, I finally found some that you could adjust by rotating the handle but there were so many bad reviews that I held off a little longer. Glad I did! The sliding bolt on these is a perfect solution. Fast and easy to adjust the weights.I read the reviews stating that plates slide off and was scared of purchasing. I'm glad that I did finally end up getting them. In the 3 months that I've had these, I've done curls, overhead tri extensions, shoulder presses, standing rows, DB squats and haven't had any issues whatsoever.It is important to note that these are a secondary set for me and I keep them in my home office. I don't do bench exercises with them (ie: press or flies), nor do I press or roll them on the ground (ie: DB pushup into single arm row). I have a hex DB set and rack for all of that in the garage. I mainly use these for a quick set of full body exercises a few times throughout the day. It's a good excuse to get up and away from the computer. I'll do a few push ups, DB rows, a few crunches, then stand up for shoulder press, curls, and overhead tri extensions. Then I'll max them to 50 and hold for grip/forearm burn. Sit back down and do a couple of hours of work before repeating that circuit. I usually get in 3 to 5 of these sets by the end of day.Makes it a lot easier, having these behind me. No more need to go to garage (over 105f in there), and have to switch out the dumbbells, etc. So much easier to spin chair around, get up, do set. Drop DBs into holder, quickly switch weights, pick up, do reps, and so on until set/circuit is complete.Don't slam them, don't drag them on floor/mat/carpeting, treat them as if you were using them on a second floor apartment and don't want to make noise for tenant below, and these should last you a lifetime.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 1, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for female lifters', 'author': 'Hannah', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I combed reviews for Bowflex adjustable weights and many of the competitors looking for a set of adjustable weights that wouldn‚Äôt be bulky for me as a 5‚Äô2‚Äù female. I‚Äôm not a power lifter or anything of the sort but wanted a set of adjustable weights for my circuit style and Peloton weight workouts that are often full body or at least a bit of both upper and lower body. The adjustment lever can be a little finicky and takes a second to click on but overall easy to switch weight between sets. The other thing that can be slightly annoying is needing to return the weights to the frame/holder to adjust. But again is a minor inconvenience. What I really love about these weights is that it only carries the plates needed for the weight (5lb/plate). So when I‚Äôm doing upper body with 20lb it‚Äôs not a huge dumbbell. This was deterred me from the Bowflex set. When I‚Äôm doing a heavy set of lower body I don‚Äôt mind the bulk ones of multiple plates. I‚Äôve only had them for about 5mo so I can‚Äôt speak to the longevityBut my set has gotten better with time (smoother weight adjustments) not worse. Highly recommend this set for home lifters. For straight sets or circuit style workouts.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value for Money', 'author': 'Eoin O Leime', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These dumbbells are significantly cheaper than others you see out there and I haven't seen any dip in quality compared to other dumbbells I've used. I recommend wrist weights to cover this gap and because I don't feel like this was a hidden aspect of the product I wouldn't deduct any stars from my rating. It's a manageable inconvenience for the price, a high recommend from me", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Dumbbells
