title: Bundles
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Solid Choice for Home Workouts!', 'author': 'James Rushforth', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Cap Barbell 40-Pound Dumbbell Set, and I must say, I am thoroughly impressed! This set is perfect for anyone looking to add some weight training to their home workout routine.First off, the quality of these dumbbells is top-notch. The handles are sturdy and provide a comfortable grip, even during intense workouts. The weight plates are also well-made and fit securely onto the handles, so there's no need to worry about them coming loose.Another great thing about this set is the versatility it offers. With four 2.5-pound plates, four 5-pound plates, and two dumbbell handles, you can easily adjust the weight to suit your needs. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned lifter, this set has you covered.I also appreciate how compact this set is. It doesn't take up much space, so it's perfect for small home gyms or apartments. Plus, the plates are easy to store, so you can keep your workout area neat and organized.Overall, I highly recommend the Cap Barbell 40-Pound Dumbbell Set to anyone looking for a high-quality, versatile, and space-saving weight set for their home gym. It's a fantastic value for the price, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Don't listen to the negative reviews...", 'author': 'Mantis Toboggan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a long review, I hope I can keep your attention.First off, I want to tell you guys that Fedex Smartpost is the carrier for this item. I didn\'t have a problem with them, even though they delivered my dumbbells 2 days after the delivery estimate(can\'t complain, free shipping). Fedex Smartpost sends to the closest USPS, then USPS takes an additional 2 days to deliver. It seems like most people hate Fedex Smartpost because they take longer than usual("google fedex smartpost sucks" to see what I\'m talking about). I ordered these on 2-9-13 and they arrived at my doorstep on 2-16-13, so one week exactly, average time for free shipping. The dumbbells came packaged professionally and my case came in perfect condition, which I was very pleased about.I also ordered 60 pound db set from Lion Roar Fitness on 2-8-13, and as of 2-16, they didn\'t even start shipping so I ended up cancelling that order. They charged $20 for shipping too... I will NEVER even consider buying from LRF again. Just wanted to warn you guys about that. $20 for shipping AND they lag it? No thank you.These Dumbbell sets are a great investment, and I know they will last a long time. First of all, there is no toxic chemical smell the negative reviewers mentioned. Not even the case it came with. They clearly have gotten better with quality control. I read ALL of the negative reviews and took a chance with these, and I am glad I did. My bars are all nicely polished, smooth, and the weights and collars fit accordingly. There are 4 pieces of rubber stoppers that help keep these weights in place, 2 in the middle of the bar and 2 that are connected to the collars, which does an excellent job. When you lift weights, you should never "jerk" through your workouts, but instead keep good form with nice controlled movements. That\'s how my workouts are, and the weights have not moved, rolled, clanked, at all. The only time the collars roll out, is when I twist them to change weights. I even put all the plates on one bar(30 lbs) and the weights/collars were still in place. People say these are not the best quality, but what more do you expect from a set of dumbbells? Good finish on the plates with a clean tough metal bar, which cannot rip as some rubber grip bars tend to rip after tightening the collars too much. Carefully put the plates on, or you could scratch/chip off the paint. If you don\'t like getting callouses on your hands, I recommend investing in gloves. I don\'t feel a thing with gloves on and can enjoy lifting weights without getting blisters. If you have Fat Gripz(check my review for Fat Gripz), you don\'t even need gloves. Those rubber suckers will cover it, and give you a much better workout.I will buy additional plates for these soon but before you guys do as well, try adding Fat Gripz to the bars with your normal workouts. It will give your workouts more of a challenge, and you will see some good results in your forearm strength. I wish I knew about them when I wrestled in high school..Long story short, don\'t listen to the negative reviews. Keep yourself in shape and buy these already!Oh yeah, I forgot to mention that the bars + collars does not equal 5 pounds(unless you are weighing both bars and 4 collars together). So you get about 17.5 pounds each dumbbell. The description states that they weigh 5 pounds but it\'s half. The case it comes with is about 5 or 6 pounds so that\'s where they kind of trick you. So if you do the math, 4 x 5lbs plate + 4 x 2.5 lbs plate + 2 x 2.5 collars & bar = 35 lbs + 5 lbs case = 40 lbs db set.. I\'m not going to knock off a star for that because I bought these knowing this information. We can always buy more plates, so no big deal.Thank you for reading my long review. I hope this helped make your decision in building a better body! Train hard, train safe, and good luck :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Affordable and heavy.', 'author': 'Mike', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a great set of weights for someone looking to get started working out at home. It's not perfect, but I'm not really sure that the imperfections matter for a product like this. So let's get the negatives out of the way first:- Yeah, they smell, as others have noted. It's nothing strange -- if you've ever been to a gym before, you already know this smell. They're metallic with additional chemical odors. For a basic sniff test, you won't notice much. But the smell does begin to accumulate after a few days in cramped quarters, so maybe they're not the best choice for a bedroom or tiny apartment. I suspect the smell will dissipate in time, but I don't know how long that will be.- The carrying case is cheap molded plastic, and there's a good chance yours will arrive with one or more corners dented. It's fine -- the cases aren't meant to be display items. They're meant to store the weights, and to give you a convenient way to lug them around when needed.- It's obvious that corners were cut in some regards. The rubber cushions on the bars are cheap, and could possibly fall off and get lost if you aren't attentive. Likewise, the rubber cushions within the screw-on collars can fall out. It's not a big deal if they do -- you just stick them back in. But these are obviously not advanced equipment. They were designed to be cheap and functional.That said, I don't think any of these cons really matter. Weights have one purpose in life -- to weigh something. Your muscles can't tell if you're holding twenty pounds of expensive metal or cheap metal. This particular set is very well priced, and they feel safe and sturdy. You don't have to worry about the collars wiggling loose, and they're adjustable down to 2.5 pound increments. I snagged two sets, giving me greater versatility and the ability to put more weight on a single bar if needed. For the price, this is a perfect way to get started with a cheap, space-saving home gym.Weights don't need to be pretty and fancy to work. They just need to give gravity something to act on. You can buy fancier equipment than this, but it's not clear why you'd really want to.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Honest review addressing common concerns...', 'author': 'Bleacherbum95', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When originally considering this product I was very concerned with the number of negative reviews/comments that people were leaving about these dumbbells. After deciding to take the risk, I felt the need to write a review since I believe that the negative reviews are overblown and overly dramatic. I will hopefully address the main concerns that you as the prospective buyer are having while considering this product. If you don\'t care about the details I have a TLDR at the bottom =)1. Smell: These weights do not smells like daisies; no dumbbells do. However, the smell is NOT as bad as people are saying. I would highly recommend leaving these weights outside (and/or washing them) to let them air out and control the smell, but it is not immediately overpowering. When the package arrived I slowly opened the box waiting for a toxic stench to explode out, but it never came. It was not until I lifted a plate out of the box that I noticed the smell people mentioned (the chemical applied to prevent rust), and it was not very strong. I left mine in the garage to air out and noticed a slight change in the smell of the garage, but nothing extreme. I would certainly keep them out of the house to be safe, but for $40 a quick wash or airing out was worth it to me.2: Quality: If you are looking for professional dumbbells that are made of top quality materials then look elsewhere. But if you are looking for a solid set of starter weights, this is your product. I will say that the first time I removed a collar a small piece of metal broke off, but it did not affect the functionality of the piece. Also, I noticed someone mentioned that the collar lets the weights slide...this was incorrect in my experience. The collars seem to hold the weights snugly in place, so there should be no problems there. The quality is by no means great (unbeatable for the price though), but it is good enough that I trust it will last and serve its purpose.3. Case: I saw a few people talking about how the case broke easily. The case seems fairly sturdy if it is treated well. A case breaking or not will depend on your delivery man. The weights are packaged very well inside a few boxes (Amazon ships it out in an excessively large box), and in my experience there were no cracks. The sliders to keep the box closed seem pretty lame, but I\'m one of those people who isn\'t going to sweat it if the case breaks.I hope I covered the main concerns that most people were having. My honest review of this product is that this is unbeatable for the price. $40 with free shipping (mine came in 2 days) is great, and these are exactly what I was looking for. And NO I was not paid for this review and think Amazon should be ashamed of including paid reviews.TLDR: Does NOT smell that bad (easily fixed), decent quality, best bang for the buck for somebody looking for starter dumbbells.UPDATE 1/25/14: I now have two sets of these (it was cheaper than buying weight individually), and they are holding up great after over a year and a half of use. I\'ve noticed the collar shifts slightly when you get over 30lbs, but never enough that it\'s a problem. Be confident in purchasing these as starter weights.UPDATE 7/31/16: My original bars are still going strong. The collar shifting still happens on occasion, but not to the point where it interferes with my workout. I\'ve purchased additional plates for it and added them just fine - any 1" plate should fit just as well as the originals. So these have held up strong for 4 years...zero complaints here. One thing I forgot in the original review - you may want some lifting gloves. The metals isn\'t forgiving on your hands, so if you don\'t want big calluses, invest in a cheap pair of gloves.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Adjustible Weight Set', 'author': 'Lumbre', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First of all, let\'s get the smell part clear. Yes, it smells. It smells similar to the stuff you find in the tire/automotive aisles at Target/WalMart/other stores. Yes, it can be a bit strong. Let it air for a day and put a dryer sheet in the case when you close it. Problem solved. If you\'re picky on having your home smell like candles or something, these are not for you. If you don\'t even notice the smell of a gym when you\'re in a gym (or aren\'t the quickest to pick up on smells), then you\'re fine. Also, I think it\'s the box that smells, not any of the paint.Pros:*It is easy to add/remove weights. Just unscrew the collars, remove/add weights, screw collars back in. You can do this while resting in less than a minute.*You can add your own weights. When you outgrow these, you can add your own weights (doesn\'t have to be the same brand). Any generic 1" weight will do.*When I bought these, they were awesome for $40. Under $1/pound if you count the different combinations of weights you can do and that you can add more later.*Cheap compared to buying individually.Cons:*Slight bump in one of the corners of the case. No big deal. Contents inside are fine. Just an aesthetic issue.*Smell. As addressed above, it can be a bit overpowering, but just take the time to let them air out. Some people also do fine by rinsing them.*They\'re not neoprene.Notes & Thoughts:*A lot of people complain about the default California warning added to this set. Seriously, California is overprotective. Drinking dozens of gallons of water is known to cause death. If ingested, gasoline can destroy your organs. Too much sun can give you cancer. They have these warnings on a ton of things for sale in California. Something containing nickel, for example, automatically gets this warning. If it were more serious, more states or the entire country would place a warning or they would be getting sued for giving people cancer (it\'s not like lawyers are exactly shy).*The handles may be a bit too textured for some people, especially those with delicate hands or buying more weights. In that case, maybe you should buy weight-lifting gloves. For those who don\'t mind getting scuffed by sand or falling hands-first on pavement, you\'re fine. If anything, I shift my hands around on the bar which varies up my routine a bit.*People say it\'s a good starter set. I just started a serious workout routine and have had this for a month. I see myself having this for years.*A few have complained that the weights aren\'t exact. The bar doesn\'t seem like 5 pounds, but when I weight myself with one of my 20 lb. dumbbells, I see my weight increase by 19.8 or 20 (my scale goes in intervals of 0.2). It\'s close enough for me. I don\'t need it to be that exact.*Mine didn\'t seem to have any loose seal rings or collars. They seem good for the price. They may shift a small amount after a 30 minute workout to where you can hear a slight clunk. Just retighten them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing quality', 'author': 'John carter', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Everything came double if not even triple boxed and wrapped and had stuffing on the original box all the weights came individually wrapped there was no chemical strong smell with my set (105lb) pair they just smelled new nothing that made me gag or was to strong as far as the mechanics it seems to work perfect they hold still while I do chest dumbell flys with 35lbs on each only time will tell but as of now extremely happy don‚Äôt listen to the review also if you want to add plates to this set make sure there 1.14 or bigger 1inch plates won‚Äôt work also I personally love the diamond pattern grip but if your not used to lifting without gloves your going to have to break your hands in or get some gloves me personally gives me more grip I love it it does not feel like it‚Äôs digging in my skin like others said overall good product for the price can‚Äôt beat it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Nice dumbbell bars', 'author': 'RY', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I liked the dumbell bars. They are solid, easy to grip, and the nuts tighten down nicely. The weights that came with them would be fine except the center hole in them is a lot bigger than it needs to be causing the weights to shift,if you don't really crank down on the bar nuts.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best deals I‚Äôve ever found on Amazon', 'author': "D'Art", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This 52.5 lb single dumbbell setup is without a doubt one of the best deals I‚Äôve ever found on Amazon. While most iron free-weights sell for around $2/pound (as of the fall of 2022), this set is much more affordable,The price for it does seem to vary wildly day by day. I paid $77 in October 2022 and see that a month later, it is selling for $65. But I‚Äôm not complaining since it‚Äôs a steal at either price.I bought 2 sets so I‚Äôd have a pair of dumbbells.The dumbbell bars and threaded, star-shaped end nuts are nicely made. The chrome coating seems thick and durable. And because the threaded nuts have black rubber washers on the side that makes contact with the weight plates, they tighten securely and stay firmly in place when in use. Other sets I‚Äôve used did not have the rubber washer and as a result, would loosen up while doing reps. That‚Äôs both annoying and dangerousThe rubber washers do tend to fall off when removing the nuts from the dumbbell, but that is easily rectified by putting a few drops of superglue in the groove in the nut into which the rubber washer sits.The weight plates themselves are a little less precisely made. For instance, I weighed my 5 lb plates on a postal scale and discovered they range anywhere from 4.75 lbs to 5.25 lbs. That‚Äôs not a big deal most of the time but you can definitely notice an imbalance if you inadvertently end up with 8 of the heavier 5 lb plates on one hand and 8 of the lighter plates on the other.To avoid that from happening, I used a silver Sharpie to mark the plate that are over 5 lbs and keep them in a separate pile so I can distribute the weight more evenly into the bars.Also, while the clear-coat on the plates seems heavy duty enough, you do need to check for rough edges. That goes for the dumbbell bars too. I had to file down a couple of spots to avoid getting metal splinters in my hands.Last but not least, the dumbbells I received have a diameter of 1.18 inches (or 30mm) and the weight plates have holes that size. This means any plates you may already have with 1 inch (25mm) holes will not fit onto these bars. Likewise, while the plates from this set will easily go onto a 1 inch bar, they can flop around a bit. In practice the latter is not a problem as long as you can tighten down the bar-end clamps. I use my 30mm plates on a 25mm curl bar without issue.In short, while there may be some compromises involved, at these prices, this dumbbell set is one of the best deals out there.Follow up note written on April 11, 2023:I‚Äôve been using my weight set several times a week for about 6 months now and all parts are holding up great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really like these', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed a set to get started with. It‚Äôs hard to make it all the way to the gym...and if I‚Äôm watching tv I can just pick these up and do a few curls every now and then. Really helpful. They are easy to switch weights in and out, and if you are cool with doing one arm at a time then you could add all the weights on one and basically have a dumbbell that goes up to nearly 50 pounds (minus the 4 pound bar), without having to spend all the money of buying 2, 50 pound dumbbells, which would cost twice as much. Instead just do one arm at a time and save half the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Customer service was decent', 'author': 'Nick', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'For quality. You need to try each screw to find one that will actually screw on all the way. Paint is intact, other than that, they are weights.Be advised, you might not get everything in your shipment. Thankfully, customer service was easy to contact. After a couple of days, I recieved a reply asking for the details of my purchase, and after that I recieved my missing handle promptly.4 stars for good customer service.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Top Sellers
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Set, Great Value', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As others have mentioned, these are shipped in three boxes of weights at 50# each, and one narrow box that holds the stand. In my case, while extremely heavy duty boxes were used, and well taped, one of the boxes was sliced open and minor damage to rubber ends of DBs in that box occurred. Looks like it was slid over something which cut it through.In any event, 2x5, 2x10, 2x15, 2x20, 2x25# DBs are included, making this an excellent "base" set. Handles are knurled and as expected in diameter and abrasiveness. No gloves required, but your mileage may vary.Is there a smell? seems to be the burning question. Of course they have a smell. They were just born of chemicals. They smell like what they are: rubber. So if you have ever had a new bike tire in your house, that is the smell, multiplied by a few pairs. It doesn\'t bother me in the slightest, and I was able to start using right away. I cannot relate at all to folks who seemed like they were going to swoon after opening the boxes.NOTE: I "washed" these with dish soap and water before using because they are covered in manufacturing residual dust etc. and will make your hands filthy otherwise. Mine did *not* have any kind of oily residues, as others have mentioned; again, just new tire smell, which for me is not obnoxious. But hey- some people think cilantro tastes terrible, so there is no accounting for taste.NOTE #2: Unlike the way Amazon\'s own brand and some other DBs I have purchased are wrapped, these were just loose in the box. No Styrofoam, no placement in a baggie, nada. Just in the box. So they are not going to be 100% brand new and flawless looking when you take them out. Get over it. They\'re dumbbells. They\'ll look like that in a couple months of workouts anyway. Also, because there is no protection, be judicious in opening the boxes. Just slice around the tape so you are not gouging a chunk out of your new best friends.I got these for basically a buck a pound, which is what weights were before Covid, and what they should be anyway, and held off on buying them until I hit the sale amount. Plan on augmenting with additional weights and eventually using a horizontal rack for all of them, but this was a steal-- and delivered on top of it.I am keeping the boxes. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I LOVE THIS SET!!!', 'author': 'JB', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a great value and I love the set! The holding stand is sturdy, easily moveable and even looks great!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect color, handsize and materials', 'author': 'Bay Area Reader', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My physical therapist suggested I use 1 lb. hand weights so I could continue to use them on non-therapy days for weighted movements I did in PT recovering from shoulder surgery. There were many dumbbell brands to choose from, but I'm thrilled I chose this Lionscool brand. The dumbbells/hand weights arrived quickly, carefully bubble-wrapped and zip-tied together so they didn't damage each other (neoprene coating), nor bounce around in transit, plus packaging was strong to support weight of dumbbells. These hand weights come in great colors with weight numbers on the end. I don't feel the neoprene will degrade through use or age. The weights work well and I love the light purple color. I also purchased the 2 lb. weights, and they were packaged identically. The two sets DID arrived separately, which was actually nice if you are limited on how much you can pick up due to my shoulder surgery (I had them shipped to an Amazon locker). It will be some time before I move up to the 2lb weights, but I'm glad I purchased both sets. I would definitely purchase this brand again. I especially like that they are not slick. The neoprene coating covering all of the dumbbell(s) feel a little sandy/gritty, but does not hurt your hand, nor will they slip from your hand accidentally, and six-sided ends. They seem priced similarly to other brands, but since I plan to have these a long time, I figured, why not get the colors-themed sets that I like best, with non-slip weights. (I have 2 and 3 lb. single dumbbells that I purchased at a store which were on sale years ago that are slick, glossy, vinyl-type material colored with end numbers fading off the weights). I prefer these hand weights MUCH more...material, color, shape, and size. I have a larger hand (about an 8), but these do fit my hands fine, and feel secure in my hands as well. Other than that the dumbbells have been worth their money so far.The company needs to update their instructions to include this.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars weight fell off while working out.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 1, 'content': "Thank God my husband was not doing anything overhead. we were working out, rear delts, and one of the weights fell off and smashed his pinky toe. we attempted to proceed but the other side fell off. not smashing anything this time.From the beginning we've not had the best experience with these. yes, we bought them because the price was cheapest we found with 52lbs; and i suppose that is the saying, you get what you pay for.in the beginning, we'd have trouble changing weights, they wouldn't always attach the the dumb bell we'd have to drop it back down and readjust. plus getting the weights back to the base wasn't always smooth either. in comparison to a Walmart brand CAP, these are horrible.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good value, works as intended, adds additional weight options to my existing weight set', 'author': 'Nicole Hanabusa', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I previously purchased a set of individual dumbbells, which work reasonably well but take up a lot of space. I noticed also that going from 5 lbs up to 10 lbs was a big jump so I was looking for a way to have intermediate steps.I really liked this set because it has a nice attractive design visually, and also a smart design for how to change out the plates to different sizes. You just set the dumbbell down onto the stand, rotate the handle to select the size you want, and lift it back up. It automatically adjusts both sidesThe first 3 sizes are 2.5 lbs, 8 lbs and 13.5 lbs. What's nice is I also have individual dumbbells of 5, 10, 15 lbs so now by using this adjustable dumbbell, plus the set I already have, I am able to increase the weight by small amounts - 2.5, 5 (other set), 8, 10 (other set), 13.5, 15 (other set) which makes it much easier to find exactly the right amount of resistance.Compared to buying a set of dumbbells separately, having this adjustable one has saved me a lot of money, and it also saves me space in the room. I also like that the plates are compact and the sizing is really nice for a balanced feel on it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 15, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars comfortable, easy and made well!', 'author': 'Ryan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'great product!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars It works.', 'author': 'Duc Huynh', 'rating': 3, 'content': "There are plenty of images already so I won't bother posting anymore. title: 25/55 lbs Pair Adjustable Dumbbells Set, Adjustable Weights Dumbbells Set for Men and Women with Anti-Slip Fast Adjust Weight by Turning Handle
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars What I needed', 'author': 'william b', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Didn't want to spend 500 on a set of 55 lb, so far for the price, unbeatable! They work as should, comfortable grip, granted it only has been a couple of days but I should have been purchased theses!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Turn the handle', 'author': 'Nawora', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've wanted a set of these for quite some time now but didn't want to pay the high price of the name brands. So I got these for me and my husband. They're actually very sturdy and very well made. The main thing to know is on these you have to turn the handle to change the weight amount. Put them in the rack and turn the candle. When you go to lift them they'll be at the weight you wanted. Other ones have knobs on the side this is all in the handle. That said once it's turned and you have them in your hand we haven't had any issues with the handle turning while being used which was a little bit of a concern of mine but hasn't happened so far. All in all these are a little different but they work really well and like I said they're pretty well made.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works well, takes practice to work it smoothly', 'author': 'SB', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This works pretty well after you've practiced using it for a bit. You twist the grips to choose a weight, and boom, that's the weight you're lifting. It's dead simple and space-saving. Is it quicker than just grabbing dumbbells off a rack? No, though the difference is trivial. I mainly wanted these because of my limited space, and they are worth it IMO. My only quibble is that it can be tricky to seat the dumbbell back into the slots, you have to give it a little extra shimmy sometimes to feel it slip back into place. Small quibble, overall I like these and recommend them.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Adjustable dumbbells', 'author': 'Jason N.', 'rating': 3, 'content': "The dumbbells set are ok I guess. I like that it's a space saver. However, not sure of the quality. The base seems to be made of cheap hard plastic, a small part of it already cracked and chipped. The dumbbells handle are just plastic, smooth plastic, no grip at all. So if you have sweaty hands, these thing would slip and slide all over the place. They use round plastic caps/plugs to cover the screw holes at the ends, these caps/plugs keeps falling off.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome weight set.', 'author': 'Anonymous', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. I have a few other sets of adjustable dumbbells, and honestly, this set is my favorite. The reason for that is the speed of use. These adjust by grabbing the handle and twisting it. That's it! No dials, no levers, just an extra twist before you pick them up.The build quality seems to be quite good, and even shaking them around gave me no sign they would fail or dump weights. I didn't experience any handle twist when lifting with them, either - it seems like they have to engage with the base first before the handle will twist, as a safety measure.The set I got goes from 5 to 25 pounds, so that's what you see photos of. I also did a video review so you can see a little more realistically what they are like in operation.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Weight imbalance!', 'author': 'Unknown', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Love the appearance, looks GREAT, but the weight distribution on the dumbbells is UNEVEN (not sure if it‚Äôs normal. That's the main reason I like these.They are small and compact get you get a good range of weights to choose from.Switching between weights is super easy as well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Good quality but dangerous. Watch out for these', 'author': 'Nina', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Dumbbells are great and its easy to switch weights on the fly, but its maybe too easy to switch because ive had the handle turn while lifting on more than one occasion now.I would not recommend using these for any lift above your face/head where weights can fall on you. These are a great way to save a ton of space by replacing of pairs of dumbbells with just one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome technology', 'author': 'lovestoshop', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Wow! I highly recommend adding these to your home gym setup.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Adjustable Dumbbell 55LB Single Dumbbell 5 Weight Options Dumbbell Anti-Slip Metal Handle, Satisfying Multi-Stage Fitness Experience
reviews: [{'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars You Only Get One', 'author': 'Drew Carter', 'rating': 1, 'content': "The weight itself I have no problems with. Everything works just fine. But what I didn't expect was that I'd only be getting one dumbbell, especially for the price I paid. Thankfully it looks like they changed the name to reflect that it's only a single dumbbell you're getting.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars sturdy, quick, and convenient', 'author': 'Shop Nut', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got this to replace my old school clamp-style dumbbell that was getting rusty. This new style lets you change the weight by simply rotating the handle while it's on the stand. When it's removed from the stand the weights are locked in and very stable so they don't turn or shake while exercising which is a huge improvement to my old style where the weights would sometimes spin on the handle during workouts. The weights are in 11 pound increments but I've found you can work in 5.5 pound increments by removing one of the weights on the stand so that it doesn't engage the handle (see image).Speaking of the handle, it appears to be very hard plastic or graphite and the grip area is covered by a rubberized material making it comfortable to hold. I guess it could also be taped over with grip tape if the rubber eventually erodes.Considering I've been using my old dumbbell for over twenty years, I'm hoping this new set will last at least that long if not longer. Great quality, very sturdy, easy to use, and very fast to change the weights.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Misleading ad', 'author': 'Heather', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'This ad originally included two dumbbells and had four stars. Only received 1 dumbbell. Go back to the Amazon listing.. 17 reviews all bashing this listing.. might as well be a 1 star listing. Amazon or the company better pony up and ship an addition dumbbell at no cost. I have NEVER had this issue happen on Amazon. Was really excited for a new workout at home.. now super bummed. Product feels good and proper and should work for most people.. if you have 2 of them!!!Update: Amazon has done right by the customer (at least this customer), and has shipped the 2nd dumbbell at no addition cost.Thank you Amazon. Seller is still bogus.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for home gym', 'author': 'Dlip', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I like this unique dumbbell from the day I bought it. Now I pay VERY close attention when I put them back together", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable Pair of Adjustable Weights', 'author': 'o0hotoko0o', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These weights look really plastic-like in the photo. They actually appear to be encased in a rubber-like material. It's hard to describe: It has a suede-like texture in your hands, it's cool to the touch, and it has some give when you dig into it with a fingernail, but the material isn't soft like rubber and it doesn't leave fingernail marks in it either. It's probably mostly plastic with a layer over it to make it nicer to hold. The weight grips don't roll or pinch my skin when in use and the weights are easy to take off a put on once you practice a couple of times. I think as long as you don't drop them, store them in a hot/humid place, gently clean them after each use, and take your time to remove/attach the weights, these dumbells should last a long time. There is a specific way to line up the attachments. If you look carefully at each, you'll see the button has a raised bump that fits perfectly into a slot on the weight. If you don't line it up there, the weight can fall off. It's very similar to the way an Instapot lid works. I wanted to like these weights more, but they just aren‚Äôt what I was looking for.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 10, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very basic/starter dumbbell set', 'author': 'mrmobile', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I have no idea why dumbbells are so expensive, so I thought I‚Äôd try this basic-looking and inexpensive set. I wasn‚Äôt expecting a lot.‚Ä¢ The set has four 7.5# weights and four 2.5# weights. You can combine them to have dumbbells from 2.5# to 30#. However, the instructions say to put a maximum 20# per dumbbell. You decide.‚Ä¢ The weights go on a certain way: there is an indent on the center hole on one side and a raised edge on the other side. Face the indents toward the middle of the handle and they will fit much better‚Ä¢ The grip is plenty wide for my hand and I‚Äôve got pretty large hands. The bars are hollow so they don‚Äôt add much weight. The grip area is gently knurled so it‚Äôs a no slip grip but doesn‚Äôt bite into your hands like higher-end bars.‚Ä¢ The spring clamp is basic and smallish. But it fits and holds the weights securely. It‚Äôs easy to change the weights by squeezing the clamp, removing it, adding/removing another weight, squeeze and slide the clamp onSo 2-3 stars for quality, plus a star or two for being priced well and having accurate pictures. Meets my expectations for the price.Note: I‚Äôve seen this very same set (or things that look identical) sold under other brand names (e.g., Marcy) for slightly more money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 15, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Adjustable', 'author': 'Rebecca', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I like these weights because they are adjustable so I can add weight as I need. title: PowerBlock Elite EXP Adjustable Dumbbells, Sold in Pairs, Stage 1, 5-50 lb. Dumbbells, Durable Steel Build, Innovative Workout Equipment, All-in-One Dumbbells, Expandable with Expansion Kits
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No gimmicky or questionable adjustment mechanisms, just a simple, safe, quality design.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Purchased these to share with my teenage son with limited space. I performed an enormous amount of research into adjustable dumbbells and ultimately chose these. Have absolutely no regrets.We switch back and forth between weight preferences easily and efficiently. And the range of incremental weight selection is the absolute best out there - largely due to the hidden 2.5 lb removeable handle inserts. If you can do simple math, you will easily understand.As I suggested in the title, I've no fear of these coming apart overhead or above toes. Even the highest rated, competing adjustable dumbbells on the market almost all have truly sketchy locking mechanisms counting on buttons or ratcheting dials that will absolutely break at some point, or on pins that will stop pinning, and a most also have wedge like shape designed in the weights meant to hold- but should and surely will always linger in one's mind that they may come apart if jostled ever so slightly the wrong way- or just an accidental bumping together of the two dumbbells above your chest. No thanks to that. I'll stick with these.Even in such a case as the slide/selector on these somehow breaking, it's simplistic design will easily allow for a safe replacement alternative to be purchased (or even made) instead of a complete rebuild or garbage toss like the others that count on too many internal, proprietary parts.Made of solid steel, really good welds, and again, K-I-S-S design.I also chose this model because there are weight upgrades/additions available- up to 90 lbs each. At my age, I doubt I will get back to that level, but good to know as my sons may be there sooner than later.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great adjustable dumbbells', 'author': 'L. Yu', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Edit 12/4/23 I bought the last expansion pack to complete the set from 5-90lbs.Original review:Unlike some others I got my dumbbells and plastic selector rods intact although one box was a little beat up otherwise it survived the delivery process. The box seemed to be taped together to denote a pair but the tape was only on one box so it was probably separated on purpose and address labels were on both boxes.Opening the boxes reveals the selector rods on top of a styrofoam covering the dumbbells and it is cradled on a form fitted styrofoam bottom for travel but I would not be surprised if there are accidents when shipping.I had the bowflex 552 for 12 years and wanted to expand the weight of the dumbbells so I picked up the power blocksI don‚Äôt have a gym membership and I‚Äôve been working out at home for 20 years. So I‚Äôm not too familiar with the single weight dumbbells. But weight is weight their prob more compact and it more stable than adjustable dumbbells.When I first received I didn‚Äôt like the rubber grip because it felt greasy. It was slipping from my grip so I cleaned it with a Clorox wipe and it has improved drastically.I don‚Äôt know why people hate the cage of the hand that much. I like the cage handle. I actually turn the weight so when I pick it up the padded cage ‚Äúbars‚Äù leans on my wrist so I use that to stabilize the weight as I perform my dumbbell bench pressing. This is an advantage I feel.The annoying thing is the two 2.5 adder weights to add or subtract for smaller incremental increases or decreases. On this powerblock the adder weight chamber gets locked as you return the handle to the weights. You won‚Äôt be able to operate the blocks without closing them.Also need to be mindful of the rod selector as you are choosing your weight make sure its level and is capturing the weight you want. It can easily go in lopsidedAnother thing I found was that when you‚Äôre doing bicep curls the red tab can get snagged on your pants/shorts as you‚Äôre curling up. I have rectified it by turning the block 180 degrees so those tabs are on the outside so it won‚Äôt snag.Also do not drop these weights it might get twisted and a bit mangledAlthough there is no cradle you still have to return the weights gently into the weight stack.The weights feel great in the hand and it smaller when your using less weight as opposed to the bowflex 552 which has the same length through out.OverallI recommend these weghts for your gym', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Expensive, but SO worth it!', 'author': 'SC', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I waited for years to buy these. Each time I would go to Amazon to get them, I would talk myself out of buying them because of the price -- they're not cheap! Finally, after years of delay, I pressed the purchase button and got them, and I couldn't be happier with them. These are the best dumbbells I've used -- not just a space-saving alternative to hex dumbbells. I really like the grip, which is a more ergonomically curved shape and rubber. Also, compared to hex dumbbells, the weight is closer to your hand so it's much easier to balance the dumbbell when lifting -- a problem I didn't know existed until I used these, then later used hex dumbbells. Also, I love that the ends of each dumbbell are flat, so when seated and about to begin a lift, the weights sit comfortably on your thighs.Can't say enough about the quality and utility of these. If you're working out at home, make these a priority to buy. I wish I would have bought them much sooner!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good investment', 'author': 'Payton Romero', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got these weights to invest in my health in the coming new year. These are very cost effective while also maintaining phenomenal quality. Unlike other adjustable weights these change from 11lbs to 55lbs in increments of 11 in seconds! Not only that but each weight is securely held. I don't have to worry about the weights falling on my head like others that have snap individual adjustments. They come with a rack that holds them in place and have a flat bottom on the weights so you don't have to worry about them rolling away either. You can also use them for assisted push ups and the handles have nice soft grip so you don't have to worry about them cutting up your hands or needing to wear gloves. The only real con is that the adjustable increments are 11lbs. However, I found you can simply remove one plate from the rack if you prefer an odd increment of say 16.5lbs instead of 11lbs or 22lbs as each plate weighs 5.5lbs. Multiply by 8 plus 11lbs handle gives you 55lbs. Lastly I love how the plates are tough steel and not those bulky plastic plated plates you see on some name brand adjustable dumbbells that look and feel cheap. 5* I'd recommend it to everyone from beginners to pros.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 20, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Review', 'author': 'London Bingham', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These Aotob adjustable weights are fantastic; they're a must-have for anyone with a home workout. title: Adjustable Weight Dumbbell Barbell Set, 4-In-1 Dumbbell Set, 44 Lb Free Weight Dumbbell, with Curved Bar Connector, for Women Men Workout Fitness, Home Gym Exercise Training Dumbbell Sets
BalanceFrom Colored Neoprene Coated Dumbbell Set with Stand, Multiple Sizes
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Price cant be beat! Perfect weight set for working out!', 'author': 'Jleukim', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This weight set is great value for the price and exactly what I was looking for to complement my home workouts! I've been using them several times a week for the past 3 months, and they have held up great so far. They are covered in good quality neoprene, and the colors are so vibrant and eye catching. The neoprene provide for a good grip so they don't slip out of my hand, and the hex shape prevents them from rolling away when I set them down on a flat surface. The stand was super easy to assemble and holds the weights in place in a compact and space saving fashion. Like other reviewers mentioned, the stand could be a little sturdier in construction, but I didn't purchase it for the stand, and it serves it's purpose and has held up fine. I've been very happy with this purchase, and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a solid quality weight set.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The weights are great; the stand needs work...', 'author': 'E B', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this weight set to use at home for physical therapy excecises after a rotator cuff injury. After reading other reviews about each of the varying weights, I conducted a very unscientific test of weighing myself while holding each weight. In my set, the 3 lb and 8 lb weights each weighed exactly 3 lbs and 8 lbs. The 5 lb weights, however, each weighed 5.4 lbs. Certainly not a major discrepancy and nothing that warrants any complaints from me. They are comfortably solid and fully covered in color-coordinated neoprene coating with no discernible defects. Each weight was individually packaged in bubble wrap, and each set of weights was packaged snugly in their own box.The other complaint I saw in many of the reviews had to do with the plastic stand. Yes, it's true that the stand is plastic and not of the absolute highest quality. All hardware (including a cheap screwdriver) is included. I attempted to assemble the stand as is, but I can understand all the frustration involved with somewhat crooked screw holes and an unstable finished product. My solution was to first glue the plastic dowels to each half of the stand using Gorilla Glue and let it cure for 24 hours and THEN reinforce it with the included screws. I used 2 pieces of cardboard that came in the package and placed one on the bottom and one on the top because I knew some of the glue would leak through the screw holes. Essentially, the stand was lying flat on its side, sandwiched between the pieces of cardboard. I placed several of the weights on top to act as a clamp and keep pressure on the whole thing while the glue cured overnight. After I pulled the cardboard off, I used a pick to remove any excess glue from the screw holes. I tried using the included screwdriver but I quickly gave up on that and used a ratcheting screwdriver instead for more torque and was able to tightly fasten all 6 of the included screws. The assembled stand is now sturdy and stable with no fear of falling apart or toppling over on its own. I tested the movement of the stand while all the weights were on it and it wobbles slightly when you push on it (I mean, it IS plastic after all) but it's definitely sturdy and you'd have to push with some force to actually cause it to topple over. There should be no reason for this stand to be knocked over under normal use WITH ALL THE WEIGHTS in place. If you remove both of the 8 lb weights from the bottom, then yes, the stand could topple when pushed since it's top heavy. That goes for most top heavy items though. However, the stand is certainly stable while removing the weights and replacing them back on the stand.I suppose if you place the stand in the center of the room and are using both of the 8 lb weights at the same time, then it's conceivable that your child/dog/clumsy roommate or whatever could accidentally bump into it and knock it over. But really though? Who's placing their weights somewhere where people or animals are knocking into it? Just use common sense and place it near or against a wall or furniture and not in the path of others. I have mine against a wall and there's really no chance for it to fall over with normal use. Also, there's not an actual carry handle to transport the stand with the weights on it, but the notches at the bottom create handholds and you can CAREFULLY lift the stand straight up and move the entire set as necessary.I do agree that I should not have HAD to take the steps I took to ensure that my stand would be solid and sturdy. We should be able to assemble the stand directly out of the box without having to resort to using glue or struggle with wonky screw holes. But, it is what it is and I was able to use my available resources to make sure the stand was not going to fall apart. Personally, I purchased the set of weights specifically for the actual weights, not for the stand itself. As far as the weights are concerned, they're a great basic set of weights. title: Core Fitness¬Æ Adjustable Dumbbell Weight Set by Affordable Dumbbells - Space Saver - Dumbbells for Your Home
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So far, so good. I picked these because they got bigger per weight, where the BoxFlex ones were the same length whether there was 5 lbs or 50 lbs.I have had these about a week and I have enjoyed using them, and my sons have enjoyed as well. Very easy to use and set up, and I really enjoy the quality of them.Overall- So Far, So good!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Adjustable Dumbbell Weight Set!', 'author': 'Blade3colorado', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I never do anything half-*ssed regarding significant purchases, i.e., I research professional reviews and also get a take for personal reviews, especially the negative ones. Essentially, I gather my information and determine what is and what isn\'t important. Same deal with these weights . . . So, this is what I determined about what was really important to me: 1. All parts were sturdy and well made/constructed; 2. Similar to number 1, that the weights had zero to minimum movement while working out; 3. The weight set was "compact" even when using maximum load of 50lbs; and, 4. The company supported their product with excellent customer service (note: I do not know this personally, but from what I have read, they do a good job of this).All of the aforementioned were answered positively by what I read and reviewed. So, what was my first impression? The delivery was on time and the packaging was excellent. Two boxes were delivered to my door, and I had zero issues with the boxes/packaging. Assembly was simple. Fast forward to working out everyday (upper body one day and lower body the next) the last few weeks and I am extremely impressed with my weight set. Why? First and foremost, I discovered for myself what others had already discovered - this is a quality weight set, with little to no movement of the weights while in motion; and the set is compact, where someone lean like myself can easily maneuver the weights while doing various exercises. For example, when you are doing overhead tricep extensions with one weight at maximum weight (50 lbs), it is very important that you have a good two handed grip while maneuvering into the overhead position. I was concerned before buying the weights that the adjustable mechanism would interfere or not be comfortable either during the process of getting into the position or actually doing the tricep extension exercise. NO WORRIES . . . IT IS QUITE COMFORTABLE - BOTH GETTING INTO THE POSITION AND DOING THE ACTUAL EXERCISE. Regarding the actual adjustment mechanism, it is well made and so simple to use. One turn of the wrist and you move the weight dial up or down. Simple.The only issue - a minor one - is removing the weights from the floor rack when you exceed approximately 25 or more lbs. This is simply rectified by using your foot on the side bar of the rack. Quite frankly, more times than not, it never happens if you remove the weights in a firm and deliberate manner.Conclusion? I am quite impressed with this adjustable weight set. Price was outstanding, as I only paid $249.91 and I am fairly confident that this weight set will last the rest of my life due to the quality of materials used to make this set.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Way Better Than Bowflex', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I never write reviews, never! I'm so glad I bought these instead of trying to clunk around the old ones. Although I do wish there was a way to add micro weights to these better...magnetic don't stick with the coating on them and the Rogue make the handle too narrow. But otherwise they are amazing!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good dumbbell set', 'author': 'hannaman', 'rating': 4, 'content': "My son has recently started lifting and asked for dumbbells to compliment the power rack and barbells that we already have in the garage. Since we don't have a lot of space, an adjustable set is what I decided on. The price on these seems competitive for adjustable dumbbells - not expensive, but not exactly cheap either. Here are my pros and cons so far.Pros:- Adjustable weights from 5 to 50 lbs (I didn't weigh them to make sure the advertised weight is accurate as that didn't matter to me).- Selection method. The way of selecting the desired weight works well. Spinning the handle to select the weight is easy and intuitive.- Compact storage. This is important if space is at a premium. We can store these in a small corner of the garage and bring them out when needed.- No bar extending past the weight. I had originally bought dumbbell handles that you can add weights to, but that meant the bar extended past the weight and could be in the way doing some exercises such as overhead ones. On these the weight gets added to the ends of the dumbbell so they act just like a full set of individual dumbbells and there is no bar extending past the weight.- Comfortable. They are not overly padded so you can get a secure grip and the contoured handle feels fine in my hands.Cons:- When selecting heavier weight, the dumbbell tends to get stuck in the carrier and you have to hold the carrier down with a free hand or foot. I fixed this by building a cart for the dumbbells that holds the carrier down. (Cart is also useful for moving them in and out of where they are stored)- Sometimes you can't select the heavier weight if the handle isn't fully inserted. Resetting the handle with a little more force works to fix that issue.- The weight rattles a little when lifting. That makes me unsure of how long the attachment method will hold up. It is working fine so far.Fine but odd:- These came as a set in 2 boxes. The first box we opened only included the weights and carrier. We figured out how to set the dumbbells up easily enough but I was expecting some instructions. The second box not only had the instructions, but logo endcaps for both dumbbells. It was clear that the 2 boxes we meant to be a set, but I wondered why both boxes weren't packed identically with the instructions and one set of the endcaps.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent adjustable dumbell set, if you're looking for your first set this is the one.", 'author': 'gimpyviper', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been building out my home gym since my kids have picked up and rekindled my passion/hobby for weight lifting. These are my second set of adjustable dumbbells, my first set are the Pro Forms which are fine but if I had done more research I wouldn't have gotten and would have gotten these instead. It's ok though since there's three of us working out it helps to have multiple sets. Theres two big advantages these have over the Pro Form, first is ease of adjustment, just twist the handle, done. Second is 5 lbs vs 10 lbs increments which was the primary motivator to get this set and why I wouldn't have gotten the Pro Form if I had known about this set. (I was in a bit of a hurry, like I said the Pro Forms are fine, but just wish they had 5 lbs increment instead.)Couple of things to note, I wish the handle was knurled steel but that's a personal preference and for me one area where the Pro Forms have an advantage, but this is a personal preference, not really functional though we'll see how the handles on these fare over time.Assembly was easy, the weight selection mechanism is actually kind of ingenious. It feels well made but the core is made of plastic, so it can only feel so well made but that's what helps to keep the cost down of these amazing dumbbells.One thing of note when you're using them you need to be mindful of positioning when returning the dumbbells to the carrier/remaining weight plates. Same for when you take them out, sometimes they'll get stuck. However this problem isn't unique to these dumbbells.Overall, 100% would recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality adjustable dumbbells', 'author': 'Jim C.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love the adjustable dumbbells. I think this would be a better product if they made the plates thinner. This may be tough in order to get the locking system to work properly. Besser h√§tte ich pers√∂nlich 3kg als Startgewicht gefunden. Die h√∂heren Gewichtsklassen sind ideal f√ºr zielgerichtetes Krafttraining das man auch durchaus mit einer Hantel durchf√ºhren kann. Durch die variablen Gewichte k√∂nnen sich M√§nnlein und Weiblein die Gewichte bei der Benutzung teilen. Braucht man die Hanteln nicht liegen sie sauber und platzsparend in ihrer Ablageschale. Die Verarbeitung und Qualit√§t ist sauber und ordentlich, ich erkenne keine scharfen Kanten oder Spalten. Durch die Menge an Gewichten hat man lange Freude und Spa√ü an den Hanteln, da man selbst als Frau eine ganze Zeit braucht bis man die Gewichte ausgereizt hat. Daher wohlverdiente 5 Sterne f√ºr dieses eindrucksvolle Set.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in Germany November 4, 2022', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': 'Anstatt 5 verschiedener Hanteln nur eine, sehr platzsparend', 'author': 'Chaostante', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Sehr sehr sicher verpackt, was ich bei diesem Gewicht f√ºr sehr wichtig halte.Alles ist auch nochmals in sich gesichert, was auch das Auspacken erleichtert und einem nicht gleich alles auseinander f√§llt.Die Hanteln funktionieren wirklich super.Wer wie ich nicht viel Platz zur Verf√ºgung hat und nicht 10 verschiedene Hanteln aufstellen kann wird es lieben mit diesen Hanteln sein Workout zu machen.Das gew√ºnschte Gewicht ist sehr schnell eingestellt und die Hantel wird dann einfach nur abgehoben. Funktioniert ohne Probleme. Abstellen w√ºrde ich pers√∂nlich aber nur in der Vorrichtung.Ich habe mit den Hanteln schon alle m√∂glichen √úbungen gemacht, inkl. schwingen und alles bleibt am Platz, keine Scheibe l√∂st sich.Qualit√§t wirkt wirklich sehr hochwertig.Ich bin wirklich sehr begeistert!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in Germany December 9, 2022', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': 'Platzsparend', 'author': 'Gerda', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Da es in unserem Fitnesszimmer etwas eng geworden war ich von den neuen, im Gewicht verstellbaren, Hanteln schon vorab begeistert, da man mit diesem System sehr viel Platz spart. Innerhalb weniger Sekunden kann man das Gewicht erh√∂hen, oder senken. Eine Hantel bietet 5 unterschiedliche Gewichte. Ein gutes und platzsparendes System, verglichen mit meinen alten Handeln , bei denen man die Gewichte noch umstecken und dann festschrauben musste, allerdings passten sie auch an eine Langhantel, wie es bei diesem System ist wei√ü ich nicht. Auch empfinde ich die klappernden Ger√§usche der Gewichte als etwas nervend. Eine gute Erfindung mit etwas Nachbesserungsbedarf.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in Germany November 6, 2022', 'is_verified': False}]

title: XMARK Rubber Hex Dumbbell Weight Sets, 380 lb to 550 lb Dumbbell Sets With Dumbbell Storage Rack, Complete Your Home Gym with an Adjustable Dumbbell Weight Bench or Purchase Each Separately, Home Gym Essentials
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value dumbbell and bumper plate rack! Highly recommended!', 'author': 'veritas.cubed', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I used to have the cheap CAP barbell 2 tier 24" dumbbell rack, and some brand horizontal plate and barbell holder that both together cost maybe $30 less than this rack, and I realized I should have bought this rack for storage in the first place! Have only had it for maybe a week or so, but it is STURDY with about 465lbs of all bumper plates on the bottom, and I STILL have room to add a few more! I did purchase adjustable dumbbells, but for fixed rubber dumbbells from Tru Grit, I have the top row filled and maybe 1/5 of the bottom? Assembly was easy, just READ DIRECTIONS! In reading the directions, I almost gave up thinking I got wrong cutout left and right uprights, but when I saw a YouTUbe video and LOOKED AT THE PICTURE, not the words, realized the uprights go to the two front holes, and leave the two back holes for barbell storage. Was my fault being an idiot, and I admit I had Bleach running in the background as I assembled, so maybe distracted, so I won\'t take off for my negligence.Storage as I have it:Dumbbells: All PAIRS of 5, 7.5, 10, 15, 20 on top. 25 on bottom. I have adjustable up to 55lb in 2.5/5/10 increments, so to fill across I added two hip thrust/squat pads, belt and resistance band sets and gloves.Plates: (ALL Bumpers. Black ones and the 2.5 and 5 colored change plates are Tru Grit branded, the colored ones are Everyday Essentials from Walmart and I have an extra wide 5lb pair from Nexo) (2) PAIRS of 45, PAIR of 35, (2) PAIRS of 25, PAIR of 15, (3) PAIRS of 10, (2) PAIRS of 5lb, PAIR of 2.5. 465lbs total. I feel I could add a few more plates too.Barbells: Left is an Amazon black EZ Curl bar, right is a 7foot Olympic Tru Grit black cerakote 20KG bar.Much more sturdy and space saving over what I had before. Fits well to my home gym inside! Can\'t recommend enough!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Incredible value-- very sturdy and professional looking!', 'author': 'Jenny R', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a great product. Easy to assemble. Super sturdy. Great value.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, useful storage for my dumbells and plates', 'author': 'Linda A', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm an old lady exerciser, so I don't need dumbbells or plates that go above 25#, so this storage rack is perfect for me. If you have a bigger set, you might want more storage. My exercise area is short on space, so this is good.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality, good size, multi-purpose rack fits all my weights', 'author': 'Aimee Butler', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Fits small and big weights, and weight plates look great stacked on the bottom. I was able to get all of my weights off the floor! Seems very sturdy. Looks nice.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pleasantly Surprised', 'author': 'Greg Norman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'After doing extensive research on options I went for the XMark packaged deal with the rack, 550 pounds of weights and bench for our new home gym. Just received, but first impressions were very good. Total package was nearly 800 pounds, the bench was package separately as was the rack and the weight were individually boxed in a wooden crate. The packaging was very impressive coming from a guy who has done a lot of shipping all over the world! The driver met us at a good drop off spot and helped me load all boxes into the back of my truck and even took back the wooden crate. Our driveway is very steep, the truck could not get down that grade...great job Old Dominion! Best to put the rack and bench together with one other person and use a ratchet set to make the process pretty seemless. We put both packages together in about 1.5 hours. The weights are packaged with oil to help with stability in storage and will need a good wipe down. Also, the grips will be slick so make sure to also clean them well. I also attached a picture of the hardware for the bench. Very well labeled with directions to each individual part. Bench is sturdy as is the rack. Would be nice if they used a bit thinner angle iron on the top for the light weights in that they will ride up a bit on the handles. Will report back after several months to see how everything is holding up, but first impressions have been very good!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This rack is perfect!', 'author': 'Ed  H', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This rack is perfect! Weights start at 5lbs and go to 50lbs. This is not like other racks where the weights fit tight. There is plenty of room for the weights and room to spare. Some complained about the strong rubber smell, but it goes away after a few weeks. It was easy to assemble and is very sturdy. For the price you can't beat it. The truck driver was very accommodating and was able to put the crate into the garage for me. Overall, I am very happy with the weights and the rack. Really love the rubber coating that won't scratch the hardwood floors.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 26, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great product (slightly problematic hardware)', 'author': 'AT', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I needed a weight rack for the pairs of 5-50lb rubber hex dumbells I've had all over the floor. I bought a different model from Amazon, and when it came, it couldn't fit all 10 sets, so 4 dumbells were still on the ground, which seemed pointless. Even though that was $40 cheaper, that one came poorly packed and scratched and was missing hardware, so I returned it and bought this one.This one came extremely well packed, all the parts were wrapped in plastic. It's more than big enough for all my weights -- in fact, it could have been a little smaller (my workout room isn't too big) but I'm not complaining because it's a really solid rack that looks good. My only complaint is that the 16 nuts that came with the product, to secure the bolts in place, were a little too tight. Well, a lot too tight. I'm fairly good at putting together furniture and equipment, but except for 2 nuts which screwed on and tightened nicely, the rest were too tight to be tightened all the way. I ended up giving up on the provided nuts and found some the same size in my toolbox. These looked identical, but tightened down all the way perfectly. Not sure what was wrong -- I think they might have used the wrong plastic ring inside the nuts. This would have been a big problem had I not had a toolbox full of random parts, so hopefully they can fix this for other people who may not be so lucky. I'm giving it 4 stars because they are at least trying to put out a good product unlike the company whose rack i purchased first.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ordered twice', 'author': 'Don Cristobel', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have bought this twice, so I must like it right? And I do. I'm thinking about ordering it a third time and putting a set at my work. It is all about reducing resistance to exercise, if there is a full rack of dumbells at work and I have a spare minute or two I can do a few sets really quick. I haven't bought it because COVID is making all exercise equipment hard to find.But I digress, what is not to like? The assembly is straightforward and was not difficult, took maybe 30 minutes. I don't use the little weights, so I just put them elsewhere, but then I freed up space to add additional heavier weights to it. So I go from 25 to 80 on my rack and so its heavier but still handles the load fine. Though the one I have on my second floor did worry me, but it hasn't collapsed through the first floor ceiling yet.The diameter of the grip on these is quite nice. The one odd weight I have is my 60# set, they're metal, not rubber coated, with a narrower grip. Despite the fact that buying rubber ones would be over $200 dollars with current COVID pricing I'm considering it because the grip is just so much nicer on these than on that one.There are no moving parts and nothing to break, they're dumbbells, they work. I will say that if you're considering this style of dumbbell rack versus the pyramid or triangle style. Get this style. Those pyramid styles use hooks that grip the grip of the dumbbell, this stand uses shelves that hold the weight of the dumbbell. So imagine you're reracking a heavy dumbbell onto a pair of hooks where the hooks have to go where your hand is. Unless you have very small hands the odds of a pinch are pretty good. Also those pyramid ones are low to the ground which is annoying. This is the kind of dumbbell stand you want to get.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great', 'author': 'Jesse W.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'They came on time in a wooden crate. I would definitely check the size of where you want the weights placed before buying. The weights and the rack are made of quality material. The only thing you‚Äôll have to let them air out as they do have a new rubber smell. Other than that they‚Äôre great.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Xmarks the spot. Wouldn‚Äôt have my weights on anything else', 'author': 'JJ', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have a set of CAP dumbbells that have been great, so i thought i‚Äôd buy their rack too. Bad idea. Metal used for their rack was similar in gauge to what you'd find on metal cabinets and started buckling to the screws tightening. Xmark has by far the sturdiest, well built dumbbell rack this side of amazon, for a more than reasonable price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]
