title: Sunny Health & Fitness Exercise Vinyl 40 Lb Dumbbell Set Hand Weights for Strength Training, Weight Loss, Workout Bench, Gym Equipment, and Home Workouts
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality consistent with price.', 'author': 'John Greth', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This product is great for a beginner trying to start lifting without making a significant investment. As others have pointer out, the weights are plastic shells filled with sand. The seal isn‚Äôt good, so sand does spill out. I put some gaffers tape over the openings to solve that problem. The parts had some greasy coating which washed off with some dish soap. The value proposition is that this is much much cheaper than competing products, and I was able to work around the problems associated with cheapness.Update: I am so grateful for this product which got me started down the right path to strength and health. I purchased this just over two years ago and started exercising just a few minutes each day. I immediately saw progress in the weight/reps/sets I could do for each exercise, doing a little more each week. This motivated me to keep progressing. After a year, I purchased a higher-capacity adjustable dumbbell since I maxed out the weight on this one. A few months ago, I got a bench, a barbell, and a set of weights to go further. I now have spreadsheets to track my progress and workout schedule and I spend ~2 hours each week lifting. This product allowed me to get started and realize how rewarding exercising can be. Everyone has different exercises they enjoy, so I recommend this as a cheap way to get started lifting to determine if it‚Äôs right for you.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great bargain dumbbells', 'author': 'Lewis Likens', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Sturdy plastic outside avoids annoying clanks of metal. Perfect for dumbbell newbies. A value buy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Does the job', 'author': 'Juniper01', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Pros:The plates don't clank when they bump against each other or adjusting the weights (as opposed to metal).The plastic handles are very comfortable to grip. They're textured enough to provide a good grip, but not so much that they eat into your hands or require gloves.The weight bar is covered in plastic and there is no way to get metal splinters from the end of it (other weight sets had this complaint)Cons:The washer that secures the weights tends to come loose over time, and needs to be tightened occasionally. Annoying, but not a dealbreaker. It's not like it comes loose when you're using the weights, so as long as you check it once before lifting each session you'll be fine. People report a similar complaint with the Amazonbasics weight set, so it's not unique to this one.They seem fairly bulky for how heavy they are, but I'm not sure if metal would be more compact. Looking at the amazonbasics set, it seems like the weights are smaller, which is more convenient when doing certain exercises (weights don't bump against your thighs when doing shrugs). The size issue is my biggest complaint.Nitpicks:These are vinyl weights, so the weights are concrete with a plastic cover over them. According to other sites, the downside of vinyl is that you can potentially crack/damage the concrete core of the weights if you drop them on a hard surface enough times, whereas metal will last basically forever. I never slam the weights down, so this isn't really a concern for me.Visually, they look kind of cheap, and don't look have the high quality/indestructible look that metal has.Overall, they are solid and do the job, but I think I would've preferred to get the amazonbasics set, mostly due to the size issue.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 7, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love the weights they are nice', 'author': 'Zahria', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love the way you can take off plates if you want less they are good quality !!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Get what you pay for', 'author': 'Rebekah L.', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Purchased these as they were a much better price than any others I could find. However they‚Äôre not entirely fit for purpose in my opinion - they are very bulky which makes it difficult to do a lot of exercises effectively. They also leave a mess every time you use them - the sand seems to leak out of the weight easily.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very simple', 'author': 'Kaitlyn Mitchell', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It is exactly what it says it is. Almost all of the weights could fit on one stick if you want.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars VERY SUSPECT THAT THIS HAS SO MANY GOOD REVIEWS IS', 'author': 'Andrea Brown', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'My dumbbell set was missing two pieces and one of the weights basically arrived empty bc of all the sand that came out. As others have said, the sand is going to leak everywhere anytime you use them. Then the weights are completely worthless. I DONT UNDERSTAND HOW THESE CAN HAVE SO MANY GOOD REVIEWS!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just what I wanted.', 'author': 'dewitt maddox', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was looking for a light set to sustain muscle not necessarily build it. This set works great. Can start low and slow and build my arms and chest back to where I want to be. Price is fair also. The set is good quality and easy to assemble.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Used', 'author': 'olivia hudson', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The weights were dusty and dirty I had to clean them before using them also came in some weird wrapping paper that didn‚Äôt fit the product itself', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Affordable and Decent Weights', 'author': 'N', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'They are nothing special but they serve their purpose. Overall I‚Äôm happy with the product but I took off a star because the weights were covered in some kind of grease (?) so I had to wash them before I used them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

The 25lbs and 30lbs sets were both damaged, however everything else seemed in fine condition.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good weights', 'author': 'Steve Carrier', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good solid product for the price. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good weights', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I just received these weights and so far, I am pleased with them. title: Bundles
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Solid Choice for Home Workouts!', 'author': 'James Rushforth', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Cap Barbell 40-Pound Dumbbell Set, and I must say, I am thoroughly impressed! This set is perfect for anyone looking to add some weight training to their home workout routine.First off, the quality of these dumbbells is top-notch. The handles are sturdy and provide a comfortable grip, even during intense workouts. The weight plates are also well-made and fit securely onto the handles, so there's no need to worry about them coming loose.Another great thing about this set is the versatility it offers. With four 2.5-pound plates, four 5-pound plates, and two dumbbell handles, you can easily adjust the weight to suit your needs. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned lifter, this set has you covered.I also appreciate how compact this set is. It doesn't take up much space, so it's perfect for small home gyms or apartments. Plus, the plates are easy to store, so you can keep your workout area neat and organized.Overall, I highly recommend the Cap Barbell 40-Pound Dumbbell Set to anyone looking for a high-quality, versatile, and space-saving weight set for their home gym. It's a fantastic value for the price, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Don't listen to the negative reviews...", 'author': 'Mantis Toboggan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a long review, I hope I can keep your attention.First off, I want to tell you guys that Fedex Smartpost is the carrier for this item. I didn\'t have a problem with them, even though they delivered my dumbbells 2 days after the delivery estimate(can\'t complain, free shipping). Fedex Smartpost sends to the closest USPS, then USPS takes an additional 2 days to deliver. It seems like most people hate Fedex Smartpost because they take longer than usual("google fedex smartpost sucks" to see what I\'m talking about). I ordered these on 2-9-13 and they arrived at my doorstep on 2-16-13, so one week exactly, average time for free shipping. The dumbbells came packaged professionally and my case came in perfect condition, which I was very pleased about.I also ordered 60 pound db set from Lion Roar Fitness on 2-8-13, and as of 2-16, they didn\'t even start shipping so I ended up cancelling that order. They charged $20 for shipping too... I will NEVER even consider buying from LRF again. Just wanted to warn you guys about that. $20 for shipping AND they lag it? No thank you.These Dumbbell sets are a great investment, and I know they will last a long time. First of all, there is no toxic chemical smell the negative reviewers mentioned. Not even the case it came with. They clearly have gotten better with quality control. I read ALL of the negative reviews and took a chance with these, and I am glad I did. My bars are all nicely polished, smooth, and the weights and collars fit accordingly. There are 4 pieces of rubber stoppers that help keep these weights in place, 2 in the middle of the bar and 2 that are connected to the collars, which does an excellent job. When you lift weights, you should never "jerk" through your workouts, but instead keep good form with nice controlled movements. That\'s how my workouts are, and the weights have not moved, rolled, clanked, at all. The only time the collars roll out, is when I twist them to change weights. I even put all the plates on one bar(30 lbs) and the weights/collars were still in place. People say these are not the best quality, but what more do you expect from a set of dumbbells? Good finish on the plates with a clean tough metal bar, which cannot rip as some rubber grip bars tend to rip after tightening the collars too much. Carefully put the plates on, or you could scratch/chip off the paint. If you don\'t like getting callouses on your hands, I recommend investing in gloves. I don\'t feel a thing with gloves on and can enjoy lifting weights without getting blisters. If you have Fat Gripz(check my review for Fat Gripz), you don\'t even need gloves. Those rubber suckers will cover it, and give you a much better workout.I will buy additional plates for these soon but before you guys do as well, try adding Fat Gripz to the bars with your normal workouts. It will give your workouts more of a challenge, and you will see some good results in your forearm strength. I wish I knew about them when I wrestled in high school..Long story short, don\'t listen to the negative reviews. Keep yourself in shape and buy these already!Oh yeah, I forgot to mention that the bars + collars does not equal 5 pounds(unless you are weighing both bars and 4 collars together). So you get about 17.5 pounds each dumbbell. The description states that they weigh 5 pounds but it\'s half. The case it comes with is about 5 or 6 pounds so that\'s where they kind of trick you. So if you do the math, 4 x 5lbs plate + 4 x 2.5 lbs plate + 2 x 2.5 collars & bar = 35 lbs + 5 lbs case = 40 lbs db set.. I\'m not going to knock off a star for that because I bought these knowing this information. We can always buy more plates, so no big deal.Thank you for reading my long review. I hope this helped make your decision in building a better body! Train hard, train safe, and good luck :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Affordable and heavy.', 'author': 'Mike', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a great set of weights for someone looking to get started working out at home. It's not perfect, but I'm not really sure that the imperfections matter for a product like this. So let's get the negatives out of the way first:- Yeah, they smell, as others have noted. It's nothing strange -- if you've ever been to a gym before, you already know this smell. They're metallic with additional chemical odors. For a basic sniff test, you won't notice much. But the smell does begin to accumulate after a few days in cramped quarters, so maybe they're not the best choice for a bedroom or tiny apartment. I suspect the smell will dissipate in time, but I don't know how long that will be.- The carrying case is cheap molded plastic, and there's a good chance yours will arrive with one or more corners dented. It's fine -- the cases aren't meant to be display items. They're meant to store the weights, and to give you a convenient way to lug them around when needed.- It's obvious that corners were cut in some regards. The rubber cushions on the bars are cheap, and could possibly fall off and get lost if you aren't attentive. Likewise, the rubber cushions within the screw-on collars can fall out. It's not a big deal if they do -- you just stick them back in. But these are obviously not advanced equipment. They were designed to be cheap and functional.That said, I don't think any of these cons really matter. Weights have one purpose in life -- to weigh something. Your muscles can't tell if you're holding twenty pounds of expensive metal or cheap metal. This particular set is very well priced, and they feel safe and sturdy. You don't have to worry about the collars wiggling loose, and they're adjustable down to 2.5 pound increments. I snagged two sets, giving me greater versatility and the ability to put more weight on a single bar if needed. For the price, this is a perfect way to get started with a cheap, space-saving home gym.Weights don't need to be pretty and fancy to work. They just need to give gravity something to act on. You can buy fancier equipment than this, but it's not clear why you'd really want to.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Honest review addressing common concerns...', 'author': 'Bleacherbum95', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When originally considering this product I was very concerned with the number of negative reviews/comments that people were leaving about these dumbbells. After deciding to take the risk, I felt the need to write a review since I believe that the negative reviews are overblown and overly dramatic. I will hopefully address the main concerns that you as the prospective buyer are having while considering this product. If you don\'t care about the details I have a TLDR at the bottom =)1. Smell: These weights do not smells like daisies; no dumbbells do. However, the smell is NOT as bad as people are saying. I would highly recommend leaving these weights outside (and/or washing them) to let them air out and control the smell, but it is not immediately overpowering. When the package arrived I slowly opened the box waiting for a toxic stench to explode out, but it never came. It was not until I lifted a plate out of the box that I noticed the smell people mentioned (the chemical applied to prevent rust), and it was not very strong. I left mine in the garage to air out and noticed a slight change in the smell of the garage, but nothing extreme. I would certainly keep them out of the house to be safe, but for $40 a quick wash or airing out was worth it to me.2: Quality: If you are looking for professional dumbbells that are made of top quality materials then look elsewhere. But if you are looking for a solid set of starter weights, this is your product. I will say that the first time I removed a collar a small piece of metal broke off, but it did not affect the functionality of the piece. Also, I noticed someone mentioned that the collar lets the weights slide...this was incorrect in my experience. The collars seem to hold the weights snugly in place, so there should be no problems there. The quality is by no means great (unbeatable for the price though), but it is good enough that I trust it will last and serve its purpose.3. Case: I saw a few people talking about how the case broke easily. The case seems fairly sturdy if it is treated well. A case breaking or not will depend on your delivery man. The weights are packaged very well inside a few boxes (Amazon ships it out in an excessively large box), and in my experience there were no cracks. The sliders to keep the box closed seem pretty lame, but I\'m one of those people who isn\'t going to sweat it if the case breaks.I hope I covered the main concerns that most people were having. My honest review of this product is that this is unbeatable for the price. $40 with free shipping (mine came in 2 days) is great, and these are exactly what I was looking for. And NO I was not paid for this review and think Amazon should be ashamed of including paid reviews.TLDR: Does NOT smell that bad (easily fixed), decent quality, best bang for the buck for somebody looking for starter dumbbells.UPDATE 1/25/14: I now have two sets of these (it was cheaper than buying weight individually), and they are holding up great after over a year and a half of use. I\'ve noticed the collar shifts slightly when you get over 30lbs, but never enough that it\'s a problem. Be confident in purchasing these as starter weights.UPDATE 7/31/16: My original bars are still going strong. The collar shifting still happens on occasion, but not to the point where it interferes with my workout. I\'ve purchased additional plates for it and added them just fine - any 1" plate should fit just as well as the originals. So these have held up strong for 4 years...zero complaints here. One thing I forgot in the original review - you may want some lifting gloves. The metals isn\'t forgiving on your hands, so if you don\'t want big calluses, invest in a cheap pair of gloves.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Adjustible Weight Set', 'author': 'Lumbre', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First of all, let\'s get the smell part clear. Yes, it smells. It smells similar to the stuff you find in the tire/automotive aisles at Target/WalMart/other stores. Yes, it can be a bit strong. Let it air for a day and put a dryer sheet in the case when you close it. Problem solved. If you\'re picky on having your home smell like candles or something, these are not for you. If you don\'t even notice the smell of a gym when you\'re in a gym (or aren\'t the quickest to pick up on smells), then you\'re fine. Also, I think it\'s the box that smells, not any of the paint.Pros:*It is easy to add/remove weights. Just unscrew the collars, remove/add weights, screw collars back in. You can do this while resting in less than a minute.*You can add your own weights. When you outgrow these, you can add your own weights (doesn\'t have to be the same brand). Any generic 1" weight will do.*When I bought these, they were awesome for $40. Under $1/pound if you count the different combinations of weights you can do and that you can add more later.*Cheap compared to buying individually.Cons:*Slight bump in one of the corners of the case. No big deal. Contents inside are fine. Just an aesthetic issue.*Smell. As addressed above, it can be a bit overpowering, but just take the time to let them air out. Some people also do fine by rinsing them.*They\'re not neoprene.Notes & Thoughts:*A lot of people complain about the default California warning added to this set. Seriously, California is overprotective. Drinking dozens of gallons of water is known to cause death. If ingested, gasoline can destroy your organs. Too much sun can give you cancer. They have these warnings on a ton of things for sale in California. Something containing nickel, for example, automatically gets this warning. If it were more serious, more states or the entire country would place a warning or they would be getting sued for giving people cancer (it\'s not like lawyers are exactly shy).*The handles may be a bit too textured for some people, especially those with delicate hands or buying more weights. In that case, maybe you should buy weight-lifting gloves. For those who don\'t mind getting scuffed by sand or falling hands-first on pavement, you\'re fine. If anything, I shift my hands around on the bar which varies up my routine a bit.*People say it\'s a good starter set. I just started a serious workout routine and have had this for a month. I see myself having this for years.*A few have complained that the weights aren\'t exact. The bar doesn\'t seem like 5 pounds, but when I weight myself with one of my 20 lb. dumbbells, I see my weight increase by 19.8 or 20 (my scale goes in intervals of 0.2). It\'s close enough for me. I don\'t need it to be that exact.*Mine didn\'t seem to have any loose seal rings or collars. They seem good for the price. They may shift a small amount after a 30 minute workout to where you can hear a slight clunk. Just retighten them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing quality', 'author': 'John carter', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Everything came double if not even triple boxed and wrapped and had stuffing on the original box all the weights came individually wrapped there was no chemical strong smell with my set (105lb) pair they just smelled new nothing that made me gag or was to strong as far as the mechanics it seems to work perfect they hold still while I do chest dumbell flys with 35lbs on each only time will tell but as of now extremely happy don‚Äôt listen to the review also if you want to add plates to this set make sure there 1.14 or bigger 1inch plates won‚Äôt work also I personally love the diamond pattern grip but if your not used to lifting without gloves your going to have to break your hands in or get some gloves me personally gives me more grip I love it it does not feel like it‚Äôs digging in my skin like others said overall good product for the price can‚Äôt beat it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Nice dumbbell bars', 'author': 'RY', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I liked the dumbell bars. They are solid, easy to grip, and the nuts tighten down nicely. The weights that came with them would be fine except the center hole in them is a lot bigger than it needs to be causing the weights to shift,if you don't really crank down on the bar nuts.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best deals I‚Äôve ever found on Amazon', 'author': "D'Art", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This 52.5 lb single dumbbell setup is without a doubt one of the best deals I‚Äôve ever found on Amazon. While most iron free-weights sell for around $2/pound (as of the fall of 2022), this set is much more affordable,The price for it does seem to vary wildly day by day. I paid $77 in October 2022 and see that a month later, it is selling for $65. But I‚Äôm not complaining since it‚Äôs a steal at either price.I bought 2 sets so I‚Äôd have a pair of dumbbells.The dumbbell bars and threaded, star-shaped end nuts are nicely made. The chrome coating seems thick and durable. And because the threaded nuts have black rubber washers on the side that makes contact with the weight plates, they tighten securely and stay firmly in place when in use. Other sets I‚Äôve used did not have the rubber washer and as a result, would loosen up while doing reps. That‚Äôs both annoying and dangerousThe rubber washers do tend to fall off when removing the nuts from the dumbbell, but that is easily rectified by putting a few drops of superglue in the groove in the nut into which the rubber washer sits.The weight plates themselves are a little less precisely made. For instance, I weighed my 5 lb plates on a postal scale and discovered they range anywhere from 4.75 lbs to 5.25 lbs. That‚Äôs not a big deal most of the time but you can definitely notice an imbalance if you inadvertently end up with 8 of the heavier 5 lb plates on one hand and 8 of the lighter plates on the other.To avoid that from happening, I used a silver Sharpie to mark the plate that are over 5 lbs and keep them in a separate pile so I can distribute the weight more evenly into the bars.Also, while the clear-coat on the plates seems heavy duty enough, you do need to check for rough edges. That goes for the dumbbell bars too. I had to file down a couple of spots to avoid getting metal splinters in my hands.Last but not least, the dumbbells I received have a diameter of 1.18 inches (or 30mm) and the weight plates have holes that size. This means any plates you may already have with 1 inch (25mm) holes will not fit onto these bars. Likewise, while the plates from this set will easily go onto a 1 inch bar, they can flop around a bit. In practice the latter is not a problem as long as you can tighten down the bar-end clamps. I use my 30mm plates on a 25mm curl bar without issue.In short, while there may be some compromises involved, at these prices, this dumbbell set is one of the best deals out there.Follow up note written on April 11, 2023:I‚Äôve been using my weight set several times a week for about 6 months now and all parts are holding up great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really like these', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed a set to get started with. It‚Äôs hard to make it all the way to the gym...and if I‚Äôm watching tv I can just pick these up and do a few curls every now and then. Really helpful. They are easy to switch weights in and out, and if you are cool with doing one arm at a time then you could add all the weights on one and basically have a dumbbell that goes up to nearly 50 pounds (minus the 4 pound bar), without having to spend all the money of buying 2, 50 pound dumbbells, which would cost twice as much. Instead just do one arm at a time and save half the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Customer service was decent', 'author': 'Nick', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'For quality. You need to try each screw to find one that will actually screw on all the way. Paint is intact, other than that, they are weights.Be advised, you might not get everything in your shipment. Thankfully, customer service was easy to contact. After a couple of days, I recieved a reply asking for the details of my purchase, and after that I recieved my missing handle promptly.4 stars for good customer service.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Top Sellers
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Set, Great Value', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As others have mentioned, these are shipped in three boxes of weights at 50# each, and one narrow box that holds the stand. Handles are knurled and as expected in diameter and abrasiveness. No gloves required, but your mileage may vary.Is there a smell? seems to be the burning question. Of course they have a smell. Mine did *not* have any kind of oily residues, as others have mentioned; again, just new tire smell, which for me is not obnoxious. But hey- some people think cilantro tastes terrible, so there is no accounting for taste.NOTE #2: Unlike the way Amazon\'s own brand and some other DBs I have purchased are wrapped, these were just loose in the box. No Styrofoam, no placement in a baggie, nada. Just in the box. So they are not going to be 100% brand new and flawless looking when you take them out. Get over it. They\'re dumbbells. They\'ll look like that in a couple months of workouts anyway. Also, because there is no protection, be judicious in opening the boxes. title: Adjustable Weights Dumbbells Set, 44Lbs 66Lbs 88Lbs 3 in 1 Adjustable Weights Dumbbells Barbell Set, Home Fitness Weight Set Gym Workout Exercise Training with Connecting Rod for Men Women
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy assembly and sturdy product', 'author': 'Todd Bergman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These are very straightforward and the grip is pretty well designed so it doesn‚Äôt hurt your hand. Make sure you do the math first to make sure the combinations of plates work for what you need so you don‚Äôt order the wrong size. My dumb a** did not, but fortunately the seller is super helpful and got me sorted out with the weights that I needed. Definitely recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Honestly so glad we chose this amazing set, it was worth every penny', 'author': 'Talia', 'rating': 5, 'content': "There are no shortage of options on Amazon and we took our time going through all of them to make a very careful decision. This was absolutely our favorite option and, in our opinion, the best choice based on both price, quality, and the apparent quality of the build materials (aka durability, long-lasting-ness).Basically, this is everything we wanted and at a completely fair price. The range of weight options they provide is great and higher than many other listings. Also, it was the perfect balance of aesthetic appeal and seeming sturdiness (although sturdiness was obviously the higher priority).The hexagonal shapes make it so they don't roll when on the ground. The fact that it can be either dumbbells or a bar is amazing. And the heavy, deep grooves are the main thing to help assure you that it won't fall off and is safe to use.The only weird thing I could say to give anyone a heads-up is that there are tiny 'grub' screws (I think they're called??) that you have to tighten with an Allen key (provided with set, of course) and some might find that uncomfortable or strange. Because you have to use the little 'L-shaped' tool every time to re-tighten the little tiny screw into the big twisty-tightening ring thing. However, this is completely normal, not their fault or bad design, it's simply the trade-off that YOU must pay for because you want something that can do all kinds of wacky stuff all at once, interchangeably. I've actually seen other little screw things that you can do with your hands, but the allen key set thing is not enough to deduct a star. I suppose I could buy those hand-tighten-able things myself elsewhere if I really wanted to.All in all, pretty amazing. Feel like we've made a solid investment for years to come. Great work on this weight set, guys.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 13, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good but not great', 'author': 'Roderick M Creed', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Let's start with the good. It's a very simple product. It doesn't take a lot of thought to get it up and working. The weights are accurate and it's all very sturdy. Barbell mode is wonderful and simple and having a flat bottom makes for easy storage.Now for the bad. This wasn't manufactured very well fit several reasons. The threads for the barbells to enter into the dumbbell are not deep enough so in the light dumbbell mode you will have exposed threads. The threads are also not made very tight, even with the locking pin in place the weights will rotate. The foam cover doesn't move and it hasn't been placed in the middle so getting a perfect center on that alone is hard. Add in the uneven threads and you have to get a tape measurer to figure out where exactly you should be grabbing it.Overall though is a great product that I'm glad I bought.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good set for a beginner', 'author': 'Jodi', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect for someone just starting on their fitness journey. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality product', 'author': 'Peter D.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I like the hex shape for sturdiness/non-rolling. Happy with my order!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price', 'author': 'Joshua Segeleon', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôve bought quite a few of these (pretty much a 5-50 lbs set and a set of 80lbers so far). I will list the pros and cons :Pros:1. Cheap. You will not find decent dumbbells for this price anywhere, besides maybe Craigslist. But then you have the pain of dealing with Craigslist and going and picking them up. Dumbbells from most other sources are 2 or even 3 times more expensive, which compounds significantly if you need a full set.Cons:1. Chip easily. So easily that they sometimes come slightly damaged already. If you are throwing or dropping these, you‚Äôre going to destroy the coating within months.2. Essentially no knurling. Hasn‚Äôt been a big deal for me this far3. Not as pretty as the more expensive dumbbellsOverall, it‚Äôs a decent product for what it is. For me I don‚Äôt need something pretty - picking up an ugly piece of metal has the same effect as picking up a pretty piece of metal, but for half the price.If you buy the ‚Äúused‚Äù ones when they pop up, you can get them for almost $1/lb. Again, you won‚Äôt beat that anywhere right now. Every ‚Äúused‚Äù one I‚Äôve bought has come in the same shape as the ‚Äúnew‚Äù ones (an unused dumbbell with a chip or 2 out of the painting from manufacturing/shipping), so you‚Äôre getting the same product for slightly cheaper than they already are.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Iron sharpens iron', 'author': 'Raymond Lopez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Solid construction.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great dumbbell, but not as good as they used to be', 'author': 'Santacruiser', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I actually bought this to replace a dumbbell I purchased from Amazon during the pandemic. The one I replaced was not made by CAP, and was pretty poor quality (chipping paint, shoddy casting and assembly, etc.). I also have an older CAP dumbbell, just like the one I'm reviewing here, and the quality is excellent. This new CAP dumbbell looked nearly perfect when I received it but, surprisingly, there were a couple of dents. It's held up well, but I am starting to see some small chips, leading me to think that CAP's quality control, post pandemic, has slipped a little bit. I still think CAP is the standard for this type of dumbbell, and I'd probably buy another one, but it's not quite as nice as the one I bought 5 or 6 years ago.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Dumbbells fine, packaging not the best', 'author': 'Frank', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So the 50 pound dumbbells I got are great (thankfully), no loose heads or issues overall. The finish isn‚Äôt the best, they have some chips and damage to the finish.I didn‚Äôt love the packaging. They were in two cardboard boxes (for each dumbbell, they were delivered separately of course), both of which were destroyed, filthy, and wet since it‚Äôs been snowing here. One box was entirely open on one side, however given the weight of these I‚Äôm not surprised and I honestly feel bad for the delivery driver who had to deliver two 50 pound boxes to my door. So, thanks to him.But either way, the packaging really wasn‚Äôt good enough for 50 pound dumbbells. They had a plastic bag wrapped around them inside as well, which seemed to be extremely old and dirty. The plastic was torn and destroyed, so I‚Äôm guessing these have been sitting around for a long time.They were dirty as well, but nothing a little alcohol can‚Äôt clean. I cleaned the floor and vacuumed after unpacking them, which took a few minutes.I held off on ordering dumbbells this heavy online, but went for it this time (I got 40s in the past which turned out great, but 50s seemed like I was pushing it for a delivery driver). It turned out fine in my case, they are not damaged in any meaningful way (again the finish isn‚Äôt perfect but I don‚Äôt care at all, they‚Äôre just dumbbells). Maybe I got lucky but I‚Äôm very happy in the end, after the slog up the stairs and the cleaning. Can‚Äôt really ask for more when buying 100 pounds of stuff online.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value!', 'author': 'Bill E.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Almost a perfect match to a dumbell I have had for over a decade. And it didn't cost me an arm and a leg!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "1.0 out of 5 stars Don't buy the heavy ones. Absolute nightmare and shipping is pathetically inadequate.", 'author': 'Elliot', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I wish I could give 0 stars. 0 starts to cap for the quality of these dumbbells. 0 stars to amazon for the packaging. 0 stars to UPS for delivery.I bought a pair of the 65 lbs cast iron dumbbells. These were shipped and sold by Amazon.This was not even remotely worth the small savings over the rubber headed dumbbells I have bought many times through amazon.To begin, they ship these in a cardboard box and that is pretty much it. Only one dumbbell arrived on time. The box was absolutely shredded from trying to contain 65 lbs of iron. In fact, the dumbbell was falling out of the box when it arrived. The UPS man also just dumped this at the top of the driveway. This dumbbell has also defective. One of the welds was poorly done and visibly defective. I could feel the dumbbell head wobbling when pressed over head. That's scary for a 65 lbs dumbbell. The handle itself also was poorly finished.The second dumbbell arrived a week late. Its box was also destroyed and you could tell UPS had to add extra packing tape just to hold the box together. This was also dumped in the grass at the top of my driveway. It was even worse than the first dumbbell. The dumbbell head was extremely loose from the handle. I don't know if this is a defect or damaged in shipping. I guess it is probably both.I also received a replacement from Amazon for dumbbell #1. This time it didn't even arrive with a a box. There was literally just a shipping label zip tied to the dumbbell. The sad little cardboard box they ship these big dumbbells in must have been obliterated in transit. The dumbbell looks like it was dragged across concrete. Paint was chipped and peeling off. One corner looked ground down. The welds actually looked good on this one but there was too much physical damage from shipping.I am returning them all.Maybe these cast iron dumbbells would be a good option for lighter weights or if Amazon even remotely cared about packaging. I would never again consider trying to buy the heavier weights of these cast iron dumbbells. I didn't even get one functional/undamaged dumbbell from the three they sent. I recommend you the rubber coated dumbbells with the chrome handles. I have never had an issue with those.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great weights', 'author': 'Jose N.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Quality weights and great price highly recommend', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent basic dumbbell', 'author': 'Rob Banzai', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Although it would've been nice to get dumbbells that had a coating on the ends I couldn't find something that was as cost-effective as these traditional ones from CAP. A local source would've been cheaper but I couldn't find one so Amazon it was.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well worth the cost', 'author': 'Henry Debardeleben', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the CAP Barbell 55 lb Single Adjustable Dumbbell with Contoured Full Rotation Handle in the Honeycomb Black and Chrome design, and I couldn't be more satisfied with my purchase.First and foremost, the contoured full rotation handle adds a level of comfort and versatility to my workouts that I haven't experienced with other dumbbells. The honeycomb black and chrome handle not only looks sleek and stylish but also feels durable and reliable. I appreciate the attention to detail in the design, as it adds a touch of elegance to my workout space.In terms of performance, the CAP Barbell 55 lb Single Adjustable Dumbbell delivers excellent results. The weight distribution is well-balanced, ensuring a smooth and controlled motion during each repetition. This has positively impacted the effectiveness of my strength training routine.Overall, I highly recommend the CAP Barbell 55 lb Single Adjustable Dumbbell to anyone looking for a high-quality, versatile, and aesthetically pleasing piece of fitness equipment. I've done a lot of research on adjustable weights lately and they typically range from double to quadruple the price of these for big name brands. These are very cost effective while also maintaining phenomenal quality. Unlike other adjustable weights these change from 5lbs to 25lbs in increments of 11 in seconds! Not only that but each weight is securely held. I don't have to worry about the weights falling on my head like others that have snap individual adjustments. They come with a rack that holds them in place and have a flat bottom on the weights so you don't have to worry about them rolling away either. You can also use them for assisted push ups and the handles have nice soft grip so you don't have to worry about them cutting up your hands or needing to wear gloves. . However, I found you can simply remove one plate from the rack if you prefer an odd increment of say 16.5lbs instead of 11lbs or 22lbs as each plate weighs 5.5lbs. Multiply by 8 plus 11lbs handle gives you 55lbs. Lastly I love how the plates are tough steel and not those bulky plastic plated plates you see on some name brand adjustable dumbbells that look and feel cheap. 5* I'd recommend it to everyone from beginners to pros.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Adjustable Dumbbell Set, 66 LBS Weights Dumbbells Sets, Solid Cast-Iron Core Free Weight Set for Home Gym, Barbell Weight Set with Connector,Workout Strength Training Equipment for Men Women
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Versatile Barbell/Dumbbell Combo - Highly adaptable per Exercise: LM BodyPump Alternative', 'author': 'Ivan Cheng', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My girlfriend and I have used this system for a little more than a month, and we are very happy with the flexibility, durability, overall quality of this barbell/dumbbell system.I am a Les Mills Instructor and I came across this set when I was searching for a bar and heavier dumbbells. The actual system that we use was out of stock and way delayed. This is a good substitute with some limitations for workouts at home, at a fraction of the cost of the actual LM set.I really appreciate that the plates are solid material with a TPU outer ring. Most of these other sets are sand-filled plastic shells and that's a no-go for me. They're very sturdy and durable - reinforced in places that need them and the numbers stand out. The threading of the bars is also very thick, smooth, and easy to do-up or break apart. There is a slight bit of play when the barbell is put together with the connecting rod but this is a tradeoff for easier assembly/ disassembly, and while it may loosen up a little bit, there is enough threading to keep it from coming apart. The bar is about 1.1-1.5 inches in diameter depending on where you grab it so it's got a good heft and feel to it.The Specs:Dumbell bars > 2lbs (I think 2.2lbs.)Bar connector < 2lbs (about 1.8 lbs.) - finished bar ~ 7lbs. (these weights are from when I first weighed them)4x. 2 Kg (4.4 lbs)4x 1.25 Kg (2.75 lbs)4x 1 Kg (2.2 lbs)4 + 1 plastic screw locking nut. (I appreciate the extra one)I generally use my bar for squats like the first set-up. This is about 36.8 lbs and I think this isn't recommended because the locking screws can't be done in all the way (The correct way is probably in the second photo). I don't recommend the connected dumbbells for added weight during squats as it doesn't rest on the meaty part of the upper back.Limitation: It maxes out the available weight for this bar with what you have, but the end connectors still screw them together securely. For Bodypump, it's a little on the light side, and because the end stops are threaded, it just takes a bit longer to change weight - but you're buying this system and it's really only light for squats at my level.This bar is great for the repeated rows, deadlifts, high-pulls, clean and press, chest press, shoulder press, bicep curls... Endless possibilitiesLimitation: If you have a bigger wingspan, the barbell is a bit narrow (28 in./ 71 cm. across plate-to-plate) to do wide rows and presses.For BP, the plates also feel good in the hand if you want to hold them together for presses during the lunge track or those days where your shoulders/lats are gone during the flyes and rotators in the shoulder track. I like how they're not entirely round, they have flat sections.You can also break them apart as dumbells for unilateral work, as I do when I'm not doing BP. This is an alternative to the wide rows/presses with the barbell if you want to put more isolation on the left/right sides of your body.*I think in this case, you cannot exceed 3 plates on either side of the dumbbell bar in the case of making one super heavy dumbbell.*Other constructive criticisms:- If the connector can be slightly longer, adding maybe 10 - 12 inches to the span of the barbell- The weight set is a little light and I'd like some expandability. Maybe sell additional heavier weight plates on the side for us to upgrade our existing sets.Again, I am very happy with this bar set-up. It achieves everything that it can do within its specifications for a reasonable price point, and I'm honestly considering another set as a gift.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for at home use', 'author': 'Blaire', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Ive been working out at home for a while and this is perfect for easy at home use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars slightly heavy enough.', 'author': 'klaudie rice jr', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'great starter set to tone small build.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value', 'author': 'Chris Montgomery', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This set has been absolutely amazing. It's been used and abused for 2 years and is as good as the day it arrived. The versatility also allows you to do so many different workouts.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars These are amazing!', 'author': 'Amanda T.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm a teacher so finding time to workout every day at the gym was increasingly difficult. I made excuses for why I couldn‚Äôt go to the gym- it‚Äôs raining, it‚Äôs too cold, etc. Buying these took away those excuses. No reason to skip a workout if I have a full weight set waiting for me in my living room! I started lifting a year ago and this weight is perfect for me. They are incredibly versatile and have so many possibilities! I opted for the 66lbs set with steel bars to avoid plastic bar breaking issues, and I‚Äôm glad I did. They‚Äôre very sturdy and have a similar hand feel to a barbell you‚Äôd find at a gym. The plates are stiff steel coated in rubber. The plastic coating on the dumbbell handles was different but after a few workouts I got used to it. Everything arrived perfectly intact and was even a day earlier than expected!I agree with other reviews that screwing the caps on and off can get a bit tedious and does slightly break up the flow of the workout. As an American it also took me some time to adjust to KG instead of LBS. But if you‚Äôre looking for something as versatile as this AND as convenient, just splurge on Bowflex. For the price, these are PERFECT for any home workout. I‚Äôve been recommending these to everyone! You will not be disappointed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 13, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for those wanting to start lifting weights!', 'author': 'momof5', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased these for my grandson when he wanted to start lifting weights and building muscle. They are sturdy and hold up well to daily use. He loves that he can change out the weight amounts.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good product', 'author': 'QUOC-KHANH TRAN PHAM', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I will recommend to my friends.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Patience is required', 'author': 'Left of the Aisle', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'These weights are good quality and so what they say. My issue with them is they disrupt the flow of a workout because spinning the holders on each end and removing or adding weights just takes too long. If you are a zen master, you might have the patience but, I do not. I also don‚Äôt like the metric only weights. I had to make a chart with the US equivalents on it and different combos for total weight and it still feels heavier than what it should be. I am freely admitting a flaw in my character here but, if you know you lack patience, purchase carefully.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 6, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 10/10', 'author': 'Fulvia', 'rating': 5, 'content': '', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars They are great. The listing seems to be intentionally pluralizing as if you've bought a set when you're only actually getting one for the price. They are clearly lightweight and cheap and the housing feels very brittle. I went back to read because I thought it was my mistake but with how the listing is written I still can't say for sure. Even if the product had been high quality the review would still be poor for that reason.Save your money and go for a less expensive name brand.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars The weight works great, but you only get one', 'author': 'NMMo', 'rating': 3, 'content': "The weight is great, 5 levels of weight 5lbs-25lbs. In 5lbs. increments. It also comes with a tray to set the weight in that keeps all the weights aligned so you can add and remove weight quickly and easily.The picture and description is misleading though. It makes you believe you're getting a set of weights when it's actually only 1.Also the weights can kind of feel unbalanced if the weight plates are lined up differently in each hand.And the weight plates always wants to be on the bottom, so while lifting you're also fighting the weight trying to reorient itself in your hand if you don't line it up correctly beforehand.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Weights Christmas gift', 'author': 'Margaret Sweeney', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'After a delay received the product I wanted. It is a Christmas gift.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: NordicTrack Select-a-Weight Adjustable Dumbbells
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice, solid, *narrow*, easy-to-use, adjustable dumbbells', 'author': 'M. Gotts', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The NordicTrack adjustable dumbbells are a real winner that are working out well for my wife and I.Pros:1) Nice weight range (10-55) and sufficient increments for me. We have a small set of 2.5 to 8-lb individual dumbbells to fill in on the very low end.2) Compact dumbbells. The dumbbells are no longer than needed for the weight you are using. The 10-lb configuration is narrower than the 20-lb, which is narrower than the 30-lb, which is narrower than the 40-lb, which is narrower than the 50-lb. DO NOT DISCOUNT this when shopping for adjustable dumbbells. You do not want to be swinging around a 2-ft long bar in each hand when simply using a 10-lb dumbbell. It gets in the way and limits the range of motion for some exercises. These incrementally add plates to the end as the weight goes up. So they are compact at low weights, and very much the size of a fixed dumbbell of similar weight at heavier weights.3) Easy to adjust. The adjustment system is low effort, but locks solidly and seems unlikely to fail long term, normal use.4) Value. Not the cheapest, but give a great bang for the buck.Cons:1) Slower to adjust, relatively. Some changes require moving 4-adjustment levers on each dumbbell, depending on what weight you are switching between. A single or double dial is quicker, no doubt. But, note that I said "relatively". They really only take a couple of seconds to adjust, and it has been a non factor in my workouts.2) Missing some weight choices. You can add 2.5-lb or 5-lb to the coarse 10-lb, 20-lb, 30-lb, 40-lb, 50-lb settings. So you can do 12.5-lb & 15-lb, but not 17.5-lb, etc. The next increment after 15-lb is 20-lb. You could fudge around this by selecting an uneven amount to each end of the dumbbell, which would make them unbalanced by 2.5-lbs and give you a 7.5-lb increment. But I don\'t suggest doing that. For me, the increments are fine enough for what I do, and I move up and down in 5-lb amounts anyway.3) maybe more fragile than fixed weights? This is actually a comment that applies to probably all adjustable dumbbells, simply because they have a selection mechanism added to them. These do not appear fragile in the absolute sense, but I have no plans to drop them the way you see some guys do with fixed weights at the gym.I researched buying these quite a bit, and narrowed it down to several contenders. The Bowflex dumbbells were one finalist, and are undeniably slick, with the one-knob adjustment system. But, they (and some others) have a disqualifying flaw (in my opinion) where the dumbbell bar is always full length, regardless of how much weight you\'ve selected. Even at whatever their minimum is, you are swinging around like a two-foot rod with each arm.Anyway, I\'m a happy customer, and these are working great.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best adjustable dumbbells', 'author': 'Koyfish', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Why buy this product over the Bowflex 552 model and other types such as the Core Fitness?Most adjustable dumbbells can change weights easily. There are videos comparing the time it takes to change weights. Deciding to buy a particular type just because it is 1 second faster is silly.All are quick. You should decide to buy based on the following criteria: (1) handle feel and grip; (2) incremental weight options; (3) max weight needed; and (4) size of dumbbell.1. handle feel and grip ‚Äì the Bowflex grip is made of rubber and textured ‚Äì no slippage. The Nordictrack (orange model) has a metal grip similar to grips found on regular dumbbells. I have handled both and I think the Nordictrack is better in this area.2. Incremental weight options ‚Äì be careful in choosing. Some adjustables like the Core Fitness which use the twist handle to increase the weight ‚Äì will increase it by 5 lbs. That is a lot of weight to add when you are doing bicep exercises. This is where the Bowflex and the Nordictrack adjustables are superior. The Bowflex starts at 5 lbs and increases by 2.5 lbs until you get to 25 lbs (5, 7.5, 10, 12.5, 15, 17.5 20, 22.5), then it increases in 5 lbs increments (30,35,40,45,50,55 lbs). The Nordictrack starts at 10lbs and can increase to 12.5 then to 15 lbs then it jumps to 20 lbs. After 20 lbs you can increase it as follows ( 22.5, 25, 30, 32.5, 35, 40, 42.5, 45, 50, 52.5, 55 lbs). This means that the Bowflex has more adjustable increments between 5lbs and 25 lbs, while the Nordictrack has more adjustable increments between 20lbs and 55 lbs. So if you are going to always use the smaller weight amounts and need that lower increments there ‚Äì maybe the Bowflex is better for you. For me, I didn't mind that the Nordictrack started at 10 lbs and I wanted the more adjustable increments at the mid to higher weight ranges. My opinion is that the Nordictrack adjustables are better because of the continuous incremental weight adjustments all throughout the weights.3. Max weight needed. Most of the adjustable dumbbells only go up to 55 lbs. If you need more then look elsewhere such as the Bowflex 1090. For most people, the 55 lbs max limit is probably more than enough weight to do all of your dumbbell exercises.4. Size of dumbbell. Take a look at videos of the Bowflex adjustables. Even if you are using them as a 5 lbs weight you are picking up the entire outer portion of the dumbbell which states the length is 15.75 inches long. If you are using them to do a chest press ‚Äì you cannot bring your arms close together at the top of the press because of the length of each of the dumbbells. Here is where the Nordictrack dumbbells shine. If you are picking up the lightest weight (10 lbs) you are only picking up the inner most weights and each dumbbell will measure about 9 inches. The Nordictrack design makes for a superior compact and usable dumbbell.In my opinion the Nordictrack adjustable dumbbell is the best adjustable dumbbell out in the market at this time. I bought mine for $325.00. Don't know why they jumped in price. But at the price I bought them, they are well worth the price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 1, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Hidden Gem in Adjustable Dumbbells!!', 'author': 'ClimbAnyMountain', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I discovered these after seeing a very positive review on YouTube. These are the newer model (orange adjusters). After looking at LOTS of different dumbbells and researching my options over a course of several weeks, I decided that these have the best price/value ratio. What I love about these dumbbells: (1) Metal knurled grips (not rubber or plastic) (2) Easy to change weights (3) Flat dumbbell ends so you can rest weight on your thighs (unlike Bowflex) (4) Adjustable in 2.5 lb increments up to 55 lbs. (5) Solid quality feel to the weights.Pro Tip: Mount these to a stand so you don\'t have to bend down to the floor to pick them up, especially at the heavier settings. I bought a cheap harbor freight universal tool stand and added a wood top. To secure the NordicTrack cradles to the wood top I cut slots in the wood top and used Velcro One-Wrap 15" x 1/2" thin ties that I threaded through the 4 pre-existing slots can be found on each plastic cradle. 1/2" wide zip ties would also be another way to go. If you don\'t secure the cradle, the cradle may lift up when you remove the weights from the cradle.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars If you have little space and the money', 'author': 'ZOB', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'A bit expensive but you won‚Äôt get as many weight increments with standard adjustable dumbbells. The only way you would is with a single weight dumbbell set which will most likely cost around the same if not more. The weights are a bit wobbly when moved around but nothing that will interfere with a workout. I does have me questioning the overall sturdiness. I can‚Äôt imagine maximizing out in reps and just dropping them. You could only do that on a padded area and it‚Äôs probably going to considerably lessen the lifespan of the weights if not outright break the various moving parts that probably aren‚Äôt repairable to the average person if at all due to it being a unique item with its own specific parts. The levers yo change weights can be a pain but you will get the hang of it and you can switch between weight easy and quickly enough. The levers do seem like if you wanted to you could break the off with minimal effort. So if you‚Äôre angry lifting stick to one weight till you calm down. Make sure you figure out the trick to adjusting the levers and you should be fine. I haven‚Äôt been able to find any feed back on this model. There‚Äôs another model norditrack makes that I saw a YouTube video that said they break easily. And many comments to reinforce that including breaking on the first use. These have held up well for almost two months. I thought the screws would come loose or a weight would fall of while moving them around but the wobble hasn‚Äôt gotten any worse. I will continue to be overtly aware of this as it still creeps me out Over all the get the job done are pretty simple and take up minimal space. Pretty much what you would expect from adjustable weights', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 26, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So far works great, only complaint is for smooth operation needs to be aligned perfectly.', 'author': 'Adam', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love the number of different weights.Love the low/high amount of each weight (so I can do heavier exercises like squats, lunges, etc.)Only complaint is changing the weights.- If you dont align the weights that are off of it first it will be nearly impossible to put back on. If you align them and every time you carefully put them back when done (with that weight amount) then it works like intended. Think the changing of weights needs to be re-designed. I dont remember when we purchased these but currently (March 2024) still using them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Affordable pair of 50lbs adj dumbbells', 'author': 'Randy Moore', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I ordered these a few days ago on 2/8, they were delivered early this morning (6:30am) on 2/11. Firstly I am very impressed with the shipping of these! The product box is over 110lbs and there was NO physical damage to the exterior or interior, I have no idea how they handled this dumbbell box so carefully. I fully expected tons of damage inside and out, so 5 stars there.Now I haven't put these through their paces just yet, but wanted to give an initial impression after playing around with weight selection and doing a few quick and light exercises to see how they feel. Bear in mind this is my first ever set of adjustable dumbbells, and if you are reading this in this future, we are still in the middle of the covid pandemic and finding any weights at all is difficult, much less a set like these and at MSRP no less ($329).1) Weight Selection - First impressions here is slightly mixed. The selection itself is obvious enough though, the outside pin you pull up and drag and drop to wherever you want your heavy weight (10lbs, 20lbs, 30lbs, etc). The inside pin you pull up and drag to the front for 5lbs extra, back for 2.5 lbs, or middle for no extra. So getting from 10lbs, 12.5lbs and 15lbs is very obvious and straight forward. My concern is the selector pin handle is just a plastic piece, so I'm interested to see how this holds up over time. But the pin itself is metal so hopefully that lasts. Also when selecting your base heavy weight, the pin tends to get stuck sometimes when moving back and forth. Not a huge deal, but again I haven't gone through a full workout to see if this becomes annoying or not.2) Dumbbell Feel - As stated this is my first set of adjustable dumbbells. I've used plenty of standard hex dumbbells in the past and have always enjoyed lifting those. These definitely feel a bit different when lifting versus standard hex dumbbells. There is a slight wiggle to the plates and some click-clacking sounds when lifting. Very slight, but noticeable. The metal handles are nice though, they have a nice knurling and good grip, so solid marks there. So far I think they seem perfectly fine though, especially considering these 2 dumbbells are replacing like 10+ pairs of normal ones.3) Durability - Only time will tell here. I am concerned that there is only a 90day mfg warranty... I never like seeing that for any product ever. If you don't want to guarantee your product for even 1 year, that's a straight red flag. Especially with something like this, that costs $$$, I would hope to get many years of use out of them. I will certainly treat these with kids gloves, make sure I am gentle with the adjustor pins, definitely not dropping these or tossing them around, not going to use them for pushups, etc. I should mention that the plates themselves are a heavy plastic, not metal or rubber, so I don't think they would survive much impact.I'll come back and update this review after 30 days. I felt it was important to give an early impressions of these. When I bought these dumbbells, they literally sold out just later that day, and I see 3rd party resellers (SCALPERS) selling these things for $500+... DO NOT BUY THOSE!!! I paid $329 shipped, so PLEASE do not buy from any of these scalpers, they bought the product, so maybe they can use them as intended instead of taking advantage of this screwed up global situation were all in. Those a-holes are ruining many peoples hobbies and interests by doing that crap, so do not support them.Lastly, I have no idea if this is a genuine NordicTrack product. I've seen people on this page say they are brand new, and others say they are old and discontinued. The packaging doesn't really indicate much. There is NordicTrack branding on the shipping box and on stickers for the dumbbells. They are manufactured by the company that makes NordicTrack products though, so at least that's something. Regardless, I think the value for money is there if you can buy them at MSRP.EDIT (39 days later):After having used these dumbbells about 4-5 days a week since I got them, I can definitely say this was a solid purchase. Super convenient, weight selection is very nice and quick, no major gripes at all. However, as I stated some concerns in durability above... that is still very much a concern. There's been a couple of times where the inner 5lb weight would not attach to the pin, had to pull the dumbbell out and reset it to get it working properly. And I would still caution against using these for exercises like man makers or anything similar. I almost want to try it, but have the feeling these things would be toast in a couple of months if I did that. So these are not perfect for all workouts, but for general purpose lifting I definitely recommend.P.S. DO NOT BUY FROM SCALPERS!!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars very easy to use even for supersets!! I bought these for my 2 month stay in Florida and I love them.', 'author': 'Doreen Kojoian', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought these along with a foldable weight bench for my 2 month stay in Florida. I needed a variety of weights for my workouts and these do not take up a lot of room, they are very easy to use and economical so they fit the bill for me perfectly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value, great quality, improvements over blue model', 'author': 'Ivan Schustak', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I just received the orange version of the NordicTrack Select-a-Weights, and wanted to compare it with the blue version. Both are 10-55 pounds, made by NordicTrack, and bear the "Select-a-Weight" name (although sometimes they call the blue ones "Speed Weights" and the orange ones don\'t show up on the NordicTrack site - NordicTrack, what\'s going on with you all?)Material: The orange ones seem to be mostly metal, while the blue ones are mostly plastic. The orange has a metal, knurled handle. And the 10-pound weights are metal on the orange as well. The blue has a plastic handle and plastic weights. The blue doesn\'t feel bad, but the orange feels more premium. On both of them, the two 2.5-pound weights seem to be plastic, although the orange ones are smaller/thicker chunks versus taller/thinner chunks on the blue.Size: The orange ones are more compact overall with uniform plate sizes throughout. Whether you are lifting 10 or 55 pounds, the diameter is the same. The blue ones start wider at the 10-pound size and get narrower as you add weight. The orange design makes it easier for certain movements as well as when you want to rest the weights on your calves during certain bench lifts. Length is basically the same for both models.Other Design Aspects: The orange one has two 2.5-pound weights that stack/nest in each other. The blue one has two thin 2.5-pound plates that rest next to each other. I\'ve occasionally had a hard time lining up the weights with the blue\'s 2.5-pound weights still in the tray, and I have a feeling that the orange one\'s design will be easier to align. The blue ones have a handy reference on the weight itself about where to put the slider for 2.5 or 5 pounds; the orange ones do not have any indicator on the weights. Without that indicator, you might find yourself occasionally forgetting where to put the slider for 0, 2.5, or 5 pounds on the orange.Shape: The orange ones are mostly circular, with a small flat bit on the bottom to minimize rolling. The blue ones have a more angular shape across the entire design. The blue\'s angular shape might make certain floor exercises easier.Overall, I\'d say that the orange design is a pretty good improvement in most areas over the blue. I definitely like the feel of the metal more than the plastic, and like the more compact size. There are little touches about the blue ones (like the 0, 2.5, and 5-pound indicator) that I\'ll miss. Honestly, though, whether you get the blue or the orange, you\'ll be happy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A worthwhile compromise for the money', 'author': 'Ryan D.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I have owned these for over 6 months now. I spent a lot of time searching for a weight set that would allow me to cover a wide range of my workouts without breaking the bank on a full rack of dumbbells. I watched hours of reviews on the different options from bowflex, nuobell, flybird, etc. Please know that for my specific use case, I needed a range of weight, but I am not a gym fanatic. I workout a few days a week, and I just needed something that had good value.Pros: for the price, this set does the job well. Ranging from 10lbs to 55lbs, it allows me to hit a good range of weight exercises. The adjustment of the weights is easy and straightforward, and the grip is metallic and etched with a good grip surface. It feels good in the hand, and you can rotate the weight upside-down without worrying about a weight falling off and hitting you in the head. The holder for the weight does a good job of keeping them solidly in place.Cons: the weight portion of the dumbbell is plastic, and you can see from my picture that the mold is not perfect. One of the 5lb weight rings on one of the dumbbells seems to have been press molded in a way where it doesn\'t sit flush with the rest of the weight portion. It is annoying and quickly became noticeable. The time it takes to adjust the weight is not "super quick" like you see with a Nuobell; there are a number of clicks needed to reach the specified weight, and the be honest, the separate little 5lb mini adjustment is kind of odd, but can be convenient if you need a bit more weight for a set. My biggest complaint is the fact that the base holder of the dumbbell is ambiguously labeled. The small adjustment for each weight is a 2.5/5lb adjustment left or right. There is no way to tell by looking at the dumbbell which one (2.5 or 5) is activated, and the base has a labeling system but does not tell you which side is 2.5 or 5lb active. So you have to pick up the weight to understand if you\'ve got one engaged over the other. And sometimes in the middle of a workout, that little ambiguity and having to pick up and put back down to get the right weight is annoying. That and the fact that you *have* to have the weight on the base in order to adjust any weight at all.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great all in one dumbell set', 'author': 'Jason Eng', 'rating': 4, 'content': "These work great. They do the job and obviously save on space vs having every single weight increment covered by these dumbbells.What I like the most is the increments of 2.5 and 5 in between. This helps people like me who like to go up in smaller increments.Obviously with it topping out at 55 lbs each, its not good for heavy lifting, but for me it gets the job done.The only down side is that when you want to change weight, you need to move at least 4 sliders. So if you need to switch mid workout, you'll have to pause for 10 seconds. Not the biggest thing in the world. Also, mine seemed to come with one dumbbell having an extra piece of plastic blocking the space between one weight and the other. Just needed to file it down to have smooth transition.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Finer Form Adjustable Dumbbells 5-32.5 LBs: Save Space with This Female-Friendly Adjustable Dumbbell Set. Go Up Or Down in 2.5 LB Increments with These Adjustable Weights, Sold as A Pair.
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wife wanted a more compact adjustable over the Bowflex', 'author': 'StrykEagle', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have the 552s and I personally love them, but my wife didn\'t like them. She wanted the more "traditional" feel of a dumbbell. She didn\'t like how, regardless the weight of the 552s, they felt awkward to her since they keep the same size throughout the entire scale of weights. So, I went ahead and bought her these Finer Form pair. I wasn\'t expecting too much from them, but they are quite surprisingly well made.Looks alone, they beat the 552s hands down. The 2.5lb increment of adjustment up to its max weight is a plus for her. I guess only time will tell how well these will hold up, but when it comes to functionality, price, adjustability, and compact footprint these Finer Form dumbbells are a great buy. Definitely a good addition to our home gym.One negative and it is a small one, they are slightly noisy. As in the weight plates clink and clank now and again. Ended up purchasing the 30lb ones as well. I love that I can combine weights from both sets to have more weight options (see diagram in photos for some possible combinations).‚ÄîORIGINAL REVIEW: February 15, 2021 (10lb dumbbells)I've been using these 10lb dumbbells for about 2 weeks and overall really like them!Pros:- Really beautiful design (maybe that doesn't matter to everyone but I'm a designer so that was a factor for me lol).- Grip is very cushiony which makes it super comfortable to hold, even for long workouts.
