title: Bundles
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Solid Choice for Home Workouts!', 'author': 'James Rushforth', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Cap Barbell 40-Pound Dumbbell Set, and I must say, I am thoroughly impressed! This set is perfect for anyone looking to add some weight training to their home workout routine.First off, the quality of these dumbbells is top-notch. The handles are sturdy and provide a comfortable grip, even during intense workouts. The weight plates are also well-made and fit securely onto the handles, so there's no need to worry about them coming loose.Another great thing about this set is the versatility it offers. With four 2.5-pound plates, four 5-pound plates, and two dumbbell handles, you can easily adjust the weight to suit your needs. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned lifter, this set has you covered.I also appreciate how compact this set is. It doesn't take up much space, so it's perfect for small home gyms or apartments. Plus, the plates are easy to store, so you can keep your workout area neat and organized.Overall, I highly recommend the Cap Barbell 40-Pound Dumbbell Set to anyone looking for a high-quality, versatile, and space-saving weight set for their home gym. It's a fantastic value for the price, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Don't listen to the negative reviews...", 'author': 'Mantis Toboggan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a long review, I hope I can keep your attention.First off, I want to tell you guys that Fedex Smartpost is the carrier for this item. I didn\'t have a problem with them, even though they delivered my dumbbells 2 days after the delivery estimate(can\'t complain, free shipping). Fedex Smartpost sends to the closest USPS, then USPS takes an additional 2 days to deliver. It seems like most people hate Fedex Smartpost because they take longer than usual("google fedex smartpost sucks" to see what I\'m talking about). I ordered these on 2-9-13 and they arrived at my doorstep on 2-16-13, so one week exactly, average time for free shipping. The dumbbells came packaged professionally and my case came in perfect condition, which I was very pleased about.I also ordered 60 pound db set from Lion Roar Fitness on 2-8-13, and as of 2-16, they didn\'t even start shipping so I ended up cancelling that order. They charged $20 for shipping too... I will NEVER even consider buying from LRF again. Just wanted to warn you guys about that. $20 for shipping AND they lag it? No thank you.These Dumbbell sets are a great investment, and I know they will last a long time. First of all, there is no toxic chemical smell the negative reviewers mentioned. Not even the case it came with. They clearly have gotten better with quality control. I read ALL of the negative reviews and took a chance with these, and I am glad I did. My bars are all nicely polished, smooth, and the weights and collars fit accordingly. There are 4 pieces of rubber stoppers that help keep these weights in place, 2 in the middle of the bar and 2 that are connected to the collars, which does an excellent job. When you lift weights, you should never "jerk" through your workouts, but instead keep good form with nice controlled movements. That\'s how my workouts are, and the weights have not moved, rolled, clanked, at all. The only time the collars roll out, is when I twist them to change weights. I even put all the plates on one bar(30 lbs) and the weights/collars were still in place. People say these are not the best quality, but what more do you expect from a set of dumbbells? Good finish on the plates with a clean tough metal bar, which cannot rip as some rubber grip bars tend to rip after tightening the collars too much. Carefully put the plates on, or you could scratch/chip off the paint. If you don\'t like getting callouses on your hands, I recommend investing in gloves. I don\'t feel a thing with gloves on and can enjoy lifting weights without getting blisters. If you have Fat Gripz(check my review for Fat Gripz), you don\'t even need gloves. Those rubber suckers will cover it, and give you a much better workout.I will buy additional plates for these soon but before you guys do as well, try adding Fat Gripz to the bars with your normal workouts. It will give your workouts more of a challenge, and you will see some good results in your forearm strength. I wish I knew about them when I wrestled in high school..Long story short, don\'t listen to the negative reviews. Keep yourself in shape and buy these already!Oh yeah, I forgot to mention that the bars + collars does not equal 5 pounds(unless you are weighing both bars and 4 collars together). So you get about 17.5 pounds each dumbbell. The description states that they weigh 5 pounds but it\'s half. The case it comes with is about 5 or 6 pounds so that\'s where they kind of trick you. So if you do the math, 4 x 5lbs plate + 4 x 2.5 lbs plate + 2 x 2.5 collars & bar = 35 lbs + 5 lbs case = 40 lbs db set.. I\'m not going to knock off a star for that because I bought these knowing this information. We can always buy more plates, so no big deal.Thank you for reading my long review. I hope this helped make your decision in building a better body! Train hard, train safe, and good luck :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Affordable and heavy.', 'author': 'Mike', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a great set of weights for someone looking to get started working out at home. It's not perfect, but I'm not really sure that the imperfections matter for a product like this. So let's get the negatives out of the way first:- Yeah, they smell, as others have noted. It's nothing strange -- if you've ever been to a gym before, you already know this smell. They're metallic with additional chemical odors. For a basic sniff test, you won't notice much. But the smell does begin to accumulate after a few days in cramped quarters, so maybe they're not the best choice for a bedroom or tiny apartment. I suspect the smell will dissipate in time, but I don't know how long that will be.- The carrying case is cheap molded plastic, and there's a good chance yours will arrive with one or more corners dented. It's fine -- the cases aren't meant to be display items. They're meant to store the weights, and to give you a convenient way to lug them around when needed.- It's obvious that corners were cut in some regards. The rubber cushions on the bars are cheap, and could possibly fall off and get lost if you aren't attentive. Likewise, the rubber cushions within the screw-on collars can fall out. It's not a big deal if they do -- you just stick them back in. But these are obviously not advanced equipment. They were designed to be cheap and functional.That said, I don't think any of these cons really matter. Weights have one purpose in life -- to weigh something. Your muscles can't tell if you're holding twenty pounds of expensive metal or cheap metal. This particular set is very well priced, and they feel safe and sturdy. You don't have to worry about the collars wiggling loose, and they're adjustable down to 2.5 pound increments. I snagged two sets, giving me greater versatility and the ability to put more weight on a single bar if needed. For the price, this is a perfect way to get started with a cheap, space-saving home gym.Weights don't need to be pretty and fancy to work. They just need to give gravity something to act on. You can buy fancier equipment than this, but it's not clear why you'd really want to.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Honest review addressing common concerns...', 'author': 'Bleacherbum95', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When originally considering this product I was very concerned with the number of negative reviews/comments that people were leaving about these dumbbells. After deciding to take the risk, I felt the need to write a review since I believe that the negative reviews are overblown and overly dramatic. I will hopefully address the main concerns that you as the prospective buyer are having while considering this product. If you don\'t care about the details I have a TLDR at the bottom =)1. Smell: These weights do not smells like daisies; no dumbbells do. However, the smell is NOT as bad as people are saying. I would highly recommend leaving these weights outside (and/or washing them) to let them air out and control the smell, but it is not immediately overpowering. When the package arrived I slowly opened the box waiting for a toxic stench to explode out, but it never came. It was not until I lifted a plate out of the box that I noticed the smell people mentioned (the chemical applied to prevent rust), and it was not very strong. I left mine in the garage to air out and noticed a slight change in the smell of the garage, but nothing extreme. I would certainly keep them out of the house to be safe, but for $40 a quick wash or airing out was worth it to me.2: Quality: If you are looking for professional dumbbells that are made of top quality materials then look elsewhere. But if you are looking for a solid set of starter weights, this is your product. I will say that the first time I removed a collar a small piece of metal broke off, but it did not affect the functionality of the piece. Also, I noticed someone mentioned that the collar lets the weights slide...this was incorrect in my experience. The collars seem to hold the weights snugly in place, so there should be no problems there. The quality is by no means great (unbeatable for the price though), but it is good enough that I trust it will last and serve its purpose.3. Case: I saw a few people talking about how the case broke easily. The case seems fairly sturdy if it is treated well. A case breaking or not will depend on your delivery man. The weights are packaged very well inside a few boxes (Amazon ships it out in an excessively large box), and in my experience there were no cracks. The sliders to keep the box closed seem pretty lame, but I\'m one of those people who isn\'t going to sweat it if the case breaks.I hope I covered the main concerns that most people were having. My honest review of this product is that this is unbeatable for the price. $40 with free shipping (mine came in 2 days) is great, and these are exactly what I was looking for. And NO I was not paid for this review and think Amazon should be ashamed of including paid reviews.TLDR: Does NOT smell that bad (easily fixed), decent quality, best bang for the buck for somebody looking for starter dumbbells.UPDATE 1/25/14: I now have two sets of these (it was cheaper than buying weight individually), and they are holding up great after over a year and a half of use. I\'ve noticed the collar shifts slightly when you get over 30lbs, but never enough that it\'s a problem. Be confident in purchasing these as starter weights.UPDATE 7/31/16: My original bars are still going strong. The collar shifting still happens on occasion, but not to the point where it interferes with my workout. I\'ve purchased additional plates for it and added them just fine - any 1" plate should fit just as well as the originals. So these have held up strong for 4 years...zero complaints here. One thing I forgot in the original review - you may want some lifting gloves. The metals isn\'t forgiving on your hands, so if you don\'t want big calluses, invest in a cheap pair of gloves.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Adjustible Weight Set', 'author': 'Lumbre', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First of all, let\'s get the smell part clear. Yes, it smells. It smells similar to the stuff you find in the tire/automotive aisles at Target/WalMart/other stores. Yes, it can be a bit strong. Let it air for a day and put a dryer sheet in the case when you close it. Problem solved. If you\'re picky on having your home smell like candles or something, these are not for you. If you don\'t even notice the smell of a gym when you\'re in a gym (or aren\'t the quickest to pick up on smells), then you\'re fine. Also, I think it\'s the box that smells, not any of the paint.Pros:*It is easy to add/remove weights. Just unscrew the collars, remove/add weights, screw collars back in. You can do this while resting in less than a minute.*You can add your own weights. When you outgrow these, you can add your own weights (doesn\'t have to be the same brand). Any generic 1" weight will do.*When I bought these, they were awesome for $40. Under $1/pound if you count the different combinations of weights you can do and that you can add more later.*Cheap compared to buying individually.Cons:*Slight bump in one of the corners of the case. No big deal. Contents inside are fine. Just an aesthetic issue.*Smell. As addressed above, it can be a bit overpowering, but just take the time to let them air out. Some people also do fine by rinsing them.*They\'re not neoprene.Notes & Thoughts:*A lot of people complain about the default California warning added to this set. Seriously, California is overprotective. Drinking dozens of gallons of water is known to cause death. If ingested, gasoline can destroy your organs. Too much sun can give you cancer. They have these warnings on a ton of things for sale in California. Something containing nickel, for example, automatically gets this warning. If it were more serious, more states or the entire country would place a warning or they would be getting sued for giving people cancer (it\'s not like lawyers are exactly shy).*The handles may be a bit too textured for some people, especially those with delicate hands or buying more weights. In that case, maybe you should buy weight-lifting gloves. For those who don\'t mind getting scuffed by sand or falling hands-first on pavement, you\'re fine. If anything, I shift my hands around on the bar which varies up my routine a bit.*People say it\'s a good starter set. I just started a serious workout routine and have had this for a month. I see myself having this for years.*A few have complained that the weights aren\'t exact. The bar doesn\'t seem like 5 pounds, but when I weight myself with one of my 20 lb. dumbbells, I see my weight increase by 19.8 or 20 (my scale goes in intervals of 0.2). It\'s close enough for me. They may shift a small amount after a 30 minute workout to where you can hear a slight clunk. Just retighten them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing quality', 'author': 'John carter', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Everything came double if not even triple boxed and wrapped and had stuffing on the original box all the weights came individually wrapped there was no chemical strong smell with my set (105lb) pair they just smelled new nothing that made me gag or was to strong as far as the mechanics it seems to work perfect they hold still while I do chest dumbell flys with 35lbs on each only time will tell but as of now extremely happy don‚Äôt listen to the review also if you want to add plates to this set make sure there 1.14 or bigger 1inch plates won‚Äôt work also I personally love the diamond pattern grip but if your not used to lifting without gloves your going to have to break your hands in or get some gloves me personally gives me more grip I love it it does not feel like it‚Äôs digging in my skin like others said overall good product for the price can‚Äôt beat it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Nice dumbbell bars', 'author': 'RY', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I liked the dumbell bars. While most iron free-weights sell for around $2/pound (as of the fall of 2022), this set is much more affordable,The price for it does seem to vary wildly day by day. I paid $77 in October 2022 and see that a month later, it is selling for $65. But I‚Äôm not complaining since it‚Äôs a steal at either price.I bought 2 sets so I‚Äôd have a pair of dumbbells.The dumbbell bars and threaded, star-shaped end nuts are nicely made. The chrome coating seems thick and durable. And because the threaded nuts have black rubber washers on the side that makes contact with the weight plates, they tighten securely and stay firmly in place when in use. Other sets I‚Äôve used did not have the rubber washer and as a result, would loosen up while doing reps. That‚Äôs both annoying and dangerousThe rubber washers do tend to fall off when removing the nuts from the dumbbell, but that is easily rectified by putting a few drops of superglue in the groove in the nut into which the rubber washer sits.The weight plates themselves are a little less precisely made. For instance, I weighed my 5 lb plates on a postal scale and discovered they range anywhere from 4.75 lbs to 5.25 lbs. That‚Äôs not a big deal most of the time but you can definitely notice an imbalance if you inadvertently end up with 8 of the heavier 5 lb plates on one hand and 8 of the lighter plates on the other.To avoid that from happening, I used a silver Sharpie to mark the plate that are over 5 lbs and keep them in a separate pile so I can distribute the weight more evenly into the bars.Also, while the clear-coat on the plates seems heavy duty enough, you do need to check for rough edges. That goes for the dumbbell bars too. I had to file down a couple of spots to avoid getting metal splinters in my hands.Last but not least, the dumbbells I received have a diameter of 1.18 inches (or 30mm) and the weight plates have holes that size. This means any plates you may already have with 1 inch (25mm) holes will not fit onto these bars. Likewise, while the plates from this set will easily go onto a 1 inch bar, they can flop around a bit. In practice the latter is not a problem as long as you can tighten down the bar-end clamps. I use my 30mm plates on a 25mm curl bar without issue.In short, while there may be some compromises involved, at these prices, this dumbbell set is one of the best deals out there.Follow up note written on April 11, 2023:I‚Äôve been using my weight set several times a week for about 6 months now and all parts are holding up great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really like these', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed a set to get started with. It‚Äôs hard to make it all the way to the gym...and if I‚Äôm watching tv I can just pick these up and do a few curls every now and then. Really helpful. They are easy to switch weights in and out, and if you are cool with doing one arm at a time then you could add all the weights on one and basically have a dumbbell that goes up to nearly 50 pounds (minus the 4 pound bar), without having to spend all the money of buying 2, 50 pound dumbbells, which would cost twice as much. Instead just do one arm at a time and save half the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Customer service was decent', 'author': 'Nick', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'For quality. Thankfully, customer service was easy to contact. After a couple of days, I recieved a reply asking for the details of my purchase, and after that I recieved my missing handle promptly.4 stars for good customer service.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Set, Great Value', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As others have mentioned, these are shipped in three boxes of weights at 50# each, and one narrow box that holds the stand. title: Yes4All D1IB4
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best investment', 'author': 'Twark Main', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is the best investment a guy can make. To be able to lift weights at home is life changing. I had this exact set (60 lb set), lost it in a move, and just replaced it.IMPORTANT: Watch the plates as you lift during and between sets. The collars can shift, weight and motion of the plates can relatively quickly come off and liable to drop a plate during a set, which could crush your foot or face depending on what you're doing. I had the 8lb plate fall off while doing standing dumbbell curls and thank goodness it missed my foot by a few inches. Just always be looking at the collars AS you lift, and tighten them back between sets. I believe it is partly because the threads on the bars are sparse and wide; a more finely densely threaded bar and collar design might prevent slipping (in case manufacturer is reading this). The little tightening screws on the collar are not engineered well enough to handle the plate weight and motion. It is a risk to use these dumbbells but IT IS WORTH using them despite the risk. Be watchful and frequently tighten collars between sets or even during a set of you need to. Keep Lifting!!!!Much more versatile and less expensive than buying various fixed weights.60 lb set includes:2x dumbbell bars at 4lb each4x 8lb plates4x 5lb plates4x screw on collars to secure the weights onto the barsKeep in mind each bar weighs 4 lbs, so if you load them evenly, you'll have, in each hand:2x 8 lb plates = 16 lbs2x 5 lb plates = 10 lbs1x 4lb bar = 4 lbsTotal for each hand = 30 lbsKeep in mind you can increase the weight too if you want to do some workouts with just one barbell, which is perfectly fine. Ie load a dumbbell to 56 lbs and just do one arm at a time, or for heavy tricep press etc.The set came very well packaged in tight fitting foam, nothing sliding around, and in perfect condition (see photo).The box also has a glossy instructions pamphlet which shows a a good variety of exercises, in case you are just starting out as a weight lifter.This is a very well made set, high quality steel bars and quality plates, although the plates are traditional and don't have rubberized coating, so I suggest getting some good dense rubber or foam floor mats if you're using these on hardwood floor to avoid dinging the wood or maybe even if on concrete if you're worried about clanging when you set them down (or just put them down gently and don't just drop em like some people do at the gym).This 60 lb set is absolutely perfect and fine for anyone from a beginner to a fairly fit man, especially considering you can load one bell higher than 30lbs and alternate arms.You can always buy more plates to stack on the bars if you get to that point, but if you have this set as well as a barbell set and power cage, you are SET to get RIPPED. (With decent food intake lol).For the price, quality, and versatility this is THE dumbbell set every man should own.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars I couldn't be happier.", 'author': 'Old School', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm a little bit baffled by some of the negative reviews for this product so I want to comment on the complaints posted. I have had absolutely no metal shavings come off the bar. Some people have complained that metal shavings and splinters were all over the floor where the dumbbells are used and even got splinters in their hands. Maybe the product has been improved but I haven't experienced any such problems. Second, others have complained that the paint has come off the plates. Again, I haven't experienced that at all and, even if I did, I wouldn't care. After all, they're just weights. But the paint on mine has not fallen off at all. In my opinion, complaints about chips and dents on the surface of the plates is trivial even if there are chips and dents. Again, we're talking about weights. Also, I haven't had problems with the spin-on collars with the exception of one slightly loosening when I was doing fast curls but I simply tightened it down a bit more and I haven't had any problems since but it really wasn't a problem then because it only loosened slightly and wasn't anywhere near the end of the bar. It just caused a slight rattle which I haven't experienced since simply tightening the collars down a bit more.If there was one thing that I could criticize - and this is VERY MINOR thing - it would be that I would have liked the bars (where your hands go) to be slightly larger because I have large hands. But I must stress that this is such a minor thing that I was hesitant to even mention it. If I thought it was a problem, I could easily rectify it but it's not worth bothering with.I just ignored complaints by reviewers who complained that they didn't get the total pounds for EACH dumbbell that was listed for the set. They simply didn't read the description carefully and they should not rate a product poorly because of their own mistake, IMO. I bought the 60 lb. set and the description makes it perfectly clear that it makes two 30 lb. dumbbells.These dumbbells are very well made. I was hesitant to order them because I always read the negative reviews for products and there's a higher than normal number of negative reviews or if some of those reviews report serious problems, I generally don't buy that product but I couldn't be happier with these dumbbells. They're a great value. I bought the 60 lb. set but also ordered four 2 1/2 lb. disks and four 1 1/2 lb. disks.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Value with deception', 'author': 'Eric M. Hough', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Product is well made. A good price but deceptively marketed. You are not actually getting 60lbs of weights. You get 52 lbs of weights with the spinner ends and dumbbell bars making up the extra 8lbs. Minor paint wear was rubbed off on the iron weights upon arrival and the packaging was heavily tapered to prevent the contents from breaking free.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cost efficient', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great basic dumbbell, great price and the quality has exceeded my expectations.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars About $1.00 per pound best deal around', 'author': 'Brandon', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is in response to reviews I read prior to purchase. I would say that I believe this company has addressed the issues that may have happened. My shipping was great. Intact and easy to handle while being heavy. Came with a warning for sharp edges but I feel none however keep reading for more on that. My locks screws go on smooth. Machined well. They did come a bit loose after 2 hours of trying out different lifts but I think it is just because I am a weak loser who can't screw things down properly. Nothing some pliers won't fix or... Now that I have a sweet adjustable bench, gloves, and these weights I will screw down anything once i am jacked. Speaking of gloves...grip on these would make a gorilla cry so gloves are neccessary (1 star off because the grip is harsh with heavy weight). Paired with res bands and a adjustable bench it seems I have a great setup in very little space. I am happy with these weights to get started.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic quality and craftsmanship !', 'author': 'Gary Stern', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The overall transaction was flawless. The quality of the items was excellent and I would recommend that you do business with this Seller if they are selling an item you are looking for', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent weights at a good/great price', 'author': 'Jared Hunsaker', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'During the COVID quarantine madness I decided to invest (modestly) in my own personal workout equipment. I don\'t need the high-end stuff, just something functional and affordable. These adjustable dumbbells DEFINTELY meet my needs! I picked up my first set (40lb) when I started a new exercise routine and quickly purchased another set (50lb) to increase my options. Nearly a year later and I have since also purchased the 60lb set as well as a few other plates from different manufacturers to further increase my options.Sturdy - These bars and weight plates have been sturdy for me with no problems (I haven\'t pushed them to the limits by dropping them yet... hopefully it won\'t come to that!). I have loaded them up to 50lbs to a single dumbbell and haven\'t noticed any stress on the bars.Variety - The flexibility of being able to add or reduce weight on each bar is amazing! Plus, these bars work great with other brands of weights with a 1" hole, so I have been able to shop around for more weight plates to add to my collection and they all work as well as the name brand weight plates.Comfort - The grips are not as nice as some of the REALLY high-end dumbbells, but they are similar to what you would find in a name brand gym. I use weight-lifting gloves and there is no problem with the comfort.Overall, an EXCELLENT choice for a low-cost, build as you go consumer who wants to get into lifting without dropping $300-$500 for adjustable dumbbells.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 26, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best youll get for the price!', 'author': 'Edward Gonzales', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Gets the job done. . Not perfect but great budget dumbells . Id suggest athletic tape around handles for a better grip. And make sure twist locks and Hella tight.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Best weight for dollar', 'author': 'Michael S', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I have 0 reference point, I have never been to a gym in my life. I have never lifted a dumbell in my life. I want to lose weight, but you lose muscle and fat. So I am gaining muscle to off set muscle loss. So I am not a gym bro drinking protein trying to get big. This means my knowledge is limited, but it also means I think my perspective is that many people wanting a cheap set are also coming in with.-It is easy and fast to change weights. I read so many reviews on the easy adjustable bells and often people say it makes working out easier if you can change fast. Well for me I can add and remove weights in 2min, which is usually within my rest time anyways. If I am changing workout, then who cares how long it takes to change the weights, time and rest are now irrelevant I can do it hours from now If I want.-Tons of custom weight sizes. I have had insane gains, probably regular rates, but I didn\'t expect it this fast. I went from a bench press of 20lb each are to 60lbs each arm in 5 weeks. I had to buy 15lb weights, 1.25lb weights, and 2.5lb weights. This means every single workout I can increase my load. I don\'t have to weight to get another 10lbs in, I can get as low as 2.5lb. From my research the fastest way to muscle growth is decent reps at as much load as possible, so if I can add more today I will.-Noise, I heard they were loud on YouTube channels and in 2 reviews. I notice they are loud to drop of course, but like it is weight. No matter what dropping mass is loud. As for the sound of adding weight, it sounds clanky and metalic, but I can say with my thin walls I can\'t hear it in another room of my trailer. So I am not disturbing family.-Handle, I don\'t like the knurling (pattern of metal). I am a softboy, but my issue is less the texture and more the handle size maybe. I have a unisex small for gloves (slightly smaller than men\'s small) The bar digs into my hand still despite small hands and it hurts to do dumbell benchpresses. It is not unbearable, but I do wear gloves now to help distribute the weight. Also the Knurling is still not amazing. It is a cheap bar I don\'t expect great Knurling so gloves also give grip. I wear Helix armor gloves(free from work)- 1" weights work on this. I bought 1.125" and 1". 1" fit and still have some wiggle, 1.125" have too much wiggle imo, but is what this product ships with.-Biggest issue is the nut is not tight on there. I can Twist as hard as I want, that nut on the end might come lose. So Check every time you pick them up if it is tight. I read a few reviews saying this is fine cause you check anyways and should always with all sets. I disagree, I do agree on checking, but not that it should still occur and that somehow makes this ok. It is not. I can\'t lift much with biceps, and suck at growing them so far. So lifting these onto my chest for a dumbell benchpress is hard. SO I slide them, well the weight is tight against the tight nut so when I slide the round weight it transfers its energy to the nut turning the nut, making the nut go lose. A few times I had to cancel a set to place the weights down and tighten them again.4/5 because they work and are massively cheap. I wont 5/5 as I do think they can be dangerous if you are not cautious and no matter how cheap a product is to its competitors I can\'t 100% recommend something that may cause injury. I will say if you are going to check the nut every time then go for it, great deal.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars pretty good for the money honestly', 'author': 'g', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'the quality for this product is well worth your money however the handle is kinda uncomfortable and leaves grooves on your skin it‚Äôs annoying but easy to avoid', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Dumbbell Set, Rack and Mat', 'author': 'The Ghost Man', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's hardly ever that I leave a review of a product I've purchased on Amazon but I believe this one more than merits it. title: SNODE Weight Dumbbell Set for Women, 5 lb Adjustable Dumbbell Set of 2, Hand Weights Sets for Women, Dumbbell Adjustable Weights 2lb 3lb 4lb 5lb, at Home Workout Equipment
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Saves space!', 'author': 'C. Baines', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love the idea of the adjustable weights. One set replaces several!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cool', 'author': 'Xiaodongli', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A very good fitness equipment, suitable for exercise and fitness at home. The design is clever.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good value, fast and easy to change weights', 'author': 'patticake', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I\'m rehabbing my shoulders after healing from torn rotator cuffs, and to do that, I needed very light weights that I wanted to increase just a tiny bit at a time as increasing more has caused me to re-injure. I found these SNODE Weight Dumbbell Set for Women cost less than similar sets, so I grabbed it.These look just like the pictures, and they come surprisingly well packaged in fitted foam. They have no smells or issues. I found the dumbbells comfortable to hold, and after getting the hang of it, it\'s very fast and easy to add and subtract the weights. They feel pretty plasticy, but then they are plastic. The weights themselves and the actin of the buttons doesn\'t feel very robust to me, but for the price and from the pictures, I wasn\'t expecting them to be.I put the parts on a scale; the handles weigh 2.12 pounds, and each "weight" weighs in at .79 of a pound, a bit heavier than the half pound each one is marked. That means with two of them on a weight, instead of adding a pound, you add just over a pound and a half. It\'s not a problem, just something to be aware of.These are just what I needed to rehab my shoulders after injury. They\'re not heavy enough to build muscle with unless you\'re a beginner, but they\'re perfect for rehabbing after injury, and the lightness makes the a good option for someone who is frail or has been bedridden to work with. While they\'re not the most robust weights I\'ve owned, the price is right.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars good', 'author': 'Xristina üá∫üá¶', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good dumbbells that are easy to add weights onto- they click into place when you align them. Pretty sturdy and easy to use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect space-saving, adjustable dumbbell set', 'author': 'blue eyes', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is the perfect set of lightweight adjustable dumbbells for anyone who's older, just starting out lifting, after an injury/during physical therapy, or someone using lower weights with any of the current fitness programs that are designed around doing lighter lifting while stretching to develop longer, leaner muscles. Each dumbbell can be adjusted from 2-5 pounds and changing the weight is as easy as pushing the orange locking mechanism and then sliding each 0.50 pound interlocking weight out. The orange locks are secure (they are not going to get accidently moved and the weights are not going to randomly fall out), but they are relatively easy to push and even someone with moderate arthritis should have no issues. For me, this weight set replaced all of my individual small 2-5 pound dumbbells, making my space less cluttered. Was worried what would show up after seeing some bad reviews across all brands. They showed up on time & in perfect shape. As far as the mold release smell peeps complained about, I washed them with dishwashing soap, dried them right away & then used some 91% alcohol on the grip bars to remove any residual oily chemicals. 5 minutes & no smell or residue. These all look like they\'re made in the same shops so the price variance on amazon between the different "brands" discourages me from being brand loyal. Shop around & price compare but don\'t wait if you find some around $1/lb. I did look for used ones locally but people are still asking new prices for used dumbbells, anywhere form $1.30-$2/lb similar to Amazon.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I wanted', 'author': 'MdniteEagl', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered the pair of 20-pound weights for an exercise and diet program my doctor wants me on. I read the other reviews about people who only got one when that weight was supposed to be a pair, but I also ordered directly from Amazon, and once getting the shipping notice, saw the weight was 40.5 pounds, so I knew I was getting two. When they arrived, my UPS guy jokingly asked "what the heck did you buy?" because the relatively small box was that heavy.When you first open them, there\'s a pretty noticeable rubber smell, but that dissipates over time. They have a nice comfortable feel and a no-slip grip - perfect for doing repeated-reps curls or vertical lifts without worrying about dropping. These weights are well constructed, there\'s no signs that they will separate in the future. In addition to the program my doctor wants, they\'ll also help build up arm and upper-body strength for shoveling, in case we have a winter like the last one.These weights are not the cheapest, nor are they the most expensive, but they are a great value for what you get, and worth the purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love these', 'author': 'Heather', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Came exactly as shown', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars These Are A Good Value & Very Sturdy', 'author': 'Dusty D', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The bars are a bit small in diameter, & the rubber coating is smally for a while after removal from the plastic, but overall they are very good.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars buy', 'author': 'IVA', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'my son loves this set and thinks that it is everything you need to do a nice workout. he is only 15 and just started like less than a year ago to lift weights, and he is very happy with it. great buy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ease Of Use', 'author': 'Lorey Smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was the perfect addition to my home gym.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Best adjustable weight I've had so far.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Misleading Description *updated*', 'author': 'Logan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Order only comes as the adjustable dumbell (single) without the barbell or kettlebell attachments. Product does seem to be good quality which is the only thing saving this from a 1 star review.A customer service representative reached out to me and was able to fulfill the correct order. Product is still good quality. Thank you!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Adjustability works really well, but not quick to change modes from kettlebell to barbell, etc.', 'author': 'M. Burke', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have a set of 50lb Powerblock adjustable dumbbells that I use for workouts, but I wanted an adjustable kettlebell and a barbell. For the price, I wasn't expecting much but I am pleasantly surprised with this setup.It comes in a fairly compact box and the barbell needs to be assembled from three pieces (two bars and a joiner). I was concerned about the sturdiness of this, but it is locked together really well. The unit comes set up as a dumbbell and you need to reconfigure it for either the kettlebell or the barbell. The mechanism to set the weight works really well - you simply rotate the handle to select the weight. Once while I was changing weights, it started to get difficult to turn, but the instructions have a section on how to deal with that and specify not to force it - they show you how to reset the dumbbell. The markings reference the three setup options - barbell, dumbbell and kettlebell. It took a little getting used to before I could remember which was which, but I've got it now. Once you set a weight, you just lift it up and the plates are either attached or remain in the cradle based on what you picked.Switching between the modes isn't the easiest, so don't plan on being able to just change this up easily. It's not hard, but it's more involved than just setting a weight. There are magnetic pins that lock the handles into the weight ends. But since the cradles hold the weights into position, you need to remove the dumbbell from the cradles and remove the pins, then slide off the weight ends to change it up. You also need to modify the base, which isn't hard. The poles that hold the cradle ends just slip on and off easily, so you can easily turn it into a barbell or kettlebell cradle, but you need to set up the cradle and the barbell, kettlebell, etc. separately.The base could use a small set up in quality. It's fine as it is, but a simpler way to change modes would be helpful, and there's no rubber/anti-slip feet on it, so the base can slide around when trying to put the weights back in the cradle. A few rubber pads would help.The instructions are very clear and well written. Overall, I'm very happy with this set. I'll likely use it either as a barbell or kettlebell since I have the Powerblock set for dumbbells.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Dynamic weights easy to use', 'author': 'BINH NGUYEN', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Product had some sharp rubber parts that can cut your hand...weight parts may fall out if click is not locked in...but I love the product overall...', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So comfortable to use while exercising!', 'author': 'Lee Scott', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Transform your workout routine with these Soft and Safer Dumbbells, a perfect blend of functionality, safety, and comfort that promises to elevate your exercise experience to new heights. Crafted with meticulous attention to detail, these dumbbells are tailored to meet the diverse needs of fitness enthusiasts, providing a comprehensive solution for a fulfilling and effective workout session.The first standout feature of these dumbbells is their softer and cushioned design, ensuring that both your floors and your feet remain unscathed during intense workout sessions. The waterproof and rust-resistant properties further add to their appeal, allowing you to focus on your fitness goals without worrying about the impact of sweat on the equipment. This reliability and durability guarantee a long-lasting investment that will withstand the rigors of regular use.Safety remains paramount, as these dumbbells are constructed using high-quality materials that adhere to the same safety standards as those used for baby products. This emphasis on safety not only reassures users about the durability and sturdiness of the product but also underscores its suitability for long-term use, instilling confidence in the users' minds.The non-slip and ergonomic design of these dumbbells make them a joy to handle, offering a comfortable grip that enhances your workout experience. The compact size and manageable weight ensure hassle-free storage and convenient handling, enabling users to seamlessly incorporate them into their exercise routine without any unnecessary inconvenience.Furthermore, these versatile dumbbells serve as a dynamic tool for various exercises, including but not limited to arm rows, squats, chest presses, bicep curls, walking, jogging, and yoga. This adaptability amplifies the effectiveness of your strength training regimen, allowing you to target various muscle groups and achieve a well-rounded, full-body workout that caters to your specific fitness goals.Beyond their physical benefits, these Soft Dumbbells contribute significantly to your overall well-being, aiding in the sculpting of your arms, shoulders, and back, while simultaneously boosting stamina and accelerating your metabolic rate. With their multipurpose functionality, they serve as an invaluable asset for activities such as balance training, weight management, aerobics, cardio, yoga, and strength building, making them an essential addition to any fitness enthusiast's arsenal. I love them!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Similar to products twice the price elsewhere.', 'author': 'Alan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I ordered this item after seeing a similar set at the warehouse club that was over $400, and it did not disappoint. The weights are assembled easily after actually reading the instructions, and this set is far more compact than just having weights spread out around the basement. It was pricey to me, but when compared to the cost of weights locally, it's cheaper than the average.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good product', 'author': 'u107rick', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The product is eary more fun', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Missing pieces', 'author': 'Iris C.', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I love the concept and the product, but I am missing the required parts to convert it into the barbell. title: Adjustable Dumbbell Set, Hand Weights Set for Women/Men, 3.4lb, 5.7lb, 8.0lb, 10.3lb, 12.6lb Adjustable Weights Dumbbells Set for Home Gym Strength Training
reviews: [{'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice set of dumbbells for light work outs but limits range of motion', 'author': 'CC', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Not a bad set of interchangeable dumbbells for the price for non heavy use. This set would be great for light workouts with light weights. Doing push ups on top of the dumbbells as advertised is not recommended, even for a petite person. The weight and pressure of doing push ups actually pushes the weights out of place. Also, if you add all the weights, you cannot get the full range of motion for movements like overhead dumbbell presses. The weights click in and out of place, but they don't seem too sturdy. If you are more serious about lifting, there are better options out there. If you simply enjoy the benefit of lifting and are limited in space and not looking to go heavier than 13 lbs, these would work.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Adjustable Dumbbells!', 'author': 'Grant  Vande Zande', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Recently picked this up for my mom and dad and these work great. If you are looking for a great set of lowe weight adjustable dumbbells, pick these up!What I like about this item is how easy they are to use. Just simply adjust on the fly and you have 5 great options for lower weight exercises! I even used them a few times for shoulder raises and higher rep stuff and they are great! Very easy to grip and use and they look great too! Really pop out in the home gym with the color. Feel super durable and you can throw them around if you want too, they should have no problem!Nothing I dislike here!Great product and great price point here for these dumbbells, I would buy them again!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Press and slide to adjust weights', 'author': 'S. Marr', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Stylish color and unique weight swapping system.Here's the breakdown on weights. The bars weigh 1.1 lb each, and have one weight permanently affixed to each end for a total weight of 3.4 lbs to use at minimum. Each additional slide-on weight adds 1.15 lbs. I can add a total of 14 extra weights to one bar for a total 19.5lb at maximum. Four of the weights are end pieces do not allow more weight to be added onto them. Balancing all the weights between the two bars is 12.6 lbs. each.The outer material is a rigid plastic. To add a weight, line a new plate flush to the side and slide down from the top with white buttons visible from the top. The plates slide into a V-shaped groove and clicks into place. The lock is a plastic tab that sticks out about 2mm and fits into a notch on the added plate. Pressing the top button makes the tab recede into the plate and lets you remove the adjoining plate.Keep in mind that these thin plastic tabs secure these weights when upside down, so it's wise to always keep the buttons facing upward. Because of this weak point, I would not feel comfortable doing a full range of exercises. This is the only drawback I can find, but a single dropped weight could cause injury.The plates are square, so you can use these for deep pushups without them rolling away.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Work great', 'author': 'Angel', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this weight set that you can make lighter or heavier. I love that it came with different things you can do with the weights for your arms and your legs. It‚Äôs perfect and I use it almost daily. I‚Äôd recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Solid Weight Set', 'author': 'BF', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This weight set should prove to be very useful for exercise sessions where quick changes in weights are needed. The plates detach with an easy push of a button and adding them is just a matter of sliding them on, which means that changing weights takes mere seconds. The plates feel very secure when stacked and there is no fear of them coming loose or falling off.The square shape is nice to prevent rolling and can be used as a stable base if you want to do push-ups with them.I've included a photo of my girlfriend holding the weights to show size.Just a few negatives to note:1. Color. This product was supposed to be blue. Instead, it came in pink.2. Handle color. White handle will definitely get dirty quickly.3. No weight markings on the plates forces you to memorize what the weight is for each additional plate added.Additional word of caution. The plates do have sharp edges and I found myself getting pinched/cut when attempting to release a plate and remove it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ugnxery Adjustable Dumbbell Set Review', 'author': 'Brooke', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I want to first start this review by saying I received this item for free but that this does not affect my review or opinion of the item.This dumbbell set is perfect for what I was needing them for. I love that they are pink and adjustable. No complaints here.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Heavy duty adjustable hand weights', 'author': 'Moonlight ‚ò™Ô∏è', 'rating': 4, 'content': "These adjustable hand weights are pretty unique. You push a button to release a weight bar to slide , and then remove or add for desired weight. Make sure you hear the click to know it's securly attached. It's pretty slick.The one thing I'm not sure about is the tiny plastic piece used to make the attachment. There are grooves that keep these together also, but what if the plastic piece breaks~will that section come off unexpectedly? My husband doesnt see how it could even happen, he believes it all looks pretty secure and loves the weights.The other thing was, for me, the square design of the the bars scratched my hands. Again, my husband had no complaint about that. The shape will make it nice though to use on some floor exercises.All in all, this is a pretty nice adjustable weight set for the versatility and choice in options creating various weights. The set is a good value for the price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 12, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Versitile and Easy Weights', 'author': 'Chuck Minsker', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My wife has been looking to gradually increase the amount of weights she lifts and these dumbbells are a great solution. The grips are comfortable and the additional weights click on or off easily - no annoying pins or clamps to deal with. You just push a button and slide the weight on or off. They feel secure when she\'s lifting them, and my wife says, "They\'re also cute." They\'re also quiet - no clanking or rattling. Highly recommended!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice weights', 'author': 'NYSunshine', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded.
