title: Adjustable Dumbbells, 10-50/80lbs, 5pound Increments Quick-Lock Square Weight set for Home Gym Fitness
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love these dumbbells. Very solid and compact for an adjustable dumbbell.', 'author': 'Beef Rolex', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been using my Eisenlink dumbbells for over a month now, and I wanted to use them a bit before I wrote a review.I also own a pair of Powerblock Pro Exp with the 90lb expansions, but in the side-by-side photo, I only have 80lb on the Powerblocks so you can see the more efficient use of space with the Eisenlinks.I bought the Powerblock Pro Exp because I hoped the urethane coating on the powerblocks would make them less noisy, but the powerblocks rattle a ton when doing curls and the it feels like my hands are inside a pair of toasters. One time, with my powerblocks I worked to failure and put them down rather hard and broke the weight selector pin. It was in expensive enough to replace, but it's really kind of scary that a thin piece of plastic is holding 90 lbs together.I've looked at Ironmasters and Pepin dumbbells. These are similar to those two brands and, in fact, they really remind me of a dumbbell from a company called Hoist, which I believe was manufactured by Ironmaster and it had the similar side slot for adding plates without removing everything.(A lot of companies manufacture for other brands. Powerblock also makes dumbbells for Hammerstrength).What I like most about my Eisenlinks is 1) I admittedly like to try new things, 2) The price and 3) The relatively quick change. Not as fast a the Powerblocks, but definitely faster than my other screw-on adjustable dumbbells.One thing to note is the length of the handle.My powerblocks have a 5 inch long handle.My generic adjustable dumbbells have a 6 inch handleThe Eisenlink handle is a whopping 6.75 inches long. I think this is needed to provide enough room for the internal screw system. .This hasn't caused any problems but it does make centering the dumbbells important. If you tend not to center them, they will tilt when doing bench presses or curls. It's important to center them.I think that these are great dumbbells, and what would make me rate them even higher (if higher than 5 stars was possible) is if Eisenlink follow through on their plans to release a barbell system as well as an expansion to bring these up to 120 lb.I tested my Eisenlink handle with 90 lbs (I took 10 lbs off one of the dumbbells and placed it on the other) for single arm dumbbell rows and it was very comfortable. I would not place 90 lbs over my head without longer screws and the manufacturer doesn't recommend doing this either. So, please come out with longer screws. :)All in all, these are great. I'm a bit OCD, so the rattling fo my Powerblocks really annoys me when I work out. This rattle happens with everything from Bowflex dumbbells to Nuobells. With these Eisenlinks, they feel like a single piece of metal during your workout. There is no rattling at all.One of my screws did arrive a bit scuffed and chipped and there was some kind of adhesive goo on it. I used goo gone and cleaned it up. The chrome finish was a bit chipped where the screw faces the plates, but this was only cosmetic damage. It cleaned up fine and the scratches will eventually be joined with more scratches from regular use. Weights are going to get scratched up. As nice as these look in new condition, I look forward to putting many scratches on them over the years, and from the way they feel, I believe that I'll be using them for a long time.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Durable, simple, versatile, and good value dumbbells', 'author': 'Topdog-182', 'rating': 5, 'content': "All metal construction, so very durable. Simple design, so not quite as convenient perhaps as those adjustble dumbbells with dial or toggle type adjusting mechanisms; but I would counter that these more complex options have been often reviewed (in my research) as being sometimes unsafe overhead if improperly set; and sometimes that parts are more fragile because they are made of plastic. The Eisenlinks are still fairly easy to change up on the fly, tho I guess if your intending to change weight frequently, during a session, this might be too cumbersome for you. I like that this dumbbell design is quite compact and very solid, does not rattle, and finally, does not roll on the floor. I like that the individual plates are 5lbs each, and they provide a set of 2.5lb plates, so you can increase the weight in five pound increments. I dont like that he 2.5lb plates dont accept the 5lb plates' locking stubs, so have mount the 2.5lb plates in a specific orientation with the respect to the 5lb plates, making the assemblage a tiny bit more cumbersome to adjust. Finally, at about two-seventy-five for the pair, these were significantly cheaper than most other well rated adjustable dumbbells.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing value', 'author': 'Alex1224', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I looked at Nuobells, Snode, and Ironmaster, but only the Eisenlink met all my requirements:- No baseThe Nuobell and Snode require you to set the dumbbells in the base before adjusting the weight.- Reasonably quick weight adjustmentNuobell and Snode are the fastest. Ironmaster requires you to remove the screws before adjusting the weight.- No rattlingOnly Ironmasters and Eisenlink have zero rattling- Real dumbbell feelAll options feel solid- AffordabilityNuobell, Snode, and Ironmasters are very expensive. The Snode, in particular, requires magnetic weight plates to achieve adjustments of 2.5 lbs and 5 lbs, driving up the price considerably.I owned Powerblocks, and I really dislike the feel and all the rattling they make. I have also owned the previous generation Quick-Change dumbbells from Ironmasters, which have a similar design to the Eisenlink, so I knew what to expect, but the Eisenlink are superior and exceeded my expectations.The only observations are that they maxed out at 80 lbs; the knurling could have been more aggressive, and the handle is a bit long at 6.9 inches.Customer service is stellar. One dumbbell was missing one of the 2.5 lb plates, and they shipped it to me immediately. For the price, these adjustable dumbbells offer incredible value and will last a lifetime. I'm super happy with my purchase.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Decent.', 'author': 'Josh', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'While these are relatively cheaper than the competition, the machining and tolerances of the square weights could be better for the money. Overall recommended.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice Dumbbell-SINGULAR', 'author': 'Spread the Word', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I was sad when my son unwrapped 'these' for Christmas there was only 1, not a pair. I had no idea for that price it would only be one. My oversight. Seems like good quality, we shall see. He likes it, so we will just have to get another one eventually.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality seems good; all as promised', 'author': 'James Durand', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Bought two of the 80# adjustable dumbbells; work exactly as expected. Changing the weights it not going to be as quick as with other systems, so maybe not ideal if your workouts require quick adjustments. But they are solid, no rattle, feel very balanced, not awkward at all. Nothing really to break. Ideally you'd be able to add/subtract weight a bit quicker but that's the tradeoff for having this simple, reliable design.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Solid Product', 'author': 'Bill McClary', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Color me biased now that I own them, but I think these are superior to Ironmaster‚Äôs ‚Äî if‚Äôs essentially an upgraded version of the Ironmaster design. Does not require the side screws to be removed to adjust weight. Do wish they would offer a longer screw to allow for expanding weight capacity beyond 80 lbs ‚Äî perhaps they will offer that at a future time. As it stands however, seems to me the design can accommodate addition of plates up to 90 lbs without issue. The additional plates are available as a set of 4 on Amazon, and there is still adequate bite with the screw threads to allow for it. Do so at your own risk, but I am ordering a set for that purpose. Dumbells are solid when the screws are tight, no rattles ‚Äî feels like a standard dumbell. Handles are knurled but thicker and a little longer than I was used to (does not fit well into my Mad Spotters, but can still make them work). Adjusting weight is not as fast as Powerblocks or Nuobells, but does not take an unreasonable amount of time ‚Äî can use for drop sets without issue. Strong design ‚Äî all metal construction that does not roll, and will not break if dropped. Very reasonably priced. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre in the market for a product like this.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Defective Dumbbells with Questionable Customer Service', 'author': 'Nick N.', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I\'ve had these dumbbells for over 2 months now, and I\'ve had nothing but bad experiences with this and the customer service for the time being. I ordered the 50lbs and the 80lbs on the same day; the shipping ETA was a week - no problem; on the day of delivery, I received the 80lbs dumbbells and received a notification saying my expected delivery date for the 50lbs was going to be a delayed for the next day - no problem, I waited and still nothing. A few days go by and still no updates, and my order status goes from "shipped" to "preparing for shipment", so I contact Eisenlink customer service, their responses usually take a day as they are based overseas I think, and they told me, "There is now one 50lbs dumbbell in stock and 11 in transit. This is the last inventory for the near future." Seriously? That had not been the case on the day of the purchase because Amazon usually has a disclaimer if a product is low on stock, and even if it was, I was still charged for both of the dumbbells more than 2 weeks ago! So I go on the product page, which said there was 1 dumbbell left in stock and the same dumbbell was $40 more expensive, so I place the item in my cart and contact customer service about this and asked them if they could just ship that one dumbbell since I already have an outstanding order and instead of me having to pay an extra $40 increase in price, and I response I get is "After investigation to confirm that our system is working properly but the order is not paid, we will ship the order only after confirming payment with the buyer. If no valid proof of payment is provided within the payment verification period, the order will be automatically canceled by Amazon." There was no way that was true because the order for both dumbbells was placed and charged to my card on the same day! So I contact Amazon Customer Service, and they told me they would put priority on shipping this item out and reimburse me for the new item with the $40 difference once I repurchase the dumbbell. Can\'t argue, I did as they asked because I needed a second dumbbell ASAP and so the dumbbells arrived after a week with more problems‚Ä¶I opened both boxes on the same day, no damage to the box, everything was great. There were scratches, dents, and a bit of rust on the plates but that\'s inevitable due to shipping so I ignored it. The handle is a bit too long and may cause balance issues, and the knurling on it is almost nonexistent. I read through the manual to figure out how to properly change the weights and whatnot, and as I\'m taking the plates out, I realized the quality of the plates was getting worse and worse, especially on the 80lbs dumbbell, the texture of the plates were grittier with particles coming off, more scratches and rust and most of them had 2 small plates screws (round buckles) missing. I decided to weigh the plates and most fell within .1-2lbs, which is great, however, some plates were much worse, and more notably the handle, which is advertised as 10lbs each, one of them was 8lbs and the other was 7lbs, and the large screws, advertised as 2.5lbs each, are just 1lb. Odd, but I still used it, just not for any sort of pressing movement because it is a potential safety hazard without the buckles and it has been over 2 weeks since the purchase date without use, so I figured I\'d just return it if I had any issues.Later, I contact Eisenlink customer service and after some questions and pictures over a span of a week, they said they shipped out 6 small plate buckles, completely disregarding my request for a new handle. I didn\'t want to argue and the questions and responses would take longer so I agreed on it, and in two weeks, which was past my return period for the dumbbell, it arrived - and I installed them with an allen wrench like they advised, and everything was good.I treated the dumbbells with care, never dropped them, and always used it on rubber flooring; however, problems still persisted, rattling plates, black particles scraping off, and what I soon realized is that when you turn the round large screws to lock the plates in, it scratches the outer plates, which is always going to be the 2.5lbs plate, and the inside of the screws, and over time you\'ll need more turns to lock the plates in because it requires more grip.I never complained, however, a few days ago, as I was doing an incline chest press with 70lbs, I get up after my set and the large screw facing down loosens, and the plates slip out onto my thighs which caused me to drop the entire dumbbell onto my foot. 2 pairs of round buckles had come off the plates and my guess is it caused all the plates to slip out, and now I\'m left with an unsafe defective dumbbell and a bruised foot.The price is okay for these dumbbells but if you care for your safety and the longevity of the product you purchase, please go look for another pair of adjustable dumbells.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best deal on dumbells out there!', 'author': 'Brian A.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought a pair to try, figured I could return them if they weren't any good. I liked them so much I was going to order the extra plates. Unfortunately they were out of stock but found a deal on another pair of 50's.I had a few pairs of the Hoist and the old Ironmaster dumbbells but the newer design is much better. I ended up selling of all my hex dumbbells and only use these now.I know some complained about the handle but I like the fatter grip. If the handle is too long, cut a couple pieces of a pool noodle and that will fill the gap.Over all I give these a thumbs up!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value!', 'author': 'MikeH', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have no complaints. Thanks to reviews on YouTube, I made a wise decision with these.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: NUOBELL Adjustable Dumbbells Pair 5-80 lbs : the Adjustable Dumbbell Set to Replace 16 Sets of Dumbbells. Add Nuobell Dumbbells 80lb and Free Weights to Your Home Gym. Just Twist the Handle to Adjust and Start Your Exercise.
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 14 month review', 'author': '626', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'After 14 months of almost daily use I can honestly say I have nothing bad to say about this product. The price was steep coming in at just over $800 shipping (NOV 22) included to Hawaii but just the shear convenience of having 160lbs of dumbbells in my dinning room that takes up no more than a 3‚Äôx3‚Äô space is worth the cost. I was worried about the plastic parts that everyone was talking about that might break off and leave your dumbbells inoperable and upon first inspection of the dumbbells I was too but after continuous use I found it was nothing to worry about (also Nuobell sells parts if your break). If your a weight slammer and like to throw your weights back in the rack then you have a lot to worry about but if you take care of your equipment then this problem will go unnoticed. I recommend getting a rack like the one in the picture. This makes it easier to maneuver the dumbbells in and out of the holster. This rack seemed to me at first to be unstable because of just the one bar coming up from the base and it is a little wobbly but again after 14 months of use I have to issues with it.The weight change is still almost effortless and glides through the 5-80lb seamlessly with zero maintenance. There is a little slop in the weights a little rattle when using the dumbbells under 25lb but goes away when you use heavier weight. The only problem I‚Äôve come across now that I think about it was the kind of sharp edge digging into my forearm when doing over head Tricep extension. I just adjust my form and problem diverted.Not much else to say about these. They are sturdy, convenient and most of all reliable. My only major gripe is that I out grew these dumbbells hella fast because of the convenience of having them in literally arms reach rather than having to motivate myself to drive to the gym but I‚Äôd say that‚Äôs a good thing lol.Have recommended them to many and I recommend them to you as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent product and excellent customer support', 'author': 'Kappa', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have been using the adjustable 50 pound core fitness dumbbells for about 8 years now and never had issue with them, other than they are limited in weight to only 50 pounds. I got the 80 pound adjustable nuobells as an upgrade, and boy are they awesome. When I first opened the box one of the dumbbell cradles had a cracked plastic part that made it more difficult to rerack the weight. However, after emailing customer support, they sent out a replacement cradle to me that same day and at no charge, and it arrived after about a week. I won't dock a star for the item being slightly damaged out of the box because sometimes it happens. Now onto the dumbbells...Pros-The cast iron plates just look and feel awesome. No issues with the plates feeling insecure and the plates themselves are very durable.I love the handles! The steel grip with the knurling feels like an actual gym dumbbell.The 80 pound max weight is such a game changer for me. While 80 isn't quite enough for some exercises (chest press, db rows, shrugs), it is still enough to get in the work I need.Huge space saver and much more economical than getting 16 different pairs of dumbbells.Cons-Some connector parts of the dumbbell are plastic and only time will tell how they hold up.You can't just drop these. Although it seems fairly durable, you will most certainly break the plastic connectors if you are carelessly throwing them around. Not that I would drop them anyways, but you just have to treat them with respect. If you want dumbbells you can abuse and drop, then you need solid cast iron or rubber coated ones.This product is an absolute must have for any home gym. The price point is very high, but this is absolutely worth it.Edit: I have been using these for over a year now and they have held up flawlessly. I frequently use the full 80 pound weight and the plastic connector pieces are showing no signs of wear. Just treat them with respect and as long as you arent dropping them or aggressively reracking them, they will hold up fine. These are the best investment I have ever made in my home gym, they are worth the price!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love my Nuobell Adjustable Dumbbells - Fast and Efficient Shipping!', 'author': 'Jim', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. I recently purchased the 80 pound Nuobell Adjustable Dumbbells and I must say I'm very happy with my purchase! These dumbbells have exceeded my expectations in every way. First off the shipping process was incredibly fast and efficient. I placed my order and in no time at all, my dumbbells arrived at my doorstep.Not only was the shipping fast, but the packaging was excellent as well. The dumbbells arrived in perfect condition, with no signs of damage or wear.These adjustable dumbbells are an absolute game-changer. The ease of adjusting the weight is sweet allowing me to switch between different exercises.The build quality of these dumbbells is also top-notch. They feel sturdy and durable, giving me confidence that they will last for years. I appreciate the ergonomic design and non-slip grip, which is very comfortable.The versatility of the Nuobell Adjustable Dumbbells is impressive. With their wide weight range, I am able to customize my workouts to fit my individual strength and fitness goals. It's like having an entire set of dumbbells, all in one compact package.Overall, I couldn't be happier with my purchase of the Nuobell Adjustable Dumbbells. From their fast and efficient shipping to their outstanding quality and versatility, these dumbbells have truly exceeded my expectations. I highly recommend them!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent customer service', 'author': 'B.Goza', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The dumbbells are perfect, everything I expected for the price! One of the packages was damaged during delivery and UPS trying to jam the plates back in the box broke one of the dumbbell cradles. Reported to seller with pictures and received a new cradle within 5 days. Thank you!As for the dumbbells themselves they are excellent quality just as others said you should show them respect and now slam or drop them but honestly that SHOULD be common sense with any mechanical item. Very pleased to add this to my home gym. Adjustability is quick and easy, grips and comfortable and doing lifts feels just like they do with the standard bells I use at LA Fitness.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use but...', 'author': 'Jmdragon', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I like that i am able to get such a large range of weight from a single set of dumbbells. But the handle width is 4", just shy (1/2 inch) of being able to work with barbell attachments for more versatility. Also, because of the minimal handle width,i can see that being an issue for larger hands. The handles are flat (no issue so far), why not make them curved for better ergonomics? For the price i think they could have made them better.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice Product but cradle fragile. Will break if you look at it funny.', 'author': 'Thomas L.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Ordered via Amazon. Comes in 2 shipments .. about 2 weeks apart. First shipment via UPS was damaged. The cradle was busted up. Nuobell said it was a seller issue and to contact them. Amazon said a return was approved but, .. I did not feel like lugging 80-90 lbs of product to Amazon return place. I bought a replacement cradle. The dumbbells themselves are great! Just wish they would make the cradle better. As an Engineer, don't see what the biggie is.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars HUGE P.O.S Dumbells', 'author': 'Justin', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. SECOND EDIT: they replaced both handles and these terrible plastic pieces broke within a few weeks. I guess I learned a $900 lesson for everyone else. DO NOT BUY THESE DUMBELLS or anything else from this company.EDIT: Dumbells are now WORTHLESS. The selector doesn‚Äôt work at all, plates fall off while using, it so hard to turn at lower weights. They are $900 paper weights. Dont waste your money.The handle is nice and the dumbbell itself isn‚Äôt to big like some other brands. However, I have had these less than 2 months and spin weight selector is very difficult to move. Actually, most people would find it impossible to spin it‚Äôs so hard.Also, the half plate on the inside part of the dumbbell has fell off randomly since I have had them. You will move the dumbbell and a 5lb plate will randomly just fall offThey are hard to put back in their rack. It doesn‚Äôt just go right in like 90% or other brands. They have to be placed perfectly or they won‚Äôt go at all.Save your money and buy another set for much cheaper.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars They are the best adjustable dumbbells I have ever seen or used!', 'author': 'Claude Alexander', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'They feel like real dumbbells. They are tight and don‚Äôt have any play in them. They have a slightly sliced bottom so when you sit them down they don‚Äôt roll. When they are locked into place at a particular weight setting they are good to go. Two possible draw backs for some people. One they are expensive, but you get what you pay for and they only work and can be adjusted within the cradle they come with. Other people have said that those have broke. I have not had a problem. Others have also said you can‚Äôt slam them around without having problems. Why would you? If you can‚Äôt handle the weight don‚Äôt use it until you get strong enough. They come in a variety of color patterns. I think they are the bomb! Hope this helps.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Five Stars, minus Two Stars for bad paint job on two plates', 'author': 'Sarmi', 'rating': 3, 'content': "After reading A LOT of reviews on adjustable dumbbells, and also watching videos and reviews of different brands on YouTube, including Coop from Garage Gym Reviews (BTW, he gives great, honest feedback and has really thorough reviews), I concluded that the NuoBell 5 - 80 lbs adjustable dumbbells are THE best. And I whole heartedly agree - they are great! When I showed them to my workout partner (my son), he exclaimed, ‚ÄúHoly Cow!!! These are incredible! So easy! So solid! How do they even get these to adjust!?‚ÄùMine was purchased via Amazon and fulfilled by authorized US retailer Finer Form (NuoBell is a Swedish company that exports with a few authorized US retailers). Two separate boxes with different tracking numbers arrived 5 days earlier than expected, a big plus. While the outside of one box was slightly ripped / torn in the middle (see photo), and both boxes had damaged and crushed pieces of the styrofoam casing (see photo), the actual handle, dumbbell weights, and dumbbell holders were surprisingly not damaged (see photo). The potential for damage and is there and I recommend that NuoBell update it's packaging (e.g. REP fitness does an INCREDIBLE job packaging and protecting their products so they don't arrive damaged). HOWEVER, there is a manufacturing quality control issue, as two of the weight plates had their powder coated finish blistered, and when I inspected the plates, the paint flaked away (see photo) and now those weight plates are exposed and will likely rust (our home gym is indoors, but there is a lot of moisture / humidity in the air as we are just inland from the ocean). Thus, I took off two stars on this review, one for each weight plate, on an otherwise five star product.See photos of the two weight plates that had blistered paint. I am happy to update my review if Finer Form contacts me and arranges to replace the two defective plates.Here are many PROS of the NuoBell dumbbells:‚Ä¢ They feel like regular dumbbells. When you adjust the weight, it grabs another plate on the outside most section and expands in width size. Most other adjustable dumbbells (including the Bowflex) have a fixed cage and don‚Äôt change in width size, even if you are only lifting 5 lbs, so you are working with a large dumbbell all the time. Not with the NuoBell - you only lift what you need to lift. If you choose a weight in a 5 lbs increment, the NuoBell actually leaves the 2.5 lbs plates located in the interior closest to the handle, along with additional unused weight's in the tray. If you select in10 lbs increment, you pick up that interior plate along with the needed outside plates, and the unneeded plates stay in the tray holder.‚Ä¢ The weight plates are round, flat, and comfortable, with good surface area. This is important because at heavier weight settings for seated lifting, you will place them on top of your quads and kick up your knee to help get each dumbbell to your shoulders for any overhead lifts .‚Ä¢ The handles are comfortable and have the right amount of knurling ‚Äì not too aggressive that they‚Äôll rip your skin, but a nice medium amount that give you good grip‚Ä¢ The weight change mechanism / rod is metal (see photo). I believe some of the earlier reviews complained that it was made of plastic. This 2022 version that I received is metal ‚Äì that is good because you don‚Äôt want the plastic to break when it‚Äôs carrying 60-80 lbs of weight plates, and metal will last longer than plastic as long as you don't let things rust.‚Ä¢ It's simple and easy to adjust ‚Äì turn the handle with ONE HAND until it clicks and shows the next weight increment in the window. There is no need to adjust two settings per dumbbell (e.g. MX Select and Bowflex dumbbells), fiddle with pegs or bands (e.g. PowerBlock dumbbells), etc. If you like to do CrossFit, HIIT, or other similar exercises where a fast weight change is needed, the speed and simplicity of changing NuoBell weight increments is by far the best. My son and I left different weights when we work out together, and changing from his weight setting to mine is easy and fast - that said, we are also both fairly careful about placing the dumbbells back in the tray correctly (see below Con point).‚Ä¢ You can increase weight in 5 lbs increments ‚Äì quickly change to 5, 10, 15, 20 etc. up to 70, 75, and 80 lbs. That is the same range you‚Äôd get if you had individual, fixed weight dumbbells, but you‚Äôd need to purchase 16 Sets / 32 dumbbells, and that would take up A LOTof space, cost you easily 3 times the price of the NuoBells, and you‚Äôd need a large rack to hold 32 dumbbells. Not really ideal if you are a garage gym owner or have a small to mid-size home gym.‚Ä¢ You can add two pair of Platemate 1.25 lbs magnetic fractional plates to go up in 2.5 lbs increments for each dumbbell, such as 17.5, 22.5, 27.5, 32.5, etc (Platemate recommends not adding magnetic plates to less than 20 lbs, and the 15 lbs setting with the NuoBell is the minimum setting where you get a full plate that has the required 4‚Äù x 4‚Äù contact area for the magnet of the Platemate). You can attach the Platemates to iron or steel individual dumbbells, and now they have an R-3 PlateMate that connects to the handle of rubber, urethane, & non-magnetic dumbbells. The Platemates stick really well to the NuoBells (almost too well - it takes a good amount of effort to carefully remove the Platemate).Here are the CONS to the NuoBell dumbbells:‚Ä¢ Quality control failed and two of the plates had bubbled powder coating paint which flaked off, exposing the iron underneath, which will rust.‚Ä¢ Designed in Sweden, but like almost the majority of products, made in China (similarly, REP and Titan are designed in US, manufactured in China). Some folks (including me), like high quality strength training products designed and made in the US, such as Bridge Built, Sorinex and Rogue.‚Ä¢ The weight change indicator and holding aperratus is made of plastic. Not necessarily bad, but if you drop these, you might break the plastic. That said, almost all adjustable dumbbells that I researched before purchasing the NuoBells have the same warning ‚Äì DO NOT drop. If you are planning to train to failure with heavy weights and regularly drop your dumbbells after a set, you are best served with individual rubber dumbbells. Either way, even when training to failure, you should have a spotter to make sure you keep proper form, and to help if you are going to drop or other issue. Solve this issue of not dropping the NuoBells and damaging them by working out with a spotter. That is Safety 101 with weight lifting.‚Ä¢ Heavy, with both dumbbells totaling 160 lbs plus the trays for each. I don‚Äôt think you need to spend $260 on the NuoBell stand (a strong, small table / rack or reinforced wall shelf properly anchored to wood studs can work). I recommend having these stored at hip height so you don't have to bend down to pick these up, and it's also easier to place them carefully back in the tray.‚Ä¢ Speaking of which, these need to be carefully placed back in the tray with the male/female sections connecting properly (and some other reviewers complain that the male/female connectors are plastic - I don't really find that an issue if you are careful). This is a downside feature of pretty much all adjustable dumbbells (with the exception of the PowerBlock). I am assuming that if you are forking out $745 for the NuoBell pair, you are going to naturally be careful and take care of these babies. So this is more of a niggle than a con.‚Ä¢ Some other reviewers complain that they can't get these to place back in the tray correctly, rendering them inoperable. Again, one needs to be careful. Place the dumbbell back in the tray one at a time, using one hand, so you can use the other hand to move the weight plates that remain in the tray as needed to fit the dumbbell back in. If the dumbbell is at a high weight setting, work with your spotter, they can help to make sure you return to tray properly. At the lower weights (50lbs or less),I find that returning to tray by myself one dumbbell at a time and on occasion shifting the weights in the tray a works just fine.Don‚Äôt trust just my review, go to YouTube > Garage Gym Reviews and check out all of Coop & friends objective and honest reviews of home gym equipment, including a reveiwing a large range of adjustable dumbbells. Coop of GGR is a big fan of the NuoBells. I am too (other than the bubbled powder coating issue‚Ä¶ did I mention there‚Äôs an issue with their QC and powder coating?).‚Ä¢ These aren't appropriate for weight lifters who need lots of weight, train to failure, etc. For 99% of us that aren't professional body builders and need something appropriate for our home gym, these are great and save a lot of space. If you are in that 1%, you will be much better served with individual pairs of fixed dumbbells, and you can purchase dumbbells weighing more than 80 lbs per dumbbell.So buy these already if you are looking for a set of quality, simple to use, robust adjustable dumbbells. You won‚Äôt regret it, and you‚Äôll enjoy your workouts much, much more.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great adjustable dumbbells for home gym', 'author': 'Tom H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've had these for over a year now and use them at least three days a week, when I'm not traveling. I had built a pretty respectable home gym during COVID, but I was never happy with the dumbbells I had. I was a Marine until I retired in 2022 so maintaining the workout routine was important. Also, continuing to exercise in my new life as a civilian, and helping my son learn strength training to help with sports, is a goal of mine.I was using the spin-lock weights, which are OK for some things, but I hated them for doing heavier DB presses because you can't rest them on your thighs when starting or finishing. The thing I like about these, and the main reason I bought these instead of cheaper alternatives, is the fact the ends are flat and they get shorter as you lower the weight. Five to eighty pounds in 5-pound increments is also very versatile for whatever you are doing, and switching weights is very fast.I have no concerns about the durability during normal use. The mechanism seems as tight today as when I got them. Be aware, though, that these are not meant to be dropped like a set of rubberized 80s you would find at a gym. If you want to do that, then look elsewhere. You have to be careful not to go to complete failure during a chest workout.Overall I'm super happy with these and would highly recommend them.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: SNODE Adjustable Weights for Women Set of 2 with Free Weights 2-3-4-5 LB, Anti-Slip Grip, Hand Weights Set for Home Gym Workout (Pair)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Compact and they look great.', 'author': 'Paul Hemming', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are great lightweight dumbbells to keep stored in a small cubby, or under a table, away from prying eyes. But even if those prying eyes see them, they're not gonna be an eye sore.The weights are held securely by clips that keep them in place, and even a couple of falls to the floor haven't dislodged them. The material is of good quality, and should last for a good while, but I do wonder if the plastic clips that hold the weights could break if dropped the right way. But nothing to report on yet, I would of course update this review if such a thing happens.The weights are adjustable, but it isn't fast. So if you're using separate weights while doing a class driven workout, (like a beachbody class) then you may find yourself falling behind.But outside of those remarks, they're easy to use, durable, and look good. What else could you be looking for?", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars We love these!', 'author': 'Callidryas', 'rating': 4, 'content': "There's more evidence all the time that A) resistance exercise builds muscle, and B) that building muscle is a good thing. For everyone, at every stage of life. More difficult to do as you get older, (ahem) but nonetheless, good. And regular exercise just makes me feel better.But the truth is I never thought much about lifting weights. It all looked so complicated and intimidating, putting weights on and off of various sized handles. Just really entirely out of my comfort zone. And since going to a gym was equally unappealing, I've always just used those stretchy bands, and body weight, for resistance.But these are perfect. Definitely comfort zone material. They're a pretty, cheerful shade of blue, and while the handles are textured so you don't lose your grip, they're also smooth and simple to wipe down. And the set up here is just amazingly clever. The handles weigh 2 lbs. by themselves. (It's written right on the handle). Then these little saucer-shaped weights lock on each end with a straightforward, easy to manage (and super clever!) mechanism. Securely, too, so they can't come loose or fall off. And each little saucer shaped weight adds half a pound. So if you put one saucer on each end, plus the handle, you're lifting three pounds. Two saucers give you four, and all three saucers gives you five pounds. So you can ramp up.I guess if you're already a hard-core weight lifter, these may not be for you . . . but if all that stuff is intimidating, but you'd like to try lifting weights at home, give these a try. I really love them!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Accuracy ok, easy to adjust', 'author': 'dachiri', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Barbell and assembled within an ounce, .5 additions within .1 ounce, so good enough for me. Adding and removing weight is a breeze!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Easy to Use', 'author': 'E. Forrest', 'rating': 4, 'content': "These work as intended and it is easy to add or remove the small plates to increment the weight. They seem quite secure and not at risk of slipping off or getting weak. The handles are nicely shaped and not slippery or uncomfortable on the palm.Overall, I like these and they will be very useful for toning at home. However, there are a few cons:* they get a bit long with all the plates attached, so you need to be careful to avoid hitting the other dumbbell, your thigh, etc, when doing your reps.* not quick-release/change like some more expensive sets are. You need both hands to add/remove plates, so these aren't great for quick swaps (e.g. power sets) but are fine for slower pace sets or aerobic-type usage.* the pretty end cap is only there if you stack the plates correctly, so you will need to slide off the end cap, then add the additional plate and replace the end cap plate. You don't need the pretty end cap for functionality, but it makes the finish nicer. (This is probably the same on all comparable adjustable dumbbell set.)I think these are a great buy for the price point and perfect for people looking for smaller dumbbells for aerobic or lightweight toning at home without cluttering up their house. These are not for (nor intended for) people doing lots of quick, heavy lifting.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 21, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to adjust weight', 'author': 'J. D. Fegler', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These adjustable dumbbells are perfect for my workout routine. It is very easy to adjust the weight, quickly snapping the plates on or off to adjust the weight to suit you. The coating on the dumbbells is also really nice - smooth and almost soft feeling. The dumbbells work well for the various exercises I am doing. I have another set of adjustable dumbbells that have cylinder shaped weights that you put in the ends of the dumbbells. They allow smaller increments of weight adjustments but are more time consuming to take in or out. I prefer these.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Weights', 'author': 'Artinna Fontenot- McZeal', 'rating': 4, 'content': "These are very nice weights. They are definitely durable.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice small set of dumbbells!', 'author': 'SublimeCalliope', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This is what I needed! They go from 2-5#, depending on how many you attach, which is perfect for the exercises I wanted them for!AND instead of having multiple weights that take up more space (which I don‚Äôt have!) this takes up about the same space as one dumbbell!These are easy to change the weight of, although I will admit, I have broke a nail taking them apart. Lol. In my video you can see why. The tab is ‚Äúdifficult‚Äù to use if your nails are longer.These feel good, and have great weight.They clean easily, and come with an extra screw for the end weight in case one loosens and gets lost.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 21, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Adjustable Weights!', 'author': 'AmazonAndi', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. These are a great set of adjustable weights. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for the Price', 'author': 'Astro Hiker', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I just received the dumbbells today. The box was in perfect condition. They are very easy to use. I hand holds the weight on the dumbbell bar and the other hand pinches and puts the clip on the bar. Very easy to do.They are basic weights and for the price $21.77, no shipping and no tax, they are a great deal!!!.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2010', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Okay quality for low price', 'author': 'Raviteja Ainampudi', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Gave 5 stars because, for around 50 dollars of worth. But, im satisfied for 50 dollars with 40 pounds weight set.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 10, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars You get what you pay for - budget weights. Not bad all things considered', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': "In light of a recent 'global pandemic', I imagine many of us have found ourselves in a situation where the gyms are closed, and home exercise is the only alternative to keep fit.With that in mind, I sought to find the cheapest, and most flexible Dumbbell option on Amazon to fill that need. Rest assured, the Marcy product accomplishes that goal.The Dumbbells took around 1 week to arrive. The packaging is fairly poor but acceptable, and the plates come in a bit dirty with black/white dust covering them. Thankfully this dust can be wiped off fairly quickly with a little Clorox, so it's not the biggest concern given the price point you get them for.The handles and clips to hold the plates are in fairly good condition. The clips are very small, but after a bit of stress testing have proven themselves to be more than sturdy enough.You receive four 7.5 lb plates, and four 2.5 lb plates. In total, that can get you to 20 lbs per dumbbell if you so choose. While it is possible to frontload a single dumbbell up to 30 lbs, it is not advised per the product instructions to go any higher than 20 lbs per handle.The plates can rotate quite a bit during workouts (if they are not firmly tightened), which can get a little annoying during use. In addition, they are very bulky (as you can likely see in the pictures). Despite these shortcomings, they get the job done - and that's all there really is to it with weights.To conclude, these are good cheap Dumbbell options if you're looking for a deal and don't mind making a few concessions.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Thank you for saving my sanity.b', 'author': 'Amy', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Cannot even begin to thank this seller. Nothing big and I'm sure it's my paranoia living in an apartment, I didn't want to have weights fall off.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 31, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Cheap but does the job', 'author': 'W. Yee', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I guess there is a reason why it's so cheap. Because it is cheap. You can tell the materials are cheap. Let me start off by talking about the shipment. I got the free delivery deal thing and even though it said 5-9 days. It actually came in 2 days after the order. Super fast 5/5 on that. But when it arrived, the box holding the weights was pretty smashed up its not usable and super dirty. Not sure where these shipments come from but boy are the weights and the box dirty as hell. There are sands or gravel or whatever inside the box with the weights. I decided to wash the weights and it started melting. Not really melting but black stuff started peeling off. I guess it's because its rubber or whatever but small rubber ink thingys were peeling off. I don't even know how to explain it. But after 30 mins of washing my tub looked like there was an oil spill. 1/5 there on the dirty job. After my weights dried I decided to try out the weights. Everything was fine until the spring clips. These clips are there to help hold the weights in place but boy are they hard to put on. and most likely super hard to take off too. could not had put it on myself without my friend helping. i originally wanted to do reps with all the weights on then slowly reducing the weights but it seems like its not possible because the spring clips are so hard to put on. maybe its just me but other than the spring clips and dirty shipment, the weights are a great set for its price. overall its a great set but i minus a few points for the dirtyness and the horrible spring clips. without the spring clips the dumbells are nothing more than normal 20lbs set because i can't remove the weights and put on the clips without a 2nd person helping me. so it defeats the purpose of having a detachable dumbell bar + plates. I am thinking of buying a new pair of clips becuase these cheap clips are pretty useless. the weights are fine tho.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2009', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice dumbbell set', 'author': 'John Esposito', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These dumbbells are a great value. title: Sunny Health & Fitness Elite Adjustable Dumbbell, Space Saver, Strength Training, Anti-Slip Steel Handle, Home Gym Fitness
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great hand weights!!', 'author': 'Rhoo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am impressed with this set of hand weights. I would highly recommend these weights to anyone.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice, low mass, odorless, adjustable weight set.', 'author': 'Kenneth W Waters', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The set is nicely chromed and comes in a convenient carrying case. The case is relatively fragile plastic, so don't expect it to get through shipping without being damaged. One reviewer complained about shavings which I thought was trivial. If there really were shavings, those could be washed off and the chrome surface dried (competitor review?) Sunny Health has a matching barbell bar and additional weights available so that this set could become part of a larger set of weights. The pieces that secure the weights snug up easily and safely. There's no synthetic (rubber-like plastic) on these to smell bad. I'm very happy with this set of dumbbells.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars I‚Äôm overall satisfied. Cheaper than buying individual weights.', 'author': 'Kimberly Smith', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These were the first set of weights I was able to get ahold of during the pandemic. I was late to the workout game but started in May. I didn‚Äôt realize how hard it would be to find some dumbbells until I started looking. I found these at the beginning of June and ordered them. They arrived pretty quickly. The set is very pretty if that‚Äôs a thing. The case is garbage like others have mentioned. I got the delivery and I‚Äôm actually surprised I got the set in one piece because the box was falling apart and the weights were coming out.The pros:-since Dumbbells are hard to find and no longer reasonably priced I think this set gives you varied weight for your money.-They are a very good looking set of weights.-There is a ‚Äústorage case‚Äù so they don‚Äôt take up too much space.-My set was well machined so I didn‚Äôt get metal flakes or anything.The cons:-the ‚Äústorage case‚Äù will likely come broken. I wouldn‚Äôt use this to travel with, only to store them. The case is incredibly flimsy for holding 33 lbs of metal.-The combinations you can create are a little strange. Instead of 5lbs and 10lbs you‚Äôre probably getting combinations like 6lbs, 11lbs, 13lbs, or 16ish lbs. Not a big deal breaker for me though.-The quality is not awful but I wouldn‚Äôt throw these weights down after completing a set. I do tighten them and even so the plates will jiggle slightly by the end of my workout. So I‚Äôve been careful in how I place them down after a set.-They are not as comfortable as neoprene weights. Also because they are round they will roll on a hard surface. I don‚Äôt do a ton of lifting but if you‚Äôre doing a long workout the bar is not that comfortable and you may want to use gloves. For me I don‚Äôt use them enough to invest in gloves but something to consider.Overall I‚Äôm not disappointed with this purchase. I was able to find some neoprene weights right after I bought this set but I‚Äôm going to hold on to it because I don‚Äôt have weights larger than 12lbs. I would recommend this for someone looking for some weights that aren‚Äôt too heavy but not too light.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 28, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality set of dumbbells', 'author': 'JDancer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm a personal trainer so I'm at the gym almost everyday and have access to just about every kind of professional equipment I could want to use. For this reason, I want practical, space-saving, economical equipment for my home gym. I paired this set of adjustable dumbbells with a set of Ativafit adjustable dumbbells, plus 4 5 lb plates to replace an entire set of dumbbells ranging from 3 lbs to 70 lbs. I chose these because with 4 more 5 lb plates, they allow for small increments in the 2.75 to 26 lb. range. You can literally go up by just 1.25 lbs if you want to. Keep in mind the bars weigh 2.75 lbs and the 2 collars weigh 1.1 lbs., so they're almost 4 lbs without any plates. These are solidly made, and fit any plates made for a 1 inch bar. The case is nice enough to keep them in, and they do look great too. Great space-saver, and a very economical way to have a whole range of weights in lighter dumbbells.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quite pleased.', 'author': 'Mrorlandom', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good quality product. Fast shipping.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to Assemble', 'author': 'Yanmei Xu', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My teenager assembled it quickly and uses it every day. It was very handy when he had to stay away from group practice due to an injure.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Case is not durable plastic.', 'author': 'N.P.', 'rating': 3, 'content': "The dumbbells work as intended.If your doing pushups with them or exercises requiring you to work on the floor with these dumbbells for example: push-ups, you might want to be careful! It can get really slippery on tile floors or vinyl and the nuts will come loose if you try to put your whole body weight pressure on them while doing push-ups. Maybe putting a towel or an exercise mat on the floor so it won't roll out from under you. It's easy to clean but maybe you shouldn't leave them outside because it'll start to rust. It's mainly intended for using indoors. The casing is not durable (cheap plastic). Mine came cracked and broken. Discarded the case. Just make sure you place them somewhere level or disassemble after your exercise and place it out of the way of traffic.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love it!', 'author': 'Tameka', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great product, can‚Äôt ‚Äòweight‚Äô to get the whole set up!!! Lol‚Ä¶', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good, Functional Adjustible Dumbbell Set', 'author': 'Andy & Ari', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I've owned and heavily used a set of these for a while now, and I can honestly say that these are a nice, solid option if you don't have either the space or the money to buy a full set of dumbbells at the different weights. The great thing about it is that you can also purchase additional weight plates as you need them...I've purchased several 5 lb and 10 lb plates to use with these to modify the amount of weights as need be depending on the exercise I am using it for.That being said, what other reviewers have said about the case being crap is true. I store mine with the plates on them, and additional plates elsewhere...I really don't think the quality of the case should be a factor in getting these or not, because the functionality is what matters most, and these are functional. And for me personally, if I have to travel, I don't find carrying this much weight to be a practical option, I'm much more likely to train with a body weight routine or bring a single kettlebell for those occasions.So I marked these down because like Sunny Health's barbell, the metal nut piece that keeps the weight plates on loosens up and has to be periodically tightened down, and it also makes them slightly more time consuming to change out weight plates on. I think that's something that can definitely be worked around, but it would make moves like the renegade row particularly not safe with these dumbbells. Actually, if you've got your heart set on doing that move a whole lot, I'd recommend hex dumbbells personally, but that may just be my take on it, because they have flat sides that won't roll on you, because regardless of what the nuts do on these things, they're very round, very smooth, and they're going to roll, even on carpet, which I think increases your risk of injury with that particular move. Otherwise, these are very functional for a full range of strength training moves.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Love them, but my case was broken as well', 'author': 'PookieThePirate', 'rating': 4, 'content': "It seems the case that comes with it, is too flimsy and weak for the weights.The weights themselves, first there is this dusty smell but just wipe it off and it will be okay. First, I love the quality. It's very easy to put the weights on as well, and the weights don't shake or move after you tighten them.I only got the 33lb because as a petite girl I didn't think I'd ever go as high as maybe 20 so I thought I should just get this set. However if you want more weights, such as a set that goes up to 40, there is another set on here that is 6 dollars more. I believe it's called the Cap Barbell 40 dumbbell set. I don't know about the quality though, but the bars look the same as well as the nut to tighten the weights. Then there's another Cap Barbell 40lb dumbbell set, but it's adjustable and it's 44 dollars, that's a bargain but again I don't know the quality. Also it seems possible to buy free weights that are different from this chrome set, and you can mix and match. As long as it can be screwed and tightened and not be wobbly.But I love these, and they aren't so bulky either. It's perfect for me personally. Doesn't take up a lot of room either.However the weight distribution in the case is also awful. I am knocking off a star because the case was broken AND too much weight on one side. I actually think this is why the case was broken. My case had a crack on the opposite side of where the weights were, go figure. It's not good for carrying around either. The weights will move inside the case too much and the case will break even more.By the way, it is 16.5 max PER dumbbell. If you want more weight, buy free weights.It goes from 4 (with no weights, the bar itself weights 4 lbs), 6.5, 9, 11.5, 14, 16.5.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 29, 2013', 'is_verified': True}]

title: CAP Barbell Olympic Bars | Multiple options
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptional Quality and Performance', 'author': 'Kyle Shapiro', 'rating': 5, 'content': "From the moment I unboxed my CAP barbell, I knew I had made the right choice. The build quality is simply unparalleled; it's evident that CAP has put a great deal of thought and expertise into crafting this piece of equipment. The barbell feels sturdy and well-balanced in my hands, providing a solid grip that inspires confidence during my lifts.What truly sets this barbell apart is its remarkable durability. I've been using it extensively for both heavy deadlifts and high-rep training sessions, and it shows no signs of wear and tear. The knurling is perfectly designed, offering just the right amount of grip without being overly abrasive on my hands.Another aspect I greatly appreciate is the barbell's versatility. It fits seamlessly into my workout routine, whether I'm focusing on powerlifting, Olympic lifts, or general conditioning. The smooth rotation of the sleeves has been a game-changer, ensuring efficient and safe execution of my lifts.Customer service from CAP was also top-notch. They were helpful and responsive, ensuring that my barbell arrived promptly and in perfect condition. It's clear that CAP values its customers and stands behind the quality of its products.In conclusion, the CAP barbell has exceeded my expectations in every aspect. It offers professional-grade quality, exceptional durability, and versatility, all at a very reasonable price point. Whether you're a seasoned athlete or just beginning your fitness journey, I highly recommend this barbell. It's an investment in your training that you won't regret.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best budget Olympic barbell!!!! But it‚Äôs 35 lbs', 'author': 'Anneg22', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered the chrome 7ft Olympic barbell. ***It isn‚Äôt 45lbs just fyi, it‚Äôs roughly 35lbs. *** but I knew that when I ordered. For a budget barbell, I am impressed. It was $60 and worth every penny. Every other barbell was like $150-$300. I‚Äôm a woman who will likely keep the weight under 300lbs on the bar so it‚Äôs sufficient for me. All my 2 inch rubber plates fit no problem. It is a bit rattly but weight lifting is noisy. It‚Äôs a great starter bar or bar for women. I will probably upgrade eventually but for just starting my home gym it is perfect, it may surprise me and last a really long time. It‚Äôs honestly no different in quality than the barbells I was squatting and deadlifting with at lifetime fitness. Thanks CAP for making an affordable option for those of us who can‚Äôt justify spending $300 on a Rogue barbell.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It‚Äôs a quality product', 'author': 'Great bar, best price going for a real Olympic bar', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a very nice bar and the best price going for an Olympic bar', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Dumbbell', 'author': 'Seth Flinchbaugh', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Bar works great and feels good in the hand. Im not a fan on the clamps used to hold the weights on but they feel solid and do work well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars It's very heavy and strong", 'author': 'Melinda', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this to help my husband get jacked. It works like it should. He puts weights on it and lifts them up and puts them down. It's been good, he likes it and I like my jacked husband!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 60" black bar is a good bar if you have realistic expectations', 'author': 'patticake', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My husband and I have had a wide variety from low to mid-range fitness and strength products over the years, so when he wanted a lower-priced Oly barbell, we thought of Cap as our experiences have overall been good with them for over 25 years. We have found that sometimes their chromed equipment has sharp edges or flakes, so we went with the 60in, Solid Bar, Black. My husband is lifting 300 pounds max - usually less - and I'm lifting 100 or under, so this bar seemed good.And it is just what we wanted. It's lighter than an official bar but heavier than a 1-inch standard bar, the black finish is attractive with no flaking or sharp edges at all. The knurling is comfortable and grippy. The sleeves don't stick, and while I don't think they have bearings or bushings, for this price, we weren't expecting any. The black finish is coming off of the sleeves in a couple small places, but for the price, we expected that. We're using it almost daily, with and without a small rack, and are completely satisfied.This is a budget-priced all-solid bar, so we didn't expect an Ohio Power Bar or something like that. We bought this bar as it will work for our needs and costs around 1/4 of the price of a value bar and about 1/8th of a price or less of a high end bar, but we don't need a high end bar. And to bring a solid bar in at this price range, there are going to be compromises, but we knew that going in.Overall if you don't want to spend too much money but don't want a hollow barbell, this is a solid option. We're getting a lot of use out of it, and plan to keep using it for years to come.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Your value-packed adjustable dumbbells are here!', 'author': 'D W', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was looking at a similar product from a "top tier" barbell company for $150, but thought I\'d save some money and go with this dumbbell instead. I am sure glad I did, because the quality on this is very nice. The knurling feels good (I hate weak/smooth knurling), and it\'s nice and clean and looks good. Nothing about it feels cheap to me. It was well packed and arrived in perfect shape. I was also considering getting some adjustable barbells like the Bowflex 1090 or Snode AD80, but these give me all the adjustability I can wish for - you only need some olympic plates to go with them which I already had.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great bang for the buck', 'author': 'NiK', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I don't know why anyone would buy anything more expensive. Its great and does the job for home gym!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars do I need a curling bar?', 'author': 'Bruce Hedlund', 'rating': 5, 'content': "You need at least one if you plan to work your arms but I would recommend two. This bar is an olympic size and I waited to verify that it does weigh 15 lb. I would recommend too of these because if you have one set up for different weights for different exercises ahead of time it helps eliminate delays in your workout. The only thing I don't like is that with every bar you buy, curl or straight, they come with these stupid spring clips which I just don't like so plan on buying better collars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Gets the job done', 'author': 'Jordan Cederdahl', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I bought this Olympic bar for the home gym I'm putting together. I used to have a full YORK Barbell rack and Olympic bar with plates. This CAP barbell was advertised as an Olympic Barbell, which, if true, should weigh 45 lbs. I've used it a few times and things seemed a bit light. I held the barbell in one arm and a 35 lb dumbbell in the other, they felt about the same. I came back to the product description and saw that it was listed as weighing 36.7 lbs. This is fine, I'm not a professional weightlifter nor do I plan to complete anything where this difference would matter. The only negative is it messes with my already present barbell math, which is slightly annoying. This is just to say that this is not a traditional Olympic barbell if you are looking for a 45lb bar. Having said all of that, this is a quality barbell to use for home fitness.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Dumbbells
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Incredible Value', 'author': 'Anon', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased a set of these 35lbs dumbbells, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase.
