title: Bundles
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Solid Choice for Home Workouts!', 'author': 'James Rushforth', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Cap Barbell 40-Pound Dumbbell Set, and I must say, I am thoroughly impressed! This set is perfect for anyone looking to add some weight training to their home workout routine.First off, the quality of these dumbbells is top-notch. The handles are sturdy and provide a comfortable grip, even during intense workouts. The weight plates are also well-made and fit securely onto the handles, so there's no need to worry about them coming loose.Another great thing about this set is the versatility it offers. With four 2.5-pound plates, four 5-pound plates, and two dumbbell handles, you can easily adjust the weight to suit your needs. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned lifter, this set has you covered.I also appreciate how compact this set is. It doesn't take up much space, so it's perfect for small home gyms or apartments. Plus, the plates are easy to store, so you can keep your workout area neat and organized.Overall, I highly recommend the Cap Barbell 40-Pound Dumbbell Set to anyone looking for a high-quality, versatile, and space-saving weight set for their home gym. It's a fantastic value for the price, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Don't listen to the negative reviews...", 'author': 'Mantis Toboggan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a long review, I hope I can keep your attention.First off, I want to tell you guys that Fedex Smartpost is the carrier for this item. I didn\'t have a problem with them, even though they delivered my dumbbells 2 days after the delivery estimate(can\'t complain, free shipping). Fedex Smartpost sends to the closest USPS, then USPS takes an additional 2 days to deliver. It seems like most people hate Fedex Smartpost because they take longer than usual("google fedex smartpost sucks" to see what I\'m talking about). I ordered these on 2-9-13 and they arrived at my doorstep on 2-16-13, so one week exactly, average time for free shipping. The dumbbells came packaged professionally and my case came in perfect condition, which I was very pleased about.I also ordered 60 pound db set from Lion Roar Fitness on 2-8-13, and as of 2-16, they didn\'t even start shipping so I ended up cancelling that order. They charged $20 for shipping too... I will NEVER even consider buying from LRF again. Just wanted to warn you guys about that. $20 for shipping AND they lag it? No thank you.These Dumbbell sets are a great investment, and I know they will last a long time. First of all, there is no toxic chemical smell the negative reviewers mentioned. Not even the case it came with. They clearly have gotten better with quality control. I read ALL of the negative reviews and took a chance with these, and I am glad I did. My bars are all nicely polished, smooth, and the weights and collars fit accordingly. There are 4 pieces of rubber stoppers that help keep these weights in place, 2 in the middle of the bar and 2 that are connected to the collars, which does an excellent job. When you lift weights, you should never "jerk" through your workouts, but instead keep good form with nice controlled movements. That\'s how my workouts are, and the weights have not moved, rolled, clanked, at all. The only time the collars roll out, is when I twist them to change weights. I even put all the plates on one bar(30 lbs) and the weights/collars were still in place. People say these are not the best quality, but what more do you expect from a set of dumbbells? Good finish on the plates with a clean tough metal bar, which cannot rip as some rubber grip bars tend to rip after tightening the collars too much. Carefully put the plates on, or you could scratch/chip off the paint. If you don\'t like getting callouses on your hands, I recommend investing in gloves. I don\'t feel a thing with gloves on and can enjoy lifting weights without getting blisters. If you have Fat Gripz(check my review for Fat Gripz), you don\'t even need gloves. Those rubber suckers will cover it, and give you a much better workout.I will buy additional plates for these soon but before you guys do as well, try adding Fat Gripz to the bars with your normal workouts. It will give your workouts more of a challenge, and you will see some good results in your forearm strength. I wish I knew about them when I wrestled in high school..Long story short, don\'t listen to the negative reviews. Keep yourself in shape and buy these already!Oh yeah, I forgot to mention that the bars + collars does not equal 5 pounds(unless you are weighing both bars and 4 collars together). So you get about 17.5 pounds each dumbbell. The description states that they weigh 5 pounds but it\'s half. The case it comes with is about 5 or 6 pounds so that\'s where they kind of trick you. So if you do the math, 4 x 5lbs plate + 4 x 2.5 lbs plate + 2 x 2.5 collars & bar = 35 lbs + 5 lbs case = 40 lbs db set.. I\'m not going to knock off a star for that because I bought these knowing this information. We can always buy more plates, so no big deal.Thank you for reading my long review. I hope this helped make your decision in building a better body! Train hard, train safe, and good luck :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Affordable and heavy.', 'author': 'Mike', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a great set of weights for someone looking to get started working out at home. It's not perfect, but I'm not really sure that the imperfections matter for a product like this. So let's get the negatives out of the way first:- Yeah, they smell, as others have noted. It's nothing strange -- if you've ever been to a gym before, you already know this smell. They're metallic with additional chemical odors. For a basic sniff test, you won't notice much. But the smell does begin to accumulate after a few days in cramped quarters, so maybe they're not the best choice for a bedroom or tiny apartment. I suspect the smell will dissipate in time, but I don't know how long that will be.- The carrying case is cheap molded plastic, and there's a good chance yours will arrive with one or more corners dented. It's fine -- the cases aren't meant to be display items. They're meant to store the weights, and to give you a convenient way to lug them around when needed.- It's obvious that corners were cut in some regards. The rubber cushions on the bars are cheap, and could possibly fall off and get lost if you aren't attentive. Likewise, the rubber cushions within the screw-on collars can fall out. It's not a big deal if they do -- you just stick them back in. But these are obviously not advanced equipment. They were designed to be cheap and functional.That said, I don't think any of these cons really matter. Weights have one purpose in life -- to weigh something. Your muscles can't tell if you're holding twenty pounds of expensive metal or cheap metal. This particular set is very well priced, and they feel safe and sturdy. You don't have to worry about the collars wiggling loose, and they're adjustable down to 2.5 pound increments. I snagged two sets, giving me greater versatility and the ability to put more weight on a single bar if needed. For the price, this is a perfect way to get started with a cheap, space-saving home gym.Weights don't need to be pretty and fancy to work. They just need to give gravity something to act on. You can buy fancier equipment than this, but it's not clear why you'd really want to.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Honest review addressing common concerns...', 'author': 'Bleacherbum95', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When originally considering this product I was very concerned with the number of negative reviews/comments that people were leaving about these dumbbells. After deciding to take the risk, I felt the need to write a review since I believe that the negative reviews are overblown and overly dramatic. I will hopefully address the main concerns that you as the prospective buyer are having while considering this product. If you don\'t care about the details I have a TLDR at the bottom =)1. Smell: These weights do not smells like daisies; no dumbbells do. However, the smell is NOT as bad as people are saying. I would highly recommend leaving these weights outside (and/or washing them) to let them air out and control the smell, but it is not immediately overpowering. When the package arrived I slowly opened the box waiting for a toxic stench to explode out, but it never came. It was not until I lifted a plate out of the box that I noticed the smell people mentioned (the chemical applied to prevent rust), and it was not very strong. I left mine in the garage to air out and noticed a slight change in the smell of the garage, but nothing extreme. I would certainly keep them out of the house to be safe, but for $40 a quick wash or airing out was worth it to me.2: Quality: If you are looking for professional dumbbells that are made of top quality materials then look elsewhere. But if you are looking for a solid set of starter weights, this is your product. I will say that the first time I removed a collar a small piece of metal broke off, but it did not affect the functionality of the piece. Also, I noticed someone mentioned that the collar lets the weights slide...this was incorrect in my experience. The collars seem to hold the weights snugly in place, so there should be no problems there. The quality is by no means great (unbeatable for the price though), but it is good enough that I trust it will last and serve its purpose.3. Case: I saw a few people talking about how the case broke easily. The case seems fairly sturdy if it is treated well. A case breaking or not will depend on your delivery man. The weights are packaged very well inside a few boxes (Amazon ships it out in an excessively large box), and in my experience there were no cracks. The sliders to keep the box closed seem pretty lame, but I\'m one of those people who isn\'t going to sweat it if the case breaks.I hope I covered the main concerns that most people were having. My honest review of this product is that this is unbeatable for the price. $40 with free shipping (mine came in 2 days) is great, and these are exactly what I was looking for. And NO I was not paid for this review and think Amazon should be ashamed of including paid reviews.TLDR: Does NOT smell that bad (easily fixed), decent quality, best bang for the buck for somebody looking for starter dumbbells.UPDATE 1/25/14: I now have two sets of these (it was cheaper than buying weight individually), and they are holding up great after over a year and a half of use. I\'ve noticed the collar shifts slightly when you get over 30lbs, but never enough that it\'s a problem. Be confident in purchasing these as starter weights.UPDATE 7/31/16: My original bars are still going strong. The collar shifting still happens on occasion, but not to the point where it interferes with my workout. I\'ve purchased additional plates for it and added them just fine - any 1" plate should fit just as well as the originals. So these have held up strong for 4 years...zero complaints here. One thing I forgot in the original review - you may want some lifting gloves. The metals isn\'t forgiving on your hands, so if you don\'t want big calluses, invest in a cheap pair of gloves.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Adjustible Weight Set', 'author': 'Lumbre', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First of all, let\'s get the smell part clear. Yes, it smells. It smells similar to the stuff you find in the tire/automotive aisles at Target/WalMart/other stores. Yes, it can be a bit strong. Let it air for a day and put a dryer sheet in the case when you close it. Problem solved. If you\'re picky on having your home smell like candles or something, these are not for you. If you don\'t even notice the smell of a gym when you\'re in a gym (or aren\'t the quickest to pick up on smells), then you\'re fine. Also, I think it\'s the box that smells, not any of the paint.Pros:*It is easy to add/remove weights. Just unscrew the collars, remove/add weights, screw collars back in. You can do this while resting in less than a minute.*You can add your own weights. When you outgrow these, you can add your own weights (doesn\'t have to be the same brand). Any generic 1" weight will do.*When I bought these, they were awesome for $40. Under $1/pound if you count the different combinations of weights you can do and that you can add more later.*Cheap compared to buying individually.Cons:*Slight bump in one of the corners of the case. No big deal. Contents inside are fine. Just an aesthetic issue.*Smell. As addressed above, it can be a bit overpowering, but just take the time to let them air out. Some people also do fine by rinsing them.*They\'re not neoprene.Notes & Thoughts:*A lot of people complain about the default California warning added to this set. Seriously, California is overprotective. Drinking dozens of gallons of water is known to cause death. If ingested, gasoline can destroy your organs. Too much sun can give you cancer. They have these warnings on a ton of things for sale in California. Something containing nickel, for example, automatically gets this warning. If it were more serious, more states or the entire country would place a warning or they would be getting sued for giving people cancer (it\'s not like lawyers are exactly shy).*The handles may be a bit too textured for some people, especially those with delicate hands or buying more weights. In that case, maybe you should buy weight-lifting gloves. For those who don\'t mind getting scuffed by sand or falling hands-first on pavement, you\'re fine. If anything, I shift my hands around on the bar which varies up my routine a bit.*People say it\'s a good starter set. I just started a serious workout routine and have had this for a month. I see myself having this for years.*A few have complained that the weights aren\'t exact. The bar doesn\'t seem like 5 pounds, but when I weight myself with one of my 20 lb. dumbbells, I see my weight increase by 19.8 or 20 (my scale goes in intervals of 0.2). It\'s close enough for me. I don\'t need it to be that exact.*Mine didn\'t seem to have any loose seal rings or collars. They seem good for the price. They may shift a small amount after a 30 minute workout to where you can hear a slight clunk. Just retighten them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing quality', 'author': 'John carter', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Everything came double if not even triple boxed and wrapped and had stuffing on the original box all the weights came individually wrapped there was no chemical strong smell with my set (105lb) pair they just smelled new nothing that made me gag or was to strong as far as the mechanics it seems to work perfect they hold still while I do chest dumbell flys with 35lbs on each only time will tell but as of now extremely happy don‚Äôt listen to the review also if you want to add plates to this set make sure there 1.14 or bigger 1inch plates won‚Äôt work also I personally love the diamond pattern grip but if your not used to lifting without gloves your going to have to break your hands in or get some gloves me personally gives me more grip I love it it does not feel like it‚Äôs digging in my skin like others said overall good product for the price can‚Äôt beat it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Nice dumbbell bars', 'author': 'RY', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I liked the dumbell bars. They are solid, easy to grip, and the nuts tighten down nicely. The weights that came with them would be fine except the center hole in them is a lot bigger than it needs to be causing the weights to shift,if you don't really crank down on the bar nuts.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best deals I‚Äôve ever found on Amazon', 'author': "D'Art", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This 52.5 lb single dumbbell setup is without a doubt one of the best deals I‚Äôve ever found on Amazon. While most iron free-weights sell for around $2/pound (as of the fall of 2022), this set is much more affordable,The price for it does seem to vary wildly day by day. I paid $77 in October 2022 and see that a month later, it is selling for $65. But I‚Äôm not complaining since it‚Äôs a steal at either price.I bought 2 sets so I‚Äôd have a pair of dumbbells.The dumbbell bars and threaded, star-shaped end nuts are nicely made. The chrome coating seems thick and durable. And because the threaded nuts have black rubber washers on the side that makes contact with the weight plates, they tighten securely and stay firmly in place when in use. Other sets I‚Äôve used did not have the rubber washer and as a result, would loosen up while doing reps. That‚Äôs both annoying and dangerousThe rubber washers do tend to fall off when removing the nuts from the dumbbell, but that is easily rectified by putting a few drops of superglue in the groove in the nut into which the rubber washer sits.The weight plates themselves are a little less precisely made. For instance, I weighed my 5 lb plates on a postal scale and discovered they range anywhere from 4.75 lbs to 5.25 lbs. That‚Äôs not a big deal most of the time but you can definitely notice an imbalance if you inadvertently end up with 8 of the heavier 5 lb plates on one hand and 8 of the lighter plates on the other.To avoid that from happening, I used a silver Sharpie to mark the plate that are over 5 lbs and keep them in a separate pile so I can distribute the weight more evenly into the bars.Also, while the clear-coat on the plates seems heavy duty enough, you do need to check for rough edges. That goes for the dumbbell bars too. I had to file down a couple of spots to avoid getting metal splinters in my hands.Last but not least, the dumbbells I received have a diameter of 1.18 inches (or 30mm) and the weight plates have holes that size. This means any plates you may already have with 1 inch (25mm) holes will not fit onto these bars. Likewise, while the plates from this set will easily go onto a 1 inch bar, they can flop around a bit. In practice the latter is not a problem as long as you can tighten down the bar-end clamps. I use my 30mm plates on a 25mm curl bar without issue.In short, while there may be some compromises involved, at these prices, this dumbbell set is one of the best deals out there.Follow up note written on April 11, 2023:I‚Äôve been using my weight set several times a week for about 6 months now and all parts are holding up great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really like these', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed a set to get started with. It‚Äôs hard to make it all the way to the gym...and if I‚Äôm watching tv I can just pick these up and do a few curls every now and then. Really helpful. They are easy to switch weights in and out, and if you are cool with doing one arm at a time then you could add all the weights on one and basically have a dumbbell that goes up to nearly 50 pounds (minus the 4 pound bar), without having to spend all the money of buying 2, 50 pound dumbbells, which would cost twice as much. Instead just do one arm at a time and save half the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Customer service was decent', 'author': 'Nick', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'For quality. You need to try each screw to find one that will actually screw on all the way. Paint is intact, other than that, they are weights.Be advised, you might not get everything in your shipment. Thankfully, customer service was easy to contact. After a couple of days, I recieved a reply asking for the details of my purchase, and after that I recieved my missing handle promptly.4 stars for good customer service.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Top Sellers
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Set, Great Value', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As others have mentioned, these are shipped in three boxes of weights at 50# each, and one narrow box that holds the stand. In my case, while extremely heavy duty boxes were used, and well taped, one of the boxes was sliced open and minor damage to rubber ends of DBs in that box occurred. Looks like it was slid over something which cut it through.In any event, 2x5, 2x10, 2x15, 2x20, 2x25# DBs are included, making this an excellent "base" set. Handles are knurled and as expected in diameter and abrasiveness. No gloves required, but your mileage may vary.Is there a smell? seems to be the burning question. Of course they have a smell. They were just born of chemicals. They smell like what they are: rubber. So if you have ever had a new bike tire in your house, that is the smell, multiplied by a few pairs. It doesn\'t bother me in the slightest, and I was able to start using right away. I cannot relate at all to folks who seemed like they were going to swoon after opening the boxes.NOTE: I "washed" these with dish soap and water before using because they are covered in manufacturing residual dust etc. and will make your hands filthy otherwise. Mine did *not* have any kind of oily residues, as others have mentioned; again, just new tire smell, which for me is not obnoxious. But hey- some people think cilantro tastes terrible, so there is no accounting for taste.NOTE #2: Unlike the way Amazon\'s own brand and some other DBs I have purchased are wrapped, these were just loose in the box. No Styrofoam, no placement in a baggie, nada. Just in the box. So they are not going to be 100% brand new and flawless looking when you take them out. Get over it. They\'re dumbbells. They\'ll look like that in a couple months of workouts anyway. Also, because there is no protection, be judicious in opening the boxes. Just slice around the tape so you are not gouging a chunk out of your new best friends.I got these for basically a buck a pound, which is what weights were before Covid, and what they should be anyway, and held off on buying them until I hit the sale amount. Having said that, they would still be worth it for the $200 amount too, of course, just slightly less of a bargain.As has been mentioned by other reviewers, the A-frame is easy to put together, but will take your fingers off if you are not watching what you are doing when replacing the weights onto the rack, something which was also true at many gyms I have used and is a bug and not a feature of this style of rack.Definitely recommend, and would purchase again. Plan on augmenting with additional weights and eventually using a horizontal rack for all of them, but this was a steal-- and delivered on top of it.I am keeping the boxes. These are some of the heaviest duty boxes I have had sent to me. You should keep them until your return date is over anyway, in the event something untoward happens and they need to go back.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely worth the price', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "TL;DRYou can't go wrong with this weight set for the money. I got them on a flash sale for under $180.The good: Easy to assemble, sturdy stand, nice grips on the weights. Company will send free replacements if anything is wrong in the shipment.The not-so-good: Rubber smell upon opening, will need some time to dissipate, so I'd plan on leaving them sit in a well ventilated area for a week before seriously using them. Also, the ends would appear to be dipped to rubberize them, and some of the material splashed onto the chrome handles. Absolutely no big deal and can be cleaned off, but something to be aware of. I would also suspect this material would wear off and expose the metal if abused (particularly if it got dropped on the corner of something).I have no idea how they make money on these as they came to me in 4 separate boxes via UPS. I did have one weight that had some shipping damage to the end (pictured), but it's not the end of the world.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value and easy to assemble!', 'author': 'Roberto A. title: SQUATZ 70lb Adjustable Dumbbell Weight, Fitness Equipment with Anti-Slip Metal Handle, Quick Change Weight Adjustments with Twist Lock Technology, for Full Body Workout and Weightlifting
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good dumbbell weight', 'author': '@@@Bruins@@@', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The dumbbell is fantastic; it works perfectly, and you can change the weight with a click. At first, I thought 70 lbs would be too much, but it is perfect; you can use almost full weight with lat rows. Dumbbells are a popular piece of fitness equipment that can be used for a variety of exercises to work different muscle groups in the body. They are versatile, easy to use, and can be adjusted to different weights to accommodate different fitness levels and exercise goals.The SQUATZ dumbbell weight set you described seems to have some useful features such as anti-slip metal handles and quick change weight adjustments with twist lock technology. These features can make the dumbbells more comfortable and convenient to use during workouts. When it comes to using dumbbells for full body workouts, there are many exercises you can do to target different muscle groups, such as squats, lunges, bench presses, and overhead presses. It's important to use proper form and start with lighter weights if you're new to weightlifting, to avoid injury and build strength gradually.Overall, using dumbbells can be a great way to add resistance training to your fitness routine and help you achieve your exercise goals. However, it's always a good idea to consult with a fitness professional or doctor before starting any new exercise program.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Brand new, will update over useage', 'author': 'Boomslang1982', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Bought and received them at the start of August. Here are a few tid bits.Packaging: very good. The weights come in a clam shell of Styrofoam and inside a cardboard box. No damage to the items or the packaging.Initial looks: they look really good. The mechanism that rotates the weights works well. Notches into each spot so you get that positive connection. The base works, but it is just a couple of metal bars and plastic ends.Weights: haven't put them on a scale yet, but they do feel about right when holding and lifting. Will drag put the scale and weigh them to see accuracy. Started lifting with them and when locked into the weight desired, they feel solid and have no qualms of lifting over my head.Concerns:website. You get a notice in the packaging to register your product online. You go there and there is no way to register. They don't even list the product on the website. This was on 8/4/23.The plastic on the weights: this will be a point that wears out over time. Since they don't list the product on the website, if these plastic bits break...you/me might be S.O.L.Update 11/9/23There is a little bit of wiggle from the weights. Not sure if it is any worse from what I remember but it's there. And 1 side definitely wiggles more than the other. The weights themselves are about 1 pound heavier than the listed number. Which is ok for me. Edit - realized if I make a rack to hold these and have the base at an angle, it would fix the problem of the plates not being flushAll things considered I'm super happy with my purchase and saving the money by skipping the nuobells", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good set of dumbbells (especially for the price), poor stand design', 'author': 'David S.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I like the ease of adjustment of these dumbbells, but as others have mentioned, it is difficult to get the plates to line up properly when returning them to the stand because the stand is either slightly too wide or the plastic ends flex too much. title: Nice C Adjustable Dumbbells Weights, Neoprene All-in-1 Options, Non-Slip, All-Purpose, Home, Gym, Office
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite dumbells ever.', 'author': 'Janice Gaddy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These are perfect for what I need as I recover from shoulder injury. They are super comfortable to hold. Easy to grasp. Love that I can add or subtract weights. And the colors selections make them even more perfect.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice but wrong color', 'author': 'Jo B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The weights were nice and a very cool shape but the first thing I noticed is that they were the wrong color. The second thing I noticed is the wrong color because the color I ordered didn‚Äôt come in the large size. I either ordered a small or accidentally ordered a large, but they‚Äôre way too big and heavy for me and I‚Äôm gonna need to return them but the quality is very good at the concept is different than others.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice system, but the weight documentation is off (updated)', 'author': 'Karla K', 'rating': 4, 'content': "(I promised an update after working out with the dumbbells)I've used them in several workout sessions now, and I'm still really happy with my purchase. They are very comfortable to hold, and changing up the weight isn't too bad. I still wouldn't try to alternate weight amounts because that would double your workout time. But if you switch them out between series of circuits, it won't take too long.More details below -- specifically about the exact weight of the configurations.---- original review ---A great way to add more weights (I was looking for 6lb, 7lb, 8lb, 10lb) without spending a fortune.I haven't worked out with these yet, but will update when I do. When I strength-train, I use circuits of 2-3 different exercises, 3 times each. These wouldn't be convenient to swap weights within the same circuit, but they seem OK to swap when I'm changing circuits, if needed.The set comes with 2 hand weights, each consisting of the empty hand weight, 2 large blocks, and 16 small blocks. You typically add the weight blocks in pairs -- one on each end so that it's balanced, but I tested it and you can use an odd number of small weights without causing any problems. And you can include or exclude the large blocks. - but always use these in pairs.The weights as listed in the instructions are not correct. I knew the docs weren't accurate when it said that you add 6 small blocks to go from 6.6 lbs to 8.8 lbs but then you add 4 more small blocks to go from 8.8 lbs to 11 lbs (also an increase of 2.2 lbs)Here's the real deal - yes, I'm pedantic, so I actually weighed all the parts. These are averages - each small block's weight is slightly different (by a tenth of an ounce here and there):The empty hand weight is 2.37 lbs2 large blocks weigh 2.45 lbs2 small blocks weigh 0.775-0.788 lbsHand weight plus 2 large: 4.82 (vs 4.4 lbs that they claim)Add 2 small: 5.60Add 2 more small: 6.38Add 2 more small: 7.16 (vs 6.6)Add 2 more small: 7.94Add 2 more small: 8.73Add 2 more small: 9.51 (vs 8.8)Add 2 more small: 10.29Add final 2 small: 11.07 (vs 11.0)I wish the documentation was more correct in this part, but as long as you know what the actual weight is, you can work accordingly.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 11, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars good to use', 'author': 'Sammi', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'it is a little bigger than i thought but still very good to use for my workout. It could get a little bit slippery when my hands are sweaty.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great set of weights!', 'author': 'Cherry Scarmardo', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are just what I needed after recovering from major shoulder surgery a year ago. I need to stay active and flexible but don't want to overdo anything since I need my strength back but also need to go slow. These are perfect as I can add weight as needed and if I can't use them for a specific exercise until stronger, I can go back down. easy to do and they are comfortable to hold.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very clever', 'author': 'Marcia J Coleman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Ingenious design. I have not had trouble with the threads, as some others have. I was able to get a weight I wanted with some experimenting.My only complaint is the diameter of the bar, probably specific to me and not too many others.I have small hands, and I am just barely able to get my hand around the bar for a secure grip. Still getting used to it.I look forward to being able to increase the weight as needed', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great idea', 'author': 'Nicole', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great idea. Design is a little flawed but never the less it works good. Perfect for what I needed !!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made adjustable weights', 'author': 'T. Moore', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These are easy to adjust by adding or removing weights- I keep mine at a weight for a while as adding weight between sets would be a bit too inconvenient, but they are filling the gap between 5 & 8 lb weights for me and I like that I can gradually add a bit more as my strength improves.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Larger than expected', 'author': 'j. mc', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I love the concept of these weights. We just started traveling in a 5th wheel and these would be perfect, as you don't have to have a bunch of different dumbbells - space is limited. They are much larger than I thought. I am sure the description gives the dimensions but my daughter has a set and I assumed they would be like hers. That being said, they are comfortable to hold and take the place of multiple dumbbells so overall I am happy with the purchase.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Finally opened years later to have a problem with one of the wights', 'author': 'christina crespo', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I am writing because I purchased a set of your adjustable weights through Amazon. To be completely honest and transparent I bought these weights quite some time go.. say 2020. Now, I literally, finally, opened that box today! It took some time to find that motivation but I have finally done it! In doing so, one of the sides of just one weight won‚Äôt open. The other weight opened fine along with the opposite side of the other. It seems that the one side is lodged from opening. I am able to move it slightly but then it locks. Definitely super frustrating that after 3 years (super embarrassing) I cannot open one side to remove weights so I can finally exercise. Is there anything that can be done about this? Possibly just return the one that‚Äôs faulty? Please help! Thank you in advance!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: FLYBIRD Weight Bench, Adjustable Strength Training Bench for Full Body Workout with Fast Folding-New Version
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Bench, Solid Investment', 'author': 'K. Johnson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Stardate - March 2021.I have two of these benches, both have been in use daily since Sept 2020, about 6 months. When I travel, I take one with me. One served for a while as a chair/bench for my home office.Both benches are used for bench press, incline bench, spider curls, sit ups, weighted situps, seated military press, rows, flys, french press, etc, etc, etc - all the typical exercises one does with a bench. Thus far, both benches have served very well, without issues. I did not attempt to fully test the 600 lb weight capacity but I did get up around 500 lb and the bench felt stable to me.These are solid/strong benches, but there is some movement under load; this is to be expected with a lightweight folding bench. The little bit of movement is, to me, minor and easy to live with.The back-pad is about 11 inches wide. I\'d like a wider pad. But, because "form ever follows function", compromises must be made sometimes.Overall, these benches were a solid purchase. Sure, there are bigger, sturdier, and more stable benches out there but they cost more, are not available, and do not fold or travel easily. FlyBirds, on the other hand, were available, did not break the bank, do fold up and travel easily, and they do get the job done. They set up in a snap, and the price is on-point.ProsThey were available during pandemic, at the regular price - kudos to FlyBird Fitness for not price gouging.Delivered in less than a week - amazing considering some fitness companies take 2 weeks to ship a t shirt.Over performs on all expectations. Excellent ROI, great value.Impressive and seemingly accurate max weight rating,Moves, stores, and travels easily.Solid construction, quality materials.Padding is better than expected, very comfortable.Glossy finish on metal and vinyl covering cleans easy.Looks good.Good range of adjustments, heavy duty pins feel solid.Leg attachment is super helpful.Does decline - huge plus.ConsPlastic leg/feed end caps can/will come off sometimes. (fixable with glue)Not absolutely 100% rock solid (minor and expected)Gap between seat/back pad forces me to shift position sometimes. (minor/typical/expected)Had to lubricate detent pins for seat/back adjustment. (minor/expected)Back does not adjust to 90", there is a slight incline at max upright position. (being picky here)TakeawayGreat value, great return on initial investment. I wanted a bench that I can put in a closet, or the trunk of my car easily. It needed to be comfortable enough so I want to use it, support up to 500 lb, cost less than $200, and be stable enough so I had confidence when lifting some decent weight. This FlyBird met and exceeded all expectations.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 30, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very high-quality for the money!', 'author': 'Vic E Bentley', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This bench arrived on time, was very easy to set up. It is very sturdy, and I'm a rather large guy. The adjustability is perfect for a multitude of exercises. I like that it folds up and can be stored away easily under a bed or in a closet. Recommended!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars good for a home gym, but not very sturdy', 'author': 'phegos', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I've been using this for 4 months. Here are my thoughts:pros:- assemble it yourself. it's super simple.- per spec it can hold my weight (~200lb) plus more weight than I'll ever press.- it folds up easily and stows out of the way.- it's light and easy to movecons:- the bench itself is a tad high off the ground. It's not a huge issue, but you do feel your feet are a little less planted especially when you are arched up to bench heavy.- the bar that you can lock your feet against seems like an after-thought. I almost never use it, but when I did need it (to get into a stable decline press position) I couldn't find a locking position to make it comfortable.- there are times when you need the bench to be rock solid stable (e.g., when doing bench dips, or when attempting a PB). This bench will rock and sway a bit. In other words you need to keep strict form always, otherwise you may feel the bench wobble under you, which is unsettling and possibly unsafe.- the seat is a bit too wide, and the back rest is slightly too narrow. Not a huge issue, but it does impact some routines: e.g., when doing seated dumbbell curls the dumbbells can graze the seat, and when rolling back with dumbbells or a barbell (e.g., to mount into a skull-crusher position) I'd feel more safe if the bench back support were wider.- the pre-drilled holes for the seatback positions are a bit odd. There's the flat and straight back positions. Those are fine. The decline positions are ok (though I can't lock my legs comfortably, but that's a separate issue). The other incline positions are just a tad too low or too high. I might drill a couple of extra holes exactly where I want them (should be easy enough to do).Despite the negatives I'd recommend this bench for the price and compactness. If you're careful it should serve you well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 26, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ultimate Full Body Workout Companion!', 'author': 'Real Deal', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The FLYBIRD Weight Bench has completely transformed my home workout routine, and I couldn't be happier with this purchase. As someone who loves to engage in various strength training exercises, this bench has become an essential part of my fitness arsenal.The first thing that impressed me about the FLYBIRD Weight Bench is its sturdy and durable construction. The heavy-duty steel frame ensures stability and provides excellent support during intense workouts. I feel safe and confident while performing various exercises, knowing that the bench can handle my weight without any wobbling or shaking.One of the standout features of this bench is its adjustability. With its fast folding and adjustable design, it's incredibly easy to switch between different positions for various exercises. I can quickly adjust the backrest and seat to target different muscle groups, making it ideal for a full-body workout. Whether I'm doing chest presses, incline or decline workouts, or shoulder exercises, the FLYBIRD Weight Bench caters to all my training needs.Another highlight of this bench is its comfortable padding. The high-density foam cushions provide ample support and comfort during extended workout sessions. The upholstery is not only soft and smooth but also easy to clean, which is a huge plus after sweaty workouts.Space-saving is a significant advantage of the FLYBIRD Weight Bench. Its innovative fast folding mechanism allows me to collapse the bench quickly and store it conveniently when not in use. This feature is especially valuable for those with limited space, as it can easily fit in a closet or under the bed.Furthermore, the FLYBIRD Weight Bench comes at a reasonable price point, making it an excellent investment for home gym enthusiasts. Considering its high-quality build, versatility, and adjustability, this bench provides excellent value for money.In conclusion, the FLYBIRD Adjustable Weight Bench has been a game-changer in my fitness journey. Its robust construction, comfort, and versatility make it an exceptional addition to any home gym. If you're looking for a reliable, space-saving, and adjustable weight bench for a full-body workout, I highly recommend the bench - it's an investment you won't regret!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Mold', 'author': 'Brian', 'rating': 5, 'content': "6/4/21 Edit: Updated from 3 to 5 stars.I would recommend flybird. They stand behind their product and go the extra mile to make sure the customer is satisfied. Even though I had problems with this bench, they made it right by sending me a replacement. When I found an issue with the replacement bench, they sent the appropriate parts to fix it along with a gift card for the inconvenience. 5/5 for customer service. If they're able to improve quality control, they would be a stellar company. See below for more detailed review of bench.5/29/21 Edit: Updated from 1 to 3 stars.A company rep reached out to me and offered a replacement. The rep seemed to really care about the customer experience and the replacement bench was shipped quickly. However, the new bench had 2 issues:1. It's missing one of the round stoppers on the leg of the bench that keeps the bench in place.2. The seat cushion is banged up / bent on the edges and seems a little unstable. The upper portion of the bench is also wobbly.I would give FlyBird 5 stars for their great customer support but 3 stars for the quality control of the bench.Bench Performance: I worked out with the bench once so far and it held up well. I'm 5'11, weigh 165 lbs, and used adjustable dumbbells (up to 50lbs each, so max of 100lbs). Although the bench did feel a bit wobbly at times, it did not feel unsafe at the current weight. However, I would not feel as comfortable using this bench if I was lifting above my body weight.Bench Ergonomics: The seat is very wide so might take a bit to get used to. The bench is taller than the normal benches you would find at the gym so might be harder to plant your feet on the ground when bench pressing, but it's still usable for me. The bench adjusts easily between flat/incline/upright positions.Bench footprint: This bench is light weight and assembles/disassembles very easily (literally takes 10 seconds) and can be stored away without taking up much space. This was one of the bench's main appeal and it did not disappoint in this aspect.Conclusion: If you want a light weight bench that is easily set up and put away, and do not plan on lifting very heavy, I think this bench is a good choice (as long as you receive a working product). I'll continue to workout using the bench for now and update my review if needed.____________Original Review:This item arrived with mold growing out of the seat. Not sure if it's inside the seat foam, but there is mold on several surfaces of the bench. Needless to say, this is a health hazard and I would recommend a careful inspection of the item before use.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 25, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Impressive!', 'author': 'Jeff J.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was a little skeptical but after reading others reviews and seeing pics of how compact and durable it appeared in pics I took a chance. For the price point this bench is impressive. Comes fully assembled in a narrow box and it folds in half. I‚Äôm 6‚Äô1 and the back of my head doesn‚Äôt hang off the edge when I‚Äôm laying flat. Another feature I liked is the seat folds all the way down so for inclines or declines it‚Äôs inline with the ‚Äúbody‚Äù of the bench (if that makes sense). It‚Äôs very light weight to me and easy to fold up and pick up to put away. Very sturdy and the padding seems pretty good. I think it‚Äôs pretty well made. I‚Äôve had several workouts on it this week and it was comfortable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great bench! Sturdy but folds up easily!', 'author': 'phenryiv1', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been using this bench for several weeks now and I feel like I have a pretty good handle on the use. I was not able to be too picky when I ordered it, as due to COVID-19 the selection was limited but I was finally able to get a bench for use in my home gym and was happy to be able to finally work out on something other than a rigged up setup.So first, what is good:Packaging was great. Setup took 5 minutes. Literally a couple of pins and screws. The assembly is pretty much fool-proof.The bench is light. Normally, you buy workout gear (and electronics) by the pound, so when something is light, it normally compromises somewhere but the design was very solid despite the weight. The light weight makes it really easy to fold and stow away. The whole thing is WAY easier to get out of the way than a non-folding bench. The folding mechanism is simple (1 pin) and is quite sturdy whether folded or open.The bench has very good angles. Lots of options, proper angles for flat, decline, incline, and seated work. The holding pin has a positive engagement and is easy to operate.The padding and back are a good thickness and width.Despite being light, the bench is VERY sturdy. Presses, flys, single arm work, raises‚Ä¶everything was stable and the bench worked great.The bench is high enough to do bench dips, for most people (more on height below).What is not so good:The seat flares to the front, which makes stepping over during incline work a little challenging. It takes a few workouts to get used to. Not a real issue.The bench is high. Meaning that when flat, it is pretty far off of the floor. I am 5‚Äô5‚Äù and my wife is 5‚Äô7‚Äù and while it is perfect for most stuff, it is too high for step-ups. Great for everything else but be aware that if you wanted to use is for step-us, you probably want to be taller than I am (which is not all that uncommon!) The thing is, it HAS to be high to allow it to fold properly, so this is a design feature, not a design flaw. Just be aware.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 29, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Well built ... but dimensions are not ideal', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'High quality bench, well built, slides easily, feels very secure in all positions. No complaints there. However, for me the dimensions make it somewhat uncomfortable to use. I\'m 5\' 9 & 3/4" (ha) ... and I find when totally flat, in order to grab weights off the floor, I\'m having to bend down a little further than I\'m used to at commercial gym weight room (like this bench is a couple inches higher than whatever the norm is at a commercial gym). Additionally, when using bench elevated I find the upper portion against my back is just a bit too short, so my head doesn\'t rest fully on the back unless I tuck my tailbone and scoot down a little. Again, I don\'t normally experience that at a commercial gym. Finally, the seat portion is wider in the very front, so when it\'s tilted up, I find it uncomfortably pushing my legs wider than they\'d naturally like to be. Somewhat minor complaints, but it bothers me enough I\'d buy something different in the future whenever I replace it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars 2.5 years later‚Ä¶', 'author': 'JustMe123465', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Purchased this in the summer of 2021 and have enjoyed it. It has seen 3-4 days of use per week since purchase, and has held up strong‚Ä¶.mostly.Pro‚ÄôsThe bench pad is well made. Not a single tear or ripped seam.The base feet are sturdy and don‚Äôt rock back and forth.Con‚ÄôsThe foot pad connector came loose and the bolt snapped within the first few weeks after purchase. I had an extra bolt lying around, so no big deal to fix it.The seat pad is a little too wide for me at the end. It really only affects me when I incline the seat, as it is difficult to fully wrap my legs around it.Like others, the bench height is what finally got me to consider something else. At 5‚Äô 10‚Äù, my feet barely touch the ground when in certain positions.Overall, I would recommend this to anyone my height or taller. Good bench for the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Try it out!', 'author': 'C. Grant', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So far I‚Äôm happy with this bench. Even better, I got it on a lightning deal for $120! My perspective, I‚Äôve been lifting weights for 25+ years, mostly in gyms with commercial grade equipment. I can bench 285 lbs. So my expectations for this bench were kinda low at this price point. I was considering Rep or something but they‚Äôre over 2x the price. I recently bought some adjustable dumbbells and just wanted a decent bench for light workouts at home. This perfectly fits my current needs. The pins/holes leave something to be desired since it wiggles a bit when you‚Äôre not using it. But when sitting on the bench your body weight keeps it nice and firmly planted to the floor. The size of the bench is perfect. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô10‚Äù and there‚Äôs room for taller people. I wouldn‚Äôt bench press more than 200 lbs or so on this, but I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to confidently dumbbell press a couple of 60s or 70s. It does fold up and it‚Äôs pretty simple, but I don‚Äôt see myself using that feature much. It comes almost fully assembled, you just attach the shin pad and insert the pins. Will post an update if I have any issues but I think most people will like this bench.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: CAP Barbell Olympic Grip Weight Plate Collection
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great in every way', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'There is everything to like about this set of 10 lb plates. They slide on and off smoothly and the little handle slits are a nice touch. I‚Äôve ordered several sets so far and am using them primarily for loading up my adjustable Olympic dumbbell handles which they‚Äôre perfect for diameter wise while being able to pack decent poundages on efficiently. Last but not least they‚Äôre packaged extremely well when they arrive and this has consistently been the case across several orders. Keep up the great work here, Cap Barbell. I plan on ordering more.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beasts! High quality', 'author': 'JM', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are as shown and as described. Price is fair and perhaps even a bit lower than current market value for in-store weight purchases. The quality is as good as any we have ever purchased in a store but these came right to the front door so we didn't have to drive two hours to get a set from out of town store.We ordered the single weights separately as this seller is selling these because we had ordered a set of weights from another seller and only half of them were even sent. It appears to be a common issue for people ordering sets. They don't get the whole thing they paid for. Ordering these from this seller, individually, seemed safer. (Ordered two of the 25's and two of the 45's. All are equally high quality, well made. No inconsistencies in manufacture.) The 45's are beasts. Each was shipped separately. 45's from two different warehouses, so they don't necessarily all arrive on the same day if you order multiples.Well packaged, padded and in 2 layers of fitted boxes with heavy duty tape.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Nice Weights', 'author': '04rk88', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just bought an Olympic barbell and in the process of converting my weights from Standard 1‚Äù plates to Olympic 2‚Äù‚Äù plates. Not bad for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good material', 'author': 'troy staten', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good weights at a good price. Easy grip weights that you can handle', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars They're (Relatively) Cheap & They Work, With a semi-Loose Fit", 'author': 'lyra', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Unlike many cheap weights, including Caps own standard plates, these were packaged well- they were double-boxed with foam protection & reinforced shipping tape.I ordered two individual 45lb weights, both of which my bathroom scale says weigh in at 45.8lbs. title: CAP Barbell Olympic Bars | Multiple options
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptional Quality and Performance', 'author': 'Kyle Shapiro', 'rating': 5, 'content': "From the moment I unboxed my CAP barbell, I knew I had made the right choice. The build quality is simply unparalleled; it's evident that CAP has put a great deal of thought and expertise into crafting this piece of equipment. The barbell feels sturdy and well-balanced in my hands, providing a solid grip that inspires confidence during my lifts.What truly sets this barbell apart is its remarkable durability. I've been using it extensively for both heavy deadlifts and high-rep training sessions, and it shows no signs of wear and tear. The knurling is perfectly designed, offering just the right amount of grip without being overly abrasive on my hands.Another aspect I greatly appreciate is the barbell's versatility. It fits seamlessly into my workout routine, whether I'm focusing on powerlifting, Olympic lifts, or general conditioning. The smooth rotation of the sleeves has been a game-changer, ensuring efficient and safe execution of my lifts.Customer service from CAP was also top-notch. They were helpful and responsive, ensuring that my barbell arrived promptly and in perfect condition. It's clear that CAP values its customers and stands behind the quality of its products.In conclusion, the CAP barbell has exceeded my expectations in every aspect. It offers professional-grade quality, exceptional durability, and versatility, all at a very reasonable price point. Whether you're a seasoned athlete or just beginning your fitness journey, I highly recommend this barbell. It's an investment in your training that you won't regret.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best budget Olympic barbell!!!! But it‚Äôs 35 lbs', 'author': 'Anneg22', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered the chrome 7ft Olympic barbell. ***It isn‚Äôt 45lbs just fyi, it‚Äôs roughly 35lbs. *** but I knew that when I ordered. I‚Äôm a woman who will likely keep the weight under 300lbs on the bar so it‚Äôs sufficient for me. All my 2 inch rubber plates fit no problem. It is a bit rattly but weight lifting is noisy. It‚Äôs a great starter bar or bar for women. I will probably upgrade eventually but for just starting my home gym it is perfect, it may surprise me and last a really long time. It‚Äôs honestly no different in quality than the barbells I was squatting and deadlifting with at lifetime fitness. Thanks CAP for making an affordable option for those of us who can‚Äôt justify spending $300 on a Rogue barbell.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It‚Äôs a quality product', 'author': 'Great bar, best price going for a real Olympic bar', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a very nice bar and the best price going for an Olympic bar', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Dumbbell', 'author': 'Seth Flinchbaugh', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Bar works great and feels good in the hand. Im not a fan on the clamps used to hold the weights on but they feel solid and do work well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars It's very heavy and strong", 'author': 'Melinda', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this to help my husband get jacked. It works like it should. He puts weights on it and lifts them up and puts them down. It's been good, he likes it and I like my jacked husband!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 60" black bar is a good bar if you have realistic expectations', 'author': 'patticake', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My husband and I have had a wide variety from low to mid-range fitness and strength products over the years, so when he wanted a lower-priced Oly barbell, we thought of Cap as our experiences have overall been good with them for over 25 years. We have found that sometimes their chromed equipment has sharp edges or flakes, so we went with the 60in, Solid Bar, Black. My husband is lifting 300 pounds max - usually less - and I'm lifting 100 or under, so this bar seemed good.And it is just what we wanted. It's lighter than an official bar but heavier than a 1-inch standard bar, the black finish is attractive with no flaking or sharp edges at all. The knurling is comfortable and grippy. The sleeves don't stick, and while I don't think they have bearings or bushings, for this price, we weren't expecting any. The black finish is coming off of the sleeves in a couple small places, but for the price, we expected that. We're using it almost daily, with and without a small rack, and are completely satisfied.This is a budget-priced all-solid bar, so we didn't expect an Ohio Power Bar or something like that. We bought this bar as it will work for our needs and costs around 1/4 of the price of a value bar and about 1/8th of a price or less of a high end bar, but we don't need a high end bar. And to bring a solid bar in at this price range, there are going to be compromises, but we knew that going in.Overall if you don't want to spend too much money but don't want a hollow barbell, this is a solid option. We're getting a lot of use out of it, and plan to keep using it for years to come.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Your value-packed adjustable dumbbells are here!', 'author': 'D W', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was looking at a similar product from a "top tier" barbell company for $150, but thought I\'d save some money and go with this dumbbell instead. I am sure glad I did, because the quality on this is very nice. The knurling feels good (I hate weak/smooth knurling), and it\'s nice and clean and looks good. Nothing about it feels cheap to me. It was well packed and arrived in perfect shape. I was also considering getting some adjustable barbells like the Bowflex 1090 or Snode AD80, but these give me all the adjustability I can wish for - you only need some olympic plates to go with them which I already had.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great bang for the buck', 'author': 'NiK', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I don't know why anyone would buy anything more expensive. Its great and does the job for home gym!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars do I need a curling bar?', 'author': 'Bruce Hedlund', 'rating': 5, 'content': "You need at least one if you plan to work your arms but I would recommend two. This bar is an olympic size and I waited to verify that it does weigh 15 lb. I would recommend too of these because if you have one set up for different weights for different exercises ahead of time it helps eliminate delays in your workout. The only thing I don't like is that with every bar you buy, curl or straight, they come with these stupid spring clips which I just don't like so plan on buying better collars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Gets the job done', 'author': 'Jordan Cederdahl', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I bought this Olympic bar for the home gym I'm putting together. I used to have a full YORK Barbell rack and Olympic bar with plates. This CAP barbell was advertised as an Olympic Barbell, which, if true, should weigh 45 lbs. I've used it a few times and things seemed a bit light. I held the barbell in one arm and a 35 lb dumbbell in the other, they felt about the same. I came back to the product description and saw that it was listed as weighing 36.7 lbs. This is fine, I'm not a professional weightlifter nor do I plan to complete anything where this difference would matter. The only negative is it messes with my already present barbell math, which is slightly annoying. This is just to say that this is not a traditional Olympic barbell if you are looking for a 45lb bar. Having said all of that, this is a quality barbell to use for home fitness.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: FEIERDUN Adjustable Dumbbells, 44/66lbs Free Weight Set with 4 Modes, Used as Barbell, Kettlebells, Push up Stand, Fitness Exercises for Home Gym Suitable Men/Women
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Home Dumbbell System', 'author': 'David Cripe', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought the 44lb set due to the types of weights included and the adjustable way you can move things around. I am not a fitness freak and just trying to get in shape more. This system is made of plastic, but it is a high quality plastic. It feels sturdy and solid!Everything is included in the pictures as is, but I wish they had included a second kettle base rod. The second handle for the kettle base is pretty much on its own since it doesn't have a place to go (unless you use it on a dumbbell or as a handle for pushups). Having a way to use two kettle bases at once would have been nice, or at least a way to store the last bit of weights so they are not loose.The yellow nuts are solid plastic and very sturdy. They screw on with no trouble and the threads on the entire system is of excellent quality. The weights on the dumbbells have not moved a cm since I got this a week ago. You will have an extra nut laying around due to the lack of a second kettle base. You could double up on one end of the dumbbells, or it will be used if you use less than 4 weights on the kettle base (needed to support the bottom).The barbell foam connector is nice and thick too. It is shaped in a rounded triangular pattern which allows for more stability. The only other thing I would improve upon is to provide both metric and imperial/standard systems on the weights. We can do the conversion easily online, but those of us here in the US cannot really fathom the difference between a kg compared to a lb. Although, I guess this will help us learn how to convert from kilograms to pounds.Overall, the entire system here is highly recommended and a quality set for the price. The plastic is really sturdy and feels like it will last a long time. I can only guess on whether there is a steel rod inside each bar (and if it is as thick as they say). But, the bars do feel that sturdy. Will buy few more weights from them.', 'author': 'Eugene Veselov', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'For me it was a long story. As many other in this stay-at-home time I decided to equip myself with the minimum stuff for exercising. I expected that dumbbells will be the easiest and the cheapest part - it\'s just a piece of metal after all. My na√Øve expectation was between 50 and 90 bucks. Turns out that I was so mistaken. Much more complex things (like benches) cost much less, while this "just metal" stuff is pretty expensive from all suppliers. And I needed many different weights for different exercises. An obvious solution was to choose one of variety adjustable dumbbells. I found an adjustable dumbbells totaling 105 pounds at about $100. Delivery wait time was long - about two month, but even after that I received nothing. Maybe I aimed too cheap. So I started investigating the topic more. And found (from customer reviews) that almost all providers of "adjustable" weights are pretty suspicious - wait time is too long, parts are missing, product is broken, adjustment is inconvenient, locking is unreliable, etc. I had to look at more expensive stuff. Found something at $600 (oh, that was so much higher than I expected in the beginning). And when I was almost ready to order it, I realized that all such "adjustable" dumbbells have too wide gripping bars - more than 17" (a space is needed by design to allow weights combination). I realized that this will make most my exercises difficult or impossible to do (I need to lift and rotate them, keeping them close to each other, which would be impossible with such wide bars). So I switched my search to fixed-weight dumbbells which I originally skipped as too expensive considering that I needed several different weights. But at this time me price expectation has been lifted enough to make such solutions comparatively acceptable. To begin, I ordered just one pair for $123. It arrived in just few days in a good double-layered box. I tried them and immediately felt that this is exactly what I needed - easy to grab, easy to switch to other weights, comfortable and reliable for exercising. How anyone could wrap up WET chemicals on dumbbells and deliberately deliver them to actual people trying to be healthy, is BAFFLING! I should have known not to try to save a little bit of money when it comes to my over all health care concerns.I‚Äôve thought a lot about what to write about this experience. I knew that a small amount of smell always comes from any rubber/plastic product. But this was not a smell. It was a baggy, wet, slurping gob of death that was all over my skin and LITERALLY POURED out of one of the bags.Luckily I have faith that God will definitely hold people accountable for their deliberate actions. This is NOT A COMPANY THAT HAS HEALTH ANYWHERE IN THEIR CONSCIENCE! It‚Äôs all the bottom dollar on cheap, cancer causing chemicals to make a buck OFF OF PEOPLE TRYING TO BE HEALTHY! IMO the worst of the worst. The funny part is they tried to give it to me for cheaper? OMG you make this stuff up! They couldn‚Äôt have PAID ME TO KEEP THIS CRAP ANYWHERE NEAR MY HOUSE AND MY FAMILY!I hope nothing but the worst for this business and hope it meets bankruptcy asap and these people are held accountable for their despicable actions.Buy steel or buy plastics from companies who actually care about their customers!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The weights I received are good quality and both weigh the same.', 'author': 'Corey Taylor', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've read other people's reviews saying the weights were inconsistent weight and were of poor quality, but the one's I received are both the same and have no quality issues I can tell. I don't know if the scale is off by 0.2 pounds or is it the dumbbells, but either way, I'm satisfied the weight is close enough, and more importantly, both weights are consistent with each other.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Be ready for a whirlwind of difficult', 'author': 'Olivia MacKell', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Let me start by saying I ordered this as a set. When I ordered the set it was "in stock" and "prime delivery" for in a couple days. Well. A month passed and i received nothing. I contacted Amazon and they told me they had not shipped because the carrier is probably "out of stock" and will send once the items are available.FINALLY a package was delivered TWO MONTHS after I ordered the set. BUT IT WAS JUST THE SET OF 30 LB WEIGHTS! I looked it up and realized that they were sending THREE separate packages. One with the 30\'s, one with the rack and the 25\'s, and then one package with the rest of the weights. I understand they are probably too heavy to all ship all together- but at least send all the packages at once or let me know that is what is going to happen.SO, I waited more. And FINALLY the rack was delivered with the 25\'s. NEARLY ANOTHER MONTH LATER. (Now it has almost been 3 months since first ordering this set.) HOWEVER, IT WAS THE WRONG RACK. I had ordered the 2 tier rack and the carrier sent me the A framed rack. Which I wanted the 2 tier so i can eventually fit more weights AND it was more expensive. So, i had to return them. UPS wouldn\'t take them because Amazon only gave me one return slip- but the weights came in a separate box, so i needed 2 slips or was going to have to pay for a 50 pound package.I finally get amazon to send me another slip. Return the rack. They almost immediately sent me the new and RIGHT one. Which i appreciated. I don\'t understand why it took over 2 months to get the wrong one and then i received the right one right away?Keep in mind- i am almost 9 months pregnant and trying to return all this stuff twice. Carrying all this heavy equipment. Patience running thin.ALSO when the rack got here it had NO instructions. I had to just figure out how to assemble it. It took hours. There were metal "hang nails" in some of the holes where screws went, that kept screws from fitting through the holes. So. I had to get a LIGHTER AND HOLD IT TO THE METAL TO TRY AND MELT AND BEND BACK THE BLOCKAGE.And now. Here I am. Waiting to receive the rest of my weights (which are the lighter weights i will probably ACTUALLY be using.) And it has been 3 months since i initially bought this set. It sucks. I really wanted these. I wish the company would at least get in contact with me. I am about to pop out a baby and I do not just have 240 dollars to mess around with. Super frustrated by this whole process. Honestly not worth it or the price. I will keep what I have and what i am waiting for- it IS good quality and I have put SO much time into this now. But please spare yourself and buy from a different company.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great but not EXACTLY what I ordered', 'author': 'hula princess', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Quality of the weights and rack are great.While putting the rack together ONE nut was missing.Also I ordered the colored set but received all black weights.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]
