The plastic end cap broke off real easy but otherwise good products.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect size, saves money', 'author': 'Eric Guest', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôve been doing exclusively barbell work for a while now and decided to add dumbbells. I really like the ease of use of the quick-adjust style like bow flex but was turned off by the cost, especially when I already have a bunch of weights. I looked into spinlocks but they pretty much all were 1 inch and I only have 2 inch plates. These fit the bill perfectly. I went with these specifically because they are 16‚Äù vs most of the others which are 20‚Äù wide. 16 is definitely the right choice, I can do any motion and they don‚Äôt feel too wide or hit each other. Your max weight will be limited to how many plates you can fit, but with my standard 5lb plates I can easily get 4 on each side with my thick collar locks, so about 50lb. If you switch to spring clips you could easily push that to 70 or 80lb using only 5s. I think 10s would be a little too large and get in the way of certain exercises. Speaking of spring clips, throw the included ones straight in the trash, they suck and the coating flaked off literally the first time I squeezed them. Overall I highly recommend these, I forgot how much I missed doing dumbbell work and these make it so easy and affordable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better than expected.', 'author': 'D. Smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Was hesitant on getting those so first got regular dumbbells but needed more weights so decided to give it a try - love them more than I expected.1. Comfort of holding them is great, I got some weight plates (small diameter) and they are perfect and don‚Äôt get on the way. I use them as-is for my back exercises but got silicon grip handles (separately) and they provide amazing support for bicep workouts.2. Ease of putting weights on and off - quick and easy. I do not like the weight clippers that they came with - they stick out too much (but kind of good if you use them since they‚Äôll stop your dumbbell from rolling away) so I use other clamps I‚Äôve already had.3. Length - is perfect, makes it convenient and not overwhelmingly huge dumbbell, this length actually feels natural.So yeah, I‚Äôm not buying those single weight dumbbells anymore for sure, should‚Äôve gotten these instead.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice budget dumbbell handles', 'author': 'patticake', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I wanted to add dumbbells to my workouts, and since we have Oly plates, it made sense to get Oly dumbbells. I\'m only 5\'4" with small hands, so I prefer a shorter dumbbell, and after considering all the 15" and 16" handles, I chose these AboveGenius Pair of 16" Olympic Dumbbell Handles based on the price, the reviews and the length.They arrived in a box that was falling apart, but they were fine - the ends are wrapped in plastic and packed in foam, which is nice. Nothing had any smells or issues, although the manual was torn in 2 places. The handles looked good with no scratches or other damage at all. I weighed each one, and each weighed 7.1xx pounds, very close to the same weight.The collar spin is very good for \'bells at this price - nice, smooth spin. The end caps are snapped-in plastic, not exactly high-end, but then these are budget dumbbell handles, so that\'s fine. There\'s a little rattle in each one, but it\'s not bad. Both my 6\'7" husband and me at 5\'4" found them comfortable to use. If you like grooved collars, you\'ll like these, and the grooves probably work really well with the spring clamps. I\'m using my own clamps with the handles like I do with our other bars, but if you don\'t have clamps, the included ones will come in handy. I personally prefer smooth collars, but that\'s the only thing I didn\'t like about this pair of handles, and it\'s just personal preference.We\'re really happy with these. If you\'re a beginner they\'ll be great for getting started, and if you have been using spin-lock handles, these are better and much faster to change the plates on. The knurling is passive but it\'s good enough to keep your hands from slipping. Overall I\'d say these were 4 star dumbbell handles, but when you factor in the price - we paid $59.99 for them - I\'m giving them a fifth star for value.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 16 inch loadable Olympic dumbbell bar..nothing more . nothing less..', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "For me the handles seemed small in diameter 15/16 (.935)‚Ä¶close enough.Solution: Local hardware , 3/8 x 1/2... or 3/8 x 7/8( fits the DB bar diameter spot on) polyethylene pipe insulation foam. Cut it to size (already pre split) then wrap it tight (@ least twice) with an electrical tape (3M). Not big on spring clamps on DB's. Replaced with Iron Crush Olympic barbell clips. Extremely satisfied. In the photos 1 DB is loaded @ 88.3 lbs the other is 98.3 lb. Rotated DB with 98.3 lbs up & down number of times, all stayed put. Abovegenius DB'S will get you where you want go in your workout routine.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Affordable', 'author': 'Windy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Excellent buy I am very happy with the quality.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for a Home gym setting', 'author': 'K', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'To start off with I‚Äôm a female I don‚Äôt work out often but I wanted some weights. I‚Äôve had these I wanna say for like two or three months now they‚Äôre perfectly fine. I chose these because they‚Äôre affordable and they can go really heavy and I can gradually build up to get up there since I am trying to build my legs/glutes at home. I didn‚Äôt really have problems of like chipped paint, Also, I wear gloves when I handle them so I don‚Äôt get calluses. Also, the grip can be a little rough. Also, these can be adjusted really easy. If you get the 200 pound set which is about 100 pounds on each dumbbell therefore I can adjust it from 5 pounds which is just the handle all the way up to 100 pounds which is good so you don‚Äôt have to buy multiple it took a while to carry these upstairs only caring 10 pound plate one at a time since I‚Äôm not strong enough to carry more than 20 pounds at a time. These aren‚Äôt fancy or anything their regular weights they get the job done also, mine didn‚Äôt have any rough marks on the weights at all. Very smooth. It does take some time to change them out, but I don‚Äôt do super sets, so it‚Äôs not a problem for me. These are iron so they will basically forever I don‚Äôt recommend dropping them though I don‚Äôt recommend dropping any weights but like I said they‚Äôre iron so they‚Äôll last you a lifetime also from other sellers I got some additional plates so instead of going up to 100 mine can go up to 120 eventually I‚Äôll be able to lift that much just gotta keep practicing and working out. Not too much to stay about these weights. They‚Äôre exactly like the picture and they work perfectly fine. Also, when they do start to get old, you can clean them and buy iron spray paint, which will stop them from rusting if the paint starts to come off. that‚Äôs all', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best out there', 'author': 'Marcelo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have a few adjustable dumbbells I‚Äôve bought over time on FB and CL. title: Finer Form Multi-Functional FID Weight Bench for Full All-in-One Body Workout ‚Äì Hyper Back Extension, Roman Chair, Adjustable Ab Sit up Bench, Incline Decline Bench, Flat Bench
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value, solid bench', 'author': 'Scott', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently decided to invest in the Finer Form Multi-Functional FID Weight Bench and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. As a fitness enthusiast who does a lot of strength training, I needed a bench that could provide me with the necessary support and functionality without breaking the bank. This bench more than exceeded my expectations, giving me excellent quality for its value.One of the things I appreciated most about the Finer Form Weight Bench was how easy it was to assemble. Everything arrived well-packaged, with clear instructions on how to put everything together. I was able to assemble it on my own without needing any additional help or tools, which is a great relief when dealing with complicated fitness equipment.The bench itself is incredibly durable and well-made. The steel frame is sturdy and can support up to 1000 lbs of weight, and the thick padding on the back and seat provides excellent support and comfort during my workouts. I also appreciate the versatile design of the bench, which allows me to adjust the angle to fit my needs, whether for incline, decline or flat bench press. This makes it perfect for a variety of different exercises, including dumbbell curls, shoulder presses and more.Aside from its functionality and high-quality, the bench also looks great. The sleek, all-black design fits perfectly in my home gym setup, and the bench is surprisingly compact so it doesn't take up too much space. I appreciate the attention to detail the design team has paid to the bench to make it both aesthetically pleasing and practical for use.All in all, I can't speak highly enough of the Finer Form Multi-Functional FID Weight Bench. It's an excellent value, and its high quality and ease of assembly have made it an integral part of my workout routine. Its solid build, comfortable padding, and good looks are a bonus, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable, multifunctional weight bench.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great upgrade from previous model', 'author': 'TTT', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've owned the previous model (without the incline) for two years and it still looks brand new after daily use and even a fair amount of stacking boxes and other heavy objects on it. It's still available, and if you're just looking to do core work, it's a great bench. It doesn't fold, but it's easy to stand on its end.I purchased this updated FID version (flat/incline/decline) because it's truly what I wanted two years ago, but wasn't available. There are plenty of bench choices, but to my knowledge, Finer Form is the only one that incorporates an adjustable pad that can be used for preacher curls as well as Roman chair hyperextension. It can also be removed easily if you want more room while sitting.One thing I hate is creaky, squeaky furniture or equipment, and I wasn't sure what to expect for this price point when I purchased the first bench. I was surprised just how good the build quality was, and I can say that the new bench is equally sturdy, and the advertised weight limit has increased to 1000 pounds. I weigh 225 pounds, and there are zero creaks and no wobbles whatsoever. I don't know about the 1k limit, but I could see it easily handling over 400 lbs.Overall, this is a great addition to an at home workout room. The older model is great for core exercises, but not as good as it could be as a weight bench. Most other weight benches are great for lifting, but not well-suited to ab or back work. This newer bench from Finer Form is great for core exercise (sit-ups, hyperextensions), while adding support for dumbbell presses, fly, and other traditional bench exercises. Still not foldable, but still reasonably easy to stand on its end to clear floor space.The only negative I experienced were a couple errors in the assembly instructions that appear to be due to editing mistakes and poor proofreading. Although the instructions are a little confusing, the diagrams are clear and easy to understand. Just make sure to use the correct fasteners as shown in the diagrams, since some are slightly different in size and count.I am receiving no compensation for this review and paid the full Amazon retail price. If you check my review history you'll see I'm not in the habit of reviewing items--good or bad. I took the time to write a review because I'm really impressed with this equipment at an affordable price point. I've also seen some negative reviews regarding missing or poor fitting parts, but I think a small percentage of issues can be expected with any product, and those same reviewers also mention getting great customer service.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It‚Äôs an ok for now versatile bench', 'author': 'Danny', 'rating': 4, 'content': '5‚Äô3‚Äù 200lb man. Did my research and chose this bench for low price, its versatility, back extension and sit up capability. Have only done one work out and it does the job.PROS: for as simple as it is, the frame is solid, study, bit of a wobble during flys but not too bad- ai might need to tighten bolts. One mid bolt didnt want to go in all the way, may need a drill to get it in all the way- bit of tight fit it seems. Fast transition between workouts. Light weight. Back extensions are good enough, I was worried the bench was going to hit my face on the way down, which was not the case‚Ä¶ face comes close to it when bench is down enough to get good sets in, I would use bumbells on each hand for added weight vs plates on the chest. Decent padding.CONS: damaged during shipping- broken plastic cap, scratches, punctured. open parts package, missing parts. Too many moving parts during shipping. Bit wobbly during flys. I was just missing a washer which I bought at a local hardware store. One plastic cap was popped out and broken, will contact vendor to replace. Seems they add or remove parts to the parts package for this model needed or not needed for assembly. Even the manual says to contact them if there is anything missing. Suggest marking parts number on parts package- not sure why instructions use part number but parts package isn‚Äôt marked. Cheap thin pleather- if it ever rips I would upholster it with good quality thick leather. Other than that no complaints. Would suggest: extending the curl pads by an inch, I have a wide frame, arms on the edge during curls. An inch wider for the bench board/seat seems a bit narrow during sit ups.Overall decent bench for now, gets the job done, just don‚Äôt know how long the pleather will last. It may be a roll of dice of parts when you get it, but once you have all you need its not bad.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 11, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, reliable so far . . .', 'author': 'LonePalm', 'rating': 5, 'content': "On balance very pleased. Decent quality and when assembled is very sturdy, no danger in having a failure. Roman chair extension works well, as does the decline portion for abb curls. My bench has been in service for six months and shows no sign of wear. Caveat: assembly may be difficult for some. I have lots of experience and it took me almost an hour. The instructions are decent, the supplied tools are marginal at best (I used my own wrenches). If you have never assembled a piece or furniture this could be daunting. I believe this model is the top end of FF's benches and its quality and versatility reflect that. Recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Solid Bench', 'author': 'Coolpapa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'To start, it arrived well-packed with organized hardware and instructions. It is not difficult to assemble, but kudos to anyone who says they put this together in 30 minutes. With two people, maybe. With one person alone, probably more like 60-90 minutes (still not bad). It comes with an Allen key and wrenches, but do yourself a favor and keep any ratchet tools you have handy.I have been using this now for regular workout for a couple weeks. It is a well-built bench, especially in this price range. I am a big person and in those two weeks I have yet to experience any lack of stability. The cushioning is comfortable I like the versatility of incline positions, foot pad positions, and preacher pad positions, and also like the handles by the preacher pad. I was originally looking at one of those collapsible benches, but I liked the idea of the preacher pad with bench incline, and some of the exercises this bench affords. This is NOT a portable bench that you can stowaway in the closet when you are done. It can be repositioned relatively easily as one side has wheels and the opposite side has a handle. But this is not one of those benches that collapses into something you can put under a bed. I like the chart that is included providing illustrations of how the bench can be utilized. The more of these exercises you can build into your workout the better bargain this bench becomes. A few things that I think would make this bench even better and probably not add too much to the cost: (1) include anchors for resistance bands - presently I use some extra velcro ankle straps with D-hooks around the legs of the bench. (2) the preacher pad is adjustable vertically, but not horizontally. If this could be adjustable width-wise it would be much better. (3) make the head rest adjustable. I am 5\'11" and I have no problem, but it would be nice to have that extra versatility.All in all, I am happy with the purchase and recommend this bench.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent quality, solid, easy assembly', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We bought this bench for our small workout room, and to have the leg pad/support for back extension type exercises. It was quite well packed, no damage to any parts that I noticed. I assembled it myself in just under an hour. Instructions were good and easy to follow. The finished product is very solid - it has a high quality and heavy duty feel. I'm 6' tall and about 250 lbs right now, and I it feels like it can handle any exercise I throw at it. Great value (I caught it on sale after Christmas). I recommend if you want to do free weights and other stuff.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value, held up well so far', 'author': 'JPDIY', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bench is well made considering the price point, tough to find anything (new) at comparable price. I‚Äôve been using it for a little less than a year and it‚Äôs held up well so far, sturdy doesn‚Äôt wobble much if at all mid lift. Padding is thick. Main thing I bought it for was back extensions. At 6‚Äô2‚Äù 230 I‚Äôm not small so laying over half my weight on an extension attachment was unnerving at first but it‚Äôs held up well. Easy adjustments. FYI I don‚Äôt lift dumbbells over 40-50lbs, I‚Äôm guessing bench can handle more but it‚Äôs not commercial grade, high end homeowner I‚Äôd call it. Couldn‚Äôt be happier for my needs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Functional but could be better', 'author': 'metricspork', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I am 5 10 180 lbs and will use it to do dumbbell exercise up to 50-60 lbs.It works ok but could be better. The precher curle bench is not wide enough to use a bar but works for single dumbbells at time. The padding could be a bit thicker and firmer. A few inch increase in width of the base would help stability. Frame is not excessively flimsy but not rugged either. I would have preferred something sturdier for $50-100 more.It is useable and maybe as good as anything else in the price range. Offers a range of exercises for a reasonable price. If you were much bigger than me/ wanted to use heavier weights I wouldn't buy it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great customer service!', 'author': 'Nancy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The bench arrived quickly. I put it together easily alone in about 1 hour carefully following the instructions. I‚Äôm a 67 year old woman who has NOT been working out. The adjustable frame that holds the support pads had a slight indentation. This would have been insignificant except it prevented one of the handles from pushing in all the way and locking. I contacted the customer service by email. Within 30 minutes the representative (Eileen) emailed me back and said they would send a new adjustable frame. It came within 5 days (probably less). You could not ask for better service.The item itself is well made, stable and very functional. I‚Äôm about 64 inches. My husband is 74 inches. It works for both of us. Needless to say, I recommend it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'christopher gates', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The only bench I could find that when you incline the back, the 'butt pad' inclines too. All the others keep it horizontal while the lower back takes all the strain. And, Roman Chair feature it great! Well worth the money.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Highly recommended üëå", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great item', 'author': 'Danny', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love these. Best dumbells I've ever ordered.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good value', 'author': 'Mike', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great value for 2‚Äù plates. I prefer having these than most adjustable dumbbells.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good-looking, relatively short and light loadable dumbbells with mild knurling', 'author': 'Windtable', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I think these are an excellent choice if you are looking for a pair of relatively inexpensive, compact (under 16" long), loadable dumbbells with a black finish and don\'t need sleeves that spin. They are perfect for my specific uses, which are shoulder exercises like external rotations that require light weights and small weight progressions (I use fractional plates or change plates) as well as wrist rotations and certain diagonal movements (because the bushings of my rotating-sleeve Rogue barbells make an annoying clicking noise when not held parallel to the ground). For other exercises with fairly heavy (for me) weights, I prefer sleeves that spin.The grip is 32.25 mm in diameter (satisfyingly wide) and has mild knurling that won\'t tear up your hands but should provide an adequate grip for most uses. The sleeves are ribbed and each has about 4" of usable length (4.8" total length). The endcaps are flat, black, and have an attractive blue logo. The finish of both the sleeves and grip is very good. The finish on the edges of the collars is a bit uneven but it isn\'t terribly noticeable unless you\'re looking for it. The welds look very solid. The dumbbells come in a box with the sleeves wrapped in bubble wrap to protect them, so there was no damage in transit.The dumbbells are a fairly light 4.6 lbs. each but still feel solid. The light weight is an advantage for beginners, for rehab/prehab, or for exercisers who want to exercise weaker muscles (e.g., doing external shoulder extensions). If you add fractional or change plates you can increase the weight of each dumbbell by as little as a half pound at a time to progress smoothly without injury. The light weight also permits you to use them as clubs with a fat 49 mm grip and the ribbing makes your grip more secure. I use them for all of these purposes.I think these dumbbells look really nice with their matte black coating. But I\'m not sure how durable it will be (it\'s not Cerakote) over time, especially on the sleeves if you use metal plates or bumper or urethane plates with steel inserts. (I can already see a few very small shiny spots where the coating was worn away on the grip but not on the sleeves.) My Olympic weights fit fine with a snug fit. The dumbbells come with spring collars that attach easily and securely. I\'m not sure whether they would scratch the sleeves over time so you might consider plastic collars like the ones from Clout if you want to avoid that, but two pairs of plastic collars are almost as much as the dumbbells.If you change plates frequently during exercise and don\'t enjoy doing so, you might want to consider adjustable dumbbells of the type where the weights sit on a stand and attach and detach quickly (like the popular PowerBlocks (not my favorite because of the plastic grip and clanging) or ones from Bowflex and the promising-looking ones from Rep Fitness, N√ºobell, Northdeer or IFAST.For dumbbells with rotating sleeves, I use the ones by Rogue. They\'re very nice, though expensive, and come in 10 lb. and 15 lbs. weights. I use American Barbell urethane change plates, which are durable and don\'t have a rubber smell and are attractively-priced for urethane, for weights between about 1 lb. and 10 lbs. (they come in kilos, not pounds) and the metal Micro Gainz fractional weight plates, which are small and colorful and fairly well made, for plates weighing up to 1 lb. The Rogue dumbbells and Micro Gainz plates are sometimes on sale.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars 2 oz difference', 'author': 'Anthony Engebretson', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'First impressions were they are heavy duty and well made, however the dumbbells are not the same weight. One is 4 lbs 10.8 oz, the other is 4 lbs 8.8 oz.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Paint missing and knurling different', 'author': 'ConcreteRhino', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'One handle has super rough knurling and the other is smooth with missing paint on both handles. Probably worth 20 for the set not what I paid.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Much better than the old 1" plates with screw collars.', 'author': 'Neuro5i5', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Each bar weighs in at 4lb 9oz bare with no collars. The knurled grip is good, enough to provide a decent grip, but not so much it will cause abrasion. Likewise, the threading on the sleeves are enough to provide some resistance to plates slipping, but not enough to make it difficult to install or remove plates. I do wish the handle portion was maybe just a touch wider. Using anything over a 25lb plate toward the middle is grip prohibitive due to my shorter arms, but luckily the sleeves are long enough to stack a few lower weight plates. Outside of that lone criticism these plate handles are surprisingly nice for the cost. They feel plenty sturdy for my needs and the overall construction makes me feel confident in using them on a frequent basis. One of my better home gym purchases I think.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic Exercise Bench for Versatile Workouts!', 'author': 'Willatvr', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I recently purchased the exercise bench, and I must say it has exceeded my expectations in every way. This bench has become an essential part of my workout routine, and I couldn‚Äôt be happier with its performance.Firstly, the build quality of this exercise bench is exceptional. The materials used are sturdy and durable, providing a solid foundation for my exercises. It feels incredibly stable, even during intense workouts, which gives me the confidence to push myself further.One of the standout features of this bench is its versatility. It offers multiple adjustable positions, allowing me to target different muscle groups with ease. Whether I‚Äôm performing incline presses, decline sit-ups, or even dumbbell flyes, this bench adapts effortlessly to accommodate my needs. The range of angles it offers is impressive, making it suitable for users of various fitness levels.Comfort is another aspect where this exercise bench shines. The padding is thick and plush, providing excellent support for my back and ensuring a comfortable experience during prolonged workouts. I\'m 5\'11" weighing a lean 240lbs, and it is very stable while working with an extra 230 lbs of weights (didn\'t try higher weight), also the headrest in the high position was tall enough to support my head in all backrest positions, which is important for me. I appreciate that it doesn\'t try to be a "jack of all trades" and keeps it simple. Just a bench with leg supports. Easy to fold up and stow.Headrest likely won\'t be tall enough in the upright position if you\'re over 6\'1", but it\'s taller than most competition. I estimate it would be good for up to 6\'4"-ish in the flat position. The bands are very lightweight bands (might be good if that\'s what you\'re looking for). A little gimmicky but great idea. I found them useful for providing more resistance for sit-ups and core exercises. My wife loves them! Bought my own resistance bands and they work fairly well affixed to the oem points. Throw enough weight on the bench, and it works as a fairly good anchor point for them.4* instead of 5* because: The backrest adjuster on a sliding pin is excellent. The seat adjustment pin is just a standard pin. Could improve seat by adding a similar styled fast slider adjustment pin as the backrest. Headrest cannot be easily adjusted, you\'ll need to unscrew it, then screw onto lower position if you need to change it. Could improve by adding an easy adjustment pin for headrest instead of screw into place, but there\'s potential cons to that (headrest stability could suffer if not implemented correctly). Headrest screws were missing washers.Overall it is a great product. For your basic adjustable and stowable bench, this is the cream of the crop of all the ones I\'ve tried. We love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great, just great!', 'author': 'Platyjaeger', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'For that price you get a first class workout bench. Highly recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Top tier for this price range', 'author': 'Chris', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôve had this bench for two months now, using it at least three times a week. If you‚Äôre reading reviews, you know you can spend a lot more on a bench or even a bit less. My 5 stars is specifically for this price range, not against all benches that one could possibly buy. I am 6‚Äô3‚Äù, 200lb, and I am doing all kinds of strength training with barbells and dumbbells. For those activities, this is meeting almost all of my needs. The padding is good, and I don‚Äôt have any immediate concerns about the quality. Feels like it‚Äôs going to hold up well. The head portion can be extended (with bolts, not something you will do more than once probably), but I found it to be better for me at the lower position. The adjustments hit all the right angles for me, both with the back and the seat. The ankle pads are also in a good spot, and have good adjustments, although I don‚Äôt use them much. While the bench does have a decline option, I would not say it‚Äôs not the best. Doing decline crunches works, but I feel like it‚Äôs lacking proper support behind the knees. I have only seen very expensive benches do decline positions well, at least for someone as tall as me. Stability is pretty good for anything laying down or seated. No wobbling at all. Tricep dips are also stable. Using this for loaded hip thrusts is possible but not great. I have managed to use it by putting the bench against a squat rack to keep it from moving away from me. To be fair, you would need a pretty substantial bench to resolve this problem. Doing incline curls, with your chest against the bench, can be tricky if you‚Äôre tall. But I‚Äôve found putting my feet on the bench feet makes it more stable. I am not lifting crazy amounts of weight, but I would not be worried about this supporting about 500 lbs total. The angle adjustment is a spring loaded, pull motion pin, that also screws in to be sure it won‚Äôt move. It‚Äôs quite easy to adjust, while also not making me worry about it. It does fold up, and has a convenient handle at the seat to help carry it. I wish there was less of a gap between the seat and the back, but that is a feature you will need to pay more for.Overall this is a great bench for the price. Don‚Äôt go into this expecting the perfect bench because you aren‚Äôt paying the price for that. I‚Äôd say this gets you about 80-90% there though. title: Bundles
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Solid Choice for Home Workouts!', 'author': 'James Rushforth', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Cap Barbell 40-Pound Dumbbell Set, and I must say, I am thoroughly impressed! This set is perfect for anyone looking to add some weight training to their home workout routine.First off, the quality of these dumbbells is top-notch. The handles are sturdy and provide a comfortable grip, even during intense workouts. The weight plates are also well-made and fit securely onto the handles, so there's no need to worry about them coming loose.Another great thing about this set is the versatility it offers. With four 2.5-pound plates, four 5-pound plates, and two dumbbell handles, you can easily adjust the weight to suit your needs. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned lifter, this set has you covered.I also appreciate how compact this set is. It doesn't take up much space, so it's perfect for small home gyms or apartments. Plus, the plates are easy to store, so you can keep your workout area neat and organized.Overall, I highly recommend the Cap Barbell 40-Pound Dumbbell Set to anyone looking for a high-quality, versatile, and space-saving weight set for their home gym. It's a fantastic value for the price, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Don't listen to the negative reviews...", 'author': 'Mantis Toboggan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a long review, I hope I can keep your attention.First off, I want to tell you guys that Fedex Smartpost is the carrier for this item. I didn\'t have a problem with them, even though they delivered my dumbbells 2 days after the delivery estimate(can\'t complain, free shipping). Fedex Smartpost sends to the closest USPS, then USPS takes an additional 2 days to deliver. It seems like most people hate Fedex Smartpost because they take longer than usual("google fedex smartpost sucks" to see what I\'m talking about). I ordered these on 2-9-13 and they arrived at my doorstep on 2-16-13, so one week exactly, average time for free shipping. The dumbbells came packaged professionally and my case came in perfect condition, which I was very pleased about.I also ordered 60 pound db set from Lion Roar Fitness on 2-8-13, and as of 2-16, they didn\'t even start shipping so I ended up cancelling that order. They charged $20 for shipping too... I will NEVER even consider buying from LRF again. Just wanted to warn you guys about that. $20 for shipping AND they lag it? No thank you.These Dumbbell sets are a great investment, and I know they will last a long time. First of all, there is no toxic chemical smell the negative reviewers mentioned. Not even the case it came with. They clearly have gotten better with quality control. I read ALL of the negative reviews and took a chance with these, and I am glad I did. My bars are all nicely polished, smooth, and the weights and collars fit accordingly. There are 4 pieces of rubber stoppers that help keep these weights in place, 2 in the middle of the bar and 2 that are connected to the collars, which does an excellent job. When you lift weights, you should never "jerk" through your workouts, but instead keep good form with nice controlled movements. That\'s how my workouts are, and the weights have not moved, rolled, clanked, at all. The only time the collars roll out, is when I twist them to change weights. I even put all the plates on one bar(30 lbs) and the weights/collars were still in place. People say these are not the best quality, but what more do you expect from a set of dumbbells? Good finish on the plates with a clean tough metal bar, which cannot rip as some rubber grip bars tend to rip after tightening the collars too much. Carefully put the plates on, or you could scratch/chip off the paint. If you don\'t like getting callouses on your hands, I recommend investing in gloves. I don\'t feel a thing with gloves on and can enjoy lifting weights without getting blisters. If you have Fat Gripz(check my review for Fat Gripz), you don\'t even need gloves. Those rubber suckers will cover it, and give you a much better workout.I will buy additional plates for these soon but before you guys do as well, try adding Fat Gripz to the bars with your normal workouts. It will give your workouts more of a challenge, and you will see some good results in your forearm strength. I wish I knew about them when I wrestled in high school..Long story short, don\'t listen to the negative reviews. Keep yourself in shape and buy these already!Oh yeah, I forgot to mention that the bars + collars does not equal 5 pounds(unless you are weighing both bars and 4 collars together). So you get about 17.5 pounds each dumbbell. The description states that they weigh 5 pounds but it\'s half. The case it comes with is about 5 or 6 pounds so that\'s where they kind of trick you. So if you do the math, 4 x 5lbs plate + 4 x 2.5 lbs plate + 2 x 2.5 collars & bar = 35 lbs + 5 lbs case = 40 lbs db set.. I\'m not going to knock off a star for that because I bought these knowing this information. We can always buy more plates, so no big deal.Thank you for reading my long review. I hope this helped make your decision in building a better body! Train hard, train safe, and good luck :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Affordable and heavy.', 'author': 'Mike', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a great set of weights for someone looking to get started working out at home. It's not perfect, but I'm not really sure that the imperfections matter for a product like this. So let's get the negatives out of the way first:- Yeah, they smell, as others have noted. It's nothing strange -- if you've ever been to a gym before, you already know this smell. They're metallic with additional chemical odors. For a basic sniff test, you won't notice much. But the smell does begin to accumulate after a few days in cramped quarters, so maybe they're not the best choice for a bedroom or tiny apartment. I suspect the smell will dissipate in time, but I don't know how long that will be.- The carrying case is cheap molded plastic, and there's a good chance yours will arrive with one or more corners dented. It's fine -- the cases aren't meant to be display items. They're meant to store the weights, and to give you a convenient way to lug them around when needed.- It's obvious that corners were cut in some regards. The rubber cushions on the bars are cheap, and could possibly fall off and get lost if you aren't attentive. Likewise, the rubber cushions within the screw-on collars can fall out. It's not a big deal if they do -- you just stick them back in. But these are obviously not advanced equipment. They were designed to be cheap and functional.That said, I don't think any of these cons really matter. Weights have one purpose in life -- to weigh something. Your muscles can't tell if you're holding twenty pounds of expensive metal or cheap metal. This particular set is very well priced, and they feel safe and sturdy. You don't have to worry about the collars wiggling loose, and they're adjustable down to 2.5 pound increments. I snagged two sets, giving me greater versatility and the ability to put more weight on a single bar if needed. For the price, this is a perfect way to get started with a cheap, space-saving home gym.Weights don't need to be pretty and fancy to work. They just need to give gravity something to act on. You can buy fancier equipment than this, but it's not clear why you'd really want to.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Honest review addressing common concerns...', 'author': 'Bleacherbum95', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When originally considering this product I was very concerned with the number of negative reviews/comments that people were leaving about these dumbbells. After deciding to take the risk, I felt the need to write a review since I believe that the negative reviews are overblown and overly dramatic. I will hopefully address the main concerns that you as the prospective buyer are having while considering this product. If you don\'t care about the details I have a TLDR at the bottom =)1. Smell: These weights do not smells like daisies; no dumbbells do. However, the smell is NOT as bad as people are saying. I would highly recommend leaving these weights outside (and/or washing them) to let them air out and control the smell, but it is not immediately overpowering. When the package arrived I slowly opened the box waiting for a toxic stench to explode out, but it never came. It was not until I lifted a plate out of the box that I noticed the smell people mentioned (the chemical applied to prevent rust), and it was not very strong. I left mine in the garage to air out and noticed a slight change in the smell of the garage, but nothing extreme. I would certainly keep them out of the house to be safe, but for $40 a quick wash or airing out was worth it to me.2: Quality: If you are looking for professional dumbbells that are made of top quality materials then look elsewhere. But if you are looking for a solid set of starter weights, this is your product. I will say that the first time I removed a collar a small piece of metal broke off, but it did not affect the functionality of the piece. Also, I noticed someone mentioned that the collar lets the weights slide...this was incorrect in my experience. The collars seem to hold the weights snugly in place, so there should be no problems there. The quality is by no means great (unbeatable for the price though), but it is good enough that I trust it will last and serve its purpose.3. Case: I saw a few people talking about how the case broke easily. The case seems fairly sturdy if it is treated well. A case breaking or not will depend on your delivery man. The weights are packaged very well inside a few boxes (Amazon ships it out in an excessively large box), and in my experience there were no cracks. The sliders to keep the box closed seem pretty lame, but I\'m one of those people who isn\'t going to sweat it if the case breaks.I hope I covered the main concerns that most people were having. My honest review of this product is that this is unbeatable for the price. $40 with free shipping (mine came in 2 days) is great, and these are exactly what I was looking for. And NO I was not paid for this review and think Amazon should be ashamed of including paid reviews.TLDR: Does NOT smell that bad (easily fixed), decent quality, best bang for the buck for somebody looking for starter dumbbells.UPDATE 1/25/14: I now have two sets of these (it was cheaper than buying weight individually), and they are holding up great after over a year and a half of use. I\'ve noticed the collar shifts slightly when you get over 30lbs, but never enough that it\'s a problem. Be confident in purchasing these as starter weights.UPDATE 7/31/16: My original bars are still going strong. The collar shifting still happens on occasion, but not to the point where it interferes with my workout. I\'ve purchased additional plates for it and added them just fine - any 1" plate should fit just as well as the originals. So these have held up strong for 4 years...zero complaints here. One thing I forgot in the original review - you may want some lifting gloves. The metals isn\'t forgiving on your hands, so if you don\'t want big calluses, invest in a cheap pair of gloves.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Adjustible Weight Set', 'author': 'Lumbre', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First of all, let\'s get the smell part clear. Yes, it smells. It smells similar to the stuff you find in the tire/automotive aisles at Target/WalMart/other stores. Yes, it can be a bit strong. Let it air for a day and put a dryer sheet in the case when you close it. Problem solved. If you\'re picky on having your home smell like candles or something, these are not for you. If you don\'t even notice the smell of a gym when you\'re in a gym (or aren\'t the quickest to pick up on smells), then you\'re fine. Also, I think it\'s the box that smells, not any of the paint.Pros:*It is easy to add/remove weights. Just unscrew the collars, remove/add weights, screw collars back in. You can do this while resting in less than a minute.*You can add your own weights. When you outgrow these, you can add your own weights (doesn\'t have to be the same brand). Any generic 1" weight will do.*When I bought these, they were awesome for $40. Under $1/pound if you count the different combinations of weights you can do and that you can add more later.*Cheap compared to buying individually.Cons:*Slight bump in one of the corners of the case. No big deal. Contents inside are fine. Just an aesthetic issue.*Smell. As addressed above, it can be a bit overpowering, but just take the time to let them air out. Some people also do fine by rinsing them.*They\'re not neoprene.Notes & Thoughts:*A lot of people complain about the default California warning added to this set. Seriously, California is overprotective. Drinking dozens of gallons of water is known to cause death. If ingested, gasoline can destroy your organs. Too much sun can give you cancer. They have these warnings on a ton of things for sale in California. Something containing nickel, for example, automatically gets this warning. If it were more serious, more states or the entire country would place a warning or they would be getting sued for giving people cancer (it\'s not like lawyers are exactly shy).*The handles may be a bit too textured for some people, especially those with delicate hands or buying more weights. In that case, maybe you should buy weight-lifting gloves. For those who don\'t mind getting scuffed by sand or falling hands-first on pavement, you\'re fine. If anything, I shift my hands around on the bar which varies up my routine a bit.*People say it\'s a good starter set. I just started a serious workout routine and have had this for a month. I see myself having this for years.*A few have complained that the weights aren\'t exact. The bar doesn\'t seem like 5 pounds, but when I weight myself with one of my 20 lb. dumbbells, I see my weight increase by 19.8 or 20 (my scale goes in intervals of 0.2). It\'s close enough for me. I don\'t need it to be that exact.*Mine didn\'t seem to have any loose seal rings or collars. They seem good for the price. They may shift a small amount after a 30 minute workout to where you can hear a slight clunk. Just retighten them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing quality', 'author': 'John carter', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Everything came double if not even triple boxed and wrapped and had stuffing on the original box all the weights came individually wrapped there was no chemical strong smell with my set (105lb) pair they just smelled new nothing that made me gag or was to strong as far as the mechanics it seems to work perfect they hold still while I do chest dumbell flys with 35lbs on each only time will tell but as of now extremely happy don‚Äôt listen to the review also if you want to add plates to this set make sure there 1.14 or bigger 1inch plates won‚Äôt work also I personally love the diamond pattern grip but if your not used to lifting without gloves your going to have to break your hands in or get some gloves me personally gives me more grip I love it it does not feel like it‚Äôs digging in my skin like others said overall good product for the price can‚Äôt beat it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Nice dumbbell bars', 'author': 'RY', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I liked the dumbell bars. They are solid, easy to grip, and the nuts tighten down nicely. The weights that came with them would be fine except the center hole in them is a lot bigger than it needs to be causing the weights to shift,if you don't really crank down on the bar nuts.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best deals I‚Äôve ever found on Amazon', 'author': "D'Art", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This 52.5 lb single dumbbell setup is without a doubt one of the best deals I‚Äôve ever found on Amazon. While most iron free-weights sell for around $2/pound (as of the fall of 2022), this set is much more affordable,The price for it does seem to vary wildly day by day. I paid $77 in October 2022 and see that a month later, it is selling for $65. But I‚Äôm not complaining since it‚Äôs a steal at either price.I bought 2 sets so I‚Äôd have a pair of dumbbells.The dumbbell bars and threaded, star-shaped end nuts are nicely made. The chrome coating seems thick and durable. And because the threaded nuts have black rubber washers on the side that makes contact with the weight plates, they tighten securely and stay firmly in place when in use. Other sets I‚Äôve used did not have the rubber washer and as a result, would loosen up while doing reps. That‚Äôs both annoying and dangerousThe rubber washers do tend to fall off when removing the nuts from the dumbbell, but that is easily rectified by putting a few drops of superglue in the groove in the nut into which the rubber washer sits.The weight plates themselves are a little less precisely made. For instance, I weighed my 5 lb plates on a postal scale and discovered they range anywhere from 4.75 lbs to 5.25 lbs. That‚Äôs not a big deal most of the time but you can definitely notice an imbalance if you inadvertently end up with 8 of the heavier 5 lb plates on one hand and 8 of the lighter plates on the other.To avoid that from happening, I used a silver Sharpie to mark the plate that are over 5 lbs and keep them in a separate pile so I can distribute the weight more evenly into the bars.Also, while the clear-coat on the plates seems heavy duty enough, you do need to check for rough edges. That goes for the dumbbell bars too. I had to file down a couple of spots to avoid getting metal splinters in my hands.Last but not least, the dumbbells I received have a diameter of 1.18 inches (or 30mm) and the weight plates have holes that size. This means any plates you may already have with 1 inch (25mm) holes will not fit onto these bars. Likewise, while the plates from this set will easily go onto a 1 inch bar, they can flop around a bit. In practice the latter is not a problem as long as you can tighten down the bar-end clamps. I use my 30mm plates on a 25mm curl bar without issue.In short, while there may be some compromises involved, at these prices, this dumbbell set is one of the best deals out there.Follow up note written on April 11, 2023:I‚Äôve been using my weight set several times a week for about 6 months now and all parts are holding up great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really like these', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed a set to get started with. It‚Äôs hard to make it all the way to the gym...and if I‚Äôm watching tv I can just pick these up and do a few curls every now and then. Really helpful. They are easy to switch weights in and out, and if you are cool with doing one arm at a time then you could add all the weights on one and basically have a dumbbell that goes up to nearly 50 pounds (minus the 4 pound bar), without having to spend all the money of buying 2, 50 pound dumbbells, which would cost twice as much. Instead just do one arm at a time and save half the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Customer service was decent', 'author': 'Nick', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'For quality. You need to try each screw to find one that will actually screw on all the way. Paint is intact, other than that, they are weights.Be advised, you might not get everything in your shipment. Thankfully, customer service was easy to contact. After a couple of days, I recieved a reply asking for the details of my purchase, and after that I recieved my missing handle promptly.4 stars for good customer service.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Top Sellers
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Set, Great Value', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As others have mentioned, these are shipped in three boxes of weights at 50# each, and one narrow box that holds the stand. In my case, while extremely heavy duty boxes were used, and well taped, one of the boxes was sliced open and minor damage to rubber ends of DBs in that box occurred. Looks like it was slid over something which cut it through.In any event, 2x5, 2x10, 2x15, 2x20, 2x25# DBs are included, making this an excellent "base" set. Handles are knurled and as expected in diameter and abrasiveness. No gloves required, but your mileage may vary.Is there a smell? seems to be the burning question. Of course they have a smell. They were just born of chemicals. They smell like what they are: rubber. So if you have ever had a new bike tire in your house, that is the smell, multiplied by a few pairs. It doesn\'t bother me in the slightest, and I was able to start using right away. I cannot relate at all to folks who seemed like they were going to swoon after opening the boxes.NOTE: I "washed" these with dish soap and water before using because they are covered in manufacturing residual dust etc. and will make your hands filthy otherwise. Mine did *not* have any kind of oily residues, as others have mentioned; again, just new tire smell, which for me is not obnoxious. But hey- some people think cilantro tastes terrible, so there is no accounting for taste.NOTE #2: Unlike the way Amazon\'s own brand and some other DBs I have purchased are wrapped, these were just loose in the box. No Styrofoam, no placement in a baggie, nada. Just in the box. So they are not going to be 100% brand new and flawless looking when you take them out. Get over it. They\'re dumbbells. They\'ll look like that in a couple months of workouts anyway. Also, because there is no protection, be judicious in opening the boxes. Just slice around the tape so you are not gouging a chunk out of your new best friends.I got these for basically a buck a pound, which is what weights were before Covid, and what they should be anyway, and held off on buying them until I hit the sale amount. Having said that, they would still be worth it for the $200 amount too, of course, just slightly less of a bargain.As has been mentioned by other reviewers, the A-frame is easy to put together, but will take your fingers off if you are not watching what you are doing when replacing the weights onto the rack, something which was also true at many gyms I have used and is a bug and not a feature of this style of rack.Definitely recommend, and would purchase again. Plan on augmenting with additional weights and eventually using a horizontal rack for all of them, but this was a steal-- and delivered on top of it.I am keeping the boxes. These are some of the heaviest duty boxes I have had sent to me. You should keep them until your return date is over anyway, in the event something untoward happens and they need to go back.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely worth the price', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "TL;DRYou can't go wrong with this weight set for the money. I got them on a flash sale for under $180.The good: Easy to assemble, sturdy stand, nice grips on the weights. Company will send free replacements if anything is wrong in the shipment.The not-so-good: Rubber smell upon opening, will need some time to dissipate, so I'd plan on leaving them sit in a well ventilated area for a week before seriously using them. Also, the ends would appear to be dipped to rubberize them, and some of the material splashed onto the chrome handles. Absolutely no big deal and can be cleaned off, but something to be aware of. I would also suspect this material would wear off and expose the metal if abused (particularly if it got dropped on the corner of something).I have no idea how they make money on these as they came to me in 4 separate boxes via UPS. I did have one weight that had some shipping damage to the end (pictured), but it's not the end of the world.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value and easy to assemble!', 'author': 'Roberto A. Rodriguez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been considering getting a set to exercise at home. This is a great value for what you get delivered to you home. The product feels sturdy and well built. The stands holds everything together in an easy to access form with minimum space requirement. It arrived on time and delivered the entrance of my house.Very happy with the purchase at this time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Definitely recommend!', 'author': 'Travis M', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'For the price you can‚Äôt beat it! So I need to grab the two side weights and put them back.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Home Gym Must Have', 'author': 'Add it to the cart!', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It took a month for the entire set to arrive as they come in 4 separate boxes. You have to put the stand together but nothing complex. The weights are very nice. They are similar to the ones in a public gym. reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Bought 80's and 90 pounders", 'author': 'Ray', 'rating': 5, 'content': "With gyms being closed due to the pandemic and no signs of opening up any time soon, I started searching Amazon for some heavy(ish) dumbbells for my home gym. The minute I came across these babies, I swooped in and ordered. Experience has taught me not to procrastinate on high demand items, cuz if you snooze, you lose! Anyway, WF Athletic Supply had 80lb and 90lb, rubber coated hex dumbells in stock, so I ordered one pair of each. Received them much quicker than was stated. Three dumbbells arrived eight days from the day I ordered, the fourth, two days later. Not a big deal, it happens, orders are broken up all the time by the shipping companies. And I'm pretty sure the delivery guy, who hand carried them to my doorstep, didn't mind having one less DB to carry, lol As for the dumbbells themselves, they are of superior quality and do exactly what they're supposed to. They do have an odor of rubber, but its to be expected, they're rubber coated. Again, not a biggie", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 16, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth 5 stars', 'author': 'Ron Doetsch', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just what I needed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars These dumbbells provide a great workout. I don't plan to return to the gym.", 'author': 'Ronald Satta', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These dumbbells are of professional grade. As good or better than anything I had access to at the gym. They have a solid handle grip that allows the user to maintain full control. They are heavy duty and do not move once they are placed on the ground. They are heavy--the exact weight advertised. I have a pair of 30, 55, 80, 95, and 110 lbs. I use the light ones for arms and the heavier ones for dumbbell chest presses. They give me a great workout. I don't plan to return to the gym! Thank you!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 26, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Bang for the buck!', 'author': 'Corey D. The design is good, and the grip fits my hands very well. Even they are made in China, the rubber coating doesn't smell too bad comparing others.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 17, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pair of dumbbells', 'author': 'avidreader', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I wasn't sure what brand was going to show up, I got CAP brand, they had CAP stickers wrapped around the handles. Very nice pair of 15s, they do have a slight odor of new tires but it's not that bad and the smell does dissipate. They were also wrapped well with thick brown paper to keep them in place in the shipping box.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 2, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well built', 'author': 'Jess H', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I thought they would make my hands smell when I held one by the ends but it doesn‚Äôt, they are well made and quality equipment.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good product', 'author': 'William P.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good price. Well made. Prompt delivery.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 3, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Has a really weird smell to it', 'author': 'ayeewassup', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Smells weird upon opening , had to spray it down', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Save your money', 'author': 'Tee', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Cat litter gets rid of the smell. Pop them in a sealed container and cover the weights completely with Freshstep and a box of baking soda. The next day, change the litter out and be sure to turn your weights. I‚Äôve only ever used Freshstep. But I‚Äôm sure any other cat litter brand with odor absorption would suffice.Unfortunately they come from China, like everything else, and permeates the chemical odor heavily. Airing them out does nothing. You need the litter to counteract the chemicals. After sitting in litter 2-3 days, air out. You do it right the smell should be gone. Clean with soap and water and good to go.These are not CAP brand. The listing and some user review photos would lead you to believe they are. These are Walmart brand from a reseller. They look exactly like Amazon brand. You may as well save yourself the money and buy direct from Amazon because this seller is almost double.That said heavier weights are harder to find. I paid about $450 for a pair of 45 and 50 lbs sets. Before the pandemic, that would have been half that. At most.Buy Amazon brand. Nothing against this seller but there‚Äôs no incentive to pay twice the amount for non branded weights. It would be different if they actually were CAP.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2021', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Homebody Multi-Bell Bar - Dumbbell to Barbell Converter - Dumbbell Bar - Weights Dumbbells Set - Dumbbell to Barbell Set - Gym Equipment for Home - 200 lb Capacity
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Initial thoughts', 'author': 'Rebecca N', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've only had this for about two weeks, but here's my initial thoughts.Pros:Easy to assemble and useAppears sturdy during initial usesMetal constructionFits my CAP adjustable dumbbellsThe length is great for me, I can do all my deadlifts, squats, etc with ease and it's easy to store. It doesn't weigh much, I just prop it in the corner.Cons:Like other reviewers said, screwing down the nut to secure the dumbbell can be difficult if you have to pinch the two pieces together, there's not much room to hold while screwing. Not a big deal, but can be annoyingQuality of the foam padding to hold the dumbbells secure in the clamps. Not seeing this last very long, it doesn't seem replaceable? Then what? I'm pretty crafty so I'll come up with something, but that area needs some attention.Overall it's a win. I'd buy it again and I hope they address the foam padding in the clamps, offering replaceable options or something, as that is the only area I see that will fail, leaving the dumbbell not secure over time.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Game Changer for my Home Workouts', 'author': 'BradleyChiro', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been on a fitness journey for quite some time now, and finding versatile and space-saving equipment for my home gym has always been a priority.\xa0One of the things I appreciate the most about this product is its durability. The steel clamps are robust and well-built, providing a firm grip on the dumbbells without any wobbling or loosening. This gives me the confidence to push myself to the limits without worrying about the equipment's reliability.The versatility of the\xa0Multi-Bell is truly impressive. With the ability to adjust the weight and use different combinations of dumbbells, I can customize my workout to target various muscle groups. It's like having a complete barbell set without the clutter!In terms of value for money, the Multi-Bell bar is an investment that's well worth every penny. It has transformed my home workouts, allowing me to engage in more diverse exercises and challenging routines.Pros:Ingenious concept that converts dumbbells into a barbellSturdy steel clamps ensure stability and safetyDurable build that withstands intense workoutsVersatile and customizable for targeting different muscle groupsEasy assembly and compact storageGreat value for moneyCons:None that I've encountered so far!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Damaged', 'author': 'Chanel Bella', 'rating': 1, 'content': "The bar arrived damaged. The bolt has been bent and the cover won't close properly. Please package this better. The bar is too heavy for the cheap packaging.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Strong Steel Clamps!', 'author': 'Stephen', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Easy to use, and very well made! I really like that it has steel clamps that hold the dumbbells securely. I've used similar ones with plastic clamps and they've always ended up cracking.I can do many different exercises with it (squat, deadlift, row, bench press, curl, shoulder press, etc)It's great for saving space and money since there's no need to buy additional weight plates like other workout bars. I just use the dumbbells I already have and it keeps from making clutter.The grip is also comfortable and do not slip.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Very disappointed', 'author': 'Chris Cantwell', 'rating': 2, 'content': "I have this device and another that serves the same purpose, and by far this is the worse of the two.It is just plain poorly manufactured to begin with. I ordered one, and it arrived in unusable condition. The threading on the pipe to connect the two bars was not aligned and I could not get the two parts of the bar to join together. The threading was also bad on the bolts that hold the dumbbells in place.I initiated a return and hoping I could still use the device I had Amazon send me new one, which they did promptly. Unfortunately, even properly functioning, this device still disappoints.This one appealed to me because it has a longer handle than the one I purchased prior, and I read in the comments it would work with my FitRX adjustable dumbbells. These have short handles which are not wide enough for the other dumbbell converter I purchased on Amazon. They do in fact fit, but the difficulty with getting them on and off basically defeats the purpose of an adjustable dumbbell.The clamp wraps around the handle of the dumbbell, and to begin, it just scarcely fits. You don't want these things loose in there, obviously, but to secure the clamp you have to apply pressure on it while you screw on the nut. This is difficult to do, because there is not much to grab onto beyond the area where the nut is threaded down onto the bolt, and you have to turn the nut many times to get a secure fit.In my first use, this put tension on the handle of the dumbbells, which caused one of them to click back five pounds. As I took the bar up, and the dumbbells came out of their racks, the weights caught and I had to go through some fuss just to get it out of the rack. Then I discovered that I had uneven weight on each side, and realized what had happened with the tension clicking the weight handle back 5lbs.And of course, to then change the weight intentionally, one must take the clamp off, which involves unscrewing the nut from the belt, opening the clamp, adjusting the weight, clamping back on, and screwing down again, all while trying to make sure the tightening does not put tension on the handle and click it back 5lbs again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Fits Nuobell dumbells', 'author': 'Byron A. Savage', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The bar seems pretty sturdy made of steel. The attachments on the end are welded, so you only have to open one side. I like that.Unfortunately I broke one of the retaining screws. Seems like a bit of paint on the screws that made me torque harder than the screw could handle.Just wondering if there is replacement retaining screws for the end clamps? Thanks!Overall I would recommend this product. Seems solid. The one thing I would improve is the clamps retention. Maybe something quicker, like a quarter turn and it locks? ü§î', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful Product!', 'author': 'Paul M Bolin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this product! It is easy to carry around to different rooms to workout in and easy to store and not bulky. The clamps are great to use and this product makes lifting weights fun again. Overall, I would recommend this product for any gym.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love how sturdy it is', 'author': 'Bryant Hdez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It‚Äôs a tight fit for my dumbells as they‚Äôre the adjustable kind but it‚Äôs very sturdy And the only bar I found that would fit my equipment', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Completes your home gym', 'author': 'ray', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really love the steel clamps because it‚Äôs just realistic to have it and it just makes sense. I used to have a similar product that have plastic ones, but you‚Äôre putting on so much weight so it cracks.This is very useful for anyone who doesn‚Äôt want to buy a whole rack, etc. It gets the job done and it‚Äôs portable so take it anywhere with you- if you want.There are also Velcro ‚Äòclasps‚Äô (Idk the word for it) that you wrap around your dumbbell if the handle is too small to fit so it makes it tighter and sturdier when you do clamp it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Good quality metal no pl√°stic', 'author': 'Claudio V.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Excellent quality is not plastic 5* fast delivery', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]
