title: LIONSCOOL 16"/20‚Äù Loadable Dumbbells Pairs in Commercial Grade, Heavy Duty Olympic Dumbbell Bar/Handle for Strength Training, Compatible with 2‚Äô‚Äô Standard Plates
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Product Good Value', 'author': 'SCC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These are very nice dumbells. Finish, detailing and look is nice. Spin seems fine, although I am not a power lifter. Weights fit on sleeves. Knurling is a little more than I find in a normal dumbbell, but is fine. I do not use gloves. I use what I consider better collars than those that come with the dumbbells, but I knew I would replace before buying. Price is right and so is quality.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Edited: Missing spring collars', 'author': 'Ryan F.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Dumbbells are good quality, but as others have said, no spring collars in the box despite the Amazon description and the box saying spring collars. Hoping to get in touch with the company for resolution as it appears others have.EDITED: company sent out two sets of spring collars so I‚Äôve changed my rating and am very satisfied.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Impressive!', 'author': 'Jerid Smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was really surprised how nice these are for the price. They could easily charge $100 a piece for these dumbbell handles. I‚Äôm not sure how on earth someone managed to break theres on one of these reviews he must of dropped it from a 30ft building or something. I add 100lb+ on these for presses and they hold sturdy as ever. I really believe they could hold 350lbs per handle. I have used many other dumbbell handles from Rogue, Titan, Fringe & BellsofSteel which are way higher in price and I would say these are comparable if not better then all of those but Rogue‚Äôs. If you‚Äôre looking for a good pair of loadable dumbbells you can‚Äôt go wrong with these, they‚Äôre going to hold way more than you can handle and save you space and money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Diameter of sleeve is perfectly fine', 'author': 'Jeff', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was buying adjustable dumbbells' and individual sets as I do not want a loadable bar poking in my leg when I rock it back from my thighs to do say a bench. I bought up to 60 pounds of dumbells and any higher is really costly. Then came in dumbell spotter hooks and I no longer need to rock the dumbells back thus these 20 inch dumbell bars can hold all the weight I need. The spotter hooks for those that do not know rest on a barbell and you put your dumbells on the hook and lift off the barbell saving your shoulders and energy for the lists. Thus I am back to these leg pokers I hated and they work perfectly with the hooks and I can load more then I will probably ever need using my Olympic sized weights. I saw a review where the diameter of the sleeve is too small. They are the exact same as all my 5 of my other Olympic bar sleeves. There will always be a little relief to accommodate for different brands of weights from what I can tell. Comes with 4 tension sleeve locks which are decent.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good product. Works well.', 'author': 'jim m.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Good value for the money. Works well for home gym. The clamps aren‚Äôt the best but overall very good product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Dumbbells no spring collars', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Dumbbells seem to be good quality, but they did not include the spring collars as indicated on both the product description and the box. This is the second set that I ordered. First didn‚Äôt have the collars either so I used a return and had them ship a new product. New product came today and no collars in this box either. Not a huge deal, but annoyed that I have to spend $10 to buy collars that were supposed to be included. Assuming this isn‚Äôt a fluke as this is the replacement that they sent.update. Contacted the company and they were very responsive and sent two pairs of collars out.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Quality Dumbbells', 'author': 'Adam galvan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are basically just mini barbells and just as sturdy as well. They are fairly hefty unloaded and can be used as 12 lb dumbbells with no weights. The weights spin smoothly on them and only real con is the same for all loadable dumbbells of this size and they are kind of bulky which will restrict your range of motion on some excercises. I usually just rotate my hands when doing pressing movements to keep them from banging into each other and it's no big deal. They have a high quality feel and look nice when stored away on my wall on a dual barbell hanger.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality and proper size', 'author': 'Jay B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These dumbbells are high quality and fit my Olympic size weights perfectly. The bars weigh about 12lbs each. Recommended!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality', 'author': 'Itsme', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great finish and excellent weight. Not a knock on them but you‚Äôll need a set of appropriate weights. I was hopeful I could do some things with bumper plates on them. Not sure what I was thinking.Chrome finish is good quality. Gnurling is aggressive.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Bad Clamps', 'author': 'Benjamin Yang', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The bar itself is really nice, no issue so far. Comfortable knurling and no rattles on the collars.The clamps on the other hand are just awful. I ended up spending another $30 to get 2 pairs of screw-type collars, so the bars plus clamps cost me $100.I like Lionscool‚Äôs product, but if you wanna save your time, just spend the $100 on another brand‚Äôs loadable dumbbell with good clamps.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: PLKOW Dumbbell Rack, Weight Rack for Dumbbells, Home Gym Storage for Dumbbells Kettlebells Yoga Mat and Balls, All in One Workout Storage with Wheels and Hooks, Powder Coated Finish Steel
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent!', 'author': 'Anonymouz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Building out the home gym. The PLKOW 50.4‚Äù weight rack and organizer is outstanding. Looks good, sturdy, easy to assemble and has more than enough room to store the difficult items to organize for everyone‚Äôs home gym. A solid Amazon buy with two day delivery. Couldn‚Äôt be happier.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made and great organization', 'author': 'Yorkiebug', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Overall, I was very happy with this product. It is heavy and well made. It also holds most of my at home gym equipment.For reference, the top rack holds my smaller weights and 15 lb kettlebells. Next rack down holds my 10, 12, 15 lbs weights though they don‚Äôt fit perfectly. Third rack holds my 20 and 25 lb weights. You could get some 5lb weights on there as well.This didn‚Äôt ship with Prime shipping even though it showed 2 day Prime. It took about a week to get it.It would be much easier to put together with 2 people. It was tricky to hold the pieces together and then put in the screws making sure everything was lined up. Putting it together by myself took about an hour and a half. Would have been about the time if there would have been 2 people.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for a small home gym', 'author': 'ShortNakia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very easy to put together, holds most of my workout stuff... Perfectly compact!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!!', 'author': 'Rayda Grullon', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great product! Easy to assemble and looks very nice!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice and sturdy', 'author': 'Lida', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The unit is nice and sturdy. I would recommend the unit.However, the assembly was unnecessarily tedious. There are better ways to design the unit so the assembly is faster and efficient. There were just too many unnecessary steps because there were too many parts. Also, you will need a Philips screw driver. I found myself using 2 different sizes.An example of wasting time and too many parts, the wheels require you to screw them into a predrilled hole, making sure you use 2 different washers and the provided lug nut tool. A better design would have it where you take the wheel and clamp it into the pre drill hole. One click taking 5 secs versus a minute or so per wheel. This is one example.Overall, sturdy device just took longer than necessary and wasted my time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very pleased with this storage rack.', 'author': 'Carrie D', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'m very pleased with this organizer. It came well-packaged with all the pieces, screws etc included. A bit time-consuming to assemble (was working by myself), but not difficult. The directions were easy to follow (but I have assembled many things over the years from furniture to gym equipment). The end result is very sturdy & holds a lot. So happy to get all my hand weights, kettle bells, resistance bands & yoga mats/blocks off the floor & organized. I opted not to put the wheels on it, but just put some "chair-leg pads" on the leg bottoms to protect my floor (so, definitely set the rack up where you want it before loading all your gear on it!)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Storage Cart', 'author': 'Tkaye', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Sturdy easy assembly. Holds weights nicely.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly good quality', 'author': 'Trina V. Goldstacks', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am SUPER pleased with this rack. It is very sturdy, and the color is a breath of fresh air. So many fitness racks are just so ugly, and this looks great in my living room. I can stash my dumb bells, 2 yoga mats, a huge foam roller, a small foam roller, resistance bands, and my massage gun on this thing, and everything looks tidy and organized.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic and stylish weight rack', 'author': 'Tim Delaney', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We were looking for a weight rack that could be in the corner of the bedroom by the Peloton that would be both functional and look good -- this was the one! The white color made it look more stylish instead of only utilitarian. I tried a couple of quick exercises, so far I like them a lot.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is a low cost way to improve your fitness.at home easier.', 'author': 'Bruce Williams', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The cables are marked for tension values and have nice connectors for attaching the grips. The pieces work as advertised. The instruction sheet provides instructions on the different ways the pieces can be used. Not sure about durability. I just got the set time will tell.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Grammatical correction to original review', 'author': 'Jan D.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Firstly, I wish to say that this is an excellent product that appears to be well-made and manufactured with high quality materials. For many individuals, the kit includes the necessary components to perform all 19 exercises depicted in the included manual. However, 14 of the exercises (74%) require use if the included door anchor to which one end of the exercise band is is then secured. I do not have an interior door positioned in a location where I can exercise safely, so consequently I cannot perform 74% of the suggested exercises. Although the kit does includes two ankle bands secured with Velcro, one of which could be secured around a stationary object like a post or column, etc. to which the other end of the band could be attached, the manufacturer specifically cautions against using the ankle bands citing that it is dangerous. It is for this reason only that I cannot give this product a 5 star rating. I contacted the manufacturer inquiring whether they could provide a separate strap with two D-rings that could then safely secure the end of the band to the included caribiner and suggested that if not, perhaps they would consider including one in a future product upgrade, which would greatly increase their product's versatility and even allow their product to be used outdoors using any applicable stationary object to secure the band. The manufacturer got back to me very quickly, demonstrated their understanding, but also indicated that they did not have such a strap, but said that they would pass my recommendations on to their product design team and very courteously and thoughtfully thanked me for my input. If I could give this company higher than a five star rating for their professionalism and customer service I would readily do so. As mentioned, for some individuals the lack of a separate strap to secure the band is not a problem, but for me it limited using the product's full range of capabilities. I subsequently purchased a very affordable, double D-ring band as noted that now permits me to perform the full compliment of exercises virtually anywhere I can wrap the strap around that will ensure a secure point to attach the exercise band.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I needed this', 'author': 'Chey', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was hospitalized Feb- Jul 2023 and couldn't walk that whole time. When I got out a little stronger I did physical therapy for 6 weeks. Now that I'm even stronger I got these to help me still build up my strength. I love the different sizes and it comes with exercises too. You can also find more on YouTube. I highly recommend especially for those that can't get to the gym.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: SNODE Adjustable Weights for Women Set of 2 with Free Weights 2-3-4-5 LB, Anti-Slip Grip, Hand Weights Set for Home Gym Workout (Pair)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Compact and they look great.', 'author': 'Paul Hemming', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are great lightweight dumbbells to keep stored in a small cubby, or under a table, away from prying eyes. But even if those prying eyes see them, they're not gonna be an eye sore.The weights are held securely by clips that keep them in place, and even a couple of falls to the floor haven't dislodged them. The material is of good quality, and should last for a good while, but I do wonder if the plastic clips that hold the weights could break if dropped the right way. But nothing to report on yet, I would of course update this review if such a thing happens.The weights are adjustable, but it isn't fast. So if you're using separate weights while doing a class driven workout, (like a beachbody class) then you may find yourself falling behind.But outside of those remarks, they're easy to use, durable, and look good. What else could you be looking for?", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars We love these!', 'author': 'Callidryas', 'rating': 4, 'content': "There's more evidence all the time that A) resistance exercise builds muscle, and B) that building muscle is a good thing. For everyone, at every stage of life. More difficult to do as you get older, (ahem) but nonetheless, good. And regular exercise just makes me feel better.But the truth is I never thought much about lifting weights. It all looked so complicated and intimidating, putting weights on and off of various sized handles. Just really entirely out of my comfort zone. And since going to a gym was equally unappealing, I've always just used those stretchy bands, and body weight, for resistance.But these are perfect. Definitely comfort zone material. They're a pretty, cheerful shade of blue, and while the handles are textured so you don't lose your grip, they're also smooth and simple to wipe down. And the set up here is just amazingly clever. The handles weigh 2 lbs. by themselves. (It's written right on the handle). Then these little saucer-shaped weights lock on each end with a straightforward, easy to manage (and super clever!) mechanism. Securely, too, so they can't come loose or fall off. And each little saucer shaped weight adds half a pound. So if you put one saucer on each end, plus the handle, you're lifting three pounds. Two saucers give you four, and all three saucers gives you five pounds. So you can ramp up.I guess if you're already a hard-core weight lifter, these may not be for you . . . but if all that stuff is intimidating, but you'd like to try lifting weights at home, give these a try. I really love them!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Accuracy ok, easy to adjust', 'author': 'dachiri', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Barbell and assembled within an ounce, .5 additions within .1 ounce, so good enough for me. Adding and removing weight is a breeze!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Easy to Use', 'author': 'E. Forrest', 'rating': 4, 'content': "These work as intended and it is easy to add or remove the small plates to increment the weight. They seem quite secure and not at risk of slipping off or getting weak. The handles are nicely shaped and not slippery or uncomfortable on the palm.Overall, I like these and they will be very useful for toning at home. However, there are a few cons:* they get a bit long with all the plates attached, so you need to be careful to avoid hitting the other dumbbell, your thigh, etc, when doing your reps.* not quick-release/change like some more expensive sets are. You need both hands to add/remove plates, so these aren't great for quick swaps (e.g. power sets) but are fine for slower pace sets or aerobic-type usage.* the pretty end cap is only there if you stack the plates correctly, so you will need to slide off the end cap, then add the additional plate and replace the end cap plate. You don't need the pretty end cap for functionality, but it makes the finish nicer. (This is probably the same on all comparable adjustable dumbbell set.)I think these are a great buy for the price point and perfect for people looking for smaller dumbbells for aerobic or lightweight toning at home without cluttering up their house. These are not for (nor intended for) people doing lots of quick, heavy lifting.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 21, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to adjust weight', 'author': 'J. D. Fegler', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These adjustable dumbbells are perfect for my workout routine. It is very easy to adjust the weight, quickly snapping the plates on or off to adjust the weight to suit you. The coating on the dumbbells is also really nice - smooth and almost soft feeling. The dumbbells work well for the various exercises I am doing. I have another set of adjustable dumbbells that have cylinder shaped weights that you put in the ends of the dumbbells. They allow smaller increments of weight adjustments but are more time consuming to take in or out. I prefer these.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Weights', 'author': 'Artinna Fontenot- McZeal', 'rating': 4, 'content': "These are very nice weights. I used these at work on my down time to exercise. They are good for traveling. It took me a lil time to figure out how to change the size; it didn't come with instructions. They are definitely durable.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice small set of dumbbells!', 'author': 'SublimeCalliope', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This is what I needed! They go from 2-5#, depending on how many you attach, which is perfect for the exercises I wanted them for!AND instead of having multiple weights that take up more space (which I don‚Äôt have!) this takes up about the same space as one dumbbell!These are easy to change the weight of, although I will admit, I have broke a nail taking them apart. Lol. In my video you can see why. The tab is ‚Äúdifficult‚Äù to use if your nails are longer.These feel good, and have great weight.They clean easily, and come with an extra screw for the end weight in case one loosens and gets lost.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 21, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for building strength!', 'author': 'Robin Parr', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This product was purchased as a replacement for a pair of "dumbbells" purchased many years ago. title: REP FITNESS Rubber Hex Dumbbell Set with Racks, 5-50 Set, 5-75 Set, 5-100 Set, 55-75, or 80-100 Set. Available with and Without Racks.
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Quality', 'author': 'M. Chagoyan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "When i first received the package, it looked a bit intimidating. I have ordered from Rep Fitness in the past (power rack and adjustable bench) and putting things together has been fairly easy. I like the use of standard parts, just in case I lose a screw, nut, or bolt.I already had all the dumbbells out. Each pair came in a separate box. The dumbbell rack came in its own box and was well wrapped and protected. Assembly was easy. I did it by 99% by myself. I only asked help when I started placing the shelfs to side braces. Once I had loosely attached the bottom two shelfs and one of the top shelfs, the rest was easy.I forgot to take a photo of the fully assembled rack, but you get the idea. I placed all the dumbbells on the rack and, yes, it's solid.I will update the review over time with a fully assembled rack photo and my thoughts on the rack after using it for a month or twoOverall, delighted with the purchase.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth every penny', 'author': 'C', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The product itself is great quality. Sturdy and worth the price. Customer service though was also amazing. They accidentally shipped my package to someone else. Within a day or so they had another one on the way to me and it was delivered within a few days. They were very calm and professional with me and did a great job reassuring me that everything was being sorted out.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality construction', 'author': 'mitchell hamann', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Great product, low odor was not a joke. They smell brand new but otherwise no smell to them at all. The construction is solid and the knurling feels really good.If you're looking for good equipment I can't rec them enough. Their Power rack is also very well made.Everything was fairly painless. The only two thing I had an issue with was:1The rack and mat are not (always?) in the same shipment as the Dumbbells, so if you get a crate of dbs and no rack and mat, just make sure to call and see if it s on the way.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 20, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome products!', 'author': 'Kevin Long', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The rack was very easy to put together! The dumbbells are VERY nice! I liked this product so much I bought other items from them and plan on buying more! Very nice looking and functional product at a really great price! I highly recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great so far!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have only had for a week but have been really impressed so far. The weights arrived in individual boxes....inside a wooden crate....strapped to a pallet... no way any transport damage was going to occur. I have a 110 foot long driveway and the delivery guy took pallet all the way into garage and did not just drop off at curb as was all he had to do. Of course slipped him a 20 for the great customer service.Weights look well made with practically no defects (some black rubber goop had slightly run onto one of the handles....not a big deal, just me being OCD)I was worried about spending this much on a set of dumbbells but after looking at a lot of different products I decided to pay for the quality I desired. So far very happy with this purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 3, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My dumbbell set and rack', 'author': 'Wu Wei', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have a ton of Rep Fitness gear for a couple reasons. One, I'm always impressed with their quality and price. They are in Colorado and have a great staff! If I have any questions or concerns, they are fast to respond. Makes being a customer easy :)I really liked the fully knurled troy dumbbells at my globo gym for a couple reasons.One, there are no smooth parts of the handle that make them harder to grip. Especially when I start to sweat a bit. I noticed all of the other options for rubber hex dumbbells had the smooth/knurled handles. I think that is a really bad design.Two, the weight is better distributed over my entire hand instead of having a weird contoured handle.Third, best price for rubber hex dumbbells!Lastly, I love them!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love them', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I searched for a dumbell set for a while! It was gonna cost but I finally pulled the trigger! What I like about this set is the rubber coating as the thicker handles as it really gives me something to hold onto when using them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars oily', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'The weights are fine but they came with this oil all over them and I cant seem to get it off. It has stained my rubber gym floors and I have to buff out with a chemical cleaner. I have tried to clean them to no avail. Maybe they will eventually stop but I dont know.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Legit!!!', 'author': 'Anthony Sebastiano', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just took shipment of the 5-75lb set. Couldn‚Äôt ask for a better product! The packaging is outstanding! Pretty sure the delivery truck could‚Äôve flipped over into the ocean and been attacked by sharks and the weights would‚Äôve been fine! It‚Äôs obvious that extreme care is taken when packaging these for delivery. As for the dumbbells themselves, they‚Äôre great! The full nurl is a welcome relief from nurl/smooth/nurl/smooth/nurl style dumbbells that can start to slip when your hands get sweaty. The larger grips on the 20+ pound dumbbells are nice too! These are going to be used for our basement gym and I would not hesitate to recommend them to anyone! Great product!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 27, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Poor quality, not consistent with Rep Fitness reputation', 'author': 'novano', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I ordered these last week and received the shipment today, but am very disappointed in the sloppy craftsmanship and poor quality. I took pics and attached here to show why I am disappointed. These have not been used, as I literally took them out of the crate in the past hour.The handles look like many of them were dropped/abused before the dumbbell heads were placed on them, as the knurling is dented or nicked. On a few of the pairs, the handle must have been hit so hard that the nick caused the metal to "flake" out and it scratches your hands when holding the dumbbell. There doesn\'t seem to be a good quality assurance process in place, as the finishing on these is poor as you can see. I\'m honestly shocked, as Rep has a good reputation and so many good reviews. Hopefully I just received a bad set, but unfortunately I was just purchasing this one set to determine whether I wanted to buy the 7 other sets I need for my studio from Rep.I don\'t have any confidence that these will last long at all. I have purchased many other rubber hex sets in the past, and although rubber hex is not known as being the highest quality dumbbell available, they were all much better made than this set.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 11, 2019', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Broke in the first week', 'author': 'Chase McKinney', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'This is a ton of money to spend on an item that breaks in the first week. Have not dropped it once. I picked 71 pounds up and it fell apart on my toes and all over the floor.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Yes', 'author': 'Katrina', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Great for people like me w tight schedule. This made it easier to squeeze in a quick workout after work.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Flexible weight set', 'author': 'mdshahan', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This set ships in a very plain brown box, but quality of the components appears to be quite high. When you first pull it out of the box, the dumbbell is assembled with the weights, and the only thing you have to do is assemble the bar and extend the stand if desired. The handles and bars all feel very high quality and I was impressed with how secure the longer bar felt once assembled. I've not owned a set like this before and the magnetic pin system seems pretty easy and quick to swap between the three different modes. Adjusting the weight by twisting also works well. When I extended the base to make a stand for the longer bar, that's the only time I felt like it wasn't quite as secure as I'd like...the connections feel a little bit loose, but if you're not moving it around, it doesn't cause a problem. Also, the stand only works with one configuration at a time, so if it's extended for the longer bar there's not really a place to set the dumbbell down so kind of wish there was a center area for the dumbbell and the longer bar at the same time.My only other complaint would be that the system for switching the weights causes the weight of the bar to be offset a bit if you're doing curls, etc...since some of the total weight is shifted to the top due to the mechanisms...if that makes sense. Not terrible, but noticeable...probably more so at lower weight settings.Still, quite happy with this set as all of the weights and attachments seem high quality.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Very easy to setup, very fragile', 'author': 'Edwin Portillo', 'rating': 3, 'content': "It's super easy to change weights and it's very easy to put together. Only issue is you can not drop it even once. Mine fell from a small height and one of the large weights broke. What holds these heavy weights together is plastic surrounded by a small metal pieces and if u bang it at all it'll crack. Right now the entire barbell is maybe 60% usable because some of the weights that use that big weight can no longer be evenly used. Sucks cause it looks a feels reasonable quality, but now with this weight braking it's practically garbage. Trying to fix it but also whatever repair I do I'll never feel fully safe now. Sad cause I was excited for thid", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Adjustable Dumbbell Set, 66 LBS Weights Dumbbells Sets, Solid Cast-Iron Core Free Weight Set for Home Gym, Barbell Weight Set with Connector,Workout Strength Training Equipment for Men Women
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Versatile Barbell/Dumbbell Combo - Highly adaptable per Exercise: LM BodyPump Alternative', 'author': 'Ivan Cheng', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My girlfriend and I have used this system for a little more than a month, and we are very happy with the flexibility, durability, overall quality of this barbell/dumbbell system.I am a Les Mills Instructor and I came across this set when I was searching for a bar and heavier dumbbells. The actual system that we use was out of stock and way delayed. This is a good substitute with some limitations for workouts at home, at a fraction of the cost of the actual LM set.I really appreciate that the plates are solid material with a TPU outer ring. Most of these other sets are sand-filled plastic shells and that's a no-go for me. They're very sturdy and durable - reinforced in places that need them and the numbers stand out. The threading of the bars is also very thick, smooth, and easy to do-up or break apart. There is a slight bit of play when the barbell is put together with the connecting rod but this is a tradeoff for easier assembly/ disassembly, and while it may loosen up a little bit, there is enough threading to keep it from coming apart. The bar is about 1.1-1.5 inches in diameter depending on where you grab it so it's got a good heft and feel to it.The Specs:Dumbell bars > 2lbs (I think 2.2lbs.)Bar connector < 2lbs (about 1.8 lbs.) - finished bar ~ 7lbs. (these weights are from when I first weighed them)4x. 2 Kg (4.4 lbs)4x 1.25 Kg (2.75 lbs)4x 1 Kg (2.2 lbs)4 + 1 plastic screw locking nut. (I appreciate the extra one)I generally use my bar for squats like the first set-up. This is about 36.8 lbs and I think this isn't recommended because the locking screws can't be done in all the way (The correct way is probably in the second photo). I don't recommend the connected dumbbells for added weight during squats as it doesn't rest on the meaty part of the upper back.Limitation: It maxes out the available weight for this bar with what you have, but the end connectors still screw them together securely. For Bodypump, it's a little on the light side, and because the end stops are threaded, it just takes a bit longer to change weight - but you're buying this system and it's really only light for squats at my level.This bar is great for the repeated rows, deadlifts, high-pulls, clean and press, chest press, shoulder press, bicep curls... Endless possibilitiesLimitation: If you have a bigger wingspan, the barbell is a bit narrow (28 in./ 71 cm. across plate-to-plate) to do wide rows and presses.For BP, the plates also feel good in the hand if you want to hold them together for presses during the lunge track or those days where your shoulders/lats are gone during the flyes and rotators in the shoulder track. I like how they're not entirely round, they have flat sections.You can also break them apart as dumbells for unilateral work, as I do when I'm not doing BP. This is an alternative to the wide rows/presses with the barbell if you want to put more isolation on the left/right sides of your body.*I think in this case, you cannot exceed 3 plates on either side of the dumbbell bar in the case of making one super heavy dumbbell.*Other constructive criticisms:- If the connector can be slightly longer, adding maybe 10 - 12 inches to the span of the barbell- The weight set is a little light and I'd like some expandability. Maybe sell additional heavier weight plates on the side for us to upgrade our existing sets.Again, I am very happy with this bar set-up. It achieves everything that it can do within its specifications for a reasonable price point, and I'm honestly considering another set as a gift.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for at home use', 'author': 'Blaire', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Ive been working out at home for a while and this is perfect for easy at home use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars slightly heavy enough.', 'author': 'klaudie rice jr', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'great starter set to tone small build.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value', 'author': 'Chris Montgomery', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This set has been absolutely amazing. It's been used and abused for 2 years and is as good as the day it arrived. The versatility also allows you to do so many different workouts.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars These are amazing!', 'author': 'Amanda T.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm a teacher so finding time to workout every day at the gym was increasingly difficult. I made excuses for why I couldn‚Äôt go to the gym- it‚Äôs raining, it‚Äôs too cold, etc. Buying these took away those excuses. No reason to skip a workout if I have a full weight set waiting for me in my living room! I started lifting a year ago and this weight is perfect for me. They are incredibly versatile and have so many possibilities! I opted for the 66lbs set with steel bars to avoid plastic bar breaking issues, and I‚Äôm glad I did. They‚Äôre very sturdy and have a similar hand feel to a barbell you‚Äôd find at a gym. The plates are stiff steel coated in rubber. The plastic coating on the dumbbell handles was different but after a few workouts I got used to it. Everything arrived perfectly intact and was even a day earlier than expected!I agree with other reviews that screwing the caps on and off can get a bit tedious and does slightly break up the flow of the workout. As an American it also took me some time to adjust to KG instead of LBS. But if you‚Äôre looking for something as versatile as this AND as convenient, just splurge on Bowflex. For the price, these are PERFECT for any home workout. I‚Äôve been recommending these to everyone! You will not be disappointed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 13, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for those wanting to start lifting weights!', 'author': 'momof5', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased these for my grandson when he wanted to start lifting weights and building muscle. They are sturdy and hold up well to daily use. He loves that he can change out the weight amounts.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good product', 'author': 'QUOC-KHANH TRAN PHAM', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I will recommend to my friends.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Patience is required', 'author': 'Left of the Aisle', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'These weights are good quality and so what they say. reviews: [{'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice set of dumbbells for light work outs but limits range of motion', 'author': 'CC', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Not a bad set of interchangeable dumbbells for the price for non heavy use. title: FLYBIRD Weight Bench, Adjustable Strength Training Bench for Full Body Workout with Fast Folding-New Version
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Bench, Solid Investment', 'author': 'K. Johnson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Stardate - March 2021.I have two of these benches, both have been in use daily since Sept 2020, about 6 months. When I travel, I take one with me. One served for a while as a chair/bench for my home office.Both benches are used for bench press, incline bench, spider curls, sit ups, weighted situps, seated military press, rows, flys, french press, etc, etc, etc - all the typical exercises one does with a bench. Thus far, both benches have served very well, without issues. I did not attempt to fully test the 600 lb weight capacity but I did get up around 500 lb and the bench felt stable to me.These are solid/strong benches, but there is some movement under load; this is to be expected with a lightweight folding bench. The little bit of movement is, to me, minor and easy to live with.The back-pad is about 11 inches wide. I\'d like a wider pad. But, because "form ever follows function", compromises must be made sometimes.Overall, these benches were a solid purchase. Sure, there are bigger, sturdier, and more stable benches out there but they cost more, are not available, and do not fold or travel easily. FlyBirds, on the other hand, were available, did not break the bank, do fold up and travel easily, and they do get the job done. They set up in a snap, and the price is on-point.ProsThey were available during pandemic, at the regular price - kudos to FlyBird Fitness for not price gouging.Delivered in less than a week - amazing considering some fitness companies take 2 weeks to ship a t shirt.Over performs on all expectations. Excellent ROI, great value.Impressive and seemingly accurate max weight rating,Moves, stores, and travels easily.Solid construction, quality materials.Padding is better than expected, very comfortable.Glossy finish on metal and vinyl covering cleans easy.Looks good.Good range of adjustments, heavy duty pins feel solid.Leg attachment is super helpful.Does decline - huge plus.ConsPlastic leg/feed end caps can/will come off sometimes. (fixable with glue)Not absolutely 100% rock solid (minor and expected)Gap between seat/back pad forces me to shift position sometimes. (minor/typical/expected)Had to lubricate detent pins for seat/back adjustment. (minor/expected)Back does not adjust to 90", there is a slight incline at max upright position. (being picky here)TakeawayGreat value, great return on initial investment. I wanted a bench that I can put in a closet, or the trunk of my car easily. It needed to be comfortable enough so I want to use it, support up to 500 lb, cost less than $200, and be stable enough so I had confidence when lifting some decent weight. This FlyBird met and exceeded all expectations.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 30, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very high-quality for the money!', 'author': 'Vic E Bentley', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This bench arrived on time, was very easy to set up. It is very sturdy, and I'm a rather large guy. The adjustability is perfect for a multitude of exercises. I like that it folds up and can be stored away easily under a bed or in a closet. Recommended!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars good for a home gym, but not very sturdy', 'author': 'phegos', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I've been using this for 4 months. Here are my thoughts:pros:- assemble it yourself. it's super simple.- per spec it can hold my weight (~200lb) plus more weight than I'll ever press.- it folds up easily and stows out of the way.- it's light and easy to movecons:- the bench itself is a tad high off the ground. It's not a huge issue, but you do feel your feet are a little less planted especially when you are arched up to bench heavy.- the bar that you can lock your feet against seems like an after-thought. I almost never use it, but when I did need it (to get into a stable decline press position) I couldn't find a locking position to make it comfortable.- there are times when you need the bench to be rock solid stable (e.g., when doing bench dips, or when attempting a PB). This bench will rock and sway a bit. In other words you need to keep strict form always, otherwise you may feel the bench wobble under you, which is unsettling and possibly unsafe.- the seat is a bit too wide, and the back rest is slightly too narrow. Not a huge issue, but it does impact some routines: e.g., when doing seated dumbbell curls the dumbbells can graze the seat, and when rolling back with dumbbells or a barbell (e.g., to mount into a skull-crusher position) I'd feel more safe if the bench back support were wider.- the pre-drilled holes for the seatback positions are a bit odd. There's the flat and straight back positions. Those are fine. The decline positions are ok (though I can't lock my legs comfortably, but that's a separate issue). The other incline positions are just a tad too low or too high. I might drill a couple of extra holes exactly where I want them (should be easy enough to do).Despite the negatives I'd recommend this bench for the price and compactness. If you're careful it should serve you well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 26, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ultimate Full Body Workout Companion!', 'author': 'Real Deal', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The FLYBIRD Weight Bench has completely transformed my home workout routine, and I couldn't be happier with this purchase. As someone who loves to engage in various strength training exercises, this bench has become an essential part of my fitness arsenal.The first thing that impressed me about the FLYBIRD Weight Bench is its sturdy and durable construction. The heavy-duty steel frame ensures stability and provides excellent support during intense workouts. I feel safe and confident while performing various exercises, knowing that the bench can handle my weight without any wobbling or shaking.One of the standout features of this bench is its adjustability. With its fast folding and adjustable design, it's incredibly easy to switch between different positions for various exercises. I can quickly adjust the backrest and seat to target different muscle groups, making it ideal for a full-body workout. Whether I'm doing chest presses, incline or decline workouts, or shoulder exercises, the FLYBIRD Weight Bench caters to all my training needs.Another highlight of this bench is its comfortable padding. The high-density foam cushions provide ample support and comfort during extended workout sessions. The upholstery is not only soft and smooth but also easy to clean, which is a huge plus after sweaty workouts.Space-saving is a significant advantage of the FLYBIRD Weight Bench. Its innovative fast folding mechanism allows me to collapse the bench quickly and store it conveniently when not in use. This feature is especially valuable for those with limited space, as it can easily fit in a closet or under the bed.Furthermore, the FLYBIRD Weight Bench comes at a reasonable price point, making it an excellent investment for home gym enthusiasts. Considering its high-quality build, versatility, and adjustability, this bench provides excellent value for money.In conclusion, the FLYBIRD Adjustable Weight Bench has been a game-changer in my fitness journey. Its robust construction, comfort, and versatility make it an exceptional addition to any home gym. If you're looking for a reliable, space-saving, and adjustable weight bench for a full-body workout, I highly recommend the bench - it's an investment you won't regret!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Mold', 'author': 'Brian', 'rating': 5, 'content': "6/4/21 Edit: Updated from 3 to 5 stars.I would recommend flybird. They stand behind their product and go the extra mile to make sure the customer is satisfied. Even though I had problems with this bench, they made it right by sending me a replacement. When I found an issue with the replacement bench, they sent the appropriate parts to fix it along with a gift card for the inconvenience. 5/5 for customer service. If they're able to improve quality control, they would be a stellar company. See below for more detailed review of bench.5/29/21 Edit: Updated from 1 to 3 stars.A company rep reached out to me and offered a replacement. The rep seemed to really care about the customer experience and the replacement bench was shipped quickly. However, the new bench had 2 issues:1. It's missing one of the round stoppers on the leg of the bench that keeps the bench in place.2. The seat cushion is banged up / bent on the edges and seems a little unstable. The upper portion of the bench is also wobbly.I would give FlyBird 5 stars for their great customer support but 3 stars for the quality control of the bench.Bench Performance: I worked out with the bench once so far and it held up well. I'm 5'11, weigh 165 lbs, and used adjustable dumbbells (up to 50lbs each, so max of 100lbs). Although the bench did feel a bit wobbly at times, it did not feel unsafe at the current weight. However, I would not feel as comfortable using this bench if I was lifting above my body weight.Bench Ergonomics: The seat is very wide so might take a bit to get used to. The bench is taller than the normal benches you would find at the gym so might be harder to plant your feet on the ground when bench pressing, but it's still usable for me. The bench adjusts easily between flat/incline/upright positions.Bench footprint: This bench is light weight and assembles/disassembles very easily (literally takes 10 seconds) and can be stored away without taking up much space. This was one of the bench's main appeal and it did not disappoint in this aspect.Conclusion: If you want a light weight bench that is easily set up and put away, and do not plan on lifting very heavy, I think this bench is a good choice (as long as you receive a working product). I'll continue to workout using the bench for now and update my review if needed.____________Original Review:This item arrived with mold growing out of the seat. Not sure if it's inside the seat foam, but there is mold on several surfaces of the bench. Needless to say, this is a health hazard and I would recommend a careful inspection of the item before use.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 25, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Impressive!', 'author': 'Jeff J.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was a little skeptical but after reading others reviews and seeing pics of how compact and durable it appeared in pics I took a chance. I‚Äôve had several workouts on it this week and it was comfortable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great bench! Sturdy but folds up easily!', 'author': 'phenryiv1', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been using this bench for several weeks now and I feel like I have a pretty good handle on the use. I was not able to be too picky when I ordered it, as due to COVID-19 the selection was limited but I was finally able to get a bench for use in my home gym and was happy to be able to finally work out on something other than a rigged up setup.So first, what is good:Packaging was great. Setup took 5 minutes. Literally a couple of pins and screws. The assembly is pretty much fool-proof.The bench is light. Normally, you buy workout gear (and electronics) by the pound, so when something is light, it normally compromises somewhere but the design was very solid despite the weight. The light weight makes it really easy to fold and stow away. The whole thing is WAY easier to get out of the way than a non-folding bench. Grant', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So far I‚Äôm happy with this bench. Even better, I got it on a lightning deal for $120! This perfectly fits my current needs. The pins/holes leave something to be desired since it wiggles a bit when you‚Äôre not using it. But when sitting on the bench your body weight keeps it nice and firmly planted to the floor. The size of the bench is perfect. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô10‚Äù and there‚Äôs room for taller people. I wouldn‚Äôt bench press more than 200 lbs or so on this, but I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to confidently dumbbell press a couple of 60s or 70s. It does fold up and it‚Äôs pretty simple, but I don‚Äôt see myself using that feature much. It comes almost fully assembled, you just attach the shin pad and insert the pins. Will post an update if I have any issues but I think most people will like this bench.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Adjustable Dumbbell Set - Free Weights Set with Connector - 4 in1 Weights Dumbbells Set Used as Barbell, Kettlebells, Push up Stand - Fitness Exercises for Home Gym Exercises
reviews: [{'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Dumbbell Configuration Is Poorly Thought-out!!!', 'author': 'Julius Freeman', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I love the idea of this set & when using it in its barbell configuration, it seems to work very well. Unfortunately, when used as a dumbbell, it fall short.You have to screw-in the two dumbbell handles into each side of the padded, middle barbell section. The problem there is that the middle section should\'ve been made longer & the barbell handles at least 2 inches shorter.Trying to do dumbbell or hammer curls, or flys is next-to-impossible, without risking have the end of the handle hitting you in your face. If you try to execute triceps extensions, the dumbbell handle might skewer you in the back. Simply stated, the dumbbell handles are just too long, being about 21 1/2 inches in length, compared to the roughly 14 1/2 inches of my steel dumbbell bar.The padding on the barbell section feels pretty good. It\'s not the greatest quality, but I understand that because you get what you pay for & I can live with this unit as a barbell. It\'s good as a beginner set, I\'ll let my grandson start off with it because the weights are adjustable enough for him to be able to handle. But at age 13, I won\'t let him anywhere near those 2 spears which pose as "dumbell handles".I bought it because I liked the idea of it being compact, as I have limited space. I also liked the idea of a Kettlebell, which brings up another design problem with this set. Unless you completely load up the kettlebell handle with weights, you\'ll find that after attaching the kettlebell handle, your knuckles will be scraping against the locking clamps.I\'m just getting back into weights & wanted to ease my way back & I thought that this would be good set, as I\'m not trying to get into heavy lifting at this point & time. Crazy as it sounds, despite all of its flaws, I still like the CONCEPT of this set & am not about to repack & re-ship a 77 Lb set.While I like this set, believe it or not, I really do. But honestly, I CANNOT recommend that anyone purchase this set. The poor design will simply frustrate the average person & limit the movements that they can execute when using the dumbbell.It\'s a very unwieldy set & that\'s sad because as crazy as it sounds, I still like this set. What I\'ll probably end up doing is using it for the barbell, then using my metal dumbbell handle to do dumbbell work. Which kinda defeats the purpose of buying this set. It also would\'ve been nice had they skipped the plastic & made the connecting pieces. That would give this set a sturdier & safer feel.GREAT idea...POORLY executed!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Came cracked', 'author': 'William P.', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I‚Äôm sure this is a good starter set but I was unfortunate with the product that came cracked. It also takes very long to ship to you', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

While this one had good reviews the general search left me skeptical but I‚Äôm happy to say everything arrived as advertised and it‚Äôs very user friendly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Product!', 'author': 'Alec L.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Super easy to setup and love that you can change the weights and customize how heavy you want it. title: Neoprene Dumbbell Pairs by Day 1 Fitness - 12 Weight and Bundle Options, 1 - 20 LBS - Non-Slip, Hexagon Shape, Color Coded, Easy to Read Hand Weights for Muscle Toning, Strength Building, Weight Loss
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 5 stars', 'author': 'Thomas Vollmar', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Solid little dumbbell set. The vinyl coating is my favorite part. She likes to share.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Check the size - very large grip', 'author': 'M. Gondek', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Measured exactly the 15 pounds that I ordered, with good grippiness. No problems with the neoprene taking the finish off furniture, like a cheaper pair I have. The hex shape could be more defined, but they don\'t roll on flat surfaces.That said, I wish I\'d realized just how large "1.81 inches" diameter can be for the grip - I didn\'t even realize that grips varied this much, since all my other sets have such smaller grips. This grip is MUCH larger than any other dumbbell in my collection, including the 20- and 25-pound sets, and the swell at the center makes it even worse. That makes these dumbbells very, very uncomfortable for my average-sized (gloves: ladies\' medium) hands. Very expensive to return, so I suggest you be sure you like this huge grip size before you purchase.Edit to respond to the manufacturer\'s comment on my review: The research about wrist strain is great, but the problem is the grip is very unsure with this huge diameter. My hands barely go around the monster grip, and I\'m relying on finger strength more than forearms to maintain my grip as a result. I\'m constantly worried I\'m going to drop the weights and smash my face when I\'m doing chest flies or similar over-the-face/head exercises. I have no problems with my 25- and 20-pound weights (which have traditional grips), so I\'ll definitely be looking for a 15-pound pair from another brand, with a traditional grip.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 23, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good for kids or starting out.', 'author': 'vernicek', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Ordered these for my 10 yr son they are fine for him the only complaint I have is one weight is noticeable thicker that the other so it feels awkward to hold .
